Smoking is the leading risk factor for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) Yet many people who never smoke develop COPD. We perform a longitudinal analysis of COPD in the UK Biobank to derive and validate the Socioeconomic and Environmental Risk Score. The score captures additive and cumulative environmental, behavioral, and socioeconomic exposure risks beyond tobacco smoking.

Venous thromboembolism (VTE) is a major cause of morbidity and mortality worldwide. Current risk assessment tools have limitations in their applicability and accuracy. Study aimed to develop machine learning models to predict diagnosis and 1-year risk of VTE.

AIMS: To explore the relationship between remnant cholesterol (RC) and risk of premature mortality as well as life expectancy in the general population. We included a total of 428,804 participants from the UK Biobank for analyses. Compared with low RC group, the moderate RC group was associated with a 9% increased risk.

CYP2A6 is a polymorphic enzyme that inactivates nicotine. Two studies found that CYP2A7 deletions were associated with ovarian cancer risk. An updated reference panel was created to impute CYP1A6 SVs from UK Biobank array data.

Preserved ratio impaired spirometry (PRISm) is associated with respiratory symptoms and comorbidities. We undertook a genome-wide association study (GWAS) of PRISm in UK Biobank participants. 22 signals reached significance in the joint meta-analysis, including four signals novel for lung function.

Complement components have been linked to schizophrenia and autoimmune disorders. We examined the association between neonatal circulating C3 and C4 protein concentrations in 68,768 neonates and the risk of six mental disorders. Post-hoc analyses found that a higher C3 concentration was associated with a reduced risk of schizophrenia in females.

Irregular sleep may increase the risk of cardiometabolic conditions, but its association with incident dementia is unclear. We used Cox proportional hazard models to investigate the relationships between sleep regularity and incident dementia in 88,094 UK Biobank participants.

Heart failure (HF) and atrial fibrillation (AF) frequently coexist. Over 50% patients with HF having AF, while one-third of those with AF develop HF. Differences in obesity-mediated association between HF and HF-related AF among Asians and Europeans were evaluated.

Chinese inpatients exhibit higher multimorbidity prevalence and more complex networks compared to their UK counterparts. Essential hypertension, dyslipidemia, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and gastritis and duodenitis were the hub diseases in both populations. Targeted interventions for digestive and genitourinary diseases are warranted for the UK.

Short tandem repeats (STRs) are genomic regions consisting of repeated sequences of 1-6 bp in succession. We imputed 445,720 STRs into genotype arrays from 408,153 White British UK Biobank participants and tested for association with 44 blood phenotypes. STRs account for 5.2%-7.6% of causal variants identifiable from GWASs for these traits.

Stroke and dementia are the leading causes of neurological disease burden. Detrimental effects of air pollution on both conditions are increasingly recognised. The impacts on the dynamic transitions of stroke and dementia have not yet been explored.

Previous observational studies have been controversial regarding the association of leukocyte telomere length (LTL) with prostate cancer (PCa) and benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) The study provides convincing evidence supporting that longer LTL increases the risk of PCa and BPH.

Critical care patients require stronger analgesic prescriptions in the 12 months following hospital discharge. Patients from areas of high socioeconomic deprivation may also be associated with increased analgesic requirements. Multidisciplinary support is required for patients who may be at risk of chronic opioid use.

Childhood overweight increases the risk of type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease in adulthood. However, the impact of childhood leanness on adult obesity and disease risk has been overlooked. We examined the independent and combined influences of child and adult body size.

Genetically proxied (using a surrogate biomarker) inhibition of phosphodiesterase 5 (PDE5), an established drug target for erectile dysfunction, with fertility, sexual behaviour, and subjective wellbeing. Two sample cis-mendelian randomisation study.

White matter coordinates communications between different brain regions and is related to a wide range of neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric disorders. Previous genome-wide association studies (GWASs) have uncovered loci associated with white matter microstructure. In this study, we adopt the concept of supervariants, a combination of alleles in multiple loci, to account for potential multi-SNP effects.

The brain-predicted age difference may serve as a biomarker for neurodegeneration. We investigated the brain-PAD in patients with schizophrenia (SCZ), first-episode schizophrenia spectrum disorders (FE-SSDs), and treatment-resistant schizophrenia (TRS) Using structural magnetic resonance imaging (sMRI), we compared its performance with models based on three machine learning (ML) algorithms.

DeepFlow is a deep-learning system to extract cardiac flow and volumes from phase-contrast cardiac magnetic resonance imaging. A mixed-linear model applied to 37,653 individuals from the UK Biobank reveals genome-wide significant associations across cardiac dynamic flow volumes. Mendelian randomization reveals a causal role for aortic root size in aortIC valve regurgitation.

COPD was associated with lower physical activity levels in both Chinese and British COPD patients. COPD was inversely correlated with physical activity level, particularly in a dose-response manner in the CKB population.

The study looked at women aged 45-60 years with no history of endometrial cancer or hysterectomy. The final model incorporated age, body mass index, waist circumference, age at menarche, menopause and last birth. It was well calibrated on external validation and had improved net benefit compared with previously developed models.

Study aims to elucidate the association between reproductive lifespan and the risk of late-onset psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis (PsA) We conducted a prospective cohort study in postmenopausal women without baseline PsA. We found that later ANM and longer reproductive years were significantly associated with decreased risks of PsA and Psoriasis.

Cerebrovascular risk factors increase the likelihood of dementia in older people. Their impact on cognitive ageing in younger, healthy brains is less clear. UK Biobank provides cognition and brain imaging measures in the largest population cohort studied to date.

Study partitions phenotypic variance in metabolic syndrome (MetS), blood glucose (GLU), triglycerides (TG), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), and blood pressure. Analysis included a cohort of 62,822 unrelated individuals with white British ancestry, sourced from the UK biobank. Significant proportions of the MetS variance were attributed to distinct data sources.

Fragility fractures may be a complication of diabetes, partly caused by chronic hyperglycaemia. 117,054 individuals from the Copenhagen City Heart Study and the Copenhagen General Population Study were included for observational and one-sample Mendelian randomisation (MR) analyses. Fragility fractures were defined as fractures at the hip, spine and arm.

A total of 161,968 eligible participants from the UK Biobank were included. During a median follow-up of 9.66 years, 16,241 participants developed brain disorders. Individuals with elevated innate immunity markers including neutrophils, monocytes, platelets, neutrophil-to-lymphocyte ratio (NLR), and systemic immune-inflammation index (SII) had an increased risk.

Evidence linking ozone to depression and anxiety disorders remains sparse. It remains unknown whether omega-3 fatty acid, or genetic susceptibility of mental disorders modify the impacts of ozone. The aim is to assess the associations of ambient ozone with depression and Anxiety.

The UK Biobank is the most used dataset for genome-wide association studies (GWAS) GWAS of sex, essentially sex differences in minor allele frequencies (sdMAF), has identified autosomal SNPs with significant sdMAF, but the X chromosome was excluded. We performed a whole genome SDMAF analysis, with ~410 k white British individuals.

Type 2 diabetes (T2D) and coronary artery disease (CAD) often coexist and share genetic factors. This study aimed to investigate the common genetic factors underlying T2D and CAD in patients with CAD.

3D motion estimation from cine cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) images is important for the assessment of cardiac function and the diagnosis of cardiovascular diseases. We propose a novel learning framework, DeepMesh, which propagates a template heart mesh to a subject space and estimates the 3D motion of the heart mesh from CMR images for individual subjects.

Mental disorders are largely socially determined, yet the combined impact of multidimensional social factors on the two most common mental disorders remains unclear. We constructed a polysocial risk score (PsRS) including components from three domains: socioeconomic status, neighborhood and living environment and psychosocial factors. We tested the associations between 13 single social factors with Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ) score, Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD) score and self-reported depression and anxiety. Emotional stress, lack of social support and low household income were significantly associated with the development of depression and Anxiety.

Recent studies have shown that bile acids are essential in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) pathology. However, whether cholecystectomy increases the risk of IBS remains unclear. We aimed to investigate the association between chole Cystectomy and IBS risk in the UK Biobank.

The Great London Smog of 1952 (GLS) was an extreme air pollution event in December 1952. We use the GLS as a quasi-natural experiment to estimate the effect of exposure to air pollution in utero on adulthood health. Data from the UK Biobank is analysed for a cohort of participants born from December 1952 to July 1956.

Data were from a cohort of 88 282 adults (40-69 years) in UK Biobank that wore a wrist-worn triaxial accelerometer for 7 days. Data were linked to mortality outcomes with follow-up to October 31, 2021. Overall sleep duration was significantly associated with risk for all-cause (p)

Study used data from 26,729 NAFLD participants from the UK Biobank cohort study. 310 incident end-stage liver disease (ESLD) and 1750 deaths were recorded. Substituting free sugars with equal amounts of non-free sugars, starch or fiber was associated with a lower risk of incident ESLD and overall mortality.

The antagonistic pleiotropy hypothesis posits that natural selection for pleiotropic mutations that confer earlier or more reproduction but impair the post-reproductive life causes aging. Here, we genomically test this hypothesis using the genotypes, reproductive phenotypes, and death registry of 276,406 U.K. Biobank participants. We observe a strong, negative genetic correlation between reproductive traits and life span.

 type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is considered a putative causal risk factor for coronary artery disease (CAD) The intrinsic link underlying T2DM and CAD is not fully understood. We aimed to highlight the importance of integrated care targeting both diseases by investigating the phenotypic and genetic relationships.

Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic autoimmune disorder that affects life expectancy. Accelerated biological ageing is thought to be a major risk factor for age-related diseases, but its role in rheumatoids arthritis remains uncertain. We aimed to assess the associations between biological ageing and risk of rheumatic arthritis and genetic susceptibility to the disease. We also assessed the association between life expectancy and biological ageing status in people with rhearatoid arthritis.

Both genetic factors and air pollution are risk factors for coronary artery disease (CAD) The study aimed to comprehensively investigate their separate, combined and interaction effects.

Lung function and asthma hospitalisations were similar for white, black and North-East Asian participants. South-East (SE) Asians more commonly had an FEV 1 below the lower limits of normal.

 Reproductive risk factors and air pollution for developing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) have been documented separately. The combined effects of overall reproductive risk status on COPD and the extent to which this can be impacted by air pollution are unknown. The aim of this study was to construct a reproductive risk score (RRS) and an air pollution score (APS)

 Accelerated biological ageing has been associated with an increased risk of several chronic respiratory diseases. However, the associations between phenotypic age, a new biological age indicator based on clinical chemistry biomarkers, and common respiratory diseases have not been evaluated. We analysed data from 308 592 participants in the UK Biobank.

Brain age, most commonly inferred from T1-weighted magnetic resonance images (T1w MRI), is a robust biomarker of brain health and related diseases. Superior accuracy in brain age prediction is achieved predominantly through deep neural networks. However, comparing study results is difficult due to differences in datasets, evaluation methodologies and metrics.

Fitness levels may reduce risks of endometrial, colorectal, and breast cancer. relationships with adiposity are complex and may mediate these relationships. Increasing fitness, including via changes in body composition, may be an effective strategy for cancer prevention.

Brain age prediction from 3D MRI volumes using deep learning has recently become a popular research topic. Training deep networks can be very computationally demanding for large datasets like the U.K. Biobank.

Fetuin-A acts as both an inhibitor of calcification and insulin signaling. Previous studies reported conflicting results on the association between fetuin- A and cardiometabolic diseases. We aim to provide further insights into the association using a Mendelian randomization strategy.

We used morphometric methods to study the kidneys by constructing surface meshes from kidney segmentations from abdominal MRI data in 38,868 participants in the UK Biobank. Age was associated with kidney shape consistently across disease groups. Body mass index (BMI) and waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) were also associated with the participants with T2D.

Study included 344,609 adult participants from the UK Biobank cohort. Risk for 59 diseases was significantly associated with high neuroticism. Depression, anxiety, irritable bowel syndrome, migraine, spondylosis and sleep disorders were the most likely to develop.

Few studies have explored the association between the number of SAs and bipolar disorder and major depression (BDMD) We conducted a cross-sectional study of 13,200 female UK Biobank participants. We found that SA was an independent risk factor for BDMD.

Loss-of-function of DDX3X is a leading cause of neurodevelopmental disorders (NDD) We identify 3432 functionally abnormal variants, in three distinct classes. Systematic maps of variant effects have the potential to transform clinical interpretation of both germline and somatic disease-associated variation.

 reduced expression of the plasma membrane citrate transporter  SLC13A5 has been linked to increased longevity and mitigated age-related cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Citrate, a vital component of the tricarboxylic acid cycle, constitutes 1-5% of bone weight. Disrupting this pathway impairs bone mineralization in young mice.

White matter hyperintensities (WMHs) are well-established markers of cerebral small vessel disease. Small and punctate WMHs have been reported with surprisingly high frequency even in young, neurologically asymptomatic adults. Most automated methods to segment WMH published to date are not optimized for detecting small and sparse WMH.

We used fundus fluorescein angiography (FFA) to label the capillaries on color fundus (CF) photographs. We trained a deep learning model (RMHAS-FA) to segment retinal capillary using CF. We tested the model's accuracy on a manually labeled internal test set (FundusCapi) For external validation, we tested the segmentation model on 7 vessel segmentation datasets. Smaller vessel skeleton density had a stronger correlation with CVD risk factors and incidence.

Fanconi anemia (FA) is a bone marrow failure and cancer predisposition syndrome. FA is caused by biallelic pathogenic variants in 1 of 22 genes involved in DNA interstrand cross-link repair. To investigate all FA genes, this study utilized the DiscovEHR cohort of 170,503 individuals with exome sequencing and electronic health data.

Endometriosis affects 1 in 9 women. It is characterised by the presence of endometrial-like tissue outside of the uterus. The main symptoms are pain and infertility.

Among 142,271 diabetes-free UK Biobank participants, 126,203 were normoglycemic and 16,068 were prediabetic at baseline. At baseline, dietary intake was assessed with a 24-h dietary record. A diabetes-related genetic risk score (GRS) was calculated using 424 single-nucleotide polymorphisms. There were significant additive and multiplicative interactions between IDI and GRS in relation to type 2 diabetes risk.

About one in 40 babies born in the world is a twin and there is much speculation on why twinning runs in families. We found significant genetic correlations with multiple aspects of female reproduction and body size. We hope our results will inform investigations of ovarian response in new and existing ARTs and the causes of female infertility.

Symptoms of major depressive disorder (MDD) are commonly assessed using self-rating instruments like the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) and the Composite International Diagnostic Interview Short-Form (CIDI-SF) We assessed the single nucleotide polymorphism heritability and genetic correlation of both sets of MDD symptoms.

Pancreatic cancer (PC) is influenced by both genetic and lifestyle factors. Adhering to a favorable lifestyle was associated with a lower risk of PC. The absolute risk reduction was more pronounced among those aged > 70 years.

Non-linear associations were observed between the menstrual cycle phase and total (p) cholesterol. Anthropometric, lifestyle, fitness and inflammatory markers were explored as potential mediators and moderators of the associations.

Sun exposure, although beneficial, shows a causal relationship with skin cancer risk. Using data from 2,500 United Kingdom twins, we observed sun seeking to be significantly heritable (h2 &#8805; 58%).

Trigeminal neuralgia (TN) is a common, debilitating neuropathic face pain syndrome often resistant to therapy. Analysis of 290 whole exome-sequenced TN probands revealed enrichment of rare, damaging variants in GABA receptor-binding genes in cases.

Studies of sleep duration in relation to the risk of site-specific cancers other than breast cancer are scarce. Available results are inconclusive and the causality remains unclear. We aimed to investigate the potential causal associations of sleepduration with overall and site- specific cancers using the Mendelian randomization design.

Cortical folds help drive the parcellation of the human cortex into functionally specific regions. Variations in the length, depth, width, and surface area of these sulcal landmarks have been associated with disease. Before estimating the heritability of sulcal variation, the extent to which these metrics can be reliably extracted from in-vivo MRI must be established. Using four independent test-retest datasets, we found high reliability across the brain.

Mental health and well-being of teachers is an issue of great policy concern. High workload and associated stress is thought to be leading to a recruitment and retention crisis within the education profession.

With mounting interest in translating genome-wide association study (GWAS) hits from large meta-analyses, evaluating their generalizability in target populations is crucial. Here, we consider long-term survivors of childhood cancers from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort Study. We show the limited generalizable of 1,376 robust SNP associations reported in the general population across 12 complex anthropometric and cardiometabolic phenotypes.

Ageing and neurodegenerative diseases cause morphological changes to the brain. Age-related brain changes are subtle, nonlinear, and spatially and temporally heterogenous. Machine learning models are suited to capture these patterns.

Handedness has been extensively studied because of its relationship with language and the over-representation of left-handers in some neurodevelopmental disorders. We conducted a genome-wide association meta-analysis of handedness (N = 1,766,671) We found 41 loci associated (P) with handedness.

 psychotic experiences are core symptoms of mental health disorders like schizophrenia. Both smoking behaviour and genetic risk for psychiatric disorders have been associated with psychotic experiences. We tested whether smoking status, maternal smoking around birth, and number of packs smoked/year were associated with lifetime occurrence of three psychotic experiences phenotypes.

This study uses exome sequencing and corresponding phenotypic data from Mount Sinai's BioMe (n = 32,344) and the United Kingdom Biobank (UKBB) Variant curation identified pathogenic/likely pathogenic (P/LP) variants in RASopathy genes and FBN1.

Sex differences for chronic back pain (cBP) have been reported, with females usually exhibiting greater morbidity, severity, and poorer response to treatment. We performed sex- and age-stratified genome-wide association study and single nucleotide polymorphism-by-sex interaction analysis for cBP defined as "Back pain for 3+ months"

Image Imputation Generative Adversarial Network (I2-GAN) learns key features of cardiac short axis (SAX) slices near missing information. It uses them as conditional variables to infer missing slices in the query volumes. The method achieves significant improvements over the state-of-the-art, in missing slice imputation for CMR.

Genetic variant rs2168518 in 15q24.1 previously associated with age-related macular degeneration. Analysis revealed a gender-specific association with male AMD patients and an association predominantly with choroidal neovascularization. AMD association colocalizes with an association signal of several blood pressure-related phenotypes.

Study aimed to comprehensively analyze the relationship between low bone mineral density (BMD) and the risk of benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) Based on the large prospective population-based UK Biobank (UKB) cohort. Osteoporosis was associated with a higher risk of BPPV.

Existing SNP-heritability estimators that leverage summary statistics from genome-wide association studies (GWAS) are much less efficient. We introduce a new method for local heritability estimation - Heritability Estimation with high Efficiency using LD and association Summary Statistics.

Study included 439 807 participants without liver diseases at baseline from the UK Biobank. Primary outcome was new-onset severe liver disease, a composite definition of compensated or decompensated liver cirrhosis, liver failure, hepatocellular carcinoma, and liver-related death.

 Randomised trials of vitamin D supplementation for cardiovascular disease and all-cause mortality have generally reported null findings. However, generalisability of results to individuals with low vitamin D status is unclear. We aimed to characterise dose-response relationships between 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25[OH]D) concentrations and risk of coronary heart disease, stroke, and death.

Pancreatic cancer (PaCa) is a lethal cancer with an increasing incidence, highlighting the need for early prevention strategies. There is a lack of a comprehensive PaCa predictive model derived from large prospective cohorts. We have developed an integrated PaCa risk prediction model for PaCa using data from the UK Biobank.

There is no universally agreed-upon definition of what constitutes a planetary healthy, sustainable diet. We investigated the association between the EAT-Lancet reference diet and incident cancer, incident major cardiovascular events, and all-cause mortality.

 genome-wide association studies (GWAS) have identified tens of thousands of genetic loci. But the genetic architecture is still not fully understood for many complex traits. We leverage the identity-by-descent (IBD) segments inferred from a random projection-based IBD detection algorithm to develop a computationally efficient statistical test for IBD mapping in biobank-scale cohorts.

No genetic loci have been identified for obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) in genome-wide association studies. Although co-morbidities between OCD and schizophrenia (SCZ) were observed, their common genetic etiology was not completely known. Here, we conducted a comprehensive investigation regarding the genetic architecture of OCD and the common genetic foundation shared by OCD and SCZ using summary statistics data. We identified 323 OCD-relevant variants located within 12 loci, with four loci shared the same causal variants.

Self-reported frequency of adding salt to foods could reflect a person's long-term salt taste preference. Salt intake has been associated with increased risk of cardiovascular diseases (CVD) Whether self-reported adding of salt to food is associated with higher risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) remains unknown. UK Biobank participants aged 37 to 73 years who were free of CKD at baseline.

Lipoprotein(a) (Lp[a)%) concentrations are a highly heritable and potential causal risk factor for atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) European Atherosclerosis Society and American Heart Association recommend screening of relatives of individuals with high Lp(a), but the expected yield of this approach has not been quantified in large populations.

Osteoporosis and fractures severely impact the elderly population. Polygenic risk scores for bone mineral density have demonstrated potential clinical utility. However, the value of rare genetic determinants in risk prediction has not been assessed. We constructed a genetic risk score, called ggSOS, to incorporate influential rare variants into the common variant-based polygenic risk score.

Dietary patterns have been associated with several cancers, especially gastrointestinal cancer (GIC) Whether a healthy dietary pattern could modify the risk of GIC among people with different genetic backgrounds is not clear. Large-scale prospective cohort study included 105,463 participants in UK Biobank who were aged 40-72 y.

The relationship between genetically-driven liver fat and coronary heart disease (CHD) remains unclear. ApoB-containing lipoproteins are known causal factors for CHD and may explain this relationship. We found 25 independent liver-fat associated single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) with differing effects on lipoprotein metabolism.

Lack of physical activity (PA) and sarcopenia is a known risk factors for ischemic heart disease (IHD) However, considering their coexistence in the middle-aged and elderly population, the interaction of these two factors remains uncertain. Here, we investigated the interactive effects of PA and sarc Openia on IHD.

Habitual fish oil use was associated with a lower risk of new-onset kidney stones in participants with low or intermediate genetic risk of kidney stones.

It has been suggested that higher triglyceride levels were associated with a lower risk of Alzheimer disease. Study aimed to examine the association of triglycerides with dementia and cognition change in community-dwelling older adults.

Study was based on 194,758 chronic pain participants form UK biobank with a median follow-up of 13.7 years. Participants were categorized into different NSAIDs painkiller regimen groups. Aspirin and paracetamol use was associated with a higher risk of ACD.

Hospital-treated infections increased dementia two-fold. The strongest mediation effect was through the growth differentiation factor 15 (GDF15) protein. Top 17 proteomic mediators explained collectively 5% of the total effect.

Evidence from population-based studies on whether tea consumption could delay the biological aging process in humans remains limited. Study included 7931 participants aged 30-79 years from the China Multi-Ethnic Cohort (CMEC) Study and 5998 participants aged 37-73 years from UK Biobank (UKB) Tea consumption information was collected through questionnaires.

Study aimed to assess the epidemiological and causal relationships between neuroticism and AF. Of 394,834 participants (mean age 56.3 +/- 8.1 years, 45.9% male), AF occurred in 23,509 (6.0%) during a 10-year follow-up. The risk of incident AF significantly increased in the high neuroticism score group.

Metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease may be a risk factor for AAA. MAFLD is defined as hepatic steatosis plus metabolic abnormality, type 2 diabetes, or overweight/obesity.

Study was based on a cohort of 500 000 participants from UK Biobank. A total of 410 946 participants were followed up for an average of 10.8 years. Compared with the group of participants who had 0-1 h of daily TV time, the group who watched TV for more than 5 h per day had an  HR of 1.37 (95% confidence interval [ CI ]: 1.31-1.44).

Study examined associations in different European regions over a 30-year period. The differences in the risk factor-CVD associations between central Europe, northern Europe, southern Europe, and the UK were generally small.

Genome-wide association studies have identified 240 independent loci associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk, but this knowledge has not advanced precision medicine. We show a significant burden of pathogenic variants in genes linked with monogenic diabetes among people with common T2D, particularly in actionable MODY genes. These results open avenues for future interventions assessing the clinical interest of these pathogenic mutations.

Alcohol consumption is correlated positively with risk for breast cancer in observational studies. The association with epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) is unclear. We performed observational Cox regression and Mendelian randomization analyses.

Circulating proteins are vital in human health and disease. They are frequently used as biomarkers for clinical decision-making or as targets for pharmacological intervention. Here, we map and replicate protein quantitative trait loci (pQTL) for 90 cardiovascular proteins in over 30,000 individuals.

Tumor thickness is the strongest predictor of outcome for clinically localized primary melanoma patients. We sought to determine whether there is a heritable genetic contribution to variation in tumor thickness. We found that 26.6% (SE 11.9%, P = 0.0128) of variation is attributable to genome-wide genetic variation. While requiring replication, a chromosome 11 locus was associated.

The desire to train complex machine learning algorithms drives neuroimaging research to use ever-larger datasets. Simple pooling is often ill-advised as selection, measurement, and confounding biases may creep in. In practice, we neither know all potential confounders nor do we have data on them.

A major challenge in genetic association studies is that most associated variants fall in the non-coding part of the human genome. We searched for variants associated with bone mineral density (BMD) by sequencing a subset of the Nord-Tr&#248;ndelag Health Study. One previously unreported variant, LoF mutation in MEPE, was associated with decreased ultradistal forearm BMD and increased osteoporosis and fracture risk.

LDBlockShow is an open source software, for visualizing LD and haplotype blocks from variant call format files. It is time and memory saving. In a test dataset with 100 SNPs from 60 000 subjects, it was at least 10.60 times faster.

Using genetic scores for fasting plasma glucose (FPG GS) and type 2 diabetes (T2D GS), we investigated whether the fasting, 1-hour and 2-hour glucose thresholds from the WHO 2013 criteria for gestational diabetes (GDM) have different implications for genetic susceptibility to raised fasting glucose. We looked at women from the Hyperglycemia and Adverse Pregnancy Outcome (HAPO) and Atlantic Diabetes in Pregnancy (DIP) studies. In HAPO and DIP, the mean FPG GS was higher than controls.

One in four people slept less than age-specific recommendations, but only 5.8% slept outside of the 'acceptable' sleep duration. Among teenagers, 51.5% reported total sleep times (TST) of less than the recommended 8-10 h and 18% report daytime sleepiness. In adults, poor sleep quality (13.3%) and insomnia symptoms (9.6-19.4%) were more prevalent.

High circulating levels of Lp(a) (lipoprotein[a) increase the risk of atherosclerosis and calcific aortic valve disease, affecting millions of patients worldwide. Low-density lipoprotein-targeting therapies do not reduce Lp (a) or risk of aorta disease, which has no available drug therapies. Targeting Lp('a') production and catabolism may provide therapeutic benefit, but little is known about its cellular uptake.

LDpred2 is a widely used Bayesian method for building polygenic scores (PGSs) We present a new version of LDpred2-auto that adds an optional third parameter &#945; to its model, for modeling negative selection. We then validate the inference of these three parameters.

Cancer is an age-related condition, but changes to modifiable lifestyle-related behaviours, including physical activity, could impact risk. Step count is an accessible metric of activity for older adults, but its association with cancer risk remains poorly understood. We investigated the association between accelerometer-measured total activity, step count, and cancer risk.

This study aims to investigate the association between childhood adversity and COVID-19-related hospitalisation and mortality in the UK Biobank. Higher self-reports of childhood adversity were related to greater likelihood of COVID,19- related hospitalisation.

UK Biobank enrolled over 500,000 participants, aged 37-73years, across the UK from 2006 to 2010. During a median follow-up period of 12.0years, 14,492 (3.9%) participants developed acute kidney injury. Overall, the healthy sleep score was significantly inversely associated with the risk of new-onset acute kidneys injury.

Plasma cell neoplasms are a group of hematologic neoplasm that often develop in the elderly population. Relationship between cholesterol levels and hematologist malignancy has been identified in population studies. It is still unclear if there is a relationship between cholesterol Levels and Plasma Cell Neoplasm in European ancestry.

A moderately higher risk of breast cancer was associated with the consumption of processed meat. Higher intake of raw vegetables and fresh fruits, and adherence to a healthy dietary pattern were inversely associated with breast cancer risk.

UK Biobank cohort included 417,253 participants (aged 56.18 +/- 8.09 years) Of whom, 19,243 (4.6%) and 188,219 (45.1%) were considered frail and pre-frail, respectively. During a median of 12.4 years follow-up, 1503 elderly-onset IBD cases (1001 UC, 413 CD, and 89 IBD-Unclassified) were identified. Compared with non-frailty, individuals with frail (HR=1.40, 95 %CI: 1.13-1.73) and pre/frail showed significantly higher risk of IBD.

Evidence on the association between greenness and telomere length (TL) is insufficient, particularly in middle-aged and elderly populations. The modification effect of genetic susceptibility is unknown. We conducted a cross-sectional study among participants in the UK Biobank (2006-2010) Residential greenness was measured by normalized difference vegetation index within 500 m buffer.

Early-life exposure increases health risks throughout an individual's lifetime. Whether early-life risks could accelerate biological aging and elevate late-life mortality and morbidity risks remains unknown. Increased chronological age and healthy lifestyles could mitigate the accelerations of KDM-BA and PhenoAge.

Age at AF diagnosis is associated with risk of incident dementia and its subtypes. Data were analyzed from October to December 2022. Compared with individuals without AF, 30 601 individuals with AF had a higher risk of developing all-cause dementia.

World Cancer Research Fund/American Institute for Cancer Research Cancer Prevention Recommendations are lifestyle-based guidelines which aim to reduce cancer risk. Study investigated associations between an abbreviated score to assess adherence to these Recommendations and the risk of all cancers combined.

Loneliness is associated with morbidity and mortality, including higher risk of neurodegenerative diseases. To our knowledge, no study has examined whether the association between loneliness and detrimental outcomes extends to Parkinson disease (PD) This large cohort study found that loneliness was associated with risk of incident PD across demographic groups.

Study included participants of the UK Biobank who were free of fracture history at enrollment (2006 to 2010) Air pollution measurements included annual averages of air particulate matter (PM 2.5-10), nitrogen oxides (NO 2) and NO x. Participants living in places with the highest quintile of air pollution score had a 15.3% increased risk of fractures. 5.49% of this association was mediated through serum 25(OH)D.

Dietary fiber intake is associated with a lower risk of diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and cancer. It is unknown whether dietary fiber has a beneficial effect on preventing the development of chronic kidney disease (CKD) Using the UK Biobank prospective cohort, 110,412 participants completed at least one dietary questionnaire.

Previous studies suggest a protective role of fruits and vegetables against a variety of diseases such as dementia and depression. We investigated the effect of fruit and vegetable consumption on brain structure. Particularly on grey matter (GM) and white matter (WM) volumes, regional GM volumes and subcortical volumes.

 gray matter atrophy is commonly observed with aging. But it is highly variable, even among healthy people of the same age. Previous studies have reported that risk factors for cardiometabolic diseases are associated with accelerated brain aging. These studies were primarily based on standard correlation analyses.

Vitamin D deficiency is prevalent in type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) There are positive synergistic associations of vitamin D deficiency and T2DM with liver-related outcomes. Inversely associated with incident liver disease and related mortality.

Mothers transmit Alzheimer's disease more frequently than fathers. Factors other than female longevity may be at work to promote maternal transmission of AD. Among these are the X chromosome, mitochondrial DNA, and AD comorbidities, especially depression.

Physical activity levels of CVD patients in both China and the UK were lower than that in non-CVD population. The decline in physical activity was more pronounced among CKB and UKB CVD. patients with lower educational levels, current or former smokers or drinkers, and those with other chronic diseases.

This study aims to evaluate the causal effect of sodium-glucose cotransporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibition on bone mineral density (BMD), osteoporosis, and fracture risk using genetics. Two-sample Mendelian randomization (MR) analyses were performed utilizing two sets of genetic variants as instruments (six and two single-nucleotide polymorphisms [SNPs) associated with SLC5A2 gene expression and glycated hemoglobin A1c levels.

Epistasis is central in many domains of biology, but it has not yet been proven useful for understanding the etiology of complex traits. This is partly because complex-trait epistasis involves polygenic interactions that are poorly captured in current models. To address this gap, we developed a model called Epistasis Factor Analysis (EFA)

Integrated analyses of plasma proteomic and genetic markers in prospective studies can clarify the causal relevance of proteins. The purpose of this study was to examine associations of proteomics and genetics data with IHD in population studies.

Analysis was based on 117,252 participants from the U.K. Biobank. Habitual visual acuity was measured by a standardized logarithmic chart. Incident hospitalized anxiety recorded using longitudinal linkage with hospital inpatient data.

Heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH) is a monogenic disorder characterized by increased circulating low-density lipoprotein cholesterol and accelerated atherosclerosis. Even among this high-risk group, prior studies note considerable variability in risk of coronary artery disease (CAD)

Intimate partner violence and child maltreatment have been separately associated with asthma in adults. No study has concurrently examined of adulthood adverse events (including, but not limited to, intimate partner violence) and child Maltreatment on asthma in Adults. This was a cross-sectional study of adulthoodÂ adverseÂ events and childÂ maltreatment on current asthma in 87,891 adults 40-69 years old who participated in the UK Biobank.

Study included 458,181 participants free of baseline dementia in the UK Biobank (2006-2021) 11 digestive system diseases showed significant associations with an increased risk of dementia. The associations appeared to be stronger for cirrhosis and irritable bowel syndrome.

CluStrat is a method to correct for population structure in polygenic adaptation of height in Europeans. It leverages the linkage disequilibrium induced distances between genetic markers. In simulation studies, our method outperforms existing methods in detecting true causal variants.

In clinical practice, the co-existence of endometriosis and gastrointestinal symptoms is often observed. Using large-scale datasets, we report a genetic correlation between the two conditions. Higher use of IBS, GORD, and PUD medications in women with endometiosis and higher use of hormone therapies support theCo-occurrence of these conditions.

Study included a total of 87 885 participants (median follow-up of 9.1 years, 54% female) without dementia at baseline from the UK Biobank. A total of 249 plasma metabolites were measured using nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy at baseline. Cholesteryl esters in S-HDL were associated with lower risk of VD but not AD.

UK Biobank participants aged 38 to 70 years without cardiovascular disease were included. The primary outcome was CHD, which was ascertained using hospital and death records. We observed that age at job initiation was inversely associated with CHD.

Perturbation of lipid homoeostasis is a major risk factor for cardiovascular disease (CVD) We aimed to identify genetic variants affecting lipid levels, and thereby risk of CVD, in Greenlanders. Genome-wide association studies of six blood lipids, triglycerides, LDL-cholesterol, HDL-ch cholesterol, total cholesterol, and apolipoproteins A1 and B were performed.

Study looked at association between cardiovascular health (CVH) and incident depression and anxiety. CVH was defined by the American Heart Association's Life's Essential 8 (LE8) score. Higher CVH, evaluated by LE8 score, is strongly associated with a lower risk of incident depression.

Study included 502,369 participants from the UK Biobank. Having IBD was associated with an increased risk of death from all causes. We observed elevated breast cancer mortality rates for individuals with Crohn's disease.

Most people with autosomal dominant familial hypercholesterolaemia (FH) remain undetected. We estimated the screening performance of different low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) cut-offs to select adults for DNA sequencing. We identified 488 individuals with an FH-causing variant and 139 951 without (prevalence 1 in 288) An LDL-C cut-off of >4.8 mmol/L had a stage 1 detection rate (sensitivity) of 40% (95% CI 36 to 44%) for a false-positive rate of 10%.

Adiponectin may play an important protective role in heart failure and associated cardiovascular diseases. We hypothesized that plasma adiponect in is associated observationally and causally, genetically with risk of heart failure, atrial fibrillation, aortic valve stenosis, and myocardial infarction. In observational analyses modelled linearly, a 1 unit log-transformed higher plasma adip onectin was associated with a hazard ratio of 1.51.

Pericardial adipose tissue (PAT) is the visceral tissue compartment surrounding the heart. We identify causal associations between PAT and adverse cardiac magnetic resonance imaging measures of cardiac structure and function. Genetically predicted differences in PAT were causally associated with adverse left ventricular remodeling.

Admixed individuals offer unique opportunities for addressing limited transferability in polygenic scores (PGSs) We present inclusive PGS (iPGS), which captures ancestry-shared genetic effects. When iPGS is applied to n = 237,055 ancestry-diverse individuals in the UK Biobank, it shows the greatest improvements in Africans by 48.9% on average.

The prospective association between vitamin D and obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) remains uncertain. We aimed to assess the association between serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D), a major circulating form of vitamin D, and new-onset OSA.

Caffeine is the most widely consumed psychostimulant and is associated with lower risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) Whether these associations are causal remains unknown. This study aimed to identify genetic variants associated with caffeine intake, and to investigate evidence for causal links with CAD or T2DM.

White matter hyperintensities (WMH) are the most common brain-imaging feature of cerebral small vessel disease (SVD) hypertension is the main known risk factor. We identify 27 genome-wide loci for WMH-volume in a cohort of 50,970 older individuals. Aggregated WMH risk variants were associated with altered white matter integrity.

The human proteome is a crucial intermediate between complex diseases and their genetic and environmental components. It is an important source of drug development targets and biomarkers. We comprehensively assess the genetic architecture of 257 circulating protein biomarkers of cardiometabolic relevance through high-depth whole-genome sequencing.

Host-mediated lung inflammation is present1, and drives mortality in the critical illness caused by coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) Host genetic variants associated with critical illness may identify mechanistic targets for therapeutic development.

Genome-wide association study (GWAS) of vegetarianism in 367,198 participants from UK Biobank. We identified one locus, rs10189138, near the vaccinia related kinase 2 gene, significantly associated with vegetarianism.

Drugs targeting dyslipidemia and cardiovascular disease may increase the risk of fatty liver disease and other metabolic disorders. To identify potential novel CVD drug targets without these adverse effects, we perform genome-wide analyses of participants in the HUNT Study in Norway. We identify 76 presumed causal protein-altering variants associated with one or more CVD- or liver-related blood traits.

Serum urate has been implicated in hypertension and cardiovascular disease, but it is not known whether it is exerting a causal effect. We performed Mendelian randomization analysis using data from UK Biobank, Million Veterans Program and genome-wide association study consortia. Every 1-SD increase in genetically predicted serum urate was associated with an increased risk of coronary heart disease.

The relationship between depression and vitamin D deficiency is complex, with evidence mostly from studies affected by confounding and reverse causality. We examined the causality and direction of the relationship between 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D) and depression in bi-directional Mendelian randomization (MR) analyses using information from up to 307,618 white British participants.

Mitochondrial (MT) dysfunction is a hallmark of aging and has been associated with most aging-related diseases. Little is known about aging, lifestyle and genetic factors influencing mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) abundance. mtDNA abundance was significantly elevated in women compared to men.

Study aimed to investigate the risk of various short-term comorbidities (within one month) and long-term sequelae after COVID-19 infection. Participants were older, male, overweight/obese, ever-smoked, and hospitalized. Only 6 high-risk sequelae were observed after one month.

Data from the UK Biobank cohort were analyzed. Longer-than-recommended sleep duration was associated with lower overall grey and white matter volumes. Sleeping less than recommended is distinctly associated with low cortical surface areas.

Study examined associations of fish and fish oil consumption with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) incidence. 1554 incident IBD cases were identified during an average follow-up of 11.8 years. Compared with participants who never ate oily fish, those having  1 serving/wk had 9% (hazard ratio [HR], 0.91; 95% confidence interval [CI, 0.77-1.08) lower risks of IBD.

Study looked at 11 974 White European UK Biobank participants with type 2 diabetes, aged 40-70 years. Sarcopenia was defined based on the European Working Group on Sarc Openia in Older People. Outcomes included CVD, stroke, heart failure (HF) and myocardial infarction (MI)

Migraine is a complex neurovascular disease with a range of severity and symptoms. Here we combine large GWAS datasets from six European populations to study the main migraine subtypes, migraine with aura (MA) and migraine without aura (MO) We identified four new MA-associated variants (in PRRT2, PALMD, ABO and LRRK2) and classified 13 MO- associated variants.

It is becoming increasingly common for studies to fit single-shell diffusion MRI data to a two-compartment model. The fraction of the isotropic compartment ( f ) is sensitive to white matter conditions and pathologies.

Biological age captures physiological deterioration better than chronological age. Blood-based biomarkers have been identified as suitable candidates for biological age estimation. Biological age is estimated as the equivalent age within the same-sex population which corresponds to an individual's mortality risk.

In the UK, cancer screening invitations are based on general practice (GP) registrations. We hypothesize that GP electronic medical records (EMR) can be utilised to calculate a lung cancer risk score with good accuracy.

Hypertension is a known risk factor for subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) The aim of this study was to describe the relationship between blood pressure and SAH using a large cohort study and perform a meta-analysis of the published literature.

Abdominal organ segmentation from CT and MRI is an essential prerequisite for surgical planning and computer-aided navigation systems. It is challenging due to the high variability in the shape, size, and position of abdominal organs. template-based surface extraction methods have shown promising advances for direct mesh reconstruction from volumetric scans.

High BMI and waist circumference (WC) were associated with increased risks of retinopathy, nephropathy and peripheral neuropathy in the UK Biobank cohort. The effect sizes remained significant after adjustment for glycated hemoglobin. Weight control might modify the risks of these complications independently of glycemic control.

We show a null association between these indices and incident inflammatory bowel disease. The need to account for the effects of food processing as well as the raw ingredients is emphasized as a confounding variable.

The anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) and right ventrolateral prefrontal cortex (VLPFC) are thought to have important roles in loneliness (feeling of social isolation/exclusion) experience or regulation. Study analyzed link between loneliness and gray matter volumes (GMVs) in the ACC and right VLPFC among 1,005 patients with MDD and 7,247 healthy controls (HCs)

Anemia was associated with faster declines in global cognition. Anemia accelerated dementia onset by 1.53 years. Risk of dementia tended to be higher in people with both anemia and high CRP.

Five comorbidity clusters were identified in a population of 10 873 people with psoriasis. Genetically predicted coronary artery disease (CAD) is possibly associated with an increased risk of Psoriasis, altering our prior knowledge.

White matter hyperintensities (WMH) are an imaging marker of cerebrovascular pathologies and predictor of cognitive impairment. The role of human leukocyte antigen (HLA) genes in WMH pathophysiology remains unexplored. Four HLA genes showed an association with reduced WMH volume. Carrying DQB1*02:01 and C*07:01 was associated with higher cognitive function, but no association with dementia was found.

Co-occurrence of cardiometabolic diseases (CMDs) is increasingly prevalent and has been associated with an additive risk of dementia in older adults. The extent to which this risk can be offset by a healthy lifestyle is unknown. We aimed to examine associations of CMDs and lifestyle with incident dementia and related brain structural changes.

 GWAS of hematuria in the UK Biobank identified 6 loci, some of which overlap with loci for albuminuria suggesting pleiotropy. eGFR was lower in cases compared to controls, with the exception of the comparison in females using CKD-EPI after age adjustment.

Using the UK Biobank, we examine associations of four individual healthy dietary scores with the risk of 48 individual chronic diseases. Higher Alternate Mediterranean Diet score is associated with a lower risk of 32 (all 8 cardiometabolic disorders, 3 out of 10 types of cancers, 7 out of10 psychological/neurological disorders, 5 out of 6 digestive disorders)

The association between serum cystatin C level and vascular outcomes has not been fully elucidated in diabetes and is unclear in prediabetes. A total of 85,371 participants with predi diabetes and diabetes were included with a 14-year follow-up. The highest cyStatin C quartile had increased risks of all-cause (hazard ratio [HR], 2.02; 95% confidence interval [CI] 1.86-2.19)

Thyroid hormones play a critical role in regulation of multiple physiological functions. Thyroid dysfunction is associated with substantial morbidity. We identify 158 novel genetic associations, more than doubling the number of known associations with TSH.

Mobile phone use was significantly associated with higher risks of incident overall cancer. Nonmelanoma skin cancer (NMSC) and urinary tract cancer (HR, 1.18) were also linked to phone use.

Study aimed to investigate the joint association of asthma and sleep duration with cardiovascular disease (CVD) and mortality risk. Participants with asthma and short sleep duration showed increased risk of CVD and all-cause mortality.

 venous thromboembolism (VTE) is a major complication in IBD patients. VTE is often underappreciated with limited tools for risk stratification. Incident VTE was followed for 8465 IBD Patients in the UK Biobank.

Ultra-processed food (UPF) intake has been positively associated with obesity and diabetes. The relationship between UPF intake and liver health has been scarcely studied. We aimed to evaluate the association of UPF with risk of adverse liver outcomes including nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.

The role of anxiety in the pathway to chronic pain is unclear. Potentially, inflammatory biomarkers such as C-reactive protein (CRP) are involved. Data from 24,172 adults who participated in the UK Biobank were used to conduct Poisson regressions to assess relationships between ACEs, anxiety, and chronic pain.

Bassoon (BSN) is a component of a hetero-dimeric presynaptic cytomatrix protein that orchestrates neurotransmitter release. Heterozygous missense variants in BSN have previously been associated with neurodegenerative disorders in humans. We found that rare heterozygous predicted loss of function (pLoF) variants are associated with higher BMI in the UK biobank cohort.

17,603 UK Biobank participants underwent cholecystectomy, and 35,206 matched controls were included in this study. Within a median follow-up period of 13.56 years, 3,217 participants were diagnosed with osteoporosis. After adjustment for relevant confounders, prior choleCystectomy was associated with a 1.21 times higher risk of osteop orosis in women.

Sex differences in human brain structure and function are important. They are likely to be relevant to male-female differences in behavior and in mental health. To analyse sex differences in cortical function, functional connectivity was measured in 36,531 participants (53% female)

FactorGo is a scalable variational factor analysis model to identify and characterize pleiotropic components using biobank GWAS summary data. In extensive simulations, we observe that FactorGo outperforms the state-of-the-art (model-free) approach tSVD. FactorGo improves our understanding of shared etiologies across thousands of GWASs.

TV-watching, driving and non-occupational computer using were all positively associated with the risk of new-onset kidney stones. Glucosamine use was associated with a lower risk of kidney stones in participants with total sedentary time.

Evidence regarding the role of physical frailty in cancer-related outcomes is limited. We aimed to examine the association of frailty with cancer incidence and mortality risk. The study included 348,144 participants free of cancer at baseline from the UK Biobank.

Metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MAFLD) is a newly defined condition encompassing hepatic steatosis and metabolic dysfunction. The relationship between MAFLD and multi-system diseases remains unclear. We conducted a disease trajectory analysis to map the key pathways linking MAFLd to various health conditions.

In the UK Biobank, during a median follow-up of 12.13 years, 3535 (2.01%) participants developed CKD. Compared with tea non-consumers, the risk of new-onset CKD was significantly lower in unsweetened tea consumers (hazard ratio (HR) = 0.84, 95% confidence interval (CI) =0.76-0.93)

Using diffusion-weighted MRI from &#8764;30,000 UK Biobank participants, we test the hypothesis that obesity (waist-to-hip ratio, WHR) is associated with regional differences in two micro-structural MRI metrics. We observed significant associations with obesity in two coupled but distinct brain systems.

The fat-to-muscle mass ratio (FMR) has been proposed as a meaningful indicator of risk of obesity. This study investigated the associations between total and regional FMR and incident breast/ovarian cancer.

Back pain is a major contributor to disability worldwide, with heritability estimated at 40-60%. Less than half of the heritability is explained by common genetic variants identified by genome-wide association studies. More powerful methods and rare and ultra-rare variant analysis may offer additional insight.

Most signals in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of complex traits implicate noncoding genetic variants with putative gene regulatory effects. Currently identified regulatory variants, notably expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs), explain only a small fraction of GWAS signals. We show that GWAS and cis- eQTL hits are systematically different.

Exercise-induced premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) in asymptomatic individuals remain unclear. Study aimed to assess association between PVC burdens during submaximal exercise and major adverse cardiovascular events (MI/HF/LTVA)

Study aimed to explore the potential interaction between dietary intake and genetics on incident colorectal cancer (CRC) We analyzed prospective cohort data of 374,004 participants who were free of any cancers at enrollment in UK Biobank.

500,207 UK Biobank participants (54.5% women, mean age 56.5 years) without prior hospitalisation of PAD at baseline were included. Risk factors included blood pressure, smoking, diabetes, lipids, adiposity, history of stroke or myocardial infarction (MI), socioeconomic status, kidney function, C-reactive protein, and alcohol consumption.

Study looked at the association between periodontal diseases, airflow limitation and incident chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) The cross-sectional study involved 495,610 participants. The cohort study included 379,266 participants.

There is a research gap between genetic predisposition, socioeconomic factors, and their interactions on thyroid tumorigenesis. Three index loci of telomerase reverse transcriptase ( TERT ) were found to be significantly related to incident TCa. High genetic risk, low household income, and high education level were independent risk factors.

Inverse associations between dietary fiber (DF) and colorectal cancer risk are well-established. However, evidence is limited in relation to other cancer sites. This study aimed to evaluate the associations between total and source-specific partial DF and risk of 17 specific cancers and all cancers combined.

Cohort analyses included 287 868 participants from the UK Biobank Study. Compared with participants without MetS, those with MetS had a higher risk of COPD (HR 1.24, 95% CI 1.17-1.32) Those with high genetic predisposition had a 17% increased risk of developing COPD.

Infection burden (IB), although linked to neurodegeneration, including Alzheimer's Disease (AD), has not been examined against neurite orientation, dispersion, and density imaging (NODDI) measures. Among 38,803 UK Biobank adults (Age:40-70 years), we tested associations of total IB and hospital-treated IB with NODDI measures.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) is a complex genetic disease, and variants identified through genome-wide association studies (GWAS) explain only part of its heritability. Epistasis has been proposed as a major contributor to this 'missing heritability' We use VariantSpark, a machine learning approach to GWAS, and BitEpi, a tool for epistasis detection, to identify AD associated variants and interactions.

 Digestive disorders are a significant contributor to the global burden of disease and seriously affect human quality of life. Research has already confirmed the presence of pleiotropic genetic loci among digestive disorders. However, most cross-phenotype studies within the digestive tract system have been limited to a few traits.

Chronic pain is at epidemic proportions in the United States. The genetic relationship among these traits remains poorly understood. We conducted a joint analysis of genome-wide association study summary statistics from seventeen pain susceptibility traits in the UK Biobank.

Whether serum vitamin D mediate vascular diseases in prediabetic populations remains unclear. This study aimed to determine the associations between circulating 25-hydroxyvitamin D [25(OH)D] levels and vitamin D receptor (VDR) polymorphisms among adults with prediabetes.

Study included 98,564 participants free of IBS in the UK biobank. 8770 (8.9%) participants had a depression diagnosis at baseline. 224 cases of incident IBS were identified in patients with depression (2.0 per 1000 person-years)

 interpretability in Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) has been explored to some extent in general in computer vision. We propose an interpretable attention module (IAM) that explains the relevance of the input features to the classification task on a GNN Model. We show the application of our model on two publicly available datasets, Tadpole and the UK Biobank.

438,307 participants from the UK Biobank who completed the questionnaire on the frequency of adding salt to foods and were free of vascular disease at baseline were enrolled. Primary outcomes included incident microvascular, cerebrovascular and cardiovascular diseases. Secondary outcomes included first occurrence of fatal and non-fatal vascular diseases.

We mapped functional and structural brain networks for more than 40,000 UK Biobank participants. Structural connectivity was estimated with tractography and diffusion MRI. Resting-state functional MRI was used to infer regional functional connectivity. We provide high-quality structural and functional connectomes for multiple parcellation granularities.

Constrained source-based morphometry (constrained SBM) is a semi-blind extension of SBM. It enables the extraction of maximally independent reference-alike sources using the constrained independent component analysis (ICA) approach. This also allows us to implement a federated version of constrained SBM to allow analysis of data that is not locally accessible.

Long-term exposure to air pollutants was associated with an elevated risk of allergic rhinitis. Participants with high air pollution combined with high genetic risk showed the highest risk of AR.

The relationship between liver dysfunction and dementia has been researched extensively but remains poorly understood. 431 699 participants with a mean of 8.65 (standard deviation [SD] 2.61) years of follow-up were included from the UK Biobank. We observed that per SD decreases in alanine transaminase (ALT) were significantly associated with a higher risk of incident ACD.

We examined associations between family history of stroke and heart disease with incident stroke and myocardial infarction (MI) in 495 640 UK Biobank participants stratified by childhood adoption status (5747 adoptees) Polygenic risk scores showed strong disease-specific associations in both groups. Family history of heart disease represents predominantly genetic risk.

Single nucleotide polymorphisms in the human leukocyte antigen (HLA) region in both maternal and fetal genomes have been robustly associated with birthweight (BW) in previous genetic association studies. No study to date has partitioned the association between BW and classical HLA alleles into maternal and Fetal components. We used structural equation modelling (SEM) to estimate the maternal andfetal effects of classical Hla alleles on BW.

Study aimed to quantify the dose-response association and the minimal effective dose of leisure-time physical activity (PA) to prevent mortality and cardiovascular disease in adults with type 2 diabetes. Cross-country comparison of 2 prospective cohort studies including 14,913 and 17,457 population-based adults withtype 2 diabetes from UK and China.

Frailty combines biological ageing, comorbidity and psychosocial factors and can predict adverse health outcomes. Emerging evidence indicates that frailty is higher in individuals with SMI than in the general population. The prevalence ratio was between 3 and 18 times higher than in those without SMI.

It is unclear whether metabolic and inflammatory factors mediate the association between severe sleep apnea and coronary heart disease (CHD) In UK Biobank, 213 442 CHD-free adults were followed up for 15 years to detect incident CHD. The strongest indirect association was for dyslipidemia.

Raynaud's phenomenon (RP) is a common vasospastic disorder that causes severe pain and ulcers. Despite its high reported heritability, no causal genes have been robustly identified. We identified three unreported genomic regions associated with the risk of RP.

Genetic and lifestyle factors contribute to the pathogenesis of bladder cancer. The extent to which the increased genetic risk can be mitigated by adhering to a healthy lifestyle remains unclear. We aimed to investigate the association of combined lifestyle factors with bladder cancer risk within genetic risk groups.

Genome-wide association studies have identified numerous genetic variants (single-nucleotide polymorphisms [SNPs] associated with BC. The effects of SNPs are combined into a polygenic risk score (PRS) as a risk prediction tool. The PRS can stratify individuals with more than a 3-fold risk increase.

Evidence supporting cardiovascular diseases could increase the risk of dementia remains fragmented. A comprehensive study to illuminate the distinctive associations across different dementia types is still lacking. Study sought to determine the clinical validity of Framingham General Cardiovascular Risk Score (FGCRS)

Happiness is a fundamental human affective trait, but its biological basis is not well understood. We construct LDpred-inf polygenic scores of a general happiness measure in 2 cohorts. We detected significant (p.FDR) associations between genetic scores for happiness and brain structure in ABCD and UK Biobank.

Despite development of vaccines to prevent SARS-CoV-2 infection, treatment of critically ill COVID-19 patients remains an important goal. In principle, genome-wide association studies (GWASs) provide a shortcut to the clinical evidence needed to repurpose existing drugs. genes identified frequently lack a causal disease link.

Study looked at relationship between blood glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) and cerebral cortical thickness (CT) Results were negative, emerging negatively within the prediabetic range (39.6 mmol/mol) Loci implicated mitochondrial maintenance and ATP generation.

Permutational multivariate analysis of variance (PERMANOVA) offers a powerful non-parametric approach. However, it relies on permutations to assess significance, which hinders the analysis of large datasets. Here, we derive the limiting null distribution of the PERMANOVA test statistic.

A total of 402,982 participants from UK Biobank were analyzed. 13,120 incident cases of T2D were documented. Compared with participants who "never/rarely" added salt to foods, the adjusted HRs were 1.11, 1.18, and 1.28.

Different ages for diagnosis of diabetes have diverse effects on risks of cardiovascular disease, dementia, and mortality, but there is little evidence of cancer. This study investigated the relationship between diabetes at different diagnostic ages and risks of cancer incidence and mortality in people aged 37-73 years.

Deep generative models, including Evolutionary model of Variant Effect (EVE), Evolutionary Scale Modeling (ESM), and AlphaFold 2 (AF2), have enabled significant progress in the prediction of protein structure and function. ESM and EVE directly estimate the likelihood of a variant sequence but are purely data-driven and challenging to interpret.

Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) is characterised by the accumulation of lipid droplets (LDs) within hepatocytes. Perilipin 2 (PLIN2) is the most abundant protein in hepatic LDs and its expression correlates with intracellular lipid accumulation. A recently discovered PLIN2 coding variant, Ser251Pro (rs35568725), was found to promote accumulation of small LDs in embryonic kidney cells. In this study, we investigate the role of  PLin2 -Ser251Pro on hepaticLD metabolism in vivo and research the metabolic phenotypes associated with this variant in humans.

Life's Essential 8 composite measure consists of four health behaviours (diet, physical activity, nicotine exposure, and sleep) and four health factors (body mass index, non-high density lipoprotein cholesterol, blood glucose, and blood pressure) In the UK Biobank, 170,726 participants free of 44 common NCDs at baseline were included.

Study included 23,014 individuals without neurodegenerative diseases from the UK Biobank. 3 years of annual follow-up data of 2197 individuals from a Chinese cohort. Poor renal function was associated with a lower baseline GCIPL thickness in the UK population and a faster decline rate in Chinese participants. However, the detailed underlying mechanisms still need further exploration.

UK Biobank is a prospective study of 0.5 million adults. Analyses were restricted to 89 422 participants with plasma lipoprotein and apolipoprotein measures from Nightingale nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy and without CHD at baseline. CHD risk was positively associated with concentrations of very-low-density lipoproteins.

Set-based association analyses for rare variants are powerful tools that capture some of the missing heritability in trait association studies. We extend the convex-optimized SKAT (cSKAT) test set procedure which learns from data the optimal convex combination of kernels. We show that the resulting optimization problem is a quadratic programming problem that can be solved with no additional cost compared to cSKAT.

Body mass index (BMI; weight (kg)/height (m)2) is commonly used to measure general adiposity. Evidence of its appropriateness for males and females remains inconsistent. We aimed to identify the most appropriate sex-specific power value that height should be raised to.

Cardiomyopathies (CMs) are genetic diseases with complex etiologies for which an increasing number of recessive associations have been proposed. We classify 18 genes with robust recessive association with CMs, largely characterized by dilated phenotypes, early disease onset and severe outcomes. Several of these genes have monoallelic association with disease outcomes and cardiac traits.

Cancer survivors are less likely than comparably aged individuals without a cancer history to develop Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (ADRD) We investigated associations between cancer history and five structural magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) markers for ADRD risk. Cancer history was associated with smaller mean hippocampal volume.

The analysis of longitudinal data from electronic health records (EHRs) has the potential to improve clinical diagnoses and enable personalized medicine. Here we introduce an age-dependent topic modeling (ATM) method that provides a low-rank representation of longitudinal records of hundreds of distinct diseases in large EHR datasets.

Metformin use was associated with decreased urate levels, risk of hyperuricaemia and incident gout in patients with diabetes. Genetically proxied averaged HbA1c-lowering effects of metformin targets were associated with reduced urate. Body mass index significantly mediated this association.

Low levels of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol have been associated with higher rates and severity of infection. Alterations in inflammatory mediators and infection are associated with alterations in HDL cholesterol. We explored the role of IL-6 signalling as a potential causal driver of changes in HDL subclasses.

Regular stair use can contribute to increasing physical activity in the population. Climbing stairs >15 times per day was associated with a lower risk of 8 of the 9 outcomes analyzed than not using stairs. Findings were similar for mortality outcomes, with the hazard ratios ranging from 0.82 to 0.92.

There are 78 loci associated with Parkinson's disease in the most recent genome-wide association study (GWAS) We nominated candidate genes in each locus and identified novel pathways. Specific common coding variants in SPNS1 and MLX may be involved.

Grip strength has prognostic value for aging-related health outcomes. Whether associations of grip strength with the risk of dementia and Alzheimer's disease (AD) vary by the genetic risk of AD and related dementias (ADD) is unknown.

The relationship between adiposity and grip strength (GS) is complex. We investigated whether one pathway through which adiposity affects GS was via chronic inflammation. 367,583 UK Biobank participants had body mass index (BMI), waist-hip-ratio (WHR), C-reactive protein (CRP) and GS data.

Low heart rate variability (HRV) has been widely reported as a predictor for increased mortality. However, the molecular mechanisms are poorly understood. This study aimed to identify novel genetic loci associated with HRV and assess the association of phenotypic HRV with mortality.

CYP2A6, a genetically variable enzyme, inactivates nicotine, activates carcinogens, and metabolizes many pharmaceuticals. This phenome-wide association study examined associations between a reconstructed version of our weighted genetic risk score (wGRS) and diseases in the UK Biobank (N = 395 887)

Previous studies have shown that brain volume is negatively associated with cigarette smoking. We examined the relationship between a history of daily smoking and brain volumes. A history of heavier smoking was associated with a greater decrease in brain volume. A polygenic risk score for smoking initiation was strongly associated with daily smoking.

Few studies have investigated the joint effects of sleep traits on the risk of acute myocardial infarction (AMI) No previous study has used factorial Mendelian randomization (MR) which may reduce confounding, reverse causation, and measurement error. It is prudent to study joint effects using robust methods to propose sleep-targeted interventions.

Fat distribution pattern could help determine cardiometabolic risk profile. This study aimed to evaluate the association of balance/imbalance between visceral adipose tissue (VAT), abdominal subcutaneous tissue (aSAT), and liver fat (LF) in the UK Biobank prospective cohort study.

Rare pathogenic variants in DCM-associated genes impact left ventricular remodelling and outcomes in stable CAD. NI-LGE is associated with adverse remodelling but is not an independent predictor of outcome.

Sex-stratified genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of body fat percentage (BFPAdj) were performed in white British individuals from the UK Biobank. Loci associated with testosterone or sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) were excluded to avoid collider bias. We investigated association of BFPAdJ loci with high density cholesterol (HDL), triglyceride (TG), type 2 diabetes (T2D), coronary artery disease (CAD) using publicly available data.

There is mounting evidence that the Mediterranean diet prevents type 2 diabetes. Little is known about the role of Mediterranean lifestyles other than diet and among non-Mediterranean populations. This work aimed to examine the association between a comprehensive Mediterranean-type lifestyle andtype 2 diabetes incidence in a British adult population.

The Pharma Proteomics Project is a precompetitive biopharmaceutical consortium characterizing the plasma proteomic profiles of 54,219 UK Biobank participants. We present comprehensive protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) mapping of 2,923 proteins that identifies 14,287 primary genetic associations. We demonstrate the utility of these data for drug discovery by extending the genetic proxied effects of protein targets, such as PCSK9.

 Integrating human genomics and proteomics can help identify clinical biomarkers and discover drug targets. Previous studies have focused on common variation via genome-wide association studies. Here we identify associations between rare protein-coding variants and 2,923 plasma protein abundances measured in 49,736 UK Biobank individuals.

Study examined whether and to what extent aging mediates associations of unhealthy lifestyles with adverse health outcomes. Data were from 405,944 adults (40-69 years) from UK Biobank (UKB) and 9972 adults (20-84 years)  from US National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) An unhealthy lifestyles score (range: 0-5) was constructed based on five factors.
