The thalamus is a vital communication hub in the center of the brain and consists of distinct nuclei critical for consciousness and higher-order cortical functions. Structural and functional thalamic alterations are involved in the pathogenesis of common brain disorders. Here, we identify 55 lead single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) within 42 genetic loci and 391 genes associated with volumes of theThalamus.

Human height is a polygenic trait, influenced by a large number of genomic loci. In the pre-genomic era, height prediction was based largely on parental height. We assessed the predictive power of polygenic risk scores (PRS) combined with the traditional parental height predictors.

We investigated the dynamic properties of the organism state fluctuations along individual aging trajectories. We used a log-linear mortality estimate from the CBC variables as a single quantitative measure of the aging process. The criticality resulting in the end of life is an intrinsic biological property of an organism that is independent of stress factors.

Many genetic and phenotypic risk factors for colorectal cancer have been identified. These are not currently used by population screening programs. Using risk to determine FIT screening start age could improve the clinical outcomes and cost effectiveness.

Children whose mothers smoked during pregnancy had greater risk of being shorter or plumper at age ten in the full UK Biobank White cohort. Similar associations were identified in the South Asian and Black ethnicities. Findings strongly encourage mothers to quit smoking during pregnancy for improving growth and development.

In the UK Biobank, prediagnostic serum levels of total bilirubin were measured in blood samples collected from 440,948 participants. After a median follow-up of 7.1 years (interquartile range: 1.4), 5033 incident gastrointestinal cancer cases were recorded. In multivariable-adjusted models, bilirUBin levels were negatively associated with risk of esophageal adenocarcinoma and positively associated with HCC and IBD cancer.

We estimated penetrance through large-scale analyses of individuals referred for diagnostic sequencing for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and dilated cardiopathy (DCM) Penetrance was significantly higher for variant subgroups annotated as loss of function or ultra-rare and for males compared to females for variants in HCM-associated genes. Median penetrance was 14.6% (+/-14.4% SD)

The identification of metabolic biomarkers for aging-related diseases and mortality is of significant interest in the field of longevity. In this study, we investigated the associations between nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) metabolomics biomarkers and aging- related diseases as well as mortality. The most significant biomarker was intermediate density lipoprotein cholesteryl (IDL-CE)

Mobile health applications have been developed to increase physical activity. But they are rarely grounded on behavioural theory. In this work, we propose a theoretically driven and personalised behavioural intervention delivered through an adaptive knowledge-based system.

Lifestyle-related factors are recognized as snoring risk factors, but the role of genetics in snoring remains uncertain. One way to measure the impact of genetic risk is through the use of a polygenic risk score (PRS) In this study, we aimed to investigate whether genetics plays a role inSnoring after adjusting for lifestyle factors.

Polygenicity refers to the phenomenon that multiple genetic variants have a nonzero effect on a complex trait. Evaluation of polygenicity can provide valuable insights into the genetic architecture of the trait. We introduce a Bayesian approach genepoly to estimate this quantity for a trait.

Study looked at 8,798 SNPs from 190 DNA repair genes and 11 demographic/behavioral risk factors. Eleven SNPs were significantly associated with BCC, three of which were also associated with M-inv. Major individual factors were significant mediators for all skin cancers.

Population-based, prospective cohort study included 468 885 UK Biobank participants free of CVD at baseline. Fat mass and muscle mass were estimated using a bioelectrical impedance assessment device. FMR was calculated as fat mass divided by muscle mass in corresponding body parts. During 12.5 years of follow-up, we documented 49 936 CVD cases and 4158 CVD deaths.

We studied 4,129 T2D individuals with microvascular complications at baseline. Over a median follow-up of 11.7 years, a total of 1,180 cases of incident ASCVD were documented. After multivariable-adjustment, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) level was linearly associated with a decreased risk of ASCVD.

Cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) imaging is a powerful modality in functional and anatomical assessment for various cardiovascular diseases. A large number of medical images, the variety of imaging artefacts, and the workload of imaging centres are among the factors that reveal the necessity of automatic image quality assessment. However, automated IQA requires access to bulk annotated datasets for training deep learning (DL) models.

Multimorbidity is associated with reduced wellbeing and life expectancy. This study seeks to assess the causality of education, BMI, smoking and alcohol. We used a Mendelian randomization design to interrogate causality.

There is a paucity of evidence on the risk of sudden cardiac death (SCD) according to the degree of neuroticism. We sought to evaluate the association between neuroticism and the long-term risk of SCD.

Little is known about genetic interactions that may influence bladder cancer (BC) risk. We identified 10 statistically significant pairs of SNPs, which located in 17 chromosomes. Four SNP-SNP interactions were found to be positively associated with BC risk among Caucasian participants. Only four interactions were consistently identified in non-Caucasian participants located in ST7L-ADSS2, FHIT-CHDH, LARP4B-LHPP and RBFOX3-MPRIP. We used the selected interactions to build a BC screening model.

Peripheral immune markers have been associated with the progression and prognosis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Whether dysregulation of peripheral immunity is a risk factor for ALS or a consequence of motor neuron degeneration has not yet been clarified. We aimed to identify longitudinal associations between prediagnostic peripheral immunity and the risk of incident ALS.

ONECUT1 (also known as HNF6) is a transcription factor involved in pancreatic development and &#946;-cell function. Recently, biallelic variants in ONECut1 were reported as a cause of neonatal diabetes mellitus (NDM) and type 2 diabetes.

 Epidemiological studies have identified an inverse association between cancer and dementia. No studies systematically investigated the potential for each source of bias within a single dataset. We used the UK Biobank to compare estimates for the cancer-dementia association.

PMR/GCA cases were more likely to report poor general health and at least several days of low mood in the past 2 weeks. PMR was associated with hypothyroidism and ever-use of HRT. Hypertension and cataract, both of which can be exacerbated by long-term glucocorticoid therapy, were over-represented.

There is a widespread notion that tobacco smoking controls weight based on the appetite suppressive effect of nicotine. However, the causal relationship between smoking initiation and obesity-related traits in the general population is unclear. This analysis utilized 378 genetic variants associated with tobacco smoking initiation.

Identifying gene-by-environment interactions (GxE) is crucial to understand the interplay of environmental effects on complex traits. Current methods evaluating GxE on biobank-scale datasets have limitations. We introduce MonsterLM, a multiple linear regression method that does not rely on model specification.

UK Biobank was established from 2006 to 2010 in the United Kingdom. Functional auditory capacity was measured with a digit triplet test. 9 chronic diseases were considered, including chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, dementia, Parkinson's disease, stroke, cancer, depression, osteoarthritis, coronary heart disease, and diabetes.

Nicotine-dependence-related genetic loci are among the most replicable genetic findings. It is computationally challenging for existing fine-mapping methods to reliably identify causal variants. We propose a new method to select SNPs by jointly modeling the SNP-wise inference results and the underlying structured network patterns of the linkage disequilibrium (LD) matrix.

Many chronic disease symptomatologies involve desynchronized sleep-wake cycles. This can be interrogated using body temperature rhythms. We investigated the association of wrist temperature amplitudes with a future onset of disease in the UK Biobank.

Parkinson's disease (PD) is the fastest-growing neurological condition with over 10 million cases worldwide. While age and sex are known predictors of incident PD, there is a need to identify other predictors. This study compares the prediction performance of accelerometry-derived physical activity (PA) measures and traditional risk factors for incident PD in the UK Biobank.

The corpus callosum (CC) is a brain structure with a high heritability and potential role in psychiatric disorders. The genetic architecture of the CC and the genetic link with psychiatric disorders remain largely unclear. We investigated the genetic architectures of the volume of theCC and its subregions. We found significant genetic correlations of total CC volume with bipolar disorder and major depressive disorder.

Excess sedentary time is recognized as an important modifiable risk factor for coronary heart disease (CHD) This study included 77,500 White British (57% female) with valid wrist-worn accelerometry and without prevalent CHD/stroke from UK Biobank. Replacing any amount of ST with an equal amount of MVPA time is associated with a lower relative risk of CHD.

Myeloid neoplasms encompass acute myeloid leukemia, myelodysplastic syndromes and myeloproliferative neoplasm. Most cases arise from the shared ancestor of clonal hematopoiesis (CH) Here we analyze data from 454,340 UK Biobank participants.

Atrophy related to multiple sclerosis (MS) has been found at the early stages of the disease. We modeled the volumetric trajectories of brain structures across the entire lifespan using 40,944 subjects. The thalamus was the most impacted structure with a very early divergence in life.

The relationship between high plasma high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) and cause and mortality are not well established in healthy older people. Higher HDL-C levels are associated with increased risk from cancer and "non-cancer non-CVD" mortality inhealthy older men but no such relationship was observed in women.

The association of a healthy lifestyle with the prognosis of type 2 diabetes remains uncertain. A healthy lifestyle and a higher American Heart Association's Life's Essential 8 score were associated with lower risks of macrovascular and microvascular diseases. Adhering to an ideal lifestyle may prevent 37.0% of Macrovascular disease and 24.7% of Microvascular Disease.

Traditional modifiable cardiovascular risk factors, such as high blood pressure, have long been positively correlated with high carotid intima-media thickness (cIMT) This study found that the cardiovascular risk profile generally worsened across the cIMT quantiles from lowest to highest.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) is a polygenic neurodegenerative disorder. Single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in multiple genes have been associated with AD. None of them were characterized as causal variants that indicate the complex genetic architecture of AD, which is likely affected by individual variants and their interactions.

Low/moderate-intensity statins and ezetimibe was projected to lead to a gain in quality-adjusted life-years of 0.067 per person initiated at 30 and 0.026 at age 60 years. Initiating therapy at 40 years of age was the most cost effective for all lipid-lowering strategies.

Handgrip strength (HGS) and skeletal muscle mass (SMM) were measured in type 2 diabetes (T2DM) patients. Baseline survey was conducted between 2006 and 2010, and followed up for a median of 12.52 years. Risk for all-cause mortality and CVD mortality among both men and women increased progressively with decreasing HGS quartiles. Grip strength displayed a linear downward trend with mortality risk among T2DM patients.

Genome-wide association studies (GWASs) were performed for T2 (T2) versus non-T2 asthma. High BEC was associated with asthma and decreased pulmonary function. Genetic variants associated with BEC and asthma were not associated with severity.

Hip minimum joint space width (mJSW) provides a proxy for cartilage thickness. Study aimed to identify new genetic determinants of mJSW. 42 SNPs, which mapped to 39 loci, were identified.

Optimal lung repair and regeneration are essential for recovery from viral infections, including influenza A virus (IAV) We have previously demonstrated that acute inflammation and mortality induced by IAV is under circadian control. We show that lung organoids have a functional circadian clock and the disruption of this clock impairs regenerative capacity.

The separate effects of cooked and raw vegetable intake remain unclear. This study aimed to investigate the associations between cooked andRaw vegetable intake with cardiovascular outcomes using MR. Raw vegetable intake was nominally associated with stroke, but this did not pass the corrected significance level.

IGF-1 deficiency has been consistently reported in animal studies. Relationship between IGF-1 and human brain health remains controversial. Our study aimed to investigate the associations of serum IGF- 1 concentrations with some brain-related disorders and neuroimaging features.

C-reactive protein (CRP) tends to be elevated in individuals with psychiatric disorders. We investigated the shared genetic underpinnings of psychiatric disorders and variation in CRP levels. We identified 401 genetic loci jointly associated with CRP and psychiatric disorders with mixed effect directions.

Plant-based diets have been associated with a lower risk of several chronic diseases, but the relationship with PD is unknown. We examined the association of three different plant-based diet indices with PD incidence in the UK Biobank cohort.

Chronic kidney disease (CKD) severity is determined by levels of both estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and the urine albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR) Whether there is a graded increase in dementia risk for worse eGFR in each ACR category is unclear.

Individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) tend to experience lower well-being. This study aims to investigate if a genetic predisposition for ASD is associated with 5-WBS traits using polygenic risk score (PRS) analysis. PRS for ASD were calculated based on the latest genome-wide association study of ASD.

Mendelian randomization studies report a bi-directional relation between cigarette smoking and mental disorders. We calculated polygenic risk scores (PRS) for ever smoking, pack-years of smoking as a proportion of adult life, and neuroticism in 337,140 UK Biobank participants of white British ancestry. These PRS and self-reported smoking status were entered as explanatory variables in survival models for hospitalization.

The impact of allergic phenotypes on mid- or late-life health is less discussed. We conducted observational studies and mendelian randomization (MR) analysis. Based on the UKB data, AD, asthma and EC were positively correlated with pre-sarcopenia and decreased skeletal muscle mass index.

Cardiovascular ageing is a process that begins early in life and leads to a progressive change in structure and decline in function. Damaging biophysical, metabolic and immunological factors exceed endogenous repair mechanisms resulting in a pro-fibrotic state. The genetic architecture of cardiovascular ageing is not known.

Cadaveric studies have shown disease-related neurodegeneration and other morphological abnormalities in the retina of individuals with Parkinson disease (PD) It remains unclear whether this can be reliably detected with in vivo imaging. We investigated inner retinal anatomy, measured using optical coherence tomography (OCT), in prevalent PD and assessed the association of these markers with the development of PD.

Study included 212,968 participants from the UK Biobank, aged &#8805;60 years. Participants who regularly used paracetamol had a significantly higher risk of new-onset all-cause dementia.

A total of 452,996 UK Biobank participants with calculated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and albumin-to-creatinine ratio (ACR) were included. During a median follow-up of 12 years, 5,258 incident ACD cases were identified. The deterioration of kidney function was associated with an increased risk of ACD.

Short-term randomized trials have demonstrated that replacing saturated fat (SFA) with polyunsaturated fat (PUFA) causes a reduction or prevention of liver fat accumulation. But population-based studies on diet and body fat distribution are limited. We investigated cross-sectional associations between diet, circulating fatty acids and liver fat and other fat depots.

Severe hypercholesterolemia is associated with increased risk for coronary artery disease (CAD) Causes include monogenic familial hypercholesterol, polygenic hyperch cholesterol, elevated lipoprotein(a) [Lp(a)] hypercholesteremia, or nongenetic. Study looked at incident CAD risk among 130 091 UK Biobank participants.

We aimed to analyse whether patients with ischaemic stroke (IS) occurring within eight days after the onset of COVID-19 (IS-COV) are associated with a specific aetiology of IS. Three genomic regions were associated ( p -value  PITX2, HS6ST1 and RFFL) with IS. A statistically significant PRS was observed for LAA. Our results suggest that IS-COv cases are genetically similar to LAA and CES subtypes.

Platelets are a rich source of profibrotic TGF&#946; however, the role of platelets in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) is unclear. We identified that patients with IPF have significantly more platelets, neutrophils, and active T GF&# 946; in their airways than control patients. Using an animal model of IPF, we demonstrated that platelet-derived TGF &#9 46; does not significantly drive lung fibrosis or inflammation.

We investigated the association of HbA1c levels with COPD risk in the general population. We used data from 420 065 participants in the UK Biobank. During a median follow-up of 12.3 years, 11 556 COPD cases were recorded. The findings indicated that lower and higher Hb a 1c levels were associated with a higher risk of COPD.

Most loci currently associated with kidney function are still limited to European ancestry. We set out to identify susceptibility loci associated with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFRcrea) in 80027 individuals of African-ancestry. We identified 8 lead SNPs, 7 of which were previously associated with eGFR.

Late diurnal preference is often associated with circadian misalignment. This means that evening people live more frequently against their internal clock. Study aims to quantify the causal contribution of diurnal preferences on mental health outcomes.

Age-related hearing impairment (ARHI) is the most common sensory disorder in older adults. We conducted a genome-wide association meta-analysis of 121,934 ARHI cases and 591,699 controls from Iceland and the UK. We identified 21 novel sequence variants, of which 13 are rare, under either additive or recessive models.

Parent-of-origin (PoO) effects refer to the differential phenotypic impacts of genetic variants dependent on their parental inheritance due to imprinting. While PoO effects can influence complex traits, they may be poorly captured by models that do not differentiate the parental origin of the variant. The aim of this study was to conduct a genome-wide screen for PoO effect on a broad range of clinical traits derived from electronic health records (EHR)

UK Biobank study uses mendelian randomization approach to mitigate variability and confounding that has affected previous analyses. Systolic BP (SBP) and diastolic BP polygenic risk scores (PRSs) were calculated using summary statistics. Genetic propensity for high SBP had an approximately linear association with worsened fluid intelligence.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) is a major cause of disability and mortality in older adults. This study aimed to investigate the association of AD with education and genetic factors. Genetic risk was assessed using a polygenic risk score for AD. The educational level was categorized as either low, intermediate, or high.

 minority ethnic groups in the UK are known to have poorer COVID-19 outcomes, but also an increased prevelance of certain comorbidities associated with severe outcomes. Despite the prevalence of certain psychiatric disorders there is a lack of research establishing their relationship with outcomes. We used UK Biobank data, involving 472,182 participants.

Mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) is a maternally inherited, high-copy-number genome required for oxidative phosphorylation. Heteroplasmy refers to the presence of a mixture of mtDNA alleles in an individual and has been associated with disease and ageing. Mechanisms underlying common variation in human heteroplas my, and the influence of the nuclear genome on this variation, remain insufficiently explored.

Little is known about the extent and magnitude of variability in the amino acid composition of the proglucagon precursor and its mature peptides. We identified 184 unique missense variants in the human progLucagon gene GCG obtained from exome and whole-genome sequencing of more than 450,000 individuals.

The pharmacological management of musculoskeletal pain starts with NSAIDs, followed by weak or strong opioids until the pain is under control. The treatment outcome is usually unsatisfying due to inter-individual differences. To investigate the genetic component of treatment outcome differences, we performed a genome-wide association study (GWAS) in 23,000 participants.

FastKAST is a kernel-based approach that can test for non-linear effects of a set of variants on a quantitative trait. We apply FastKAST to 53 quantitative traits measured across &#8776; 300 K unrelated white British individuals in the UK Biobank.

Diet is increasingly recognized as an important risk factor for mental health. We aimed to investigate the associations of dietary patterns characterized by a set of nutrients of interest with depressive and anxiety symptoms. The analyses included a total of 126,819 participants in the UK Biobank who had completed at least two dietary questionnaires.

Metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MAFLD) is a condition characterized by liver fat accumulation and metabolic abnormalities. It is important to understand its association with major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) such as myocardial infarction (MI) and stroke. In this study, we analyzed the data of 325,129 participants in the UK Biobank and calculated relative risks for MI and stroke using Cox regression analysis.

UK Biobank followed 191 970 dementia-free participants for 16 years to detect incident dementia. Compared to normal kidney function, there was an increased risk of dementia with moderate to severely impaired kidney function. Impaired kidney function is associated with about 50% increased risk.

Studies have suggested a protective role for eosinophils in colorectal cancer (CRC) development and implicated neutrophils, but the causal relationships remain unclear. Here, we aimed to estimate the causal effect of circulating white blood cell (WBC) counts (N = ~550 000) on CRC risk.

Pernicious anemia is a rare condition characterized by vitamin B12 deficiency anemia due to lack of intrinsic factor. It is often caused by autoimmune gastritis. Patients with it have a higher incidence of other autoimmune disorders, such as type 1 diabetes, vitiligo and autoimmune thyroid issues.

Large-scale and high-dimensional genome sequencing data poses computational challenges. General-purpose optimization tools are usually not optimal in terms of computational and memory performance for genetic data. We take advantage of this fact and use two bits to represent each entry in a genetic matrix.

Global ultra-processed food (UPF) consumption has risen rapidly. The development and prognosis of depression and anxiety remain unclarified. We aimed to examine the association between UPF consumption and the incidence and progression trajectory of depression.

Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) was associated with elevated risk of cardiometabolic diseases in observational studies. We aimed to evaluate the observational and genetic associations of Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC) with multiple cardiometric outcomes. More than 400 000 participants who were free of major cardiovascular disease and diabetes at recruitment were followed up until December 2019.

We theorize that changes in genetic effects by social conditions depend on the level of resource constraints. We explored several sex-specific GÃ—C trends across a set of outcomes using 30 birth cohorts of UK Biobank data. We find that genetic coefficients on years of schooling and secondary educational attainment substantially decrease.

Age-related clonal expansion of cells harbouring mosaic chromosomal alterations (mCAs) is one manifestation of clonal haematopoiesis. Identifying factors that influence the generation and promotion of mCAs are key to investigate the role of m CAs in health and disease. Herein, we report on widely measured serum biomarkers and their possible association with mC as.

A large international meta-analysis using primary data from 64 cohorts has quantified the increased risk of fracture associated with a previous history of fracture for future use in FRAX. Low BMD explained a minority of the risk for any clinical fracture (14%), osteoporotic fracture (17%), and for hip fracture.

Among 427,435 people, CVD rates were 16.9 and 9.1 events/1000 person-years for men and women. Men and women with pre-diabetes, undiagnosed diabetes, and diagnosed diabetes were at higher risks of CVD than those with normal HbA1c. Excess risks could be ameliorated by attention to weight reduction strategies.

The associations of oral contraceptive (OC) use with cardiovascular disease (CVD) and all-cause death remains unclear. This cohort study included 161 017 women who had no CVD at baseline and reported their OC use. No significant associations of OC use with CVD death, myocardial infarction, or stroke were observed.

The effects of air pollutants on cardiometabolic diseases (CMDs) have been widely explored. We employed the UK Biobank cohort (N = 317,160) to study the association between six air pollutants and four CMDs. CMM was defined as occurrence of two or more of the four diseases.

Misclassification of diabetes type occurs in people with atypical presentations of type 1 diabetes (T1D) or type 2 diabetes ( t2D) Current clinical guidelines suggest clinical variables and treatment response as ways to help differentiate diabetes type. This work aimed to assess the clinical utility of 2 polygenic scores (PGSs) in differentiating between T1D and T2D.

Research suggests that posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) may be a risk factor for poor cardiovascular health. Our understanding of who might be at greatest risk of adverse cardiovascular outcomes after trauma is limited. In this study, we conducted the first examination of the individual and synergistic contributions of PTSD symptoms and blood pressure genetics to continuous blood pressure levels.

Weight gain and metabolic complications are major adverse effects of many psychotropic drugs. We aimed to understand how socio-economic status (SES) is associated with cardiometabolic parameters after initiation of psychotropic medications. The SSEP integrated neighborhood-based income, education, occupation, and housing condition.

Using severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) positive participants from the UK Biobank, we developed and validated a clinical and genetic model to predict risk of severe COVID-19. Accurate prediction of individual risk is possible and will be important in regions where vaccines are not widely available or where people refuse or are disqualified from vaccination.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) and depression are debilitating brain disorders that are often comorbid. As both disorders are (partly) heritable, characterising their genetic overlap may provide aetiological clues. Previous studies have indicated negligible genetic correlations. This study aims to expose the genetic overlap that may remain hidden.

Recent studies have implicated important roles for endolysosomal ion channels in cancer biology. We used UK Biobank data to characterise the relationships between genetic variants in TPCN2 and P2RX4 and cancer. We investigated these relationships at both global and local levels.

Endometriosis, polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) and uterine fibroids have been proposed as endometrial cancer risk factors. Using genome-wide association study (GWAS) data, we explored the relationships between these non-cancerous gynecological diseases and endometrian cancer risk. We found significant genetic correlation between endometricrial cancer and PCOS, andÂ  uterineÂ fibroids.

Migraine is three times more prevalent in people with bipolar disorder or depression. The relationship between schizophrenia and migraine is less certain although glutamatergic and serotonergic neurotransmission are implicated in both. A shared genetic basis to migraine and mental disorders has been suggested but previous studies have reported weak or non-significant genetic correlations.

Major depressive disorder (MDD) is defined differently across genetic research studies and this may be a key source of heterogeneity. Thirty-two depression phenotypes which incorporate different combinations of MDD components were created using mental health questionnaire data within the UK Biobank. SNP-based heritabilities and genetic correlations with three previously defined major depression phenotype were calculated.

Polygenic Risk Scores (PRS) for AD offer unique possibilities for reliable identification of individuals at high and low risk of AD. Little agreement in the field as to what approach should be used for genetic risk score calculations. Best prediction accuracy is achieved with a model with two predictors (APOE and PRS excluding APOE region) with pT.

Some studies suggest that occupational physical activity (OPA) may not confer health benefits. The purpose of this study was to investigate associations between OPA and mortality outcomes. 460,901 UK Biobank participants (aged 40-69 years) were followed for a median 12.0 years.

 genome-wide association studies have proven useful for investigating liver biology. The rare missense variant SLC30A10 Thr95Ile associates with the largest elevation of both enzymes. Carriers also have increased risk of extrahepatic bile duct cancer.

Alcohol consumption was associated with all assessed outcomes in a J-shaped manner relative to current non-drinkers. No statistically significant elevated risks were found at higher levels of drinking. For secondary prevention of CVD, current drinkers may not need to stop drinking.

A 1 mph (i.e., 1.6 kph) increase in self-reported habitual walking pace corresponds to a 63% (hazard ratio (HR) = 0.37, 95% confidence interval (CI), 0.25-0.55) reduction in coronary artery disease risk. We used a latent variable framework throughout to model walking pace as a continuous exposure, which provided more robust and interpretable causal effect estimates. Our findings suggest that interventions that seek to encourage individuals to walk more briskly should lead to protective effects.

Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and polygenic risk for intelligence (PRS-IQ) both confer susceptibility for autism spectrum disorder (ASD) but have opposing effects on cognitive ability. The field has struggled to disentangle the effects of these two classes of genomic variants on Cognitive ability from their effects on ASD susceptibility. In a cohort of 8,426 subjects with ASD and 169,804 controls with cognitive assessments, we found that rare CNVs increased ASD risk.

Proteomics may discover pathophysiological changes related to hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) HCC is an aggressive and lethal type of cancer with low sensitivity for early-stage diagnosis.

The association between alcohol consumption and the risk of sudden cardiac death and/or fatal ventricular arrhythmia remains controversial. We identified 397,164 individuals enrolled between 2006 and 2010 from the UK Biobank database and followed them until 2021. There was no prognostic difference among nondrinkers, mild drinkers, moderate drinkers, and heavy drinkers.

Cross-sectional study included 437,860 participants from the UK Biobank. Good adherence to a healthy diet was defined as the top 75th percentile, while poor adherence wasdefined as the lowest 25th percentile. There were significant trends whereby diet scores tended to be less healthy as deprivation markers increased.

UK Biobank data collected from 365,307 participants who were free of back pain at baseline. The associations between all types of physical activity and incident back pain were significantly non-linear. Substituting sedentary behaviours with physical activities reduced the risk of future back pain.

For every one-unit increase in body mass index, the risk of incident multimorbidity increased by 5.2% (95% confidence interval 5.0%-5.4%). Hip circumference and hip-to-height ratio had protective effects on multimorbridity onset. Consistent findings were observed for males and females.

The Oxidative Balance Score (OBS) is commonly used to assess oxidative stress. There is limited research on the association between OBS and colorectal cancer (CRC), its subsites, and complications. We included data from 175,808 participants in the UK Biobank data sample repository from 2006 to 2010.

PhenoAge is a measure of biological aging processes in the body. It could provide an alternative way to assessing aging-related cancer risks. People with higher PhenoAge scores had a roughly 25 percent higher risk of developing cancer.

Study examines the association between traditional cardiovascular health (CVH) metrics and major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) incidence in individuals with diverse sleep patterns. Sleep patterns were assessed using scores for chronotype, duration, insomnia, snoring, and daytime dozing.

Heart failure (HF) is a serious condition with increasing prevalence, high morbidity, and increased mortality. Obesity is an established risk factor for HF. Fluctuation in body mass index (BMI) has shown a higher risk of cardiovascular outcomes. We investigated the association between BMI variability and incident HF.

 353 742 adults of European ancestry were recruited from 2006 to 2010. They were followed up until 2021 with a median follow-up of 12.86 years. Participants were grouped into three genetically determined lifespan categories including long (20.1%), intermediate (60.1%) and short (19.8%)

The Tsimane, indigenous to the Bolivian Amazon, derive their subsistence from foraging and horticulture. The Moseten, a mixed-ethnicity farming population, are physically active but less than theTsimane. Within both populations, some parietal and occipital structures mediating visuospatial abilities exhibit small but significant increases in regional volume with age.

Women recruited to the UK Biobank cohort during 2006-2010 were followed up from their first delivery until 31 October 2021. After adjusting for confounders and behavioural factors, GDM was associated with increased risk for premature mortality.

Sarcopenia may increase non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) risk, but prevalence likely varies with different diagnostic criteria. This study examined the prevalence of sarcopenia and its defining components in adults with and without NAFLD.

Biological age (BA) serves as both a precursor and a predictor of age-related diseases. We measured whether there was a longitudinal association between drinking frequency and pure alcohol intake with BA among middle-aged and older people. More frequent drinkers exhibited increased accelerated BA.

Dementia has a long prodromal stage with various pathophysiological manifestations. The progression of pre-diagnostic changes remains unclear. We aimed to determine the evolutional trajectories of multiple-domain clinical assessments and health conditions up to 15 years before the diagnosis.

Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) are commonly used for gastric acid-related disorders. Their safety profile and risk stratification for high-burden diseases need further investigation. PPI use correlated with increased risk of 15 leading global diseases.

Knowing how circadian rhythm influences brain health remains limited. We aimed to investigate the associations of accelerometer-measured circadian rest-activity rhythm (CRAR) with incident dementia, cognitive dysfunction, and structural brain abnormalities in the general population.

Common variants of the max-like protein X (MLX)-interacting protein-like gene have been shown to be associated with plasma triglyceride levels. The role of these variants in steatotic liver disease (SLD) is unclear. Carriers of MLXIPL Gln241His were associated with significantly lower serum levels of triglycerides and apolipoprotein-B.

Essential tremor (ET) is a prevalent neurological disorder with a largely unknown underlying biology. In this genome-wide association study meta-analysis, comprising 16,480 ET cases and 1,936,173 controls from seven datasets, we identify 12 sequence variants at 11 loci. We highlight seven putative causal genes at these loci, including CA3 and CPLX1.

Hypertension is a leading risk factor for cardiovascular disease and is modulated by genetic variants. Study aimed to assess the effect of obesity genetic liability and physical activity on hypertension among European and African ancestry individuals within the UK Biobank.

Genetic variants that severely alter protein products are often associated with disease. For some genes, these predicted loss-of-function variants (pLoFs) are observed throughout the gene. In others, they occur only at specific locations. We investigated whether pLoF location could explain instances of incomplete penetrance of variants expected to be pathogenic for Mendelian conditions.

 Genetic susceptibility to chronic diseases has been shown to influence heart failure (HF) risk. However, the underlying biological pathways, particularly the role of leukocyte telomere length (LTL), are largely unknown. We investigated the impact of genetic susceptibility to Chronic diseases and various traits on HF risk, and whether LTL mediates or modifies the pathways.

Whole blood viscosity (WBV) and an increased risk of cardiovascular disease (CVD) has been reported. However, the causal relationship between WBV and CVD remains not thoroughly investigated. The aim of this study was to investigate the causal relation between WBVs and CVA.

Intrapancreatic fat deposition (IPFD) heightens the risk of diseases of the exocrine and endocrine pancreas. Of the 42,599 participants included in the analysis, the prevalence of FP was 17.86%. Elevated IPFD levels were associated with an increased risk of acute pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer.

Diffusion MRI is a neuroimaging modality used to evaluate brain structure at a microscopic level. We use normative modelling to create a semi-automated pipeline for detecting diffusion imaging artefacts and errors. Our method was compared to two traditional quality control approaches.

Human healthy and pathological aging is linked to a steady decline in brain resting-state activity and connectivity measures. The neurophysiological mechanisms that underlie these changes remain poorly understood. We found that the distributions of several major neurotransmitter systems including serotonergic, dopaminergic, noradrenergic, and glutamatergic correlated with age-related changes.

Few studies have examined dietary protein intake and sources, in combination with longitudinal changes in brain structure markers. Increasing the proportion of animal protein was associated with a slower reduction in the total hippocampus volume.

Alzheimer's disease (AD)-related neuropathological changes can occur decades before clinical symptoms. We aimed to investigate whether neurodevelopment and/or neurodegeneration affects the risk of AD, through reducing structural brain reserve or increasing brain atrophy.

Quercetin, a major flavonoid, can attenuate the disease activity of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) However, there is limited evidence that supports the benefits of quercet in patients with IBD. To investigate whether dietary quercETin intake is associated with adverse outcomes, we studied 2293 participants with I BD.

Previous studies have suggested a potential correlation between rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and biological aging, but the intricate connections and mechanisms remain elusive. In our study, we focused on two specific measures of biological age (PhenoAge and BioAge), which are derived from clinical biomarkers.

Deep learning was used to calculate the functional genomic activity score. This score, defined as the Haplotype Function Score (HFS), replaces the original genotype. Applying the HFS framework to 14 complex traits in the UK Biobank, we identified 3619 independent HFS-trait associations with a significance of p.

UK Biobank surveyed 174,771 adult participants who completed the Digestive Health Questionnaire (DHQ) through emails and websites. Mixed IBS was the predominant subtype, followed by diarrhea-predominant IBS (25.1%) Somatization and coeliac disease are primary risk factors for IBS.

Tuberculosis is a significant public health concern resulting in the death of over 1 million individuals each year worldwide. A substantial number of infections still remain untreated or are caused by treatment resistant strains. It is important to identify mechanisms that contribute to risk and prognosis of tuberculosis.

Study is a population-based and prospective cohort study on 36 939 UK Biobank participants. During a median follow-up of 11.6 years, a total of 5935 participants developed CMM. Usually/always night shift workers were associated with a 16% higher risk of CMM compared with day workers.

The association between adversity and cognition varies according to the specific adversity, when the adversity was experienced, and the cognitive domains investigated. Disentangling the effect of adversity and the underlying mechanistic pathway is difficult. Cumulative life course adversity was measured with items based on the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTS-5) and items adapted from the British Crime Survey. Depression was assessed with the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) Intra-individual variability in reaction time was measured using a reaction time test "snap game"

Mental disorders are associated with reduced life expectancy and elevated levels of frailty. In this study, we examined the mortality risk associated with frailty in individuals with a lifetime history of mental disorders compared to individuals without mental disorders. Frailty and mental disorders represent potentially modifiable targets for prevention and treatment.

Population-based associations between rare variants and quantitative endophenotypes for three monogenic diseases. Effect sizes are associated with pathogenic ClinVar assertions.

This study describes the creation of the new individual fatty acid (FA) dataset for the Oxford WebQ. Participants who completed &#8805;1 (maximum of five) 24 h dietary assessments were included. Nutrient data from the UK McCance and Widdowson's The Composition of Foods were used to calculate intakes of 21 individual FAs.

For Alzheimer's disease-a leading cause of dementia and global morbidity-improved identification of presymptomatic high-risk individuals and identification of new circulating biomarkers are key public health needs. We tested the hypothesis that a polygenic predictor of risk would identify a subset of the population with increased risk of clinically diagnosed dementia.

UK Biobank enrolled 501,002 individuals aged between 40 and 70 years. During 4,438,839 person-years of follow-up, there were 2505 incident cases of all-cause dementia, including 932 cases of AD and 524 cases of VaD. Proton pump inhibitor use was associated with an increased risk of incident dementia, particularly among APOE &#949;4 heterozygotes.

Physical activity is regarded as favorable to health but effects across the spectrum of human disease are poorly quantified. In contrast to self-reported measures, wearable accelerometers can provide more precise and reproducible activity quantification. We test associations between moderate-to-vigorous physical activity (MVPA) and incidence of 697 diseases.

The process of identifying suitable genome-wide association (GWA) studies can be laborious. We present a centralized polygenic risk score calculator currently containing over 250,000 genetic variant associations. Polygenic risk scores are calculated either online through the Polygenic Risk Score Knowledge Base (PRSKB) or via a command-line interface.

Polygenicity and genetic heterogeneity pose great challenges for studying psychiatric conditions. Genetically informed approaches have been implemented in neuroimaging studies to address this issue. However, the effects on functional connectivity of rare and common genetic risks for psychiatric disorders are largely unknown. Our objectives were to estimate and compare the effect sizes on brain connectivity of psychiatric genomic risk factors.

Age at natural menopause (ANM) is associated with a range of health-related traits, including bone health, female reproductive cancers, and cardiometabolic health. We conducted a hypothesis-free analysis of the genetic risk score (GRS) for ANM with 18,961 health- related traits among 181,279 women in UK Biobank. We sought to replicate our findings in independent cohorts.

The role of germline genetic factors in determining survival from cutaneous melanoma (CM) is not well understood. We conducted a genome-wide association study (GWAS) meta-analysis of melanoma-specific survival (MSS)

The aim of this study was to characterize telomere length, a biological hallmark of aging, in individuals with mental disorders. The UK Biobank is a multicenter community-based observational study that recruited >500,000 middle-aged and older adults. Individuals with depression had shorter telomeres than people withoutmental disorders.

Device-measured MPA and VPA were associated with lower risk of affective disorders. The potential mental health benefits of MPA continue to accrue above the current World Health Organization recommendation. Replacing 30 min of sedentary behaviour in a week with MPA (HR 0.95, 95% CI 0.94-0.97) or VPA ( HR 0.91, 95â€™sCI 0.85- 0.98) was associated with a lower risk.

Chronic back pain (CBP) is heterogenous and identifying sub-groups could improve clinical decision making. Machine learning can build upon prior sub-grouping approaches by using a data-driven approach to overcome clinician subjectivity. We showed that two variables (loneliness/social isolation and depression) and five clusters were optimal for creating sub- groups of CBP individuals.

Two-stage GWAS (discovery and confirmation) was performed for diaphragmatic hernia in the UKB. 275,549 and 91,850 subjects were randomly selected for association tests in Stages 1 and 2, respectively. Association tests between 8,568,156 SNPs (genotyped or imputed with MAF > 0.01) and hernia were performed in Stage 1.

Deep learning methods have recently gained success in detecting left ventricular systolic dysfunction (LVSD) from electrocardiogram (ECG) waveforms. Despite their high level of accuracy, they are difficult to interpret and deploy broadly in the clinical setting. In this study, we set out to determine whether simpler models based on standard ECG measurements could detect LVSD with similar accuracy.

Clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) is an age-related condition predisposing to hematologic cancers and cardiovascular disease. Gout is a common inflammatory arthritis caused by precipitation of monosodium urate (MSU) crystals in individuals with hyperuricemia. CHIP is associated with elevated IL-1&#946;, thus we investigated CHIP as a risk factor for gout.

No prior studies have linked air pollution exposure to incident sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) We aimed to investigate the association between long-term exposure to air pollution and SCA. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) were selected as intermediate conditions. During a median follow-up of 13.7 years, 2884 participants developed SCA among 458 237 individuals.

Using the UK Biobank cohort, a multivariable Cox regression analysis was conducted on 406,424 individuals. Reduced FEV 1  and FVC %pred values were associated with an elevated risk across all studied outcomes. The fact that the increased risk was evident also atFEV 1 and F VC levels exceeding 80 %pred challenges the contemporary classification of lung function categories.

High level of apolipoprotein A was significantly correlated with lower lung cancer risk. An inverse-J-shaped relationship between high-density lipoprotein (HDL) and incident lung cancer was found. Individuals with low total cholesterol, HDL, low- density lipop protein (LDL) combined with high PRS showed elevated lung cancer risks.

Higher heel eBMD was associated with lower odds of all prevalent CVDs considered. The greatest magnitude of effect was seen in association with HF and NICM. Findings support the notion that bone-cardiovascular associations reflect shared risk factors/mechanisms rather than direct causal pathways.

Genetic research into atrial fibrillation (AF) and myocardial infarction (MI) has predominantly focused on comparing afflicted individuals with their healthy counterparts. This approach lacks granularity, thus overlooking subtleties within patient populations. In this study, we explore the distinction between AF and MI patients who experience only a single disease event and those experiencing recurrent events.

Cystatin C (CysC) has been implicated in various physical and pathological activities. However, the impact of serum CysC on cancer mortality in a general population remains unknown. We aimed to examine the associations of Cys C concentrations with total mortality and mortality of 12 site-specific cancers.

Interplay between lifestyle risk scores and genetic risk scores on obesity and related chronic diseases are underinvestigated and necessary for understanding obesity causes and developing prevention strategies. Study aimed to investigate independent and joint associations and interactions of LRS and GRS with obesity prevalence and risks of diabetes, cardiovascular disease (CVD), and obesity-related cancer.

The "missing" heritability of complex traits may be partly explained by genetic variants interacting with other genes or environments that are difficult to specify, observe, and detect. We propose a new kernel-based method called Latent Interaction Testing (LIT) to screen for genetic interactions.

In patients with heart failure, concomitant sinus node dysfunction (SND) is an important predictor of mortality, yet its molecular underpinnings are poorly understood. Using proteomics, this study aimed to dissect the protein and phosphorylation remodelling within the sinus nodes in an animal model of HF with concurrent SND.

The association of dairy product consumption with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and cirrhosis remains controversial. This study aimed to prospectively investigate the associations between the consumption of the different types of dairy products, genetic predisposition, and the risks of NAFLD. The study included 190 145 participants from the UK Biobank Study. During a median follow-up of 11.6 years, 1512 NAFLd and 556 Cirrhosis cases were ascertained.

CRISPR base editing screens enable analysis of disease-associated variants at scale. variable efficiency and precision confounds the assessment of variant-induced phenotypes. Here, we provide an integrated experimental and computational pipeline that improves estimation of variant effects.

The presence of sex-differences in SNP effect implies a SNPÃ—sex interaction. This suggests the usage of the often overlooked joint test. The joint test statistic can be derived from sex-stratified summary statistics.

The lack of sex-specific cardiovascular disease criteria contributes to the underdiagnosis of women compared to that of men. For a first-degree atrioventricular block and dilated cardiomyopathy, two conditions with non-sex-specific diagnostic criteria, women are under-diagnosed 2Ã— and 1.4Ã— more than men.

There is a two-fold higher incidence of depression in females compared to men. Recent studies suggest a role for microglia in conferring this sex-dependent depression risk. In this study we investigated the nature of this relation. The adult microglial PGS moderated the association between BMI and financial insecurity.

Study used data from the UK Biobank cohort study, which recruited 500,000 adults. Subjects with multisensory impairments concurrent with visual impairment demonstrated a negative association with cognitive function. Those with both vision and hearing impairments had a significantly higher risk of developing dementia.

There is a close association between diet and abdominal pain, but relationship between inflammatory diet and characteristics of abdominal pain has not been characterized yet. This study analyzed baseline data from the UK Biobank, 3-item DHQ-Abdominal Pain Questionnaire (DHQ-3Q), which including abdominal pain in the past 3 months.

The role of serum urate (SU) levels in the development of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) remains a topic of debate. The objective of this study is to examine whether and to what extent a healthy diet can reduce the risk of COPD in relation to SU levels. The cohort analysis included 155 403 participants from the UK Biobank.

Elderly-onset seborrheic dermatitis (SD) seriously affects the quality of life. associations between air pollution exposures and SD incidence have not been elucidated. Higher concentrations of specific pollutants, particularly in the upper quartile, were significantly linked to an elevated SD risk.

Study looked at the effect of ultra-processed food (UPF) consumption, genetic susceptibility, and their interactions on hip/knee OA. After 1,461,447 person-years of follow-up, 11,540 patients developed Oa.

Common risk variants for schizophrenia within complement genes associate with structural changes in white matter microstructure within tracts innervating the frontal lobe. Risk alleles within the Major Histocompatibility Complex region in chromosome 6 appeared to drive these associations.

Point Cloud Deformation Network (PCD-Net) is a novel geometric deep learning approach for direct modeling of 3D cardiac mechanics. It combines a low-dimensional latent space with recent advances in point cloud deep learning for effective multi-scale feature learning directly on flexible and memory-efficient point cloud representations of the cardiac anatomy.

Study looked at 501,548 participants of the UK Biobank cohort study aged 40-69 years. Prevalence of pre-frailty and polypharmacy were 43.2% and 2.3% respectively. No profound associations with cancer incidence and cancer mortality were observed.

Lung cancer has a high incidence and poor prognosis. This study tends to develop a generalizable lung-cancer prediction model. We used machine learning to define high-risk groups and realize early identification and prevention of lung cancer.

Study aims to evaluate the association between UPF intake and the risk of CVD among individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D) Cystatin C, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), apolipoprotein A, C-reactive protein, and body mass index collectively explain 26.9% (12.8%, 48.5%) of the association.

Long-term exposure to ozone (O 3 ) and adult-onset asthma (AOA) remains inconclusive, and analysis of causality is lacking. To examine the causal association between long-term O 3 exposure and AOA, a prospective cohort study of 362,098 participants was conducted.

It remains unknown whether adiposity subtypes are differentially associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) A generally obese (PC1) and a tall, centrally obese ( PC3) body shape were both positively associated with CRC risk in observational analyses in 329,828 UK Biobank participants. Brain tissue-specific genetic instruments, mapped to PC1 through enrichment analysis, were responsible for the relationship between PC1 and CRC. Relationship between PC3 and CRC was predominantly driven by adipose tissue- specific genetic instruments.

We propose a new framework for human genetic association studies. At each locus, a deep learning model is used to calculate the functional genomic activity score. This score, defined as the Haplotype Function Score (HFS), replaces the original genotype. Applying the HFS framework to 14 complex traits in the UK Biobank, we identified 3619 independent HFS-trait associations with a significance of p  -8.

Study was designed to investigate whether the coronary artery disease polygenic risk score (CAD-PRS) may guide lipid-lowering treatment initiation as well as deferral in primary prevention. Participants were 311 799 individuals from the UK Biobank free of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease, diabetes, chronic kidney disease.

There was substantial variability in the prevalence of depression among patients with chronic pain. Clinically relevant factors were selected to develop prediction models. These predictors are convenient to collect during daily practice, making them easy for busy clinicians to use.

Patients with stroke showed poorer cardiovascular prevention profiles and lower adherence to guideline-directed therapies. These findings underscore the need to explore the reasons behind the underuse of secondary prevention in vulnerable stroke survivors.

1 in 4 people worldwide have non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) There are currently no medications to treat this condition. This study investigated the role of G protein-coupled receptor 75 (GPR75) in liver lipid accumulation.

Large-scale genome-wide association studies (GWAS) are emerging, based on heterogeneous disease definitions. We investigated the genetic architecture of IBS defined according to gold standard Rome Criteria. Rome III IBS showed significant SNP-heritability and similar genetic architecture across subtypes.

The amygdala nuclei modulate distributed neural circuits that most likely evolved to respond to environmental threats and opportunities. In the context of population change, the basal, lateral, accessory basal, and paralaminar nuclei change in lockstep with the prefrontal cortex. The central nucleus and anterior amygdaloid area are longitudinally tied with the inferior parietal lobule.

Metabolomic age models have been proposed for the study of biological aging, but they have not been widely validated. We aimed to assess the performance of newly developed and existing nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy (NMR) metabolomic Age models. Ninety-eight metabolic variables were measured in blood from nine UK and Finnish cohort studies.

Study looked at the role of longitudinal change in sleep patterns in the incidence of cardiovascular diseases (CVD) Compared with participants with stable poor patterns, those who improved their sleep patterns or maintained healthy sleep patterns had a 26% and 32% lower risk of CVD.

The UK Biobank has become an invaluable resource for identifying genetic variants that are associated with complex diseases. A common practice of these compendiums is to collect interval-censored data. One challenge in analyzing such data is the lack of methodology available for genetic association studies.

People with viral encephalitis had a later-life risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) that was 31 times higher. A genome wide association study (GWAS) with UK Biobank data revealed that the gene RAR Related Orphan Receptor B (RORB) is significantly associated with viralEncephalitis. RPTOR, a gene associated with the mTOR pathway, emerges as significant. Carriers of the minor allele A exhibiting decreased prevalence in subjects under age 55.

Rare damaging variants in a large number of genes are known to cause monogenic developmental disorders (DDs) They have also been shown to cause milder subclinical phenotypes in population cohorts. We show that carrying multiple (2-5) rare damaging variants across 599 dominant DD genes has an additive adverse effect on numerous cognitive and socioeconomic traits in UK Biobank.

The complications of liver cirrhosis occur after long asymptomatic stages of progressive fibrosis and are generally diagnosed late. We aimed to develop a plasma metabolomic-based score tool to predict these events. We enrolled 64,005 UK biobank participants with metabolomic profiles.

UK Biobank is a large-scale epidemiological resource for investigating correlations between various lifestyle, environmental, and genetic factors with health and disease progression. In this study, we augment the existing set of UK Biobanks neuroimaging structural IDPs with related measurements acquired through the Advanced Normalization Tools Ecosystem. Through predictive modeling, we assess the clinical utility of these IDP measurements, individually and in combination.

 Pharmacogenetic variants are associated with clinical outcomes during Calcium Channel Blocker (CCB) treatment. Whether effects are modified by genetically predicted clinical risk factors is unknown. We analyzed 32,000 UK Biobank participants treated with dihydropiridine CCBs.

Dietary salt intake has been linked with gastric cancer risk in Asian studies. Findings from Western populations are sparse and limited to case - control studies. Our aim was to evaluate the frequency of adding salt to food at table in relation to gastriccancer risk among UK adults.

Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) can cause a muscle loss phenotype (MLP) MLP is characterized by the loss of muscle mass, muscle strength, or loss of both muscle and fat mass. There are limited data comparing the individual traits of MLP with clinical outcomes in a large unbiased cohort of COPD patients.

Tobacco use disorder (TUD) is the most prevalent substance use disorder in the world. We leveraged four US biobanks to perform a multi-ancestral meta-analysis of TUD. We identified 88 independent risk loci and 461 potential risk genes.

Previous studies have demonstrated that incorporating a polygenic risk score (PRS) to existing risk prediction models for breast cancer improves model fit. To determine its clinical utility the impact on risk categorization needs to be established.

Early-onset prostate cancer (EOPC) has a unique clinical entity harboring high genetic risk. The majority of EOPC patients still substantial opportunity to be early-detected. A refined understanding of age-based polygenic risk score (PRS) for PCa would be essential for personalized risk stratification.

Age-related cataract and hearing difficulties are major sensory disorders that often co-exist in the global-wide elderly. Little is known about whether the two share their genetic etiology. We first investigated the clinical association between cataracts and hearing difficulty using the UK Biobank covering 502,543 individuals. Follow-up analysis implicates candidate genes QKI, STK17A, TYR, NSF, and TCF4.

Approximately 95% of samples analyzed in univariate genome-wide association studies are of European ancestry. Existing data in non-European populations could benefit from innovative approaches as recently illustrated in the context of polygenic risk scores.

Common genetic variants in SLCO1B1 cause altered systemic exposure to statins and therefore affect statin outcomes. We studied common and rare variants in up to 64,000 patients from UK Biobank prescribed simvastatin or atorvastATin. Both  S LCO1b1 *5 alone and the  SLCo1B 1 *15 haplotype increased LDL during treatment. We conclude that genotype-guided treatment could reduce GP-diagnosed muscle symptoms in statin patients.

Study looked at 407,792 participants from the UK Biobank who were free of dementia, stroke, or Parkinson's disease at enrollment. Compared with TV viewing >0-1 h/day, watching TV &#8805;5 h/ day was associated with higher risks of dementia.

The impact of smoking on healthcare costs is important for evaluating policies intended to modify this behavior. Conventional analysis of this association is difficult because of omitted variable bias, reverse causality, and measurement error. We undertook genome wide association studies to identify genetic variants associated with smoking initiation and a composite smoking index.

Overfeeding PUFA compared with SFA induced greater lean tissue accumulation despite similar weight gain. Similar nonsignificant results for SFA and PUFA were observed in UK Biobank, but circulating fatty acids demonstrated ambiguous and sex-dependent associations.

Traditional approaches use regression to sequentially test multiplicative interaction terms involving pairs of genetic variants. For higher-order interactions and genome-wide large-scale data, this strategy is computationally intractable. Building on the Predictability, Computability, Stability (PCS) framework, we introduce the epiTree pipeline.

The association between alcohol consumption and risk of peripheral artery disease (PAD) is inconclusive. We conducted this study to examine the association in two de novo cohort studies and a meta-analysis of observational studies. Compared with non- or never-drinkers, the relative risk of PAD was 0.83 (95% confidence interval [CI] 0.77-0.89)

Study investigates associations between air pollution and colorectal cancer (CRC) risk and survival from an epigenomic perspective. Methylation may partly mediate pathogenic effects of air pollution on CRC, with annotation to protein-coding genes TMBIM1/PNKD, CXCR5 and TMEM110.

Study was based on participants from the UK Biobank. 4502 cases of kidney stone were recorded during the follow-up of 423,301 participants. Participants with high (Q5) and moderate (Q2 to Q4) genetic risks had increased risks.

The morphologic properties of brain regions co-vary or correlate with each other. Here we investigated the structural covariances of cortical thickness and subcortical volumes in the ageing brain, along with their associations with age and cognition. We examined cross-sectional data from the UK Biobank (N = 42,075)

The effect of dyslipidemia on kidney disease outcomes has been inconclusive. We aimed to investigate the effects of genetic factors on the risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) using polygenic risk score (PRS) In total, 4,424 participants developed CKD.

Predicting and early detection of heart failure (HF) is crucial to mitigate its impact on quality of life, survival, and healthcare expenditure. Here, we explored the predictive value of serum metabolomics (168 metabolites detected by proton nuclear magnetic resonance [ 1 H-NMR] spectroscopy) for incident HF.

Machine learning (ML) methods are increasingly becoming crucial in genome-wide association studies. Unlike traditional methods, ML algorithms can identify groups of low-risk genetic variants.

Study investigated natural selection signals of genes associated with critically-ill COVID-19 in sub-Saharan Africans. Selection signals were assessed in 661 sub-Sahara Africans from 1000 Genomes Project. Allele frequency trajectory analysis of ancient DNA samples were used to validate the existing of selection. Natural selection resulted in increased CCR3 expression and eosinophil counts.

Dysbetalipoproteinemia (DBL) is a multifactorial disorder that disrupts the normal metabolism of remnant lipoproteins. However, establishing a proper diagnosis is difficult and the true prevalence of the disease in the general population remains unknown.

Integrated analyses of plasma proteomics and genetic data in prospective studies can help assess the causal relevance of proteins, improve risk prediction, and discover novel protein drug targets for type 2 diabetes (T2D) We measured plasma levels of 2,923 proteins using Olink Explore among &#8764;2,000 randomly selected participants from China Kadoorie Biobank.

Lung health is increasingly recognized as an essential factor in mental health. However, prospective evidence on lung function with incident depression remains to be determined. Study aimed to examine the prospective association between impaired lung function and incident depression and the underlying biological mechanisms.

Genetic susceptibility to POAG primarily influences ocular conditions, with limited systemic associations. Individuals carrying a high genetic burden exhibited a 9.20-fold increase in glaucoma incidence when associated with low corneal hysteresis, high myopia, and elevated intraocular pressure.

Women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) have increased odds of concurrent depression. Here, we aimed to use bioinformatic analysis to screen for the genetic elements shared between PCOS and depression. Three key genes, namely, SNAP23 , VTI1A , and PRKAR1A, were identified in the comorbidity.

The impact of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) on incident dementia is unknown. A history of GDM was associated with a greater risk of incident dementia. Type 2 diabetes partially mediated this relationship.

Hypertension and diabetes mellitus (DM) are major causes of morbidity and mortality. Advances in machine learning may provide opportunities to enhance diagnostics in settings with limited medical infrastructure.

Most existing PRS are primarily trained on European ancestry populations, limiting their transferability to non-European populations. We propose a novel method for generating multi-ancestry Polygenic Risk scOres based on enSemble of PEnalized Regression models.

Study included a total of 223,951 participants from the UK Biobank. Smoking, physical activity, alcohol consumption, healthy diet patterns, sedentary time, and sleep duration items were used. Risk of asthma was highest among participants with the lowest SES and the least healthy lifestyles.

Ageing is a heterogeneous multisystem process involving different rates of decline in physiological integrity across biological systems. The current study dissects the unique and common variance across body and brain health indicators. It parses inter-individual heterogeneity in the mult isystem ageing process.

A total of 294 815 participants without diabetes from the UK Biobank were included. Compared with non-smokers, a shorter time from waking to first cigarette was significantly associated with a higher risk of incident T2D.

The importance of age on the development of ocular conditions has been reported. It is unclear which types of diabetes are more predictive. Diabetes may have different associations with different stages. duration of diabetes may affect development of diabetic eye disease.

Schizophrenia (SCZ) and autism spectrum disorder (ASD) may represent opposite ends of neurodevelopmental disorders. Given the strong genetic predisposition of both disorders, we propose a shared genetic component. A common genetic variant may exert differential risk regulation on SCZ and ASD by altering brain structure.

 Observational studies have identified that declined kidney function was associated with a higher risk of cardiovascular disease (CVD) Here, we compared the observational associations of various kidney function measurements with CVD and its major subtypes. We also assessed the potential causality using Mendelian randomization (MR) analyses.

The relationship between the consumption of different beverages and the risk of microvascular complications in individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D) is unclear. This cohort study included 6676 participants with T2D who were free of macrovascular and microv vascular complications at baseline in the UK Biobank.

The Life's Essential 8 (LE8) score represents a new paradigm for evaluating cardiovascular health (CVH) We aimed to explore the association between CVH and venous thromboembolism (VTE) incidence.

Post-surgery blood-based biomarkers may be useful for guiding treatment and surveillance decisions among colorectal cancer (CRC) patients. Most candidate biomarkers provide little if any predictive value beyond stage at diagnosis. We aimed to investigate the independent prognostic value of post-operative serum C-reactive protein (CRP), a highly sensitive biomarker of inflammation.

Study aims to leverage advances in self-supervised learning to exploit the large-scale UK Biobank accelerometer dataset. Our resulting models consistently outperform strong baselines across eight benchmark datasets.

 Mutations in the gene MTARC1 (mitochondrial amidoxime-reducing component 1) protect carriers from metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) and cirrhosis. We identified a novel human structural variant deletion inMTARC1, which is associated with various biomarkers of liver health. Hepatocyte mARC1 knockdown reduced body weight, liver steatosis, oxidative stress, cell death, and fibrogenesis markers.

Long-term exposure to PM2.5, PM10, NO2 and NOx, even at low levels, was associated with an increased risk of diabetic microvascular complications. The associations of certain air pollutants with composite microv vascular complications and diabetic nephropathy were present even at concentrations below the WHO limit.

Prediabetes is a heterogenous metabolic state with various risks for development of type 2 diabetes (T2D) We used genetic data on 7,227 US Hispanic/Latino participants without diabetes. Six clusters of individuals with prediabetes with distinctive patterns of pPRSs and corresponding metabolic traits were identified.

Pulse pressure, haemoglobin A1c and cystatin-C tracked ageing consistently. Results also revealed a fundamental dynamic sex divergence that we speculate is caused by menopause-driven metabolic deterioration in women.

Hyperinsulinism (HI) is a rare genetically heterogeneous condition characterised by dysregulated insulin secretion leading to life-threatening hypoglycaemia. For up to 50% of affected individuals screening of the known HI genes does not identify a disease-causing variant. Large deletions have previously been used to identify novel regulatory regions causing HI.

Previous studies have suggested that exposure to air pollutants may be associated with specific blood indicators or anemia in certain populations. There is insufficient epidemiological data and prospective evidence to evaluate the relationship between environmental air pollution and specific types of anemia. We conducted a large-scale prospective cohort study based on the UK Biobank. NO2, PM2.5, and PM10 were significantly associated with an increased risk of iron deficiency, vitamin B12 deficiency and folate deficiency anemia, while there was no significant association with other defined types.

Vitamin D deficiency was widespread, particularly among non-White individuals. UVB was a strong predictor of 25(OH)D and the effect was modified by other factors. Findings suggest that accurately measured ambient-UVB radiation and interactions could improve vitamin D prediction models.

Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDLc) and body mass index (BMI) are not always correlated. Relationship is probably dependent on age, indicating differential age-specific associations of these factors with health outcomes. We aim to discriminate the roles of LDLc and BMI in coronary heart disease (CHD) across different age groups.

Study aims to investigate the link between glaucoma, a leading cause of blindness, and alterations in brain connections. We analyzed diffusion MRI measurements of white matter tissue in a large group of patients and healthy people. Results showed CNNs using information from the optic radiations exhibited higher accuracy.

Human fetal development has been associated with brain health at later stages. It is unknown whether growth in utero relates consistently to lifespan brain characteristics and changes. Here we show remarkably stable and lifelong positive associations between BW and cortical surface area and volume across and within developmental, aging and lifespan longitudinal samples.

A total of 138 064 participants from the UK Biobank were included in this prospective study. The free and non-free sugar intakes were assessed using repeated web-based 24-hour dietary recalls. During a median follow-up of 10.5 years, 2,923 participants (2.1%) developed CKD. Free sugar intake was positively associated with the risk of CKD (HR quartile 4 vs. quartile 1  = 1.32, 95% CI = 1,18, 1.47), with a nonlinear relationship ( P  for nonlinearity = 0.01, the risk increased rapidly after free sugars made up 10% of the total energy)

The risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD) significantly increases in individuals carrying the APOE&#949;4 allele. We found that potentially protective variants segregating exclusively among unaffected APOE &#949%;4 carriers. Study suggests that vascular deposition of FN1 is related to the pathogenicity of AD.

Aerobic MVPA bouts undertaken in the evening were associated with the lowest risk of mortality, CVD, and MVD. Timing of physical activity may play a role in the future of obesity and T2D management.

Study included 176,686 postmenopausal women from UK Biobank. Strong evidence of positive associations between PC1 (general obesity) and PC2 (tall, low WHR), and BC risk. Association of PC1 with BC risk was positively mediated by testosterone and negatively by insulin-like growth factor-1.

Polygenic risk scores offer promising advancements in predicting disease risk. Research aimed at enhancing their effectiveness within African and Asian populations remains key for equitable use. Prostate cancer is a heritable disease with ancestry-biased incidence and mortality.

Comorbidities are prevalent in digestive cancers, intensifying patient discomfort and complicating prognosis. We investigated 150 diseases across 18 categories by collecting and integrating various factors related to disease comorbidity. We have established an integrated pleiotropic gene set comprising 548 genes in total.

Evidence regarding the relationships of serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D [25(OH)D] with cardiovascular diseases (CVD) and mortality among patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) is limited and inconsistent. This study aimed to investigate the associations between serum 25( OH)D and CVD incidence and mortality. The study included 21,507 participants with CKD and free of CVD.
