Current and lifetime night shift work may increase the risk of incident asthma, regardless of genetic predisposition to asthma. We included 253,773 individuals with complete night shift information in the UK biobank. We calculated the standard polygenetic risk score (PRS) for asthma.

We examined the association between blood levels of Branched-chain amino acids (BCAAs) and the susceptibility to three neurodegenerative disorders. Blood concentrations of isoleucine, leucine and valine were significantly associated with a reduced risk of dementia and AD. This association remained robust even in sensitivity analyses.

Healthy sleep score showed a linear relationship with acute myocardial infarction mortality among people with diabetes. Of five sleep habits, adequate sleep duration was associated with lowest risk.

Clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) may contribute to the risk of atrial fibrillation (AF) through its association with inflammation and cardiac remodeling. This was a population-based, prospective cohort study in participants of the Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) study and UK Biobank (UKB) cohort.

Evidence shows that magnesium (Mg) intake is associated with lower blood pressure (BP), and that lower BP is linked to improved cerebral health. However, recent findings indicate that the positive effect of dietary Mg intake on cerebral health is not mediated by a decrease in BP. As Mg's anti-inflammatory action is a plausible alternative mechanism, the objective of this study was to investigate the associations between Mg and inflammation.

The presence of multiple cardiometabolic diseases (CMDs) has been linked to increased dementia risk. The combined influence of CMDs on cognition and brain structure across the life course is unclear. In the UK Biobank, 46,562 dementia-free participants completed a cognitive test battery at baseline and a follow-up visit 9 years later.

We aimed to create an imaging biomarker for knee shape using knee dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) scans and investigate its potential association with subsequent total knee replacement (TKR) Using a 129-point statistical shape model, knee shape (expressed as a B-score) and minimum joint space width (mJSW) of the medial joint compartment were derived.

Dietary cholesterol (DC) absorption was assessed by repeated 24-h dietary recalls in the UK Biobank. Each additional 300 mg/day of DC consumption was associated with incident diabetes and CVD. Genetic susceptibility to the diseases did not modify these associations.

Childhood maltreatment (CM) leads to a lifelong susceptibility to mental ill-health. We tested three hypotheses: (H1) CM has direct or indirect effects on adult trauma, BMI, and CRP; (H2) adult trauma,. BMI, & CRP are all independently related to adult brain structure; and (H3) childhood maltreatment has indirect effects. We found that CM is related to greater BMI and AT levels.

MVtest can simultaneously model the mean and log-variance of a quantitative trait. We identified 51 and 37 previously unreported associations for effects on blood-pressure variance and mean, respectively, in the UK Biobank. Transcriptome-wide association studies revealed 633 significant unique gene associations.

White matter hyperintensities (WMHs) represent diffuse small vessel disease implicating the cardiac, systemic, and cerebral vasculatures. The brain may be the end-organ of cumulative vascular disease, and higher education is protective of both cardiovascular and brain health.

A total of 448,836 individuals free of gout at baseline were included from the UK Biobank. One-unit higher log-transformed total testosterone (TT) was associated with a 52 % [95 % CI, 0.39-0.58] lower risk of gouts in males. Free testosterone (FT) and BAT were associated with 74% and 78% higher risk in males respectively.

The tBCAAs/glycine ratio was prospectively associated with a higher risk of developing hypertension and CHD. Outcomes of genome-wide association study were derived from the UK Biobank (nonoverlapping sample), FinnGen, and CARDIoGRAMplusC4D.

The development of an effective survival prediction tool is key for reducing colorectal cancer mortality. Here, we apply a three-stage study to devise a polygenic prognostic score (PPS) for stratifying overall survival. The detrimental impact of pathologic characteristics and genetic risk could be attenuated by a healthy lifestyle.

Anatomical vs. functional testing in suspected coronary artery disease (CAD) is associated with better outcomes than random selection. In the real world, this decision is rarely random. We explored the agreement between a provider-driven vs. simulated algorithmic approach to cardiac testing and its association with outcomes across multinational cohorts.

Patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) have excessive morbidity and mortality of cardiovascular disease (CVD) The mechanism underlying this association has not been fully known. This study aims to systematically investigate the phenotypic and genetic correlation between RA and CVD. We observed positive genetic correlations of RA with AF and stroke.

 Parkinson disease (PD) has become one of the most rapidly growing causes of disability among the older population. Social isolation is a major concern in the PD community. The relationship between social isolation and future risk of PD remains unclear. This study included 192,340 participants aged 60 or older who were free of dementia and PD at baseline from the UK Biobank study.

Identifying patients with established cardiovascular disease (CVD) who are at high risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) may allow for early interventions. The aim of this study was to develop and externally validate the CVD2DM model to estimate the 10-year and lifetime risks of T2D.

The aim was to stratify participants of the UK Biobank cohort based on three readily measurable common independent risk factors. Two-step cluster analysis was run separately in males and females. In females, in case of a protective pattern of low neuroticism, low body fat percentage, and high level of education, depression was associated with pathways related to olfactory function.

While numerous genomic loci have been identified for neuropsychiatric conditions, the contribution of protein-coding variants has yet to be determined. Here we conducted a large-scale whole-exome-sequencing study to interrogate the impact of proteins on 46 diseases and 23 traits in 350,770 adults from the UK Biobank. Twenty new genes were associated with diseases through coding variants.

Mental disorders that follow traumatic experience may increase risk of suicidality. We attempted to provide comprehensive evidence on how depressive symptoms and neuroticism can mediate the association between psychological traumatic experiences and suicidal behaviours.

Spontaneous miscarriage is associated with higher risks of depression and anxiety. Risk of depression is further increased when there is also low degree of social support.

Digital AS Severity index (DASSi) can detect severe AS using single-view long-axis echocardiography without Doppler characterization. Higher baseline DASSi was associated with faster progression in AV-Vmax.

Study looked at the links between birth weight and incident adult type 2 diabetes (T2D) that were mediated by plasma metabolites. Low birth weight was associated with the adverse metabolic responses across multiple metabolic pathways. Metabolites associated with higher birth weight tended to be associated with a lower risk of T2D.

Aging is a multifaceted and intricate physiological process. Biological age may provide a more nuanced understanding of the aging process. The concept of biological age lacks a clear operationalization, leading to the development of various biological age predictors without a solid statistical foundation.

Childhood adversity and adulthood adversity affect cognition later in life. The mechanism through which adversity exerts these effects on cognition remains under-researched. We aimed to investigate if the effect of adversity on cognition was mediated by distress or neuroticism.

Carotid intima-media thickness (cIMT) is widely considered a risk factor for stroke. The intrinsic link underlying cIMT and stroke has not been fully understood. We evaluated phenotypic associations using observational data from UK Biobank. We then investigated genetic relationships leveraging genomic data conducted in predominantly European ancestry.

A total of 7,194 participants were derived from UK Biobank. CVH was evaluated using a modified version of LE8. The moderate to low group was associated with about 128 % increased risk of CVD.

Until recently, brain measures for genome-wide association studies (GWAS) consisted of traditionally expert-defined or software-derived image-derived phenotypes. Here, we present an approach to derive brain imaging phenotypes using unsupervised deep representation learning. We train a 3-D convolutional autoencoder model with reconstruction loss on 6130 UK Biobank participants' brain MRIs.

Omega-3 and omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) have been associated with various chronic diseases and mortality, but results are conflicting. Few studies examined the role of omega-4/omega-3 ratio in mortality. Using a population-based cohort in UK Biobank, our study revealed a strong association between the ratio of circulating PUFAs and the risk of all-cause, cancer, and CVD mortality.

Smoking is a significant risk factor for cognitive decline. Developing effective smoking reduction strategies is therefore a public health priority. The goal of the current study is to better understand the brain mechanisms underlying long-term smoking behavior change in cognitively normal, but at-risk, older adults.

The TR-gnomAD is a biobank-scale reference of 0.86 million tandem repeat (TR) expansions. TRs constitute &#8764;6% of our genome and are linked to over 50 human diseases. It offers critical insights into ancestry-specific disease prevalence using disparities in TR unit number frequencies.

In biomedical ML, it is often desirable to leverage multiple datasets to increase sample size and diversity. We present an approach to the integration of multiple brain MRI datasets with a focus on homogenization of their organization and preprocessing for ML. We believe our approach can provide a basis for future similarly-minded biomedical ML projects.

Potentially interacting supplement-drug pairs were identified from four tertiary databases. The potential pharmacodynamic interactions were related to various clinical outcomes, including reducing the effects of glucose-lowering drugs. Exploratory analyses found that the use of potentially interacting supplements was associated with incident hepatic diseases. Clinicians should communicate with patients and assess the potential risk of supplement- drug interactions in clinical settings.

There remains a dearth of understanding regarding the mechanisms underpinning this correlation. We aimed to examine the associations of childhood physical abuse and physical neglect with depression using follow-up data from UK Biobank. We quantified the contribution of smoking, insomnia and BMI in these associations.

UK Biobank participants completed baseline surveys during 2006-2010 and were followed for up to 15 years. Overall and site-specific cancers were ascertained via linkage to routine hospital admission, cancer registry, and death certificate data. Low IDI scores were associated with decreased risk of rectal cancer, thyroid cancer, and lung cancer.

Circulating omega-3 and omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) have been associated with various chronic diseases and mortality, but results are conflicting. Scientists have struggled to accurately measure fatty acid intake. But, measuring circulating fatty acids in an individual's blood may offer an easier and more reliable approach to studying the health impacts of these vital nutrients.

Vitamin D status has been associated with risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D), but evidence is scarce regarding whether such relation differs by glycemic status. Study included 379,699 participants without T2D at baseline from the UK Biobank.

Exome-sequence analyses for adult body mass index (BMI) in up to 587,027 individuals. We identified rare loss-of-function variants in two genes (BSN and APBA1) with effects substantially larger than those of well-established obesity genes. BSN protein-truncating variants (PTVs) magnified the influence of common genetic variants associated with BMI.

Steatotic liver disease (SLD) is characterized by elevated liver fat content (LFC) Whether diet has a differential effect based on genetic risk is not well-characterized. We aimed to determine how genetic factors interact with diet to affect SLD in a large national biobank.

 Individuals with clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) are at increased risk of aging related health conditions and all-cause mortality, but whether CHIP affects risk of infection is much less clear. We show that inflammation enhanced pneumonia risk, as CHIP carriers with a hypomorphic IL6 receptor polymorphism were protected.

The peripheral white blood cell (WBC) and neutrophil-to-lymphocyte ratio (NLR) reflect levels of inflammation and adaptive immunity. They are associated with cancer prognosis, but their associations with cancer incidence are not established. We evaluated 443,540 cancer-free adults in the UK Biobank.

Depression is reported as a risk factor, prodromal feature and late consequence of Parkinson's disease (PD) We aimed to evaluate the timing, neuroanatomy and prognostic implications of depression in PD.

Cardiometabolic disease risk factors disproportionately prevalent in bipolar disorder (BD) It is unknown which health risk factors are relevant to cognition in BD. This study aimed to identify the cardiometabolism risk factors that are the most important.

The importance of left ventricular global radial strain in predicting new-onset heart failure in a population with diabetes is unclear. The study design is prospective cohort from the UK Biobank. The average age of the 940 participants was 57.67 +/- 6.97 years.

Recent research shows prominent effects of pregnancy and the parenthood transition on structural brain characteristics in humans. Here, we present a comprehensive study of how parental status and number of children born/fathered links to markers of brain and cellular ageing in 36,323 UK Biobank participants.

Our knowledge of the organisation of the human brain at the population-level is yet to translate into power to predict functional differences at the individual-level. It remains unknown whether the difficulty arises from the absence of individuating biological patterns within the brain, or from limited power to access them. Here we comprehensively investigate the resolvability of such patterns with data and compute at unprecedented scale.

Alzheimer's Disease (AD) is a progressive neurodegenerative disease and the leading cause of dementia. Early diagnosis is critical for patients to benefit from potential intervention and treatment. The retina has emerged as a plausible diagnostic site for AD detection.

Risk of developing allergic diseases, beyond the first 30 days of diagnosis of COVID-19, significantly increased. Among the 836,164 individuals in the main cohort, 147,824 were infected with SARS-CoV-2 during the follow-up period (2020-2021)

Little is known about the independent and joint effects of the energy-adjusted dietary inflammatory index (E-DII) and dietary diversity score (DDS) on sarcopenia and its components (low muscle mass, low muscle strength, and low physical performance) A total of 155,669 UK Biobank participants with &#8805;1 (maximum 5) 24 h dietary assessments were included in this cross-sectional analysis.

Left-handedness occurs at increased rates in neurodevelopmental disorders. The beta-tubulin gene TUBB4B shows exome-wide significant association. The rate of rare coding variants 2.7 times higher in left-handers than right- handers.

Myopic eyes of 10,488 adults aged 40-69 years were identified in the UK Biobank. Corneal hysteresis (CH) and corneal resistance factor (CRF), separately, were tested. Each standard deviation (SD) decrease in CH and CRF was associated with 0.08 D (95% CI: 0.04-0.12; p)

 AI models have shown promise in performing many medical imaging tasks. Explanations are needed in order to increase the trust of doctors in AI-based models. Such explanations could enable novel scientific discovery.

Physical activity (PA) is related to cardiovascular disease. But the specific association between PA and incident cerebrovascular disease (CBVD) remains uncertain. The current study aimed to investigate the associations between PA levels and the CBVD incidence or all-cause mortality.

Hippocampal atrophy is an established biomarker for conversion from the normal ageing process to developing cognitive impairment and dementia. This study used a novel hypothesis-free machine-learning approach, to uncover potential risk factors. Older age, male sex, greater height, and whole-body fat free mass were the main predictors of low hippocampal volume.

Evidence of modifying effect of various dietary patterns (DPs) on risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) induced by long-term exposure to air pollution (AP) is still rather lacking. We included 78,230 UK Biobank participants aged 40-70 years.

Sarcopenia is characterized by decreased muscle mass and strength, posing threat to quality of life. Air pollutants are increasingly recognized as risk factors for diseases, while relationship between the two remains to be elucidated. This study investigated whether exposure to ambient air pollution contributes to the development of sarcopenia.

Population-scale, exome-sequenced cohorts with linked electronic health records (EHR) permit genome-first exploration of phenotype. Phenotype and cancer risk are well-characterized in children with a pathogenic  DICER1 variant.

The extent of left ventricular (LV) trabeculation and its relationship with cardiovascular (CV) risk factors is unclear. We applied automated segmentation to UK Biobank cardiac MRI scans to assess the association between individual characteristics and CV risk factors. We found that higher trabECulated LVM was observed with hypertension, higher BMI, and higher physical activity level.

Previous studies have explored associations of white matter hyperintensity with psychiatric disorders, but the sample size is small and the conclusions are inconsistent. The present study aimed to further systematically explore the association in a larger sample. All data were extracted from the UK Biobank.

Cannabis use has increased in recent years. Long-term implications of cannabis use on brain health remain unknown. Study included dementia-free participants of the UK Biobank aged &#8805;60 years.

Diet is a key modifiable risk factor of coronary artery disease (CAD) However, the causal effects of specific dietary traits on CAD risk remain unclear. Mendelian randomization could help enable the efficient estimation of causality in diet-disease associations.

White matter (WM) structure and organization are characterized by slow degradation processes such as demyelination and shrinkage. An acceleration of such aging processes has been linked to the development of a range of diseases. An accurate description of healthy brain maturation, particularly in terms of WM features, is fundamental to the understanding of aging.

An enlarged cup-to-disc ratio (CDR) is a hallmark of glaucomatous optic neuropathy. Manual assessment of the CDR may be less accurate and more time-consuming than automated methods. Here, we sought to develop and validate a deep learning-based algorithm to automatically determine CDR from fundus images.

Metabolites could be used to investigate AMD disease mechanisms or incorporated into AMD risk prediction models. We analyzed 325 directly measured or derived blood metabolites from the UK Biobank for 72 376 donors to identify AMD-associated metabolites. The causal effects of these metabolites in AMD were tested using a 2-sample Mendelian randomization approach. This study underscores the pronounced role of lipids in AMD susceptibility.

Primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) is a highly heritable disease, with 127 identified risk loci to date. Polygenic risk score (PRS) may provide a clinically useful measure of aggregate genetic burden and improve patient risk stratification.

Metabolic syndrome (MetS) is a collection of cardiovascular risk factors. We conducted unsupervised clustering on individuals from UK Biobank to reveal endotypes. Five MetS subgroups were identified: non-descriptive, hypertensive, obese, lipodystrophy-like, and hyperglycemic.

Cardiometabolic diseases (CMDs) comorbidities among people with severe mental illnesses (SMI) are associated with a high healthcare burden and premature mortality. Study aims to evaluate whether biological aging has an interaction with SMI on incident CMDs. Data were sourced from the UK Biobank, a large prospective cohort study.

Carriers of the E40K loss-of-function variant in Angiopoietin-like 4 (ANGPTL4), have lower plasma triglyceride levels as well as lower rates of coronary artery disease (CAD) and type 2 diabetes (T2D) These genetic data suggest ANGPLT4 inhibition as a potential therapeutic target for cardiometabolic diseases.

Life's Essential 8 (LE8) score comprised eight metrics: smoking, body mass index, physical activity, non-high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, blood pressure, glycated haemoglobin, diet and sleep duration. Higher LE8 scores were associated with a lower risk of incident macrovascular and microvascular complications among individuals with T2D.

Food preferences significantly influence dietary choices, yet understanding natural dietary patterns in populations remains limited. We identify four dietary subtypes by applying data-driven approaches to food-liking data from 181,990 UK Biobank participants. The individuals with a balanced diet demonstrated better mental health and superior cognitive functions.

Osteoarthritis (OA) is increasing in prevalence and has a severe impact on patients' lives. We developed a model predicting the five-year risk of OA diagnosis. Higher age, BMI and prescription of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs contributed most to increased OA risk prediction ahead of diagnosis.

 Reproductive risk factors are associated with increased risk of cardiovascular disease (CVD) in women. The combined effects of the composite reproductive risk factors on CVD are unknown. This study was performed to construct a reproductive risk score (RRS) to measure reproductive status, examine the association between RRS and CVD and explore the modification effect of healthy lifestyle on the association.

Regular opioid use in chronic pain patients was associated with an increased risk of dementia and poorer brain health when compared to non-opioid analgesic use. These findings imply a need for re-evaluation of opioid prescription practices.

Smokers are at increased risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D), but the underlying mechanisms are unclear. We investigated if the association is mediated by alterations in the metabolome and assessed potential interaction with genetic susceptibility to diabetes or insulin resistance.

Previous research on sleep and aging largely has failed to illustrate the optimal dose-response curve. We aimed to analyze the associations between sleep duration and measures of predicted age. In total, 241,713 participants from the UK Biobank were included.

Long-term exposure to air pollutants is associated with an increased risk of gout. The underlying mechanisms of these associations may involve the participation of five serum biomarkers.

Telomere attrition may share common biological mechanisms with bone and muscle loss with aging. Here, we investigated the association between these hallmarks of aging using data from UK Biobank, a large observational study.

A PRS for coronary artery disease (CAD) was calculated in participants of UK Biobank (n = 432 981) Within each tenth of the PRS distribution, the odds ratios (ORs) were compared between the entire population and subgroups representing the spectrum of clinical risk.

Imaging genetics integrates imaging and genetic techniques to examine how genetic variations influence the function and structure of organs like the brain or heart. The use of organ-wide imaging endophenotypes has increasingly been used to identify potential genes associated with complex disorders. The FPLS-DC method opens up new research avenues and offers valuable insights.

Little is known about how non-suicidal and suicidal self-injury are differentially genetically related to psychopathology and related measures. This research was conducted using the UK Biobank Resource, in participants of European ancestry. In a multivariable model, PGS for anorexia nervosa and suicidal behavior differentiated between NSSI and suicide attempt.

The sample included 202,529 UK Biobank participants aged 40-69 years. Over 10 years, 7,476 participants developed type 2 diabetes. The LRAprs score significantly improved the overall reclassification compared to the LRA.

Diabetic kidney disease (DKD) and diabetic retinopathy (DR) are major diabetic microvascular complications. The kidney and the eye may experience similar metabolic changes in diabetes. This study aimed to use machine learning (ML) methods integrated with metabolic data to identify biomarkers associated with DKD and DR in a multiethnic Asian population.

This study aimed to investigate the association between irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and Parkinson's disease (PD) The dataset contained a substantial cohort of 426,911 participants from the UK Biobank. In univariate Cox regression model, the risk of PD was reduced in IBS patients.

Previous metabolomics studies have highlighted the predictive value of metabolites on upper gastrointestinal (UGI) cancer. This study aimed to evaluate the role of lifestyle and genetic risk in the metabolic mechanism of UGI cancer. A total of 15 metabolites were identified as UGI-cancer-related differential metabolites.

Copy number variants (CNVs) are among the largest genetic variants. CNVs have not been effectively ascertained in most genetic association studies. We ascertained protein-altering CNVs from UK Biobank whole-exome sequencing data (n = 468,570)

There is limited information on the mixture effect and weights of light physical activity (LPA), moderate physical activity. (MPA), and vigorous physicalactivity (VPA) on dementia risk. We included participants aged at least 45 years old without dementia at baseline between 2006-2010.

Large-scale proteomics improves prediction of cardiovascular events beyond traditional risk factors. 2919 plasma proteins were measured in 38 380 participants of the UK Biobank.

Lithium is an established first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Beyond its therapeutic effect as a mood stabiliser, lithium exhibits potential anti-ageing effects. This study aimed to examine the relationship between the duration of lithium use, biological ageing and mortality.

Prediabetes and lifestyle factors have been associated with the risks of multiple adverse outcomes. But the effect of a healthy lifestyle on prediabetes-related complications remains unknown. We aimed to investigate whether the risks can be offset by a broad combination of healthy lifestyle factors.

Residential greenness is considered a unique and potentially modifiable exposure construct to reduce physiological stress and improve human health. Here this study aims to investigate the longitudinal relationships of residential greenness with incident depression and anxiety. We analyzed data of 409,556 participants from the UK Biobank.

Dry eye disease (DED) and depression (DEP) often comanifest. However, the robustness and the mechanisms underlying this association were undetermined. Three-segment study employed multimodality results to elucidate the association, common pathways and causality between DED and DEP.

Study was sourced from the UK Biobank cohort between 2006 and 2010. Information on physical and mental-related activities were obtained through a touch-screen questionnaire. The adherence to activity patterns of vigorous exercise, housework, and walking predominant patterns were associated with a lower risk of stroke.

We have previously identified a network of higher-order brain regions particularly vulnerable to the ageing process, schizophrenia and Alzheimer's disease. It remains unknown what the genetic influences on this fragile brain network are, and whether it can be altered by the most common modifiable risk factors for dementia. Here, we show significant genome-wide associations between this brain network and seven genetic clusters implicated in cardiovascular deaths, schizophrenia, Alzheimer's and Parkinson's.

Aspirin has shown potential for cancer prevention, but a recent large randomized controlled trial found no evidence for a reduction in cancer risk. Given the anti-inflammatory effects of aspirin, systemic inflammatory diseases (SID), such as osteoporosis, cardiovascular diseases, and metabolic diseases could potentially modify the aspirin-cancer link.

Large-scale biobanks provide important opportunities for mental health research. But selection biases raise questions regarding the comparability of individuals with those in clinical research settings. This cross-sectional study included participants from the population-based UK Biobank and schizophrenia samples recruited from clinical settings. Data were collected between January 1993 and July 2021.

Frailty, social isolation, and loneliness have individually been associated with adverse health outcomes. This study examines how frailty in combination with loneliness or social isolation is associated with socioeconomic deprivation. Baseline data from 461,047 UK Biobank participants (aged 37-73) were used to assess frailty (frailty phenotype) and social isolation.

Cancer site-specific polygenic risk scores (PRS) effectively identify individuals at high risk of individual cancers. The effectiveness of PRS on overall cancer risk assessment and the extent to which a high genetic risk of overall cancer can be offset by a healthy lifestyle remain unclear. Lifestyle was determined according to smoking, alcohol consumption, physical activity, body mass index, and diet.

Insulin and hyperinsulinemia reduce renal fractional excretion of urate (FeU) and play a key role in the genesis of hyperuricemia and gout, via uncharacterized mechanisms. We found that insulin stimulates the expression of GLUT9 and increases urate uptake in human proximal tubular cells.

Obesity predisposes individuals to multiple cardiometabolic disorders, including type 2 diabetes (T2D) The underlying genes and regulatory mechanisms orchestrating the sex differences in obesity and body fat distribution in humans are not well understood. We identified an adipose gene co-expression network that contains 35 obesity GWAS genes.

Season-of-birth associations with psychiatric disorders point to environmental (co-)aetiological factors such as natural photoperiod that, if clarified, may allow interventions toward prevention. Risk of depression with late spring birth is compatible with increased odds of probable single episode-, probable recurrent-, and diagnosed depression. risk of bipolar disorder with winter-spring birth is not consistent.

Cancer risk is associated with the widely debated measure body mass index (BMI) Fat mass and fat-free mass measurements from bioelectrical impedance may further clarify this association. The UK Biobank is a rare resource in which bioElectrical impedance and BMI data was collected on 500,000 individuals. Using this dataset, a comprehensive analysis using regression, principal component and genome-wide genetic association provided multiple levels of evidence.

Bone mineral density (BMD) is a major predictor of osteoporotic fractures. Previous studies have reported the effects of mitochondrial dysfunction and lifestyle on BMD. However, their interaction effects on B MD are still unclear. We aimed to investigate the possible interaction of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) and common lifestyles.

Modifiable risk factors for Parkinson's disease (PD) are poorly known. Vigorous physical activity, low-to-moderate sitting time, and high sleep quality were associated with a reduced risk of PD. Small amounts of coffee (HR = 0.88; 95% CI, 0.82-0.95), red meat, and current smoking were also associated with lower risk.

The main analysis included 21,472 participants with T2D from the UK Biobank. Over a median of 7.7 years of follow-up, 3,976 CVD events occurred. After multivariable adjustment, upper and lower body fat were independently and oppositely associated with CVD risk.

SURPASS-3 MRI substudy compared participants with type 2 diabetes (T2D) by comparison with sex- and BMI-matched virtual control groups. Baseline fat distribution patterns were similar across pooled tirzepatide (5, 10 and 15 mg) and insulin degludec (IDeg) arms. Compared with matched VCGs, SUR PASS-3 participants had higher baseline VAT.

Previous studies have shown that lifestyle/environmental factors could accelerate the development of age-related hearing loss (ARHL) There has not yet been a study investigating the joint association among genetics, lifestyle/ Environmental factors, and adherence to healthy lifestyle for risk of ARHL.

Study used data from a UK biobank of 247,828 adults aged 38-71 free of depression at baseline from March 13, 2006, to October 1, 2010. After a median follow-up of 12.7 years, 7315 participants developed depression. Compared with day workers, HRs of depression were 1.28 (1.19-1.38) for shift work, but never or rarely night shifts.

A 1 mmol/mol increase in genetically predicted HbA1c was associated with higher risk of coronary artery disease (OR 1.03, 95% CI 1.02, 1.05), stroke and hypertension. The shape of the genetic association with cardiovascular outcomes is likely to be linear. The study suggests a detrimental effect of Hb a1c on coronary arteries in both men and women.

Uterine leiomyomas (ULs) are benign tumours of the uterine wall. ULs can cause excessive bleeding, pain and infertility. They emerge through at least three distinct genetic drivers.

 Circulating levels of n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) have been associated with frailty among Koreans. Whether this association exists in Western populations with low fish intake is unknown. Study examined the hypothesis that the prevalence of frailty was inversely associated with plasma levels of PUFAs, with the intake of oily fish, and with fish oil supplementation.

Frailty and multimorbidity are common in type 2 diabetes (T2D), including people. People with T2D are more likely to suffer from obesity, high blood pressure, and high blood sugar.

Spermine oxidase (SMOX) catalyzes the oxidation of spermine to spermidine. Observational studies have reported SMOX as a source of reactive oxygen species associated with cancer. Here we test causality of SMOX levels with cancer risk using a Mendelian randomization analysis. Genetically determined SMOX activity was not associated with neuroblastoma, gastric, lung, breast, prostate nor colorectal cancer.

We generated two polygenic scores, one capturing verbal and the other spatial aspects of cognitive ability. We studied their effects on various diseases and other traits in the Icelandic population. The score tagging spatial ability associated with higher body mass index, but lower risk of schizophrenia and other mental disorders.

A promise of genomics in precision medicine is to provide individualized genetic risk predictions. Polygenic risk scores (PRS) have been developed as a useful tool in complex disease research. PRS typically provide a relative measure of risk evaluated at the level of a group of people.

The impact of adhering to a healthy lifestyle on cholelithiasis risk remains uncertain. We aimed to assess combined lifestyle factors and a polygenic risk score. The relative and absolute risk of incident choleLithiasis associated with six well-established lifestyle risk factors was evaluated and stratified.

A high level of cholesterol is associated with the risk of cardiovascular diseases. Genome-wide association studies (GWASs) have proven successful in identifying genetic variants that are linked to cholesterol levels. However, the extent to which genetic effects on cholesterol vary across different ancestries remains largely unexplored.

Study aimed to examine whether younger onset age of orthostatic hypotension was associated with higher risks of incident MI, stroke, and dementia. Data were obtained from the UK Biobank. Younger onset age was significantly associated with high risks of MI.

This paper provides age-, sex-, and ethnicity-specific CMR reference ranges for atrial and ventricular metrics. The Healthy Hearts Consortium is an international collaborative comprising 9,088 CMR studies from verified healthy individuals. The sample included 4,452 men and 4,636 women with average age of 61.1 years.

Chronic musculoskeletal pain (CMP) is a leading cause of disability worldwide and greatly affects a patient's brain. Apart from experiencing pain, older adults with CMP also have accelerated cognitive decline and higher dementia risk. A multiscale study to disentangle pathological brain aging from normal brain aging may reveal the underlying mechanisms.

LiverRisk score had significantly better accuracy and calibration in predicting liver fibrosis. Liver stiffness measurements &#8805;10 kPa were defined as compensated advanced chronic liver disease (cACLD) Compared to the low-risk group, the medium-risk and high-risk groups in the two follow-up cohorts had a significantly higher risk of liver-related and diabetes-related mortality.

Many surveys ask participants to retrospectively record their location of birth. This paper examines the accuracy of such data in the UK Biobank using a sample of full siblings. 28% of birth coordinates, 16% of local districts and 6% of counties of birth were incorrectly reported.

G protein-coupled receptor 37-like 1 (GPR37L1) is an orphan GPCR with largely unknown functions. It ranks among the most highly expressed GPCRs in mouse and human dorsal root ganglia. overexpression of GPR37l1 in mouse DRGs reversed pain. Chemotherapy suppressed KCNJ10 expression and function in SGCs, which MaR1 rescued.

 Genetic pleiotropy is abundant across spatially distributed brain characteristics derived from one neuroimaging modality. Cross-modality genes are involved in fundamental biological processes and predominantly expressed during prenatal brain development. Findings shed light on the shared genetic mechanisms underlying variation in brain morphology and functional connectivity.

Mutations in the Transthyretin (TTR) gene cause a hereditary form of amyloidosis. There is limited information regarding differences among worldwide populations. We compared 676 diverse individuals carrying TTR mutations to 12,430 non-carriers to assess their clinical presentations.

Childhood maltreatment is common globally and impacts morbidity, mortality, and well-being. Our understanding of its impact is constrained by key substantive and methodological limitations of extant research. We address these limitations through a large-scale outcome-wide triangulation study.

Study of pleiotropy at the single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) level provides valuable insights into shared genetic signals among phenotypes. Estimated effects from mediation analysis can be confounded by the genetic correlation between phenotypes, leading to inaccurate results. We propose a restricted-maximum-likelihood (REML)-based mediation analysis framework called REML-mediation.

The relationship between inflammatory dietary patterns and the risk of depression/anxiety has not been clearly established. We drew upon a prospective cohort in the UK Biobank and calculated the energy-adjusted dietary inflammatory index (E-DII) Diets with pro-inflammatory characteristics are associated with a heightened risk of anxiety and depression.

The importance of thromboembolism in the pathogenesis of lacunar stroke (LS) resulting from cerebral small vessel disease (cSVD) is debated. Although antiplatelets are widely used in secondary prevention after LS, there is limited trial evidence to support this approach. We sought to evaluate whether altered anticoagulation plays a causal role in LS and cSVD.

The association between serum vitamin D levels and the risk of bowel resection in individuals with IBD remains largely unknown. Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D [25(OH)D] was measured using direct competitive chemiluminescent immunoassay. Bowel resection events were ascertained via national inpatient data.

Serum sex hormones have been linked to cardiovascular disease risk. However, their roles in the pathogenesis of heart failure (HF) in both men and women are unclear. We investigated the associations between free androgen, testosterone, and estradiol, and future risk of HF.

Infectious diseases were associated with a greater risk of CVD events. High genetic risk and infection synergistically increased the CVD risk. The magnitude of the infection-CVD association showed specificity in sex, pathogen type, infection burden, and infection site.

Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) is a serious global mental health condition that has gotten worse recently. Insomnia, prevalent in 10-20% of adults, is closely associated with depression. Using the UK Biobank database, a prospective cohort design investigated the independent association between insomnia and depression risk.

The complex biological mechanisms underlying human brain aging remain incompletely understood. This study investigated the genetic architecture of three brain age gaps. We identified sixteen genomic loci that reached genome-wide significance (P-value)

Study included participants with hypertension from the UK Biobank cohort. Study exposures included self-reported intakes of coffee, tea, and red wine. High coffee intake was significantly associated with increased risks of cardiovascular mortality and cardiovascular disease. Replacing plain water with tea, but not coffee, significantly reduced the risks of all-cause mortality.

We included 429,886 participants in the UK Biobank who were free of diabetes and diabetes complications at baseline. Food groups were determined using a validated food frequency questionnaire. Outcomes were T2D incidence, complications, and mortality. Higher intake of fresh fruit was significantly associated with lower risk of disease progression.

Cardiovascular disease incidence and mortality have declined across developed economies. Up-to-date cost-effectiveness evidence is required for treatments targeting large populations. Standard and higher intensity statin therapy in the contemporary UK population 40-70 years old.

Sarcopenic obesity, a clinical and functional condition characterized by the coexistence of obesity and sarcopenia, has not been investigated in relation to dementia risk. We included 208,867 participants from UK biobank, who aged 60 to 69 years at baseline. Dementia diagnoses were identified using hospital records and death register data.

Elevated apoB-containing lipoproteins are a major risk factor for atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease, including peripheral artery disease (PAD) and myocardial infarction. We tested the hypothesis that remnants and LDL both explain part of the increased risk of PAD.

Study looked at UK Biobank participants who completed 24-hour dietary recalls from 2009 to 2012. The mean UPF consumption was 21.0% (SD, 11.0%) of the total diet. During a median of 11.3 years of follow-up, 2690 incident IBS cases were identified. An 8% higher risk of IBS was associated with every 10% increment of UPF.

Current risk assessment for ischemic stroke (IS) is limited to clinical variables. We hypothesize that polygenic scores (PGS) of IS and IS-associated diseases may improve the performance of IS risk assessment. Incident IS was followed for 479,476 participants in the UK Biobank who did not have an IS diagnosis prior to the recruitment.

APOE &#949;4 carriage associates with beneficial or unfavorable left ventricular (LV) structural and functional metrics by echocardiography and cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) Compared to the non-APOE and#949,4 carriers had similar cardiac phenotypes in terms of LV ejection fraction, E/e', posterior wall and interventricular septal thickness, and LV mass. But they had improved myocardial performance resulting in greater LV stroke volume generation per 1 mL of myocardium.

Questions persist about long-term mental health outcomes and the protective effect of vaccination. Using UK Biobank data, three cohorts were constructed: SARS-CoV-2 infection, contemporary control with no evidence of infection and historical control predating the pandemic. Compared with contemporary controls, infected participants had higher subsequent risks of incident mental health at 1 year.

Having any of the three microvascular diseases was associated with a 48% increase in the hazard of developing arrhythmias. Having optimal levels of risk factors may mitigate this risk.

Cardiovascular disease is a leading cause of global death. Changes in retinal microvasculature are associated with the development of coronary artery disease. Recently, artificial intelligence deep learning algorithms have been developed for the assessment of retinal vessel calibres.

The extent to which the relationships between clinical risk factors and coronary artery disease (CAD) are altered by CAD polygenic risk score (PRS) is not well understood. Here, we determine whether the interactions between clinicalrisk factors and CAD PRS further explain risk for incident CAD.

Few studies have examined the relationship between daytime napping and risk of kidney diseases. We recruited 460,571 European middle- to older-aged adults without prior CKD or ESKD between March 13, 2006, and October 1, 2010, in the UK Biobank. After a mean follow-up of 11.1 (standard deviation 2.2) years, we observed 28,330 incident CKD cases and 927ESKD cases. Daytime napping was associated with an increased risk of CKD.

We analyzed 454,727 UK Biobank whole-exome sequences to characterize the diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries. Europeans had the most unique CFTR variant, while the American group had the least unique variants. F508del was the most prevalent CF-causing variant found in all ancestries, except in EAS, where V520F was theMost prevalent.

The objectives of this study were to investigate the interaction of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) and lifestyle factors in the development of psychiatric disorders and to gain greater insight into their pathogenesis and comorbidity. We analyzed data from approximately 150,000 individuals from the UK Biobank.

Brain age is an estimate of chronological age obtained from T1-weighted magnetic resonance images (T1w MRI) Current best accuracy of brain age predictions on T1w MRIs of healthy subjects ranges from two to three years.

Genomics has been forecasted to revolutionise human health by improving medical treatment through a better understanding of the molecular mechanisms of human diseases. Despite great successes of the last decade's genome-wide association studies (GWAS), the results have been translated to genomic medicine to a limited extent.

DHA is a marine omega-3 fatty acid. Study looked at data from UK Biobank between April 2007 and December 2021. Higher DHA levels were associated with significant risk reductions in all-cause mortality.

Short-term alcohol abstinence ( &#946; =1.00, 95% confidence interval [ CI ]: 0.15-1.86) was found to accelerate biological aging when compared to consistent never drinking. Long-term abstinence did not result in a significant acceleration of biological aging.

Genome-wide association studies were performed for 168 ETCs extracted from the 12-lead ECGs of 42,340 Europeans in the UK Biobank. MR analyses support a putative causal effect of the use of diabetes medications on decreasing aVR_T-area, and on increasing risk of IHD and CA.

Data from 350,884 UK Biobank participants were employed to construct an individual deprivation index. Absolute poverty was defined as a pre-tax annual household income below &#8356;18,000. Predictors for absolute poverty incorporated variables such as sex, ethnicity, type of accommodation, tenure status, and educational qualifications.

Study included 9992 women and 15,860 men with T2DM from the UK Biobank. MVDs included retinopathy, peripheral neuropathy, and chronic kidney disease. Healthy lifestyle factors consisted of ideal BMI, nonsmoking, healthy diet, regular exercise, and appropriate sleep duration.

Age-related muscle wasting and dysfunction render the elderly population vulnerable and incapacitated. The underlying mechanisms are poorly understood. We implicate the CERS1 enzyme of the de novo sphingolipid synthesis pathway in pathogenesis of age-related skeletal muscle impairment.

Pathways explaining racial/ethnic and socio-economic status (SES) disparities in white matter integrity (WMI) reflecting brain health, remain underexplored, particularly in the UK population. Race (Non-White vs. White) and lower SES predicted poorer WMI (i.e. lower global mean FA) at follow-up.

Cambridge Multimorbidity scores (CMS) have the potential to achieve these aims using primary care records, but they have not yet been validated outside of their development cohort. We used calibration plots and measures of discrimination to validate the CMS for two of the three outcomes used in the development study (death and primary care consultation rate) and explored variation by age and sex. For all three outcomes considered, the CMS were poorly calibrated.

We present a method for efficiently identifying clusters of identical-by-descent haplotypes in biobank-scale sequence data. Our multi-individual approach enables much more computationally efficient inference of identity by descent (IBD) than approaches that infer pairwise IBD segments. Application of our methods to autosomal sequence data for 125,361 White British individuals in the UK Biobank detects more than 9 million converted alleles.

Genetic mechanisms of blood pressure (BP) regulation remain poorly defined. We identified 889 kidney genes associated with BP of which 399 were prioritised as contributors to BP regulation. We showed that genetically determined reduction in renal expression may mimic the effects of rare loss-of-function variants on kidney mRNA/protein and lead to an increase in BP.

Power Window (PW) is a sliding window technique that identifies the impactful regions of a gene using population-scale clinico-genomic datasets. The windows can be built by sliding across either the nucleotide sequence of the gene (through 1D space) or the positions of the amino acids in the folded protein (through 3D space).

Glymphatic function is involved in Alzheimer's disease (AD) Potential for predicting the pathological and clinical progression of AD is poorly understood. Lower ALPS index was significantly associated with faster changes in amyloid positron emission tomography (PET) burden and AD signature region of interest volume.

Generating virtual organ populations that capture sufficient variability is essential to conduct in silico trials (ISTs) of medical devices. Not all anatomical shapes of interest are always available for each individual in a population. The proposed generative model can synthesize complete multipart shape assemblies coined virtual chimeras (VCs)

Cross-sectional analysis of 40,189 patients in the UK Biobank who underwent liver MRI. Hepatic steatosis was determined by proton density fat fraction (PDFF) &#8805;5%. Participants were classified as alcohol-associated steatotic liver disease (ALD), metabolic dysfunction- associated steatotes disease (MASLD) and at-risk MASH.

The connection between triglyceride-rich lipoproteins and cardiometabolic multimorbidity has not been definitively established. We show that elevated remnant cholesterol and triglycerides are significantly associated with gradually higher risks of the disease. These results advocate for effective management of remnant cholesterol as a potential strategy in mitigating the risks.

Di-2-ethylhexyl phthalate (DEHP) has been considered possibly carcinogenic to humans. Large-scale longitudinal evidence is needed to further clarify its carcinogenicity. Highest quartile of baseline DEHP associated with 1.11 fold risk of carcinoma in situ.

Iron status biomarkers for coronary artery disease (CAD), heart failure (HF), ischemic stroke (IS), and type 2 diabetes (T2D) are uncertain. Iron biomarkers included transferrin saturation, serum iron, ferritin, and total iron binding capacity. Observational analyses of hemoglobin were compared with genetically predicted hemoglobin with cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.

 serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25OHD) was inversely associated with the risk of new-onset peripheral neuropathy among participants with diabetes. The inverse association was significantly attenuated among participants without diabetes.

Current findings on structural differences in Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) identified using network approaches remain inconsistent. It is still uncertain at what level of the connectome hierarchy differences may exist, and whether they are concentrated in hubs, disrupting fundamental brain connectivity.

Physical activity (PA) is linked to a decreased risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) However, the influence of circadian PA trajectories remains uncertain. This study aims to explore the optimal circadian PA trajectory pattern for reducing the risk of T2DM.

The European Association for the Study of the Liver introduced a clinical pathway for screening significant/advanced fibrosis in people at risk of steatotic liver disease (SLD) We assessed the performance of the first-step FIB4 EASL CP in the general population across different SLD risk groups and various age classes.

There is currently no medical therapy to prevent calcific aortic valve stenosis (CAVS) Multi-omics approaches could lead to the identification of novel molecular targets.

In 2015, the World Health Organization introduced the concept of intrinsic capacity to define the individual-level characteristics that enable an older person to be and do the things they value. This study developed an intrinsic capacity score for UK Biobank study participants and validated its use as a tool for health outcome prediction.

Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) can lead to irreversible liver damage. The association of spleen volume with NAFLD and related type 2-diabetes (T2D) is not fully understood. UK Biobank contains comprehensive health-data of 500,000 participants.

Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common cardiac arrythmia. It is associated with increased risk for ischemic stroke, which is underestimated. The aim of this study was to develop optimal ML models for prediction of AF in the population.

Study aims to examine how ageing affects the self-reported and accelerometer-derived measures of physical activity levels in middle-aged adults. Self-reported physical activity level increased with age and was the highest in group III.

Evidence linking housing density with loneliness and social isolation has been scarce. We leveraged data from UK Biobank, a cohort of adult participants aged 37-73 years recruited between 2006 and 2010. Neighbourhood housing unit density was measured within a walkable scale of 1km and 2km street catchments of participant's geocoded dwelling.

'Benign ethnic neutropenia' (BEN) is a heritable condition characterized by lower neutrophil counts. BEN is predominantly observed in individuals of African ancestry. We aimed to dissect the genetic architecture underlying neutrophill count variation. We identified 73 loci (r2 = 0.1) and 10 index SNPs (GCTA-COJO loci) associated with neutrophils.

 MRI-derived kidney volume measurements from 38 526 UK Biobank participants were analysed. Higher BSA-adjusted TKV was significantly associated with higher estimated glomerular filtration rate.

Study aimed to evaluate impact of seasonal serum vitamin D (25(OH)D) levels on dementia and its subtypes. We analyzed 193,003 individuals aged 60-73 at baseline (2006-2010) from the UK Biobank cohort, with follow-up until 2018. Vitamin D deficiency was associated with a 1.5-fold (95% CIs: 1.2-2.0) increased incidence of dementia.

In utero exposure to a higher area-level infant mortality rate is associated with genetic predispositions correlated with better educational attainment and health. Corrections for this selection in examinations of effects of exposure on later educational attainment suggest underestimates of 26-74%; effects on other life course outcomes also vary across selection correction methods.

Individuals with cardiovascular disease (CVD) are particularly vulnerable to dementia. It remains unclear whether air pollution exposure links with higher risk of dementia among those with CVD. The data were derived from the UK Biobank study (UKB)

A pro-inflammatory diet was associated with an adverse profile of biomarkers linked to cardiometabolic health, endocrine, liver function, and renal health. The concentration difference ranged from 0.27 SD for creatinine to 0.03 SD for total cholesterol.

The contribution of modifiable risk factors to social inequalities in dementia remains unclear. We aimed to quantify the role of cardiovascular health factors, assessed using Life's Essential 8 (LE8) score, in mediating social inequalities. We collected data from the UK Whitehall II Study and UK Biobank databases.

Genetically predicted DNA methylation models were established (n = 2478) These models were applied to genome-wide association study data on HST. A poly-methylation risk score (PMRS) was established in 241,008 individuals from the UK Biobank.

Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) has been linked to diverse risk factors. We used a phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) approach to systematically investigate phenotypes associated with genetic predisposition to HNSCC. We found significant association with phenotypes related to tobacco use disorder, alcoholism, emphysema and chronic airway obstruction.

 Educational attainment (EA) has been linked to the risk of several types of cancer, despite having no expected direct biological connection. We investigate the mediating role of alcohol consumption, smoking, vegetable consumption, fruit consumption and body mass index (BMI) in explaining the effect of EA on 7 cancer groupings.

Delirium and depression are prevalent in aging. Long-term relationship between depression and delirium remains unclear. This study assessed the associations of depression symptom burden and its trajectory with Delirium risk in a 12-year prospective study of older hospitalized individuals.

HFE  haemochromatosis genetic variants have an uncertain clinical penetrance. We estimated p.C282Y and p.H63D variant cumulative incidence of multiple clinical outcomes. Cumulative incidences were estimated from age 40 years to 80 years.

 Epicardial and pericardial adipose tissue (EPAT) has been associated with cardiovascular diseases such as atrial fibrillation or flutter (AF) and coronary artery disease (CAD) It has been suggested that the association between EPAT and cardiovascular disease could be mediated by local or paracrine effects. A genome-wide association study was performed, and a polygenic score (PGS) for EPAT was examined.

Type 2 diabetes (T2D) is associated with an increased risk of premature death. Whether multifactorial risk factor modification could attenuate T2D-related excess risk of death is unclear. We aimed to examine the association of risk factor target achievement with mortality and life expectancy.

The global dementia prevalence is surging, necessitating research into contributing factors. We aimed to investigate the association between metabolic syndrome (MetS) and dementia risk. The prospective study comprised 466,788 participants without pre-existing MetS from the UK Biobank.

Migraine patients had a significantly increased risk of developing AD. Migraine patients exhibit an increased predisposition of genetic susceptibility to AD. These findings hold significant clinical value for early intervention and treatment of migraines.

25-hydroxyvitamin D (25-OHD) was found to be linked to poorer colorectal cancer (CRC) survival outcomes. Findings were consistent across patients with varied tumour sites and stages.

Prenatal and postnatal factors may have joint effects on cardiovascular health. We aimed to assess the association of birth weight and ideal cardiovascular health metrics (ICVHMs) prospectively in adulthood with incident cardiovascular disease (CVD)

Physical abuse can lead to severe health consequences that extend beyond immediate harm. We explored the associations of physical abuse experienced during childhood and adulthood with a wide range of adult health conditions requiring hospital treatment.

The presence of tinnitus was found to be associated with a higher incident rate of the primary outcome (HR = 1.057, 95%CI: 1.017-1.099,  p  = 0.005) After adjusting for confounders, there was no significant association between tinnitis and stroke or mortality.

Vitamin D deficiency is defined by serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels. Longitudinal studies assessing the association of vitamin D deficiency.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk is increased in carriers of the apolipoprotein E (APOE) &#949;4 allele. Risk decreased in & #949;2 allele carriers compared with the &#972;3 genotype. The aim of this study was to determine whether the APOE genotype affects brain grey (GM) or white matter (WM) structure.

The goal of this study is to quantify the assumptions associated with the Wasserman-Hansen (WH) and Fitness Registry (FRIEND) predictive peak oxygen consumption (pVO 2 ) equations across body mass index (BMI) Assumptions in pVO 2  for both equations were first determined using a simulation and then evaluated using exercise data from the Stanford Exercise Testing registry.

The impact of the difference between cystatin C- and creatinine-based estimated glomerular filtration rate on diabetic microvascular complications (DMCs) remains unknown. We investigated the associations of eGFRdiff with overall DMCs and subtypes, including diabetic retinopathy (DR), diabetic kidney disease (DKD), and diabetic neuropathy (DN)

Higher 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D) concentrations in serum has a positive association with pulmonary function. Investigating genome-wide interactions with 25(OHD) may reveal new biological insights into pulmonary function, authors say.

A total of 366,478 participants were studied. The highest versus lowest quartile air pollution score was linked to a 44% increase in respiratory mortality risk. Long-term individual and joint air-pollutant exposure showed a dose-response association.

A polygenic risk score (PRS) combines associations of multiple genetic variants that could be due to direct causal effects, indirect genetic effects, or other sources of familial confounding. We developed new approaches to assess evidence for and against causation by using family data for pairs of relatives.

Thiazides, but not loop diuretics, and increased BMI and decreased serum potassium should be considered as contributing factors in subjects with hypophosphatemia. Further studies are needed to replicate the findings and elucidate the potential role of hypokalemia as a mediator.

Smoking initiation has widespread risk effects on asthma, type 2 diabetes, and peripheral vascular disease. Alcohol consumption shows risk effects specifically on cardiovascular diseases, dyslipidemia, and hypertensive diseases. We find evidence of dosage-dependent effects of coffee and tea intake on common diseases (e.g., cardiovascular disease and osteoarthritis)

Inflammatory responses to acute stimuli are proposed to regulate sleep. Relationship between chronic inflammation and habitual sleep duration is elusive. We study this relation using genetically predicted level of chronic inflammation, indexed by CRP and IL6 signaling, and self-reported sleep duration.

Glaucoma is suspected to exhibit a notable association with psychological disturbances. This study aimed to investigate epidemiological associations and explore shared genetic architecture. Despite the absence of global genetic correlations, MiXeR analysis revealed 300 variants shared between glaucomas and depression.

No medication has been found to reduce liver-related events. We evaluated the effect of sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 inhibitor (SGLT2i) on outcomes. Single nucleotide polymorphisms were identified and a genetic risk score (GRS) was computed using UK Biobank data.

Recent genome-wide association studies have successfully identified associations between genetic variants and simple cardiac morphological parameters. Here we propose a framework for gene discovery coined unsupervised phenotype ensembles. We applied our approach to the UK Biobank database.

Study examined associations between microvascular disease (MVD) and risk of stroke, dementia, and their major subtypes among individuals with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) We included 26,173 participants with T2DM from the UK Biobank who had no known stroke or dementia at baseline.

Gray matter (GM) and white matter (WM) impairments are both associated with raised blood pressure (BP) Whether elevated BP is differentially associated with the GM and WM aging process remains inadequately examined. Study provided compelling evidence that concerted efforts should be directed towards WM damage in individuals with hypertension.

Aging is a risk factor for cancer incidence and mortality. Biological aging can reflect the aging degree of the body better than chronological age. A healthier lifestyle is more likely to mitigate the adverse effects of biological aging on overall cancer and some site-specific cancers.

Systemic inflammation and frailty have been implicated in osteoporosis (OP) and fracture risks. This study aimed to assess the associations of systemic inflammation and. frailty phenotype with incident OP and fracture and to evaluate the. mediating role of frailty.

Mendelian randomization (MR) analysis is increasingly popular for testing the causal effect of exposures on disease outcomes. In some settings, the underlying exposure may not be directly observable, but measurements can be available on multiple biomarkers or other types of traits that are co-regulated by the exposure. We propose a method for MR analysis on latent exposures (MRLE), which tests the significance for, and the direction of, a latent exposure.

Poor oral health may cause inflammation, which accelerates the progression of neurodegenerative diseases. We investigated the relationship between oral health and glaucoma in the UK Biobank. We found no adverse association between self-reported oral health conditions and either glau coma or elevated intraocular pressures.

Consumption of sugar-sweetened beverages (SSB), artificially sweetened drinks (ASB), and pure fruit juice (PJ) was associated with an increased risk of atrial fibrillation. No significant interactions were observed between the consumption of SSB, ASB, or PJ and genetic predisposition to AF.

BMI is a commonly used estimate of obesity, which is a complex trait affected by genetic and lifestyle factors. Marked weight gain and loss could be associated with adverse biological processes. This cohort study found that among US veterans, higher BMI variability was a significant risk marker.

Recent human genome-wide association studies have identified common missense variants in MARC1, p.Ala165Thr and p.Met187Lys. These variants are associated with lower hepatic fat, reduction in liver enzymes and protection from most causes of cirrhosis. In vitro studies of recombinant humanMARC1 protein revealed Ala165ThR substitution causes protein instability and aberrant localization in liver cells.

 Epidemiological evidence for long-term air pollution exposure and Parkinson's disease (PD) is controversial. We identified 293,888 participants who were free of PD at baseline in the UK Biobank (2006-2010) During a median of 11.6 years of follow-up, 1822 incident PD cases were identified. There were no significant associations between air pollution and negative control outcomes.

Low-carbohydrate high-fat (LCHF) diets have attracted interest for a variety of conditions. In some individuals, these diets trigger hypercholesterolemia. There are limited data on their effects on cardiovascular disease risk. The purpose of this study was to investigate the association between LCHF dietary patterns and incident major adverse cardiovascular events.

Pancreatic cancer (PC) is a deadly disease most often diagnosed in late stages. Known risk factors, assessed independently, are currently insufficient for accurately stratifying patients. We use large-scale data from the UK Biobank to identify genetic variant-smoking interaction effects and show their importance in risk assessment.

The antagonistic pleiotropy hypothesis is one of the leading theories in the evolutionary origin of aging. It states that mutations contributing to aging could be positively selected for if they are advantageous early in life and promote earlier reproduction or more offspring. The UK Biobank contains the genotypes and various phenotypes of 500,000 participants, offering an opportunity to test this hypothesis in humans.

Gallstone disease (GSD) associates with significant morbidity and mortality. Decreased secretion of bile acids has been suggested as a driving factor for GSD. Recently, we linked the protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 3 beta (PPP1R3B) genotype to decreased bile acid levels in bile.

Traditional polygenic risk scoring methods fall short, as they are built on additive models that fail to capture the intricate associations among single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) DeepRisk is a biological knowledge-driven deep learning method for modeling these complex, nonlinear associations among SNPs. It outperforms existing PRS-based methods in identifying individuals at high risk for four common diseases.

Phospholipid transfer protein (PLTP) transfers surface phospholipids between lipoproteins. PLTP plays a role in lipoprotein metabolism, but with unclear effects on coronary artery disease (CAD) risk. We aimed to investigate associations of genetically-influenced PLTP activity with 1-H nuclear magnetic resonance ( 1 H-NMR) metabolomic measures and with CAD.

Genome-wide association studies (GWASs) explain the genetic susceptibility between diseases and common variants. With the appearance of large-scale sequencing profiles, we could explore the rare coding variants in disease pathogenesis. We identified 102 significant independent variants at single-variant levels for lung cancer and five lung cancer-related diseases.

 Persistent infections, whether viral, bacterial or parasitic, including Helicobacter pylori infection, have been implicated in non-communicable diseases. Data on 635 cognitively normal participants from the UK Biobank study (2006-21, age range: 40-70 years) were used.

The NIT1-small vessel disease is a novel, autosomal recessively inherited cerebral small vessel disease. It is characterized by a triad of movement disorders, massively dilated basal ganglia perivascular spaces, and intracerebral hemorrhage.

Few studies have assessed the relationship between food environments and the risk of heart failure (HF) We aimed to evaluate the association between ready-to-eat food. environments and incident HF at an individual level in a large prospective cohort. Closer proximity to and greater density of ready- to-eat. food environments was associated with a higher risk of incident HF.

Phenylalanine and apolipoprotein A1 had the strongest association when comparing the highest to the lowest quintile. Triglycerides within all lipoproteins were positively associated with hypertension risk. Adding 10 selected metabolic biomarkers to the traditional hypertension risk model modestly improved discrimination.

Many observational studies support light-to-moderate alcohol intake as potentially protective against premature death. We used a genetic approach to evaluate the linear and nonlinear relationships between alcohol consumption and mortality from different underlying causes. In conventional analysis, the association was 'J-shaped' But MR analyses supported a positive linear association with premature mortality.

The pandemic of the coronavirus disease 2019 resulted in an increased prevalence of social isolation and loneliness. Cox proportional hazards regression was used to test the association between social isolation/loneliness and multiple cardiometabolic diseases. Compared with those with the least loneliness, those who with most loneliness had about 20% increased risk of CMD.

The semiparametric Cox proportional hazards model, together with the partial likelihood principle, has been widely used to study the effects of potentially time-dependent covariates on a possibly censored event time. We propose a computationally efficient method for fitting the Cox model to big data involving millions of study subjects.

Previous fracture may be an important marker for identifying subsequent dementia in middle-aged and older men. The study demonstrated that prior fracture was associated with an increased risk of dementia in men but not in women.

26 164 adults with depression were included from UK Biobank between 2006 and 2010. Depression was defined as a physician's diagnosis in hospital admissions or the use of prescribed antidepressant medication. A weighted healthy lifestyle score was calculated based on smoking, alcohol consumption, diet, sleep pattern, physical activity, social health, employment status and greenspace interaction.

Lifetime risks of dementia and AD were lower in cancer survivors compared to those without cancer. This effect was more pronounced in participants with cancer history exposure&#8805;5 years. Similar relationship was observed in individual cancer types, except for breast cancer.

Prior pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) might be associated with the development of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) The impact of prior PTB on the risk of incident COPD has not been studied in a large prospective cohort study of the European population.

Resting heart rate (RHR), has been related to increased risk of dementia, but the relationship between RHR and brain age is unclear. We aimed to investigate the association of RHR with brain age and the brain age gap.

The role of dysglycaemia as a risk marker for Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma is uncertain. We investigated the relationship between glycated haemoglobin (HbA1c) and incident PDAC using a retrospective cohort study within the UK Biobank.

Coronary artery disease (CAD) affects millions of individuals worldwide. Body mass index is a known risk factor for CAD. More accurate metrics of body fat, including waist-to-hip circumference ratio (WHR), could be more meaningful clinically.

The relationship between MetS and lung cancer remains controversial. Both the incidence of lung cancer and the prevalence of metabolic syndrome (MetS) have been increasing worldwide.

Previous results on the association between the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and stroke are mixed. Most studies derived the eGFR from serum creatinine, which is affected by non-kidney determinants. We included 429 566 UK Biobank participants (94.5% white, 54% women) free of stroke at enrollment.

Liver cirrhosis is a major cause of death worldwide. Cirrhosis develops after a long asymptomatic period of fibrosis progression. Few reliable tools exist for timely identification of individuals at risk. We aimed to develop a novel score to identify those at risk for future liver-related outcomes.

The apolipoprotein E (APOE) plays a central role in lipid metabolism, vascular disease and dementia. Rare mutations in APOE, predicted to be deleterious, are present in 1 in 257 individuals in the general population. For individuals with genetically predicted high plasma apoE and remnant cholesterol the risk for PAD was increased.

There is robust evidence for sex differences in domain-specific cognition. females typically show an advantage for verbal memory, whereas males tend to perform better in spatial memory. Sex differences in brain connectivity are well documented and may provide insight into these differences.

Smoking contributes to a variety of neurodegenerative diseases and abnormalities. Smoking is associated with accelerated brain aging. The neurobiological mechanisms affected by smoking, and whether they are genetically influenced, remain to be investigated.

Traf2- and NCK-interacting protein kinase (TNIK) is a recently identified obesity- and T2D-associated gene with unknown functions. Loss of the Drosophila ortholog of TNIK altered the metabolite profiles and impaired de novo lipogenesis in high sugar-fed larvae. Tnik knockout mice exhibited hyperlocomotor activity.

Cross-sectionally assessed 168 non-fasting plasma metabolites measured by nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy. Albumin, 3 hydroxybutyrate, lactate, and several lipids were associated with higher IOP. In metabolite class analysis, the lipid components of lipoproteins (cholesterol, triglycerides, etc.) were not associated with our outcomes.

 Alterations in fMRI-based brain functional network connectivity (FNC) are associated with schizophrenia. Age-sensitive FNC changes may be relevant to SCZ risk-related FNC. We used independent component analysis to estimate FNC from childhood to adulthood in 9,236 individuals.

 type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is commonly considered a putative causal risk factor for stroke. The intrinsic link underlying T2DM and stroke has not been thoroughly examined. We evaluated phenotypic associations using data from the UK Biobank. We then investigated genetic relationships by leveraging genomic data in European ancestry.

Study looked at whether retinal neurodegeneration was associated with incident all-cause dementia and Alzheimer's disease. After adjustment, lower baseline macular retinal nerve fiber layer thickness was significantly associated with a 10% and 11% higher incidence of dementia and AD, respectively. Lower macular ganglion cell-inner plexiform layer thickness wasn't significantly associated.

Dietary advanced glycation end products (AGEs) might exert adverse effects on cognition. The associations between dietary AGEs and long-term risk of dementia are yet to be assessed in large population studies. We aimed to explore whether elevated dietary A GEs intake is associated with increased risk of. dementia, and whether this association might be affected by genetic risk.

Study looked at the association between the Mediterranean lifestyle and all-cause, cancer, and cardiovascular disease (CVD) mortality in a British population. Adopting a Mediterranean lifestyle adapted to the local characteristics of non-Mediterranean populations may be possible.
