Study compared accuracy of ten reported approaches for classifying insulin-treated diabetes into type 1 (T1D) and type 2 (T2D) diabetes in two cohorts. When classifying all participants, combining early insulin requirement with a T1D probability model (incorporating diagnosis age and body image issue [BMI]), and interview-reported diabetes type consistently achieved high accuracy.

Common genetic variants have been linked to breast cancer risk, but they only partially explain the total breast cancer heritability. Inference from Nordic population-based twin data indicates rare high-risk loci as the chief determinant of breast cancerrisk. Here, we use haplotypes, rather than single variants, to identify rare high risk loci.

Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) are widely used and have been linked to kidney diseases. However, the role of PPI use in the development of chronic kidney disease (CKD) remains unclear. We undertook a prospective analysis of 462,421 participants from the United Kingdom Biobank.

Untargeted high-throughput metabolomic technologies provide an in-depth snapshot of human metabolism at scale. We studied the genetic architecture of the human plasma metabolome using 913 metabolites assayed in 19,994 individuals and identified 2,599 variant-metabolite associations.

A screening tool to assess if an older individual is likely to have a lower dietary protein intake (predicted probability of protein intake &#8804;1&#8901;0 g/kg per d), has been developed for a Netherlands dietary profile. This study aimed to adapt and then validate the protein screening tool for use in a UK population.

Preserved ratio impaired spirometry (PRISm) findings are a heterogeneous condition characterized by a normal FEV 1 to FVC ratio with underlying impairment of pulmonary function. Data relating to the association of baseline and trajectories of PRISm findings with diverse cardiovascular outcomes are sparse.

In the UK Biobank, 484,169 participants (mean age = 56.5 years; 45.2% men) free of dementia were followed from baseline (2006-2010) through July 30, 2021. During a median 12.4 years of follow-up, 6904 all-cause dementia cases and 2115 deaths from dementia were recorded. Replacing sedentary time with equal time spent doing PA may be associated with a significant reduction in dementia incidence and mortality risk.

Osteoarthritis is a common and severe, multifactorial disease with a well-established genetic component. Little is known about how genetics affect disease progression, and thereby the need for joint placement. We aimed to investigate whether the genetic associations of knee and hip osteoarth arthritis differ between patients treated with joint replacement and patients without joint replacement.

 associations between coffee and tea consumption with cardiovascular disease (CVD) and chronic respiratory disease (CRD) remain controversial. This study aims to investigate the separate and combined associations of coffee andTea consumption with CVD, CRD, and their comorbidity.

UK Biobank participants do not have a high-quality measure of intelligence or polygenic scores of intelligence. We created a standardized measure of general intelligence (g factor) relative to the UK population and estimated its quality. For individuals with at least one cognitive test, the g factor from eight cognitive tests (N = 501,650) explained 29% of the variance in cognitive test performance.

Principal component analysis (PCA) was applied to CT of 68 regions in the Desikan-Killiany atlas. PCA produced a spatially broad first principal component (PC1) that was reproducible across datasets. PC1 pattern was also correlated with the spatial pattern of normative maturation and aging.

Genetic deletions at Xp22.31 are associated with the skin condition X linked ichthyosis (XLI), and with a substantially increased risk of atrial fibrillation/flutter (AF), in males. AF is associated with elevated thrombosis, heart failure, stroke and dementia risk.

Ascending thoracic aortic disease is an important cause of sudden death in the U.S. Most aneurysms are identified incidentally. This study developed and validated a clinical score to estimate ascending aorti diameter. The model significantly overestimated or underestimated diameter in external validation.

The influences of diabetes duration and glycemic control and their potential interplays on the risk of heart failure (HF) remain unclear. This work aimed to investigate the association of diabetes. duration and Glycemic control with the risk. of HF.

497,544 UK Biobank participants were followed for an average of 11 years. Loneliness and social isolation were measured via self-report. Mortality and hospitalisations were ascertained to May 2020 for all-cause and CVD mortality.

The science of causal inference has identified situations where causal estimates can be made from observational data. Using the new results, the causal attribution of smoking and BMI to the incidence of 226 diseases in the UK Biobank are estimated. The diseases most strongly attributed to Smoking and BMI are identified.

PXStools is a package for the statistical R. The package allows users to conduct exposure-wide association studies. It can also derive and validate polyexposure risk scores with and without accounting for exposure interactions.

Recessive carriers of nonsynonymous variants in  MAP3K15 were 30% less likely to develop diabetes. These associations were independent of body mass index, suggesting protection against insulin resistance even in the setting of obesity.

People with type 2 diabetes may have insufficient or prolonged sleep that could accelerate cardiovascular disease (CVD) onset. We examined the association of sleep duration with CVD incidence and mortality in this high-risk population. During an average follow-up of 11.0-12.0 years, we documented 2,570 incident cases of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease.

Lower birth weight was associated with greater risk of incident MI and unhealthy LV phenotypes. effects were partially mediated through cardiometabolic disease and systemic inflammation. Findings support consideration of birth weight in risk prediction and highlight actionable areas for disease prevention.

The UK Biobank genotyped about 500k participants using Applied Biosystems Axiom microarrays. Participants were subsequently sequenced by the UK biobank Exome Sequencing Consortium. Axiom genotyping was highly accurate in comparison to sequencing results for almost 100,000 variants.

The observation of genetic correlations between disparate human traits has been interpreted as evidence of widespread pleiotropy. We introduce cross-trait assortative mating (xAM) as an alternative explanation. We observe that xAM affects many phenotypes and that phenotypic cross-mate correlation estimates strongly associated with genetic correlation estimates.

UK Biobank and Scottish Early Rheumatoid Arthritis cohorts linked to mortality and hospitalisation data. Participants with RA + &#8805; 2 LTCs experienced higher hospitalisation rates compared to those with RA alone.

Headache is one of the commonest complaints that doctors need to address in clinical settings. The genetic mechanisms of different types of headache are not well understood. It has been suggested that self-reported headache and self-report migraine were genetically correlated. In this study, we performed a meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies (GWAS)

High intelligence even appears as a protective factor for general anxiety and PTSD. The present study provides robust evidence that highly intelligent individuals do not have more mental health disorders than the average population.

Previous studies have suggested that moderate coffee and tea consumption is associated with lower risk of mortality. This study aimed to evaluate the separate and combined associations of coffee andTea consumption with all-cause and cause-specific mortality.

Cross-sectional analyses tested for associations between RA and RF+ (positive rheumatoid factor) vs. mental health (depression, anxiety, neuroticism), sleep variables and cognition scores in UK Biobank (total n = 484,064) Those RF+ were more likely to report longer sleep duration.

The relationship between sleep disturbances and depression is well documented, yet the biology of sleep is not fully understood. Mitochondria have become of interest not only because of the connection between sleep and metabolism but also because of their involvement in the production of reactive oxygen species, which are largely scavenged during sleep. This is the first study to analyze mtDNA variance in sleep measures in depressed individuals.

Omega-3 (&#969; 3 ) fatty acids are polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) that are largely obtained from diet. They have been speculated to decrease the inflammatory response that is involved in IBD; however, the causality of this association has not been established.

Type III hyperlipidaemia (T3HL) is characterised by equimolar increases in plasma triglycerides (TG) and cholesterol. One TG.PS standard-deviation (SD) was associated with 13.0% (95% confidence-interval 12.0-14.0%) greater TG in OBB and 15.2% (15.0 -15.4%) in UKB. Males were more susceptible to TG. PS effects (4.0%-6.0%), while females were less susceptible. APOE22 carriers had lower apolipoprotein B (apoB) than APOE33 carriers.

Body composition and related risk factors are known to be heritable and identification of their genetic determinants may aid in the development of better prevention and treatment strategies. Recently, whole-body MRI data has become available, providing more specific measures of body composition than anthropometrics such as body mass index.

High alcohol intake is associated with increased mortality. We aimed to identify factors affecting mortality in people drinking extreme amounts of alcohol. Liver disease diagnosis or abnormal liver function tests predicted not only deaths attributed to liver disease but also those from cancers or circulatory diseases.

A later age at natural menopause (ANM) has been linked to several ageing-associated traits including an increased risk of breast and endometrial cancer and a decreased risk of lung cancer, osteoporosis and Alzheimer disease. However, ANM is also related to several proxies for overall health that may confound these associations.

Psoriasis is a chronic systemic inflammatory skin disease, coexisting with depression in up to 25% of patients. Little is known about the drivers of comorbidity, including shared neurobiology and depression brain imaging patterns in patients.

Gut microbiome and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) are implicated in the development of depression. The effect of their interactions on the risk of depression remains unclear. We aim to analyze the effect of interactions between gut microbiome and IBD. We also explore candidate genes involving the interactions.

Energy Trade-Off (ETO) between height and weight for individuals with extreme body types was characterized using a novel ETO-Score (ETOS) Height and ETOS trajectories show a two-hit pattern with profound changes during early infancy and at puberty for tall-slender and short-stout body types. We discovered the multiple genomic loci and pathways probably involved in energy trade-off.

Population-based study shows that HbA1c screening in adults aged 40-70 years can reduce the time to diabetes diagnosis by a median of 2.2 years compared with routine clinical care. Female participants with lower Hb a1c and BMI measurements at enrolment experienced the longest delay to clinical diagnosis. The findings support the use of Hb A1C screening to reduce the period for which individuals are living with undiagnosed diabetes.

Residential greenness has been linked to respiratory mortality, but its long-term effect on incident chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) has rarely been investigated. Study was based on over 350 000 participants aged 38-70 of the UK Biobank, followed from 2006 to 2010 baseline to 2021.

We performed phenome-wide Mendelian randomization analysis (MR-PheWAS), two-sample MR analysis, and systemic review to comprehensively explore the health effects of milk consumption in the European population. We found evidence in support of inverse associations of genetically predicted milk consumption with risk of cataract, hypercholesterolemia, and anal and rectal polyps. We also found evidence that milk consumption was inversely associated with asthma, hay fever, multiple sclerosis, colorectal cancer, and Alzheimer's disease.

Disrupted brain structures and several life environmental factors have been shown to influence depression and anxiety, but their interactions with anxiety and depression remain elusive. Genome-wide association study datasets of 15 brain structure longitudinal changes (N = 15,640) were obtained from the published study. Sex stratification in all analyses was performed to reveal sex-specific differences in the interactions.

The male preponderance in prevalence of autism is among the most pronounced sex ratios across neurodevelopmental conditions. The authors sought to elucidate the relationship between autism and typical sex-differential neuroanatomy, cognition, and related gene expression.

Study aimed to explore associations between frailty components and mortality in adults with and without type 2 diabetes (T2D) In both populations the strongest association with all-cause mortality was observed for slow walking pace.

DrugnomeAI estimates the druggability likelihood for every protein-coding gene in the human exome. The tool generates exome-wide predictions based on labelled sets of known drug targets. Features from protein-protein interaction networks are top predictors.

Very little is known about long-term headache following aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (aSAH) We compared aSAH cases to matched controls in the UK Biobank, a prospective cohort study. Persistent headache is more frequent following a SAH compared to controls. The increased frequency of migrainous features suggests that selected patients may benefit from migraine treatment.

The expansion of the cerebral cortex is one of the most distinctive changes in the evolution of the human brain. Cortical expansion and related increases in cortical folding may have contributed to emergence of our capacities for high-order cognitive abilities.

Many different brain atlases exist that subdivide the human cortex into dozens or hundreds of regions-of-interest (ROIs) Inconsistency across studies using one or another cortical atlas may contribute to the replication crisis across the neurosciences.

Vitamin B 12 levels have been associated with a range of diseases across the life-course. We aimed to interrogate genetically predicted vitamin B 12 status in relation to a plethora of clinical outcomes available in the UK Biobank. Genome-wide association study (GWAS) summary data obtained from a Danish and Icelandic cohort of 45,576 individuals were used to identify 8 genetic variants.

Evidence on the association between air pollution and serum glycosylated hemoglobin A 1c (HbA 1c) is limited and inconclusive. We aimed to evaluate the effects of various air pollutants on serum Hb a 1c levels in patients with hypertension. We also explored the modification effect of individual serum vitamin D levels.

The first release of UK Biobank whole-genome sequence data contains 150,119 genomes. We present an open-source pipeline for filtering, phasing, and indexing these genomes.

The aim of this study was to compare. the prediction of cardiovascular events by automated cardiovascular. magnetic resonance with those of other simple measures of aort. stiffness suitable for population screening.

VAT was predictive, as obtained by sex-stratified, non-linear prediction models. The highest quintiles of VAT and FMR had the highest hazard ratios (HRs) of all-cause mortality. Significant interactions were observed in both sexes according to age category.

Study included 109,301 adults with obesity free of prior CVD based on the UK Biobank cohort. MUO was significantly associated with a 74% increased CVD risk compared with MHO. There was a significant interaction between obesity severity and metabolic status on an additive scale.

Elevated intraocular pressure (IOP) is a major risk factor for glaucoma. We identified 40 novel rare-variant genes for IOP, such as BOD1L1, ACAD10 and HLA-B. Six of these genes are drug targets that are either established for clinical treatment or in clinical trials.

Schizophrenia is a serious mental disorder with considerable somatic and psychiatric morbidity. It is unclear whether comorbid health conditions predominantly arise due to shared genetic risk or consequent to having schizophrenia. We analysed the effect of schizophrenia polygenic risk scores (PRS) on a broad range of health problems in 406 929 individuals with no schizophrenia diagnosis from the UK Biobank.

Chronic kidney disease (CKD) typically co-exists with multimorbidity (presence of 2 or more long-term conditions: LTCs) The associations between CKD, multimorbridity and hospitalisation rates are not known. The aim of this study was to examine hospitalisation. rates in people with and without CKD. Risk factors for hospitalisation were advanced CKD and age over 60.

Anxiety and depressive disorders can be chronic and disabling. Although there are effective treatments, only a fraction of those impaired receive treatment. Predictors of treatment-seeking and treatment receipt could be informative for initiatives aiming to tackle the burden of untreated anxiety and depression.

MOCOnet is a convolutional neural network solution for generalisable motion artefact correction in T1 maps. The network architecture employs U-Net for producing distance vector fields and utilises warping layers to apply deformation to the feature maps in a coarse-to-fine manner. Using the UK Biobank imaging dataset scanned at 1.5T, M OCOnet was trained on 1,536 mid-ventricular T1 mapping with motion artefacts.

We quantified how DN subregions systematically covary with specific HC subfields in the context of subjective social isolation (i.e., loneliness)

Drug targets with human genetic evidence of disease association are twice as likely to lead to approved drugs. A key enabler of identifying and validating these genetically validated targets is access to association results from genome-wide genotyping, whole-exome sequencing, and whole-genome sequencing studies.

As a marker for glomerular filtration, plasma cystatin C level is used to evaluate kidney function. We performed genome-wide association and pathway association studies using United Kingdom Biobank data. Three genes showed the most significant associations, including the CST8-CST9 cluster on chromosome 20.

Oxytocin is a neuromodulator and hormone that is typically associated with social cognition and behavior. Research has investigated its potential as a treatment for psychiatric illnesses characterized by social dysfunction. Recent evidence suggests that the oxytocin system is also linked with cardiometabolic conditions.

We combined conventional evidence from longitudinal data in UK Biobank and genetic evidence from Mendelian randomization (MR) approach to infer the causality between sleep behaviors and fracture risk. We found that participants with insomnia showed 6.4% higher risk of fracture. falls and bone mineral density (BMD) mediated 24.6% and 10.6%.

The pipeline was tested using information from 502,506 UK Biobank participants, aged 37-73 years at recruitment and followed over seven years for mortality registrations. Of the total variable importance summed up, 60% was directly health related.

Enlargement or aneurysm of the aorta predisposes to dissection, an important cause of sudden death. We trained a deep learning model to evaluate the dimensions of the ascending and descending thoracicAorta in 4.6 million cardiac magnetic resonance images from the UK Biobank. We identified 82 loci associated with ascending and 47 with descending aortic diameter.

We analyze how measures of adiposity - body mass index (BMI) and waist hip ratio (WHR) - causally influence rates of hospital admission. We implement a novel quasi-Poisson instrumental variable model in a Mendelian randomization framework. We estimate the individual and joint effects of BMI, WHR, and WHR adjusted for BMI.

We used data on 76,958 adults from the UK Biobank prospective cohort study. Favourable lifestyle included no overweight/obesity, not smoking, physical activity, not sedentary, healthy diet and adequate sleep. Polygenic Risk Score (PRS) was derived using 300 CVD-related single nucleotide polymorphisms.

The association between cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) and genetic polymorphisms in key regulators of Ca 2+ homeostasis is well established but still inadequately understood. The associations of 11,274 genetic variants located in nine calcium signaling-related genes with 118 diseases of the circulatory system were explored.

We develop a Bayesian model (BayesRR-RC) that provides robust SNP-heritability estimation. It takes 22 seconds per iteration to estimate 8.4 million SNP-effects and 78 SNP-Heritability parameters in the UK Biobank. We find that only &#8804;10% of the genetic variation captured for height, body mass index, cardiovascular disease, and type 2 diabetes is attributable to proximal regulatory regions.

Physical activity (PA) and discretionary screen time (DST) are both associated with obesity risk. Little longitudinal evidence exists on their combined influence. We examined the independent and joint associations of changes in PA and DST with incident obesity, body mass index (BMI) and waist circumference.

UK Biobank participants with no significant ocular history were included. Spectral-domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT) images were taken and segmented to define retinal layers. AMD risk associated SNPs were strongly associated with outer-retinal layer thickness.

Despite the increasing global burden of neurological disorders, there is a lack of effective diagnostic and therapeutic biomarkers. Proteins are often dysregulated in disease and have a strong genetic component. Here, we carry out a protein quantitative trait locus analysis of 184 neurologically-relevant proteins.

This study aims to disentangle the contribution of genetic liability, educational attainment (EA), and their overlap and interaction in lifetime smoking. We conducted genome-wide association studies (GWASs) in UK Biobank (N = 394,718) and the Netherlands Mental Health Survey and Incidence Study-2 (NEMESIS-2, N = 3090)

SCORE is a randomized method of moments estimator of genetic correlation. It achieves a 44% reduction in standard error relative to LD-score regression (LDSC) SCORE identifies significant genetic correlation between 200 additional pairs of traits over LDSC.

Mitochondrial DNA copy number (mtDNA-CN) measured from blood specimens is a minimally invasive marker of mitochondrial function. To identify genes involved in regulating mitochondrial function, we performed a genome-wide association study (GWAS) in 465,809 White individuals from the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) consortium and the UK Biobank.

An Amish-enriched missense variant (p.Asn352Ser) in a functional domain of beta-1,4-galactosyltransferase 1 (B4GALT1) was associated with lower LDL-C and fibrinogen levels. The mutant protein had 50% lower galacto-transferase activity compared with the wild-type protein.

Previous cohort studies have investigated the relationship between self-reported physical activity (PA) and dementia. This study aimed to explore the association of device-measured PA with the risk of dementia incidence and common subtypes (Alzheimer's disease [AD] and vascular dementia) using the UK Biobank study.

Patients with psoriasis are at high risk of developing a chronic arthritis known as psoriatic arthritis (PsA) The prevalence of PsA in this patient group can be up to 30% and the identification of high risk patients represents an important clinical research.

Most genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of complex traits are performed using models with additive allelic effects. Additive models can miss loci with recessive effects, thereby leaving potentially important genes undiscovered. We conducted the largest GWAS meta-analysis using a recessive model for type 2 diabetes. We identified 51 loci associated with the disease, including five variants undetected by prior additive analyses.

This study examined sleep and its cognitive and affective correlates in adults with and without autism spectrum disorder (ASD) There were no group differences in subjective sleep duration. Sleep efficiency was associated with wellbeing and mental health.

Migraine represents one of the most prevalent neurological conditions worldwide. It is a disabling condition with high impact on the working situation of migraineurs. Gender-related differences regarding an association of migraine with important occupational characteristics has been hardly studied.

 ANGSD-asso's latent model models the unobserved genotype as a latent variable in a generalized linear model framework. The software is implemented in C/C++ and can be run multi-threaded. In scenarios with sequencing depth and phenotype correlation, the latent model has higher statistical power and less bias than using dosages.

People with severe mental illness (SMI) experience large disparities in physical health. People with schizophrenia/psychosis, BD and MDD have higher risks of COVID-19 infection, hospitalisation and mortality. Vaccination and preventive measures should be prioritised.

Epidemiological studies have repeatedly observed a markedly higher risk for coronary artery disease (CAD) in Scotland as compared to England. It is unclear whether environmental or genetic factors might explain this phenomenon. We assessed CAD risk, based on the Framingham risk score (FRS) and common genetic variants.

We identified six proteins to have causal effects on any of 11 inflammatory diseases. IL-12B protects against psoriasis and psoriatic arthropathy, LAP-TGF-&#946;-1 protects against osteoarthritis, TWEAK protects against asthma, VEGF-A protects against ulcerative colitis. In contrast, IL-18R1 increases the risk of developing allergy, hay fever, and eczema.

Gut dysmotility is associated with constipation, diarrhea, and functional gastrointestinal disorders like irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) We studied stool frequency as a proxy for gut motility in a GWAS meta-analysis including 167,875 individuals from UK Biobank. We identify 14 loci associated with stool frequency (p &#8804; 5.0 Ã— 10 -8 ).

Genetic and lifestyle factors are related to thyroid cancer (TC) Whether a healthy lifestyle is associated with TC and could attenuate the influence of genetic variants in TC remains equivocal. A prospective cohort study using UK Biobank data recruited 502 505 participants aged 40 to 69 years between March 13, 2006, and October 1, 2010. During a median follow-up of 11.1 (IQR, 10.33-11.75) years, 423 incident TCs were ascertained (14.66 per 100 000 person-years)

Between 2006 and 2010, adults without prior stroke at recruitment in England, Scotland, and Wales were recruited into the UK Biobank prospective cohort study. Data were analyzed from September 2021 to September 2022. After mutual adjustment for waist circumference, BMI had no independent association with ischemic stroke but was inversely associated with intracerebral hemorrhage and subarachnoid hemorrhage.

Study included 407,128 individuals (mean age 56.26 years) from the UK Biobank. Severe sleep apnoea was defined as hospital admission. Moderate-to-vigorous physical activity (MVPA) was measured from frequency per week and duration per day.

It is uncertain whether typical variants causing monogenic stroke are associated with cerebrovascular disease in the general population. This cohort study is a multicenter population-based study of data from UK Biobank participants recruited in 2006 through 2010. NOTCH3, HTRA1, and COL4A1/2 pathogenic variants in monogenic. stroke; Framingham cardiovascular risk; and ischemic stroke polygenic risk.

Human induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC) lines are a powerful tool for studying development and disease. The considerable phenotypic variation between lines makes it challenging to replicate key findings and integrate data across research groups.

Study included 176,570 adults in UK Biobank who were initially free of CVD. 9,963 total CVD events, 6,993 ischemic heart disease (IHD) cases, 2,007 stroke cases, and 2,269 heart failure cases were documented. Lower frequency of adding salt to foods was significantly associated with lower risk of total CVA.

 fMRI models of systems-level brain patterns may help improve our ability to link genes, brains, and behavior by identifying reliable and reproducible endophenotypes. If such models capture activity in inherited brain systems, they may offer a more powerful link between genes and behavior.

Previous studies on alcohol drinking and health largely have ignored the potential impact of the timing of drinking. In current drinkers, moderate drinking of alcohol, especially wine, with meals is associated with a lower risk of T2D. Drinking more wine, rather than other alcoholic beverages, was related to lower concentrations of C-reactive protein.

Resting-state networks (RSNs) have been thought to reflect the brain's intrinsic functional organization. Intersubject variability in the networks' spontaneous fluctuations may be associated with individuals' clinical, physiological, cognitive, and genetic traits.

Deep learning framework developed to identify reticular pseudodrusen (RPD) and drusen on optical coherence tomography (OCT) scans. Data were obtained from 1284 participants in the UK Biobank with a self-reported diagnosis of age-related macular degeneration (AMD)

Long-term exposure to air pollution is known to be adversely associated with a broad range of single non-communicable diseases. We aimed to assess associations between long-term air pollution exposure and multimorbidity status, severity, and patterns using the UK Biobank cohort. Higher exposures to PM 2.5 , and NO 2 were associated with multi-organ conditions.

Coffee and tea intake might be associated with psychiatry diseases. However, it is unclear whether the effect of coffee/tea on anxiety and depression depending on the different types of proteins. This was a cross-sectional study.

Severe mental illnesses (SMIs) are often associated with compromised brain health, physical comorbidities, and cognitive deficits. We tested the hypothesis that these impairments can be observed in non-psychiatric individuals with SMI-like brain patterns of deviation. 22,883 participants free of common neuropsychiatric conditions from the UK Biobank were split into discovery and replication samples. Cluster analysis revealed five clusters with distinct RVI profiles.

UK Biobank participants with data on intraocular pressure (IOP), OCT-derived macular inner retinal layer thickness measures, and glaucoma status. Participants were categorized according to self-reported drinking behaviors. Compared with infrequent drinkers, regular drinkers had higher IOP (+0.17 mmHg; P  interaction)

The mutational spectrum of asthma and allergy associated genes is not known. We conducted a secondary analysis of exome data from 281,104 UK Biobank samples. 354 VOI were significantly associated with asthma, allergic rhinitis and atopic dermatitis.

Long-term exposures to air pollution is associated with increased risk of lung cancer. This effect was modified by lifestyle or genetic risk. Integrated interventions for environmental pollution by government and adherence to healthy lifestyle by individuals are advocated for lung cancer prevention.

CounterSynth is a conditional generative model of diffeomorphic deformations that induce label-driven, biologically plausible changes in volumetric brain images. The model is intended to synthesise counterfactual training data augmentations for downstream discriminative modelling tasks.

The incidence of kidney failure is known to increase with age. We investigated the association of retinal age gap (the difference between retinal. age and chronological age) with future risk of kidneys failure. Each 1-year greater retinal Age Gap at baseline was independently associated with a 10% increase in the risk of incident kidney failure.

POPDx (Population-based Objective Phenotyping by Deep Extrapolation) is a bilinear machine learning framework for simultaneously estimating the probabilities of 1538 phenotype codes. We extracted phenotypic and health-related information of 392 246 individuals from the UK Biobank.

Non-random selection of analytic subsamples could introduce selection bias in observational studies. We explored the potential presence and impact of selection in studies of SARS-CoV-2 infection and COVID-19 prognosis. We found non-negligible bias in many simulated scenarios.

 genome-wide association study (GWAS) for coronary artery disease (CAD) comprising 181,522 cases among 1,165,690 participants of predominantly European ancestry. We prioritized 220 candidate causal genes, combining eight complementary approaches. Using CRISPR-Cas9, we experimentally validated the effect of an enhancer in MYO9B, which appears to mediate CAD risk by regulating vascular cell motility.

We investigated the causality of IL-8 on carotid intima-media thickness (c-IMT), a measure of sub-clinical atherosclerosis. In IMPROVE, each unit increase in plasmaIL-8 was associated with an increase in median c-IMt measures. Our results indicate that genetic variants associated with plasma IL- 8 also associate with c- IMT.

Evidence from rodents indicated that after recent stress, reduced expression of tight junction protein claudin-5 may weaken the blood-brain barrier. Our aims were to prove this pathomechanism in humans. We used a large population genetic database to test whether variation in the CLDN5 gene could modulate effects of the IL6 gene variant.

Tobacco smoking is a risk factor for impaired brain function, but its causal effect on white matter brain aging remains unclear. This study aimed to measure the causal effect of tobacco smoking on whitematter brain aging. Study cohort included 23 624 subjects with a mean age of 54.18 years.

UK Biobank cohort included 372,530 participants aged 37-73 years at baseline (2006-2010) with follow-up until September 2021. Incident CMDs cases were identified based on self-reported information and multiple health-related records. PM 2.5 showed the strongest associations with all transitions from healthy to FCMD, to CMM, and then to death.

Tobacco and alcohol use are heritable behaviours associated with 15% and 5.3% of worldwide deaths. These substances are used across the globe, yet genome-wide association studies have focused largely on individuals of European ancestries. We leveraged global genetic diversity across 3.4 million individuals from four major clines of global ancestry (approximately 21% non-European) to power the discovery and fine-mapping of genomic loci associated with tobacco and alcohol.

We reviewed published papers on associations of genes and bladder cancer risk. We then performed a confirmation study of these genes in a large population-based cohort. We identified nine genes that were significantly associated with bladder cancer. Three genes were also known to be associated with hereditary breast cancer.

Multimorbidity (the presence of two or more long-term conditions [LTCs] was suggested to exacerbate the neuronal injuries. We aimed to investigate the association between multimorbidy and dementia risk. We used the prospective data from 245,483 UK Biobank participants during a 9-year follow-up.

Among 200,629 UK Biobank participants with whole-exome sequencing, CH was identified in a nested case-control study of 832 incident lung cancer cases and 3,951 controls. In parallel, we compared CH frequency in published data from 5,003 patients with solid tumor (2,279 lung cancer) who had pretreatment blood sequencing performed through Memorial Sloan Kettering-Integrated Mutation Profiling of Actionable Cancer Targets.

Study included 483,316 participants without heart failure and cardiovascular disease from the UK Biobank study. After adjustment for BMI and other confounding factors, each 1-standard deviation increase in LFI was associated with a 21% lower heart failure risk.

We included 18,062 adults (mean age 59.4 +/- 7.2 years, 37.4% female) with T2D at baseline in the UK Biobank. DMC, defined as diabetic nephropathy, diabetic neuropathy, or diabetic retinopathy, was identified using hospital inpatient records and death registries. Both pre-frailty and frailty were significantly associated with increased risk of overall DMC.

We examined the association of VILPA with all-cause, cardiovascular disease (CVD) and cancer mortality in 25,241 nonexercisers in the UK Biobank. Compared with participants who engaged in no VilPA, participants who had 3 bouts per day showed a 38%-40% reduction in mortality risk.

Loneliness was associated with a nearly 60% increased risk of all-cause dementia. In cause-specific analyses, loneliness was a stronger predictor of vascular dementia than AD. Loneliness was also a strong predictor of frontotemporal dementia (FTD)

Prostate cancer (PCa) is highly heritable. No validated PCa risk model currently exists. We developed a risk model using a kin-cohort of 16,633 PCa families. The model was externally validated in 170,850 unaffected men.

The large-scale open access whole-exome sequencing (WES) data of the UK Biobank is accelerating a new wave of genetic association studies. We proposed to merge the WES genotypes and the genome-wide genotyping (GWAS) genotypes of 167,000 UKB homogeneous European participants into a combined reference panel. We then used the imputed data to replicate association identified in the discovery WES sample.

Mendelian randomization was used to assess the relationship of MFA and percent body fat with whole-body, lumbar spine, femoral neck, and forearm aBMD. In all MR analyses, genetically predicted MFA was inversely associated with a BMD for the whole body. This negative relationship was strongest in older individuals and did not differ by sex.

446 772 participants in the UK Biobank (UKB) prospective cohort study were included. Per 1 standard deviation (5 years) increase in educational level was associated with a 12% lower risk of lung cancer. Education years were negatively correlated with smoking, but positively correlated with healthy diet score. Analysis of mediating effect indicated that the association of educational level with lung cancer risk was mediated by smoking and healthy diet.

A total of 239,745 participants from UK Biobank were studied. 3531 incident cases of all-cause dementia (ACD), 1729 cases of Alzheimer's disease (AD), and 925 cases of vascular dementia (VD) were identified. Several vascular risk factors (physical activity, current smoking status, and glycemic status) were found to be significantly related to dementia risk.

In biomedical science, analyzing treatment effect heterogeneity plays an essential role in assisting personalized medicine. Conventional approaches often evaluate the subgroup treatment effects via parametric modeling. We aim to efficiently evaluate the heterogeneous treatment effects of multiple subgroups simultaneously under the one-step targeted maximum-likelihood estimation (TMLE) framework.

Study aimed to identify novel genetic factors that contribute to body surface area. Based on more than 330,000 European individuals in the UK Biobank. First large-scale genome-wide association study for BSA was performed.

Study aimed to determine the independent effects of obesity and dynapenia on falls risk, areal bone mineral density, and fracture risk (lower extremity or all other fractures) A total of 16,147 women (aged 60-82 years) from the UK Biobank were categorized by handgrip strength and body weight.

Study of 254,997 adults in the United Kingdom found an association of high birthweight with the incidence of gastrointestinal cancer. Such association was remarkably observed in pancreatic cancer. Benefits would be obtained from birthweight control, particularly for individuals with a high genetic risk.

Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is not only a chronic inflammatory disorder of the gastrointestinal tract but also accompanied by systemic inflammation. Relationship between IBD and hypertension has not been investigated. We retrieved IBD onset and the incidence of hypertension from the UK Biobank.

When present in coding regions, tandem repeats (TRs) may have large effects on protein structure and function contributing to health and disease. We use a family-based design to identify de novo TRs and assess their impact at the population level in 148,607 European ancestry participants.

Systematic COronary Risk Evaluation (SCORE2) risk algorithm is suitable for the prediction of incident dementia and all-cause mortality. Whether its discrimination abilities are higher than those of the SCORE and Cardiovascular Risk Factors, Aging, and Dementia (CAIDE) risk algorithms are unclear.

Evaluation of the feasibility of using cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) radiomics in the prediction of incident atrial fibrillation (AF), heart failure (HF), myocardial infarction (MI), and stroke. We identified participants from the UK Biobank who experienced incident AF, HF, MI, or stroke during the continuous longitudinal follow-up.

Study included 366,566 participants (aged 40-69 years) without baseline CVD from the UK biobank during 2006 to 2010. Compared with no VPA, 0%-30% of VPA to MVPA was associated with 12% and 19% lower risks of incident CVD and all-cause mortality.

Alzheimer's disease is marked by intracellular tau aggregates in the medial temporal lobe (MTL) and extracellular amyloid aggregation in the default network (DN) We examined codependent structural variations between the MTL's most vulnerable structure, the hippocampus (HC), and the DN in individuals with Alzheimer's disease and related dementia (ADRD)

Previous studies have shown certain exposure factors are associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) events. This study included 335,370 individuals in the UK Biobank. Five domains were extracted from 12 variables including ecosystem, lifestyle, tobacco and alcohol use, social economics, and social support.

Despite availability of gene expression and epigenomic datasets, few variant-to-gene links have emerged. Results contradict the hypothesis that most complex trait-associated variants coincide with homeostatic expression QTLs. The field must confront this deficit and pursue this 'missing regulation'

Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) is a debilitating chronic disease that lacks known pathogenesis, distinctive diagnostic criteria, and effective treatment options. Understanding the genetic (and other) risk factors associated with the disease would begin to help to alleviate some of these issues.

Life's Essential 8 (LE8) score and the incidence of four cardiovascular outcomes (ischemic heart disease, myocardial infarction, stroke, and heart failure) in UK Biobank. 250,825 participants were included in this prospective study. Compared to individuals in the highest quartile of the score, those in the lowest quartile (least healthy) had 2.07 (95% CI: 1.99; 2.16) higher risk for MACE.

Type 2 diabetes (T2D) is a heritable metabolic disorder. While population studies have identified hundreds of common genetic variants associated with T2D, the role of rare (frequency GCK ,  GIGYF1 ,  HNF1A ) in addition to missense variants in ZEB2 and MLXIPL remains unclear.

Shift work at baseline was associated with an increased risk of all-cause dementia. Among shift workers, there was no significant association between night shift work and the risk of dementia. The increased incidence of dementia did not differ between participants in different genetic risk strata for dementia.

Light is the primary stimulus for synchronizing the circadian clock in humans. Little is currently known about the genetic basis for these interindividual differences. This study is the first to assess light as an important exposure in the genomics of chronotype.

Soluble urokinase plasminogen activator receptor (suPAR) is an immune-derived mediator of kidney disease, levels of which are strongly associated with cardiovascular outcomes. We found serum suPAR levels to be predictive of coronary artery calcification and cardiovascular events.

There is growing evidence that a polygenic burden significantly modulates LDL-cholesterol (LDL-c) concentrations. Several LDL-c polygenic risk scores (PRS) have been set up. We set up new PRS based on our routine panel for sequencing and compared their diagnostic performance with previously-published PRS. Between all PRS, the 165-SNP PRS showed the best LDL- c explained variance and the best diagnosis abilities.

High dietary calcium consumption is associated with lower colorectal cancer (CRC) risk. However, little data are available on the association between circulating calcium concentrations and CRC risk. This study used data from 2 large European prospective cohort studies.

Study investigated the influence of dietary factors on the risk of incident non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), cirrhosis, and liver cancer. Data from the UK Biobank database were analyzed (n = 372,492) Participants in the high tertile of prudent scores had a 15% (95%CI = 0.75-0.96) lower risk of Cirrhosis. The higher consumption of red meat and the lower consumption of fruit, cereal, tea, and dietary fiber were significantly associated with a higher risk of NAFLD.

The UK Biobank (UKBB) and German National Cohort (NAKO) are among the largest cohort studies. The purpose of this study was to demonstrate how MRI data from these large-scale studies can be jointly analyzed. Cross-study analysis on harmonized data revealed comprehensive quantitative models for the phenotypic variation of abdominal organs.

Despite its association with severe health conditions, the etiology of sleep apnea (SA) remains understudied. This study sought to identify genetic variants robustly associated with SA risk. After adjustment for BMI, only one genome-wide significant variant was identified.

Many ultraprocessed food (UPF)-derived by-products may play a role in the development of chronic kidney disease (CKD) Although several studies have assessed the association of UPFs with kidney function decline or CKD in various countries, no evidence has been shown in China and the United Kingdom. Study aims to evaluate the association between UPF consumption and risk of CKD.

Age-related muscle dysfunction and sarcopenia are major causes of physical incapacitation in older adults and currently lack viable treatment strategies. Inhibition of sphingolipid synthesis confers increased myogenic potential and promotes protein synthesis.

The UK Biobank provides a rich collection of longitudinal clinical data coming from different healthcare providers and sources in England, Wales, and Scotland. To make these data useful to a research community, data cleaning, curation, and standardization are needed.

An increasing number of studies harness resting-state fMRI functional connectivity analysis to investigate the neurobiological mechanisms of insomnia. The results to date are inconsistent and the detection of minor and widely distributed alterations in functional connectivity requires large sample sizes. The present study investigated associations between insomnia symptoms and resting- state functional connectivity at the whole-brain level in the largest sample to date.

Cysteine-altering missense variants (NOTCH3cys) in one of the 34 epidermal growth-factor-like repeat (EGFr) domains of the NOTCH3 protein are the cause of notCH3-associated small vessel disease. The strongest known NOT CH3-SVD modifier is NOTCH2cys variant position. NotCH3Cys variants located in EGFr domains 1-6 are associated with a more severe phenotype than those located in domains 7-34. The clinical relevance of this new three-tiered EGFr risk classification was cross-sectionally validated using SVD imaging markers and clinical outcomes.

Mitochondrial DNA dysfunction has been implicated in the pathogenesis of cardiovascular diseases. We aimed to investigate the associations between leukocyte mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) abundance, as a proxy of mitochondrial function, and coronary artery disease (CAD) and heart failure (HF) in a cohort study.

Binary diagnosis of coronary artery disease does not preserve the complexity of disease or quantify its severity or its associated risk with death. We evaluated a quantitative marker of coronary arteries disease derived from probabilities of a machine learning model. We measured the association of ISCAD with clinical outcomes.

Habitual fish oil use was associated with a significantly lower hazard of incident CKD. Consistently, participants reporting. &#8805;2 servings/week of oily fish (HR, 0.86; 95% CI,. 0.79-0.94) and nonoily fish ( HR, 0,86; 0.77-0,97) consumption had a lower hazard.

White matter hyperintensities were automatically segmented and quantified in the UK Biobank dataset (N = 18,294) Generalised linear models were applied to examine the main effects of vascular and hormonal factors. In men with testosterone levels one standard deviation higher than the mean value, smoking was associated with 27.8% higher white matterHyperintensity volumes in the whole brain. In women with a shorter post-menopause duration, diabetes and higher pulse wave velocity were associated with 28.8%. These findings highlighted the importance of considering hormonal risk factors.

A high adherence to the Mediterranean-Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension Diet Intervention for Neurodegenerative Delay (MIND) has been associated with better cognition and a lower risk of dementia. We measured adherence to MIND and its association with cognitive health in the UK Biobank (UKB) MIND score derived from 24 h diet recall questionnaires for 120,661 participants.

Asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) are two distinct diseases. They share common features in terms of their advanced stages and genetic factors. This study aimed to identify novel genes underlying both asthma and COPD using genome-wide association study (GWAS) to differentiate between the two diseases.

Genotype-by-environment interaction (GEI or GxE) plays an important role in understanding complex human traits. It is usually challenging to detect GEI signals efficiently and accurately while adjusting for population stratification and sample relatedness in large-scale genome-wide association studies (GWAS) We propose a fast and powerful linear mixed model-based approach, fastGWA-GE, to test for GEI effect and G+GxE joint effect.

More than 40% of individuals will develop osteoarthritis during their lifetime. There are currently no licensed disease-modifying treatments for this disabling condition. Common polymorphic variants in ALDH1A2 are associated with severe hand OA.

There is an increasing expectation that advanced, computationally expensive machine learning (ML) techniques will help to uncover key differences in the human brain in health and disease. We take a comprehensive approach to explore how multiple aspects of brain structural connectivity can predict sex, age, general cognitive function and general psychopathology. We modelled N = 8183 structural connectomes from UK Biobank.

Vestibular schwannomas are benign nerve sheath tumours that arise on the vestibulocochlear nerves. The majority of vestibularschwannoma present sporadically without identification of germline pathogenic variants. One risk locus reached genome-wide significance in our association analysis (9p21.3)

Multiple Sclerosis (MS) has been linked to a variety of environmental risk factors, including smoking, Epstein-Barr Virus infection, and childhood obesity. There is some evidence to support a relationship between alcohol consumption and MS risk, but this finding has been inconsistent across cohorts. We analysed data from 2100 individuals with MS and 407,128 controls.

Elevated blood C-reactive protein (CRP) further increases the risk of AD for people carrying the APOE &#949;4 allele. We found that for higher concentrations of serum CRP, the AD risk increased for SNP genotypes in 3 AD-associated genes (SPI1, CD33, and CLU)

Morroniside, derived from medicinal herb Cornus officinalis, possesses anti-inflammatory effect. Denervation increased TNF&#945; in atrophying skeletal muscles, which inhibited myotube formation in vitro. Morronisideside treatment rescued T NF&# 945;-inducedMyotube atrophy in vitro and impeded skeletal muscle atrophy  in vivo.

 Meta-analysis of whole genome sequencing/whole exome sequencing (WGS/WES) studies provides an attractive solution to the problem of collecting large sample sizes for discovering rare variants associated with complex phenotypes. Existing rare variant meta-analysis approaches are not scalable to biobank-scale WGS data.

Vitamin D deficiency is more common among African-ancestry individuals and may be associated with adverse health outcomes. Vitamin D binding protein (VDBP) regulates concentrations of biologically active vitamin D. We conducted genome-wide association study (GWAS) of VDBP and 25-hydroxyvitamin D.

Exposure to outdoor light at night may cause circadian disruption, which may disturb sleep quality and lead to incident type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) Study followed 283,374 persons from 2006 through 2020. Participants who lived in the highest quarter of outdoor LAN area were more likely to develop T2DM.

A large proportion of Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON) family members who carry a mitochondrial risk variant never lose vision. Mitochondrial variants, including m.14484T>C and m.11778G>A, have been added to gene arrays, and thus many patients and research participants are tested for LHON mutations.

Exome array analysis on 106,101 SNPs for 9721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium. 12 of the remaining 13 variants were extremely rare in European Caucasians. Power to replicate was very low given the low allele frequencies of the associated variants.

Adverse muscle composition (MC) has previously been linked to poor functional performance and comorbidities in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) In this study we aimed to investigate associations of all-cause mortality with liver fat, NAFLD, and MC in the UK Biobank imaging study. Magnetic resonance images of 40,174 participants were analyzed for liver proton density fat fraction (PDFF) and thigh fat-free muscle volume (FFMV) z-score.

Men of African ancestry (AA) have the highest mortality rate from prostate cancer (PCa) relatively little is known about the germline variants that are associated with PCa risk in AA men. The goal of this study is to systematically evaluate rare, recurrent nonsynonymous variants across the exome. Whole exome sequencing (WES) of germline DNA was performed.

Frailty is a public health problem for ageing society. Evidence is lacking regarding its impact on intestinal functions. We aimed to examine prospective relationships of frailty and pre-frailty in middle-aged and older adults with incident irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)

Study explored the mechanisms of the interaction between diet and gut microbiome on the risk of neuroticism. The neuroticism score was calculated by 12 questions from the Eysenck Personality Inventory Neuroticism scale. Protein vs. Bifidobacterium and fat vs. Clostridia were negatively associated with neuroticism in fruit types.

Winner's curse can affect Mendelian randomization estimates, but its severity and potential impact are unclear. We randomly divided a UK Biobank data set 100 times into three equally sized subsets. The first subset was treated as the 'discovery GWAS' We compared genetic associations estimated in the discovery GWAS to those estimated in each of the 100 iterations.

Step-by-step software implementation of a graph-embedded topic model. Data preprocessing, graph learning, topic inference, and phenotype prediction. As a demonstration, we use simulated data that mimic the UK Biobank data.

The level of cartilage acidic protein 1 (CRTAC1) in plasma was recently discovered to be associated with osteoarthritis (OA) risk and progression to joint replacement in Iceland. 1,462 plasma proteins were measured in 54,265 participants from the UK Biobank on the Olink Explore platform.

The 10-year Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease risk score is the standard approach to predict risk of incident cardiovascular events. Recently, addition of coronary artery disease (CAD) polygenic scores has been evaluated. Age and sex strongly predict the risk of CAD, their interaction with genetic risk prediction has not been systematically examined.

The study analyzed serum GGT concentration at baseline of 421,032 participants recruited in the UK Biobank since 2006 through 2010. The study identified 586 cases of pancreatic cancer over a median follow-up period of 7.16 years. In the multivariable-adjusted Cox model, the highest GGT level was associated with 14% higher pancreatic Cancer risk.

Absence of a dicrotic notch on finger photoplethysmography is an easily ascertainable and inexpensive trait. Little is known about its genetic underpinnings or prognostic value for incident cardiovascular disease. We created a novel continuous trait reflecting notch smoothness using machine learning. Notch smoothness stratified risk of myocardial infarction or coronary artery disease, stroke, heart failure, and aortic stenosis.

This study aimed to examine the associations between subjective well-being (SWB) and risk of all-cause dementia, Alzheimer's disease (AD), and vascular dementia (VD) We adopted a multidimensional approach to SWB that included the level and breadth of SWB. General happiness, health and family satisfaction, and satisfaction breadth (satisfaction in multiple domains) were associated with lower risk of dementia.

Men who received androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) for prostate cancer had a higher risk of dementia and/or Alzheimer disease (AD) than men who did not receive ADT. The effect was more pronounced when ADT was given for more than 12 months.

Abdominal hernias are common and characterised by the abnormal protrusion of a viscus through the wall of the abdominal cavity. The global incidence is 18.5 million annually and there are limited non-surgical treatments. To improve understanding of common hernia aetiopathology, we performed a six-stage genome-wide association study.

Artificial intelligence (AI)-based approaches can now use electrocardiograms (ECGs) to provide expert-level performance in detecting heart abnormalities and diagnosing disease. Patient age predicted from ECGs by AI models has shown great potential as a biomarker for cardiovascular age. Recent work has found its deviation from chronological age ("delta age") to be associated with mortality.

 summary statistics from genome-wide association studies (GWAS) have facilitated the development of various summary data-based methods. Analyses using these methods may be biased by errors in GWAS summary data or LD reference or heterogeneity between GWAS and LD reference. Here we propose a quality control method, DENTIST, that leverages LD among genetic variants to detect and eliminate errors. Through simulations, we demonstrate that DentIST substantially reduces false-positive rate in detecting secondary signals.

Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD) is characterized by progressive cyst formation/expansion. PKD1 and PKD2 are the common loci and GANAB, DNAJB11, and ALG9 are minor genes. We identified monoallelic IFT140 loss-of-function (LoF) variants in 12 multiplex families and 26 singletons.

We constructed polygenic risk scores (PRS) for 16 cancers using risk variants identified by genome-wide association studies. We evaluated the associations of these PRSs with breast cancer risk using Breast Cancer Association Consortium data. A 5%-8% significantly elevated risk of overall breast cancer was associated with per unit increase of the PRS for glioma and cancers of the corpus uteri, stomach, or colorectum. Our study provides strong evidence for shared genetic susceptibility of breast cancer with several other cancers.

Primary care EHR data are often of clinical importance to cohort studies. Challenges include determining the periods during which Ehr data were collected. We developed methodology to infer continuous periods of data collection and maximize follow-up in longitudinal studies.

APOE &#949;4 has been associated with lower levels of blood CRP in middle-aged and older populations. Few studies have investigated this intriguing relation and its impact on neurological markers for AD in younger ages, nor across the whole lifespan.

Sulcal depth is a robust yet understudied measure of localized folding. Sulcal depth has higher locus yield, heritability, and effective sample size. There was a large amount of genetic overlap between these traits.

One third of patients with chronic polyneuropathy have no obvious underlying etiology. We performed genome-wide association studies using genetic data from two large population-based health studies. No replicable risk loci were identified in the discovery-replication stage, in line with the limited predicted power of this approach.

Age and sex associated with changes in the functional brain network topology and cognition in large population of older adults have been poorly understood. We examined differences in 11 resting-state graph theory measures with respect to age, sex, and their relationships with cognitive performance in 17,127 United Kingdom Biobank participants. Age was associated with an overall decrease in the effectiveness of network communication.

Language is a unique trait of the human species, of which the genetic architecture remains largely unknown. Neuroimaging has significantly contributed to the understanding of structural and functional aspects of language in the human brain. Twenty genomic loci were found associated with language FCs, out of which three were replicated.

Study examined six lifestyle factors with T2DM cases among hypertension (227,966) and normotension (203,005) Low-risk lifestyle factors were defined as standard body mass index (BMI), drinking alcohol in moderation, nonsmoking, engaging in moderate- to vigorous-intensity physical activity, and maintaining a healthy sleep pattern.

Bayesian PRS methods can estimate the variance of an individual's PRS and can yield well-calibrated credible intervals via posterior sampling. For 13 real traits in the UK Biobank (n = 291,273 unrelated 'white British'), we observe large variances in individual PRS estimates which impact interpretation of PRS-based stratification.

Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) is the most prevalent liver disease worldwide. Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is leading cause of mortality among patients with NAFLD. We developed a machine learning algorithm integrating clinical, lifestyle, and genetic risk factors to identify CVD.

Anti-inflammatory approaches targeting interleukin (IL)-6 signaling can reduce cardiovascular risk. It remains unknown whether targeting IL-6 signaling could reduce risk additively to low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) lowering. Here, we assess interactions in associations of genetic downregulation of IL-8 signaling and LDL-C lowering with lifetime cardiovascular disease risk.

Mendelian Randomization study was conducted in European-ethnicity individuals from the UK Biobank population. Analyses were performed using data of 22,313 CAD cases and 407,920 controls. Causal determinants for primary CAD are age dependent with classical CAD risk factors attenuating in relation with primary CAD.

Cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) radiomics analysis provides multiple quantifiers of ventricular shape and myocardial texture. We studied variation in CMR radiomics phenotypes by age and sex in healthy UK Biobank participants. Then, we examined independent associations of classical vascular risk factors (VRFs: smoking, diabetes, hypertension, high cholesterol) with C MR radiomics features.

The age of menopause is associated with fertility and disease risk. We use whole-exome sequences from 132,370 women in the UK Biobank to test for associations. Rare damaging variants in five genes are significantly associated with menopera.

We conducted a Mendelian randomization study to examine the associations of selenium levels with 22 site-specific cancers and any cancer. Single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) strongly associated with toenail and blood (TAB) and blood selenum levels in mild linkage disequilibrium.

Inflammation has previously been linked with depression and has more recently been suggested as a possible link to anxiety aetiology. The objectives of this study are to assess the relationship between different anxiety/stress-related disorders and inflammation (measured by C-reactive protein) and to determine whether any relationship is explained by depressive symptoms and other social and health-related factors.

Neuroimaging data is comparably homogeneous due to the uniform structure of the brain. By learning filters in individual latent space patches without sharing weights, PIF layers can learn abstract features faster and specific to regions. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first study that introduces a prior in form of an inductive bias.

N-3 long-chain polyunsaturated fatty acids (LCPUFAs) prevented non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in studies of mouse models. We examined relationships between fish oil use and risk of primary liver cancer and the major histological subtypes.

Peripheral inflammation was inversely associated with grey matter volume and white matter volume. Brain atrophy mediated the inflammation-cognitive decline relationship, accounting for 15-29% of the overall impact.

Few research exists on the mediating effect of brain structure in the association between dietary inflammatory index (DII) and cognitive impairment. This analysis utilized data from a cohort of 15,526 participants in the UK Biobank who underwent brain magnetic resonance imaging during 2014-2020.

Aging is a major risk factor for cardiovascular and neurodegenerative disorders. Changes in functional connectivity between and within resting-state functional networks have been associated with cognitive decline. There is no consensus on the impact of sex on these age-related functional trajectories.

Platelet count (PLT) is associated positively with lung cancer risk. PLT has a more complex association with body mass index (BMI), positive only in women (mainly never smokers) and inverse in men. We examined the associations of PLT, mean platelet volume (MPV), and platelet distribution width (PDW) with Lung cancer risk in UK Biobank men and women.

Pancreatitis may associate with an increased risk of pancreatic cancer. The older the age of pancreatitis, the higher the risk of the disease. The risk of Pancreatic cancer increases significantly in the first 3 years of the course of the pancreatitis.

UK Biobank cohort study includes more than 500,000 participants aged 40 to 69 across the United Kingdom from 2006 to 2010. Incident sleep apnea was ascertained by hospital inpatient records, death registries, primary care, and self-reported diagnosis. Compared to participants who never/rarely added salt to foods, those who sometimes, usually, and always added Salt to foods had an 11% (hazard ratio [HR] 1.11, 95% confidence interval [CI]: 1.04 to 1.17) and 24% (HR 1.24, 95's CI: 1.12 to1.37) higher risk.

Deep learning models are increasingly being used in detecting patterns and correlations in medical imaging data such as magnetic resonance imaging. In the presence of confounders, spurious correlations between data, imaging process, content, and output can occur that allow the network to learn shortcuts instead of the desired causal relationship.

Patients with prevalent diabetes were included from 5 prospective, population-based cohorts in China, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Healthy lifestyle scores were constructed according to non-current smoking, low to moderate alcohol drinking, regular physical activity, healthy diet, and optimal body weight.

Study included 155,235 postmenopausal women (of which 6146 with BCa) from UK Biobank. Cancer diagnoses were ascertained through the linkage to the UK National Health Service Central Registers. Compared to women with low exposure, women with higher 2007 PM10 and cumulative average PM10 had greater BCa risk.

C cohort study was based on the UK Biobank. Baseline survey was conducted from 2006 to 2010. Residential distance to major roadways was ascertained residential address postcode. Compared with individuals living >1,000 m from major traffic roads, living &#8804;1,00 m was associated with a 13% to 14% higher dementia risk.

Fibroblast growth factor-23 (FGF-23) is associated with a range of cardiovascular and noncardiovascular diseases. Mendelian randomization approaches can help control for such confounding. Data from 337,448 UK Biobank participants were used to estimate associations.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients rank among the highest levels of comorbidities compared to persons with other diseases. It is unclear whether the conditions are caused by shared pathophysiology due to the genetic pleiotropy for AD risk genes.

A common approach for gene-based tests is to combine SNPs associations by computing the sum of &#967; 2 statistics. This strategy ignores the directions of SNP effects, which could result in a loss of power for SNPs with masking effects. Here, we introduce "mBAT-combo," a set-based test that is better powered than other methods to detect multi-SNP associations.

Groups of distantly related individuals who share a short segment of their genome identical-by-descent (IBD) can provide insights about rare traits and diseases in massive biobanks. Clustering algorithms play an important role in finding these groups accurately and at scale. We set out to analyze the fitness of commonly used, fast and scalable clustering algorithms for IBD mapping applications.

Reliability calculated between left and right heels was relatively poor and so was criterion validity assessed relative to dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry. Low to modest correlations (r = 0.29 to 0.44) were obtained between multiple QUS variables and DXA BMD. sensitivity identified as very poor for osteoporosis, and poor (0.37 to.62) for osteopenia diagnoses.

Genome-wide polygenic risk scores (PRS) have shown high specificity and sensitivity in predicting type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk in Europeans. However, the PRS-driven information and its clinical significance in non-Europeans are underrepresented. We examined the predictive efficacy and transferability of PRS models.

Self-reported health information could increase CKD awareness, identify modifiable lifestyle risk factors, and prevent disease. We developed and validated a survey-based prediction equation to identify individuals at risk for incident CKD.

Fluid intelligence is a cognitive domain that encompasses general reasoning, pattern recognition, and problem-solving abilities independent of task-specific experience. Understanding its genetic and neural underpinnings is critical yet challenging for predicting human development, lifelong health, and well-being.

 Neurobiological correlates of resilience to stress or trauma have not been investigated extensively. Study included 12,516 participants from the UK Biobank to investigate white matter connectivity in resilience in 13 selected regions of interest (ROIs)

Prostate cancer (PrCa) is the second most prevalent malignancy in men worldwide. Studies have linked the use of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-c) lowering therapies with reduced risk of PrCa.

We included 497,401 UK Biobank participants (mean age = 56.5 years) without dementia at baseline (2006-2010) and followed them until March 2021. Cox proportional hazard models were used to estimate the age- and sex-specific hazard ratios (HRs) of incident dementia.

MRI-derived brain age (BA) estimates are often obtained using deep learning models that may perform relatively poorly on new data. This study introduces a convolutional neural network (CNN) to estimate BA after training on the MRIs of 4,681 cognitively normal (CN) participants and testing on 1,170 CN participants from an independent sample. At both individual and cohort levels, the CNN provides detailed anatomic maps of brain aging patterns.

Onions have shown antidepressant effects but relevant evidence from people was limited. We aimed to explore the prospective association between onion consumption and risk of depressive symptoms in the general population. We used data from 2 cohorts: the Tianjin Chronic Low-grade Systemic Inflammation and Health (TCLSIH) and the UK Biobank.

Endometriosis is a common chronic gynecologic pathology with a large negative impact on women's health. It is also associated with several psychiatric comorbidities, including depression and anxiety. This is the first large-scale study to provide genetic and phenotypic evidence of the processes underlying the psychiatric comerbidities of endometriosi.

A comprehensive view of chemokines and the risk and prognosis of breast cancer is scarce. Little is known about their causal associations. We found an inverse association between genetic predisposition to CCL5 and breast cancer, while CCL19 was associated with breast cancer survival. These associations suggested the potential of these chemokine as tools for breast cancer prevention and treatment.

A variety of statistical approaches in nutritional epidemiology have been developed to enhance the precision of dietary variables derived from longitudinal questionnaires. Correlation with biomarkers is often used to assess the relative validity of these different approaches. We present a novel high-throughput approach which utilizes the modest but importantly non-zero influence of genetic variation on variation in dietary intake.

Despite evidence linking habitual sleep duration and risk of disease, the genetic determinants of sleep duration are poorly understood, especially outside of European (EUR) populations. A polygenic score of 78 European ancestry sleep duration single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) is associated with sleep duration in an African, East Asian and South Asian cohort.

Smoking and alcohol consumption were associated with the development of depression and anxiety. 3'UTR APA quantitative trait loci (3'aQTLs) have been associated with multiple health states and conditions. Our aim is to evaluate the interactive effects of 3'aqTLs-alcohol consumption/tobacco smoking on the risk of anxiety and depression.

Glaucoma, a leading cause of irreversible blindness, is a highly heritable human disease. Previous genome-wide association studies have identified over 100 loci for the most common form, primary open-angle glau coma. Two key glaucomA-associated traits also show high heritability: intraocular pressure and optic nerve head excavation damage.

GLIMPSE2 is a low-coverage whole-genome sequencing imputation method. It scales sublinearly in both the number of samples and markers. The method retains high accuracy for ancient and modern genomes.

Asthma is a complex, heterogeneous disease strongly associated with type 2 inflammation. Blood eosinophil counts guide therapeutic interventions in moderate and severe asthma. Despite these critical associations, the shared genetic architecture of these two traits remains unknown.

Dietary quality score was a good approximation of overall dietary quality. An unhealthy diet was associated with markers of poorer cardiometabolic health. The first component explained 14% of the variation in the dietary data.

Nonresponse is common and impedes proper interpretation and generalizability of results. We examined item nonresponse behaviour across 109 questionnaire items in the UK Biobank (N = 360,628) Phenotypic factor scores for two participant-selected nonresponse answers predicted participant nonresponse in follow-up surveys.

Metabolic syndrome (MetS) is characterized by a constellation of metabolic risk factors, including obesity, hypertriglyceridemia, low high-density lipoprotein (HDL) levels, hypertension, and hyperglycemia. This study explored the associations of brain morphology with MetS and brain aging due to MetS.

Hospital-treated infections had more consistent deleterious effects on volumetric and white matter integrity brain neuroimaging outcomes compared with total infectious burden. Further studies are needed in comparable populations.

Several lysosomal genes are associated with Parkinson's disease (PD), yet the association between PD and ARSA remains unclear. We found evidence for associations between functional ARSA variants and PD in four cohorts and in the meta-analysis. We also found an association between loss-of-function variants andPD in the United Kingdom Biobank cohort.

Omega-3 fatty acids and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) exhibited a negative association with heart failure risk. Conversely, creatinine negatively associated with a HLS, but positively correlated with the risk of HF. Adding these three metabolites to the classical risk factor prediction model, the prediction accuracy of heart failure incidence can be improved.

Mendelian randomization (MR) can help to mitigate biases due to confounding and reverse causation in observational studies. MR results suggest there may not be protective effects of modest alcohol consumption on obesity traits and type 2 diabetes. Heavy alcohol consumption could lead to increased measures of obesity as well as increased risk of type 2 Diabetes.

Stroke is a leading cause of death and disability worldwide. Atrial fibrillation (AF) is a common cause of stroke but may not be detectable at the time of stroke. We hypothesized that an AF polygenic risk score (PRS) can discriminate between cardioembolic stroke and noncardioembolic strokes.

The association of a healthy lifestyle and the American Heart Association (AHA) Life's Essential 8 (LE8) score with the risk of new-onset nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) remains uncertain. 266,645 participants without prior liver diseases were included from the UK Biobank. During a median follow-up of 11.9 years, 2284(0.9%) participants developed severe NAFLD.

We used the UK Biobank neuroimaging dataset (N = 37,447) to examine associations with six variables related to physical and mental health. Age may require only 300 individuals to provide highly replicable associations but other phenotypes required 1,500 to 3,900 individuals. The required sample size showed a negative power law relation with the estimated effect size.

Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) may lead to life-threatening respiratory symptoms. Understanding the genetic basis of the prognosis of COVID- 19 is important for risk profiling of potentially severe symptoms.
