447 888 dementia-free participants of the UK Biobank cohort at baseline (2006-2010) were followed-up until 31 May 2020. Latent class analysis (LCA) was used to identify multimorbidity patterns at baseline.

Study aimed to examine the theoretical effects of replacing television with different intensities of physical activity on COVID-19 mortality risk. The analytical sample was composed of 359,756 UK Biobank participants. Substituting an hour a day of TV viewing with an hour of walking was associated with a 17% lower risk.

The aim of this study is to estimate the association between anticholinergic burden, general cognitive ability and various measures of brain structural MRI. In the UK Biobank participants with linked health-care records (n = 163,043, aged 40-71 at baseline), about 17 000 had MRI data available.

UK Biobank participants with CMR data and without known cardiovascular disease were included. Long sleep was independently associated with lower left ventricular (LV) mass. Sex interactions exist with cardiac remodeling most evident in males with long sleep duration and evening chronotype.

Genotype imputation approach to whole exome sequencing data from the UK Biobank to increase sample size from 166,891 to 408,511. We detect 158 rare variants and 105 genes significantly associated with one or more of five kidney function traits.

Coffee intake and instant coffee intake were negatively correlated with telomere length. Coffee intake, particularly instant coffee, was found to have an important role in shortening telomeres. No causal relationship was found between filtered coffee intake and telomer length.

Dietary and genetic factors are considered to be associated with UGI cancer risk. We compared adherence to healthy diet and the risk of U GI cancer. Among participants with high genetic risk, the absolute five-year incidence risk was significantly reduced, from 0.16 to 0.10%.

Study used data from the UK Biobank and included 72 683 individuals without diabetes at baseline. During a median follow-up of 12.06 years, 2513 participants developed T2D. Individuals who had PRISm (N = 8394) were 47% (95% CI, 33%-63%) more likely to develop T2d compared with those who had normal spirometry. 121 metabolites showed statistically significant mediation effects.

Dietary magnesium (Mg) intake was measured using an online computerised 24 h recall questionnaire to estimate daily Mg intake. Latent class analysis and hierarchical linear regression models were performed to investigate the association between baseline dietary Mg, Mg trajectories, and brain volumes and WMLs. Associations between Mg and BP measures were mostly non-significant.

The optic radiations carry information from the thalamus to the primary visual cortex (V1) through adjacent but separate pathways in the white matter. We use pyAFQ to characterize white matter tissue properties in parts of the OR that transmit information about the foveal, macular, and peripheral visual fields. Age is associated with increased diffusivity and decreased anisotropy and kurtosis, consistent with decreased density and tissue organization with aging.

Study looked at people with bipolar disorder (BD) or major depression (MDD) 29,966 participants were identified, experiencing 10,279 hospitalization events. Among patients reporting poor SRH, 54.19 % had a hospitalization event within 2 years compared with 22.65 % for those having excellent SRH.

The amygdala is a crucial interconnecting structure in the brain that performs several regulatory functions. Yet its genetic architectures and involvement in brain disorders remain largely unknown. We carried out the first multivariate genome-wide association study (GWAS) of amygdala subfield volumes in 27,866 UK Biobank individuals.

Depression is more common in patients with chronic inflammatory diseases. Whether inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is associated with a higher risk of depression remains uncertain. We studied 497,134 participants in the UK Biobank, including 3561 IBD patients. Over a mean follow-up period of 13.3 years, the cumulative incidence of depression was 8.2%.

Genome-wide association study meta-analysis identified 42 genome-wide significant loci comprising 49 distinct association signals. Effect sizes were largest for stage 3/4 disease, driven by ovarian endometriosis. Identified signals explained up to 5.01% of disease variance.

Polygenic indices (PGIs) are increasingly used to identify individuals at risk of developing disease. They are advocated as screening tools for personalized medicine and education. Here we assess rank concordance between PGIs created with different construction methods and discovery samples, focusing on cardiovascular disease and educational attainment. We conclude that PGI-based ranking is highly dependent on PGI choice, such that current PGIs do not have the desired precision.

Lung-function impairment underlies chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and predicts mortality. In the largest multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of lung function to date, we identified 1,020 independent association signals implicating 559 genes.

Age-related macular degeneration (AMD), cataract, and glaucoma are leading causes of blindness worldwide. Previous genome-wide association studies (GWASs) have revealed a variety of susceptible loci associated with age-related ocular disorders. We found that pleiotropic genes were essential in nerve development and eye pigmentation, and targetable by aflibercept and pilocarpine.

 Consumption of a Mediterranean diet (MedDiet) has been proposed to reduce dementia risk. However, current evidence is inconclusive and is typically derived from small cohorts with limited dementia cases. Few studies have explored the interaction between diet and genetic risk of dementia.

The 3-dimensional spatial and 2-dimensional frontal QRS-T angles are measures derived from the vectorcardiogram. They are independent risk predictors for arrhythmia, but the underlying biology is unknown. Using multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies we identify 61 (58 previously unreported) loci for the spatial Q RS-T angle.

Childhood trauma has been associated with adult psychosocial outcomes linked to social exclusion. The strength of these associations in the general population is unknown. The emergence of the UK Biobank affords the exploration of the childhood determinants of adult psychopathology with greater statistical power.

Cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk amongst those with type 2 diabetes (T2D) is heterogenous. The role of imaging-based cardiometabolic biomarkers in CVD risk stratification in T2D is unclear. We sought to evaluate the individual and joint associations between CAC and hepatic steatosis (HS) with clinical atherosclerotic CVD (ASCVD) in Dallas Heart Study (DHS) participants.

G protein-coupled receptor-10 (GPR10) causes obesity in animals. We identify multiple rare variants in GPR10 in people with severe obesity and in normal weight controls. These variants impair ligand binding and G protein-dependent signalling in cells. Therapeutic targeting of G PR10 may represent an effective weight-loss strategy.

Frailty is an aging-related clinical phenotype defined as a state in which there is an increase in a person's vulnerability for dependency and/or mortality when exposed to a stressor. We identified 37 independent, novel loci associated with the FFS.

Evidence for a role for vitamin D in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) pathogenesis is conflicting. Mendelian randomisation (MR) was used to determine whether genetically predicted 25-hydroxyvitamin D [25(OH)D] levels are a risk factor for NAFLD.

Genome-wide pleiotropic analysis identified three novel SNPs and three mapped genes to be associated with CRC. Significant interactions of PIP4K2A and HLA-DPB1 with environmental factors, including smoking and alcohol drinking, were observed. All mapped genes were significantly enriched in pathways involved in carcinogenesis.

A total of 234,363 women from the UK Biobank prospective cohort were included in this study. No associations of self-reported painful/bleeding gums, loose teeth, mouth ulcers, toothache, and use of dentures with breast cancer risk were found.

Study aimed to evaluate the risk for long-term atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease according to polygenic risk scores for hypertensive disorders during pregnancy. Women with high genetic risk had a higher prevalence of hypertension at enrollment. After enrollment, women with high risk had an increased risk for incident atherosclerosis.

Biological heart age estimation can provide insights into cardiac aging. However, existing studies do not consider differential aging across cardiac regions. To estimate biological age of the left ventricle (LV), right ventricularle (RV), myocardium, left atrium, and right atrium using magnetic resonance imaging radiomics phenotypes.

Mendelian randomization was applied to data of 51,664 couples in the UK Biobank. We found evidence of partner choice for 64 traits, 40 of which had larger phenotypic correlation than causal effect. This suggests that confounders contribute to trait similarity.

High red blood distribution width (RDW) is associated with decreased red blood cell deformability. High neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio (NLR) is a biomarker of systemic inflammation and innate-adaptive immune system imbalance. Both RDW and NLR are predictors of chronic disease risk and mortality. Omega-3 index (O3I) values have previously been shown to be inversely associated with RDW.

Polycythemia vera (PV) is a myeloproliferative neoplasm driven by activating mutations in JAK2 that result in unrestrained erythrocyte production. HFE influences the expression of hepcidin, the master regulator of systemic iron homeostasis.

Gut-produced hydrogen sulfide (H 2 S) has been associated with increased gut permeability and inflammation, which may be related to higher obesity risk. We investigated the association of sulfur microbial diet, a dietary index associated with 43 sulfur-metabolizing bacteria, with the incident obesity.

 Sequence variants at ten loci have been associated with hand OA but none with EHOA. ALDH1A2 , MGP and BMP6 were identified as causal genes for hand osteoarthritis. We found shared genetic components between EhOA and other OA measures, grip strength, urate levels and gout.

We develop a model-based boosting approach for multivariate distributional regression. Our approach enables the simultaneous modeling of all distribution parameters of a multivariate response conditional on explanatory variables.

Current methods for GA inference do not scale to biobank-size genomic datasets. Rye infers GA based on principal component analysis of genomic variant samples. The algorithm's accuracy is powered by Metropolis-Hastings optimization and its speed is provided by non-negative least squares regression.

A total of 302,839 participants without prior IBS in the UK Biobank were enrolled. Psychological distress and neuroticism were ascertained using the Patient Health Questionnaire and the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire-Revised Short Form. During a median follow-up of 12.0 years, 5574 participants developed IBS.

Shorter leukocyte telomere length (LTL) is observed in multiple age-related diseases, which are also associated with vitamin D deficiency. In this study, we examined the relationship between vitamin D levels and LTL in older participants of the UK Biobank.

UK Biobank included 147,296 adult participants with complete data on body composition and the speech-reception-threshold (SRT) test. We further conducted a prospective study with 129,905 participants without SNHL at baseline and followed up to 15 years. Fat percentage, especially in the leg and arm, was a significant risk factor for SNHL.

Interoception is the sensation, perception, and integration of signals from within the body. Interoceptive variables are related to specific regions and networks in the human brain. It is not clear whether or how these networks relate empirically to different domains of physiological and psychological health at the population level.

The abnormal timing of pubertal development is a risk factor for addictive disorders among adolescents. Whether the precocious or late puberty has influence on addiction in adults remains unclear. Based on the data of 336,398 European participants in the UK Biobank, we explored the associations between secondary sexual characteristics and addiction.

PM 2.5 , NO 2 , NO x , and APS significantly associated with an increased risk of OP/fracture. OP and fracture risk raised with increasing concentrations of air pollutants. Participants with higher APS and lower GRS had a higher risk of developing OP.

 Epidemiological studies demonstrated that adverse in utero environment was associated with increased risk of offspring high blood pressure. We found fetal-specific birthweight had a negative genetic correlation with DBP, SBP and PP. These genes often exhibited opposite genetic effects, and were more likely to be differentially expressed in pancreas, liver and heart.

Study looked at interaction between genetic predisposition and adherence to a healthy dietary pattern. In the NHS and replication cohorts, association between diet and gout risk was larger and stronger among women with higher genetic risk.

Study included 309,789 participants enroled in the UK Biobank. Life's Essential 8 composite measure consists of four health behaviours and four health factors. CVH was categorised into low, moderate, and high groups.

A recent subanalysis of the EAST-AFNET 4 (Early Treatment of Atrial Fibrillation for Stroke Prevention Trial) suggests a stronger benefit of early rhythm control. ERC was defined as atrial fibrillation ablation or antiarrhythmic drug therapy within the first year after diagnosis. Patients without an elevated comorbidity burden were excluded.

Cardiac magnetic resonance is the gold-standard for left ventricular mass estimation, but is challenging to obtain at scale. We identify 12 genome-wide associations (1 known at TTN and 11 novel) implicating genes previously associated with cardiac contractility and cardiomyopathy. Left ventricularMass polygenic risk score &#8805;90th percentile is also associated with incident implantable cardioverter-defibrillator implant.

After a first episode of major depressive disorder (MDD), there is substantial risk for a long-term remitting-relapsing course. Prevention and early interventions are critically important. Various studies have examined the feasibility of detecting at-risk individuals based on out-of-sample predictions about the future occurrence of depression.

We leveraged the data of 372,056 participants from the UK Biobank between 2006 and 2010. The assessed circulating liver function markers included alanine aminotransferase (ALT) Lower levels of ALT, TBIL, ALB, and TP and higher levels of GGT and ALP were nonlinearly associated with elevated COPD risk.

There is evidence that child maltreatment is associated with shorter telomere length in early life. This study aims to examine if this is the case in middle- and older-age adults.

 adjusting for common variant polygenic scores improves yield in gene-based rare variant association tests across 65 quantitative traits in the UK Biobank. Benefits were seen for various models, with the largest improvements seen for efficient sparse mixed-effects models.

There have been reports linking branched-chain amino acids (BCAAs) to the hazard of various cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) The causal role of this relationship is still unclear. The study analyzed data of the largest genome-wide association studies.

Evidence suggests a correlation of blood pressure (BP) level with presence of diabetic microvascular complications (DMCs) This study included 23 030 participants, free of any DMCs at baseline, from the UK Biobank. Differences in incidences of D MCs were also compared between the 2017 ACC/AHA and JNC 7 guidelines.

Low grip strength and slow walking pace were associated with a higher risk of stroke and all-cause mortality in stroke survivors. If these associations are causal, improving physical capability among stroke survivors might potentially prolong survival.

Schizophrenia is a heritable psychiatric disorder with a polygenic architecture. Genome-wide association studies have reported that an increasing number of risk-associated variants and polygenic risk scores (PRSs) explain 17% of the variance in the disorder. We associated PRSs based on 5 gene sets previously found to contribute to schizophrenia pathophysiology.

Gene-environment (GÃ—E) interaction could partially explain missing heritability in traits. The magnitudes of GÃ—E interaction effects remain unclear. MET score, pack years of smoking, and alcohol intake frequency significantly interact with genetic factors in both analyses, accounting for the partial variance of BMI.

New evidence supports a bidirectional phenotypic association between stress-related disorders and autoimmune disease. However, the biological underpinnings remain unclear. This study demonstrated familial coaggregation, genetic correlation, and common biological pathways between the two phenotypes.

Few previous studies have investigated the impact of multiple types of electronic devices on health status, and the moderating effects of gender, age, and BMI. We used data from 376,806 participants aged 40-69 years in the UK Biobank. Electronics use was categorized as TV watching, computer use, computer gaming, and mobile phone use.

Infections severe enough to require hospital treatment were associated with increased risks for major cardiovascular disease events immediately after hospitalization. After controlling for traditional cardiovascular risk factors, the population-attributable fraction for severe infections and major cardiovascular events was 4.4% in the UK Biobank.

Around 20% of patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) are lean. Increasing evidence suggests that lean NAFLD is a unique subtype of the disease. We aimed to explore the metabolic profile, genetic basis, causal risk factors, and clinical sequelae.

We included 72,160 participants who were free of cataract at baseline from the UK Biobank. Frequency and type of F&V intake were assessed using a web-based 24 h dietary questionnaire.

Insomnia and short/long sleep duration increase the risk of AMI. But their interaction with each other or with chronotype is not well known. We investigated the prospective joint associations of any two of these sleep traits on risk ofAMI.

Study looked at 176,428 CHD-free adults followed up for 15 years. Depression and premature CHD (mean age: 54.53; male, 48.13) were ascertained from self-report data. Metabolic factors included central obesity, hypertension, dyslipidemia, hypertriglyceridemia and hyperglycemia.

Several breast cancer susceptibility genes have been discovered, but more are likely to exist. We used the founder population of Poland and performed whole-exome sequencing on 510 women with familial breast cancer and 308 control subjects. We identified a rare mutation in ATRIP (GenBank: NM_130384.3: c.1152_1155del [p.Gly385Ter] in two women with breast cancer.

Cancer survivors are at an increased risk of cardiovascular disease compared with the general population. We sought to evaluate the impact of mosaic chromosomal alterations (mCA) on death of CVD causes, coronary artery disease (CAD) causes, and of any cause in patients with a cancer diagnosis.

Several studies have reported associations between low-cost blood-based measurements and lung cancer but their role in risk prediction is unclear. We examined the value of expanding lung cancer risk models for targeting low-dose computed tomography (LDCT) We analysed a cohort of 388,199 UK Biobank participants with 1873 events.

Evidence is equivocal on the association between meat consumption and ischemic heart disease (IHD) risk. To what extent variation of individuals' metabolic responses to the same diet may account for this association is not fully understood. We aim to identify metabolomic signatures characterizing consumption of unprocessed red meat and processed meat and whether such signatures are associated with IHD risk.

Long-term exposure to NO2, NO, or PM2.5, individually or jointly, was associated with a risk of incident laryngeal cancer. The observed association was more pronounced among the participants who were female, were smokers, had a systolic blood pressure equal to or greater than 120 mmHg.

Study included 231,650 participants aged 38 to 72 years from the UK Biobank cohort, established in 2006-2010 in the United Kingdom. Over a median follow-up of 4.19 (SD: 2.15) years, 6436 participants reported incident HL. Poor sleep quality was associated with an increased risk of HL; but sleep duration was not associated with risk.

A 7-day accelerometer recording was performed on 92 221 participants from the UK Biobank. Over a median follow-up of 7.0 years, 3080 adults died, of which 1074 died from cardiovascular disease (CVD) and 1871 from cancer. The associations of PA and sleep duration with mortality risk were all in a curvilinear dose-response pattern.

Causality between plasma TG levels and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) risk remains controversial. We conducted a phenome-wide, two-sample Mendelian randomization (MR) analysis using inverse-variance weighted (IVW) regression to systematically infer the causal effects. Our results identified seven disease traits reaching Bonferroni-corrected significance in both the discovery (p -5 ) and replication analyses.

The relationships between different reproductive factors and the risk of asthma in females remain uncertain. Early age at first live birth, a greater number of miscarriages or stillbirths, and shorter reproductive years were associated with elevated risk. For exogenous sex hormones, hormone replacement therapy was identified to be associated with an elevated risk of adult-onset asthma.

Genomic Principal Components Analysis (Genomic PCA) is applied to genome-wide association data for 83 brain-wide volumes (36,778 UK Biobank participants) We extract genomic principal components (PCs) to capture global dimensions of genetic covariance across brain regions. We estimate genetic overlap between those general brain dimensions and cognitive ageing.

Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D) has been demonstrated to be associated with risk of colorectal cancer (CRC) It remains unclear whether this association was modified by vitamin D-related polymorphisms. We evaluated association of serum 25( OH)D concentration with CRC risk among 403 170 participants from UK Biobank Project.

Retinal OCT measurements are significantly associated with genetic risk of neurodegenerative disease. Higher Alzheimer's disease PRS was associated with a thicker inner nuclear layer.

We examined the association between regular glucosamine use and risk of incident dementia, including dementia subtypes. During a median follow-up of 8.9 years, there were 2458 cases of all-cause dementia, 924 cases of AD, and 491 cases of vascular dementia. Glucosamine continued to protect against dementia after controlling for vitamin, chondroitin supplement use and osteoarthritis.

Study looked at the left ventricle (LV) sphericity index (short axis length/long axis length) in a UK Biobank cohort of 38,897 subjects. A one standard deviation increase in LV spHericity index is associated with a 47% increased incidence of cardiomyopathy.

The association of serum uric acid (SUA) levels with liver-related morbidity and mortality remains undetermined. The present cohort study included 459 619 adults from the UK Biobank. 14 302 nonfatal and 609 fatal cases of overall liver disease were identified during a median follow-up of 12.6 years.

There is limited evidence about cancer incidence for lesbian, gay and bisexual women and men. This project used UK Biobank participant data. We explored risk factor prevalence (age, deprivation, ethnicity, smoking, alcohol intake, obesity, parity, and sexual history)

In the UK, one in four cases (25%) of kidney cancer cases is expected to occur in those eligible for lung cancer screening. A combined screening programme could detect up to a quarter of kidney cancers. Most kidney cancers would not be picked up by this approach.

Dominance is well documented in plant and animal breeding. Outside of rare monogenic traits, evidence in humans is limited. We systematically examined common genetic variation across 1060 traits in a large population cohort.

Small airways obstruction (SAO) is a key feature of both COPD and asthma. SAO may occur early in the development of obstructive lung disease and without symptoms. Whether SAO also associates with occupational exposures is unknown. Using UK Biobank data, we derived measurements of SAO from the 65 145 participants.

A growing body of evidence shows differences in the prevalence of cardiometabolic syndrome (CMS) and dementia based on gender and ethnicity. We investigated the different effects of CMS on brain age by gender in Korean and British cognitively unimpaired populations.

While chronological age is the single biggest risk factor for cancer, it is less clear whether frailty, an age-related state of physiological decline, may also predict cancer incidence. We assessed the associations of frailty index (FI) and frailty phenotype (FP) scores with the incidence of any cancer and five common cancers in 453,144 UK Biobank participants.

Obesity has been linked to atrial fibrillation (AF) burden and severity. AF is more prevalent in whites than Asian. We aimed to investigate whether obesity mediates associations with AF in Europe and Asia.

An outbreak of acute hepatitis of unknown aetiology in children was reported in Scotland1 in April 2022 and has now been identified in 35 countries2. Several recent studies have suggested an association with human adenovirus with this outbreak. Here we report a detailed case-control investigation and find an association between adeno-associated virus 2 (AAV2) infection and host genetics in disease susceptibility.

A cluster of hepatic steatosis without metabolic abnormalities has been excluded by the MAFLD definition. We included 16,308 individuals from the UK Biobank who had magnetic resonance imaging-derived proton density fat fraction (MRI-PDFF) The mean PDFF (10.65 vs. 9.00) and the proportion of advanced fibrosis (fibrosis-4 index > 2.67, 1.27% vs. 1.40%) were comparable between MA FLD and non-MAFLD steatotic. Non-MA FLD ste atosis has the highest minor allele frequency of PNPLA3, TM6SF2 and GCKR.

Study aims to decipher to which extent excess atherosclerotic cardiovascular diseases (ASCVD) and heart failure (HF) risk due to obesity can be explained by conventional risk factors. Candidate mediators included lipids, blood pressure (BP), glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c), and liver and kidney function markers.

There is evidence for contribution of inherited factors to prostate cancer, but few responsible genes/variants have been identified. We examined genetic sequence data for 51 affected cousin pairs who each died from prostate cancer and who were members of high-risk prostate cancer pedigrees.

Residential greenness has protective effects on glucose metabolism and T2D, and those beneficial effects can be amplified by low genetic risk. Our findings may facilitate the improvement of the living environment and the development of prevention strategies by considering genetic susceptibility to T2d.

Recent studies have suggested an association between children conceived by assisted reproductive technology (ART) and a distinct growth pattern in early life. Telomere shortening, specifically a shorter leukocyte telomere length (LTL), has also been linked to age-related diseases. This study aimed to evaluate the association between ART-related factors and LTL in children.

Air pollution is increasingly recognized as an important environmental risk factor for mental health. However, epidemiologic evidence on long-term exposure to low levels of air pollutants with incident depression and anxiety is still very limited. This prospective, population-based cohort study used data from the UK Biobank. The participants were recruited between March 13, 2006, and October 1, 2010.

 individuals with cardiometabolic multimorbidity (hypertension, diabetes mellitus, coronary heart disease, and stroke) Four low-risk sleep factors, including early chronotype, sleep 7-8 h/d, free of insomnia, and no frequent excessive daytime sleepiness, were used to generate a healthy sleep score ranging from 0 to 4.

There is increasing recognition that socioeconomic inequalities contribute to disparities in brain and cognitive health in older adults. Whether neighborhood socioeconomic status (SES) buffers individuals with low individual SES against neurodegeneration, cerebrovascular disease, and poorer cognitive function is not well understood. Here, we evaluated whether neighborhood deprivation (Townsend deprivation index) interacted withindividual SES on hippocampus volume, regional cortical thickness, white matter hyperintensities, and cognition.

The aorta is responsible for the conversion of phasic systolic inflow from ventricular ejection into more continuous peripheral blood delivery. Systolic distention and diastolic recoil conserve energy and are enabled by the specialized composition of the aortic extracellular matrix. Aortic distensibility decreases with age and vascular disease.

Life expectancy has increased substantially in the past few decades in most industrialized countries. Not all of the increased life expectancy is being spent in optimal health, especially among individuals with low socioeconomic status. This cohort study included 135 199 adults in the UK Biobank study.

The long-term effects of sleep health and shift work on cognitive performance are unclear. We conducted one of the largest examinations of the longitudinal influence of sleepHealth dimensions and shiftWork on Cognitive Performance in people of middle and old age.

MendelIHT enables geneticists to fit a single regression model that simultaneously considers the effect of all SNPs and dozens of traits. In simulation studies with up to 100 quantitative traits, iterative hard thresholding exhibits similar true positive rates, smaller false positive rates and faster execution times.

Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) is linked to inflammation. Whether an inflammatory diet increases the risk of NAFLD is unclear. This study aimed to examine the association between the Energy-adjusted Diet Inflammatory Index (E-DII) score and severe NAFLd using UK Biobank.

Insomnia symptoms are widespread in the population and might have effects on many chronic conditions and their risk factors. Previous research has focused on select associations/effects rather than taking a systematic hypothesis-free approach. We performed a Mendelian randomisation (MR) phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) in 336,975 unrelated white-British UK Biobank participants.

Study looked at 194 304 White-European participants. Participants' walking pace was self-reported as brisk, average or slow. Compared to brisk-walking participants with normal BMI, those with obesity who walked briskly were at an approximately 10- to 12-fold higher risk.

Gout disparities among Black individuals in the US have recently been explained by socioclinical factors. No information is available among Asian individuals living in Western countries, despite their disproportionately worsening metabolic health. In 2017 to 2018, gout affected 12.1 million US individuals, with its crude prevalence increasing from 3.6% to 5.1%.

Calcific aortic valve disease (CAVD) is characterized by a phenotypic switch of valvular interstitial cells to bone-forming cells. Two large-scale cohorts examined for genetic variation at genes implicated in BGN-TLR3-IFN signaling associating with CAVD in humans.

 Observational studies and randomized controlled trials presented inconsistent findings on the effects of cholesterol-lowering statins on depression. Here, we aimed to use genomic approaches to investigate this further. Compounds inducing highly similar gene expression responses to statins in HA1E cells were found to be enriched for antidepressants. Genes perturbed in the same direction by both statins and antidepressants were significantly enriched for diverse cellular and metabolic pathways.

A large proportion of genetic risk remains unexplained for structural heart disease involving the interventricular septum. We estimated the cross-sectional area of the IVS from the 4-chamber view of cardiac magnetic resonance imaging in 32 219 individuals from the UK Biobank. Seven loci with clear genomic consequence and relevance to cardiovascular biology were uncovered.

Cumulative burden from vascular risk factors (VRFs) has been associated with an increased risk of depressive symptoms in mid- and later life. It has been hypothesised that this association arises because VRFs disconnect fronto-subcortical white matter tracts involved in mood regulation.

PM2.5, known to be associated with lung cancer risk, promotes lung cancer by acting on cells that harbour pre-existing oncogenic mutations in healthy lung tissue. Focusing on EGFR-driven lung cancer, which is more common in never-smokers or light smokers, we found a significant association.

A unique approach with rare resources was used to identify candidate variants predisposing to familial nonsquamous nonsmall-cell lung cancers. We sequenced NSNSCLC-affected cousin pairs from eight high-risk lung cancer pedigrees and identified 66 rare candidate variants shared in the cousin pairs. One variant in the FGF5 gene also showed significant association with lung cancer in UKBiobank.

Study included 358,805 participants initially free of CVD from the UK Biobank. There was a significant interaction between sleep score and glucose tolerance status on CVD (P for interaction = 0.002)

Always night shift work had a higher risk of developing all-cause dementia and AD. Irregular shift workers had a lower risk than no shift workers. Always night shift workers were associated with a higher rate of AD in low, intermediate and high AD-GRS groups.

The lifetime risk of kidney disease in people with diabetes is 10-30%. Here we identify an expression quantitative trait loci (QTLs) in the cis-acting regulatory region of the xanthine dehydrogenase. We also uncover promoter XOR orthologue variants in humans associated with high risk of DKD.

The association between nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and incident dementia remains unclear. This study aimed to explore whether NAFLD was associated with the risk of incident dementia. We conducted a prospective analysis of 179,222 UK Biobank participants.

Iron accumulation is a cardinal feature of degenerating regions in the brain. It seems to be a key player in mechanisms that precipitate cell death. The aim of this study was to explore the genetic and genomic connection between NBIA and PD.

Previous hypothesis-driven research has identified many risk factors linked to dementia. Here we analysed data of 344,324 participants from the UK Biobank with 15 yr of follow-up data for 210 modifiable risk factors. The associations varied by domain, with lifestyle (16.6%), medical history (14.0%) and socioeconomic status (13.5%) contributing to majority of dementia cases.

Polygenic risk score (PRS) methods use a multiple linear regression framework to infer joint effect sizes of all genetic variants on the trait. Among the subset of PRS methods that operate on GWAS summary statistics, sparse Bayesian methods have shown competitive predictive ability. Most existing Bayesian approaches employ Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithms.

High systolic blood pressure is associated with fewer depressive symptoms, greater well-being, and lower emotion-related brain activity. Interestingly, impending hypertension is associated. with poorer mental health years before HTN is diagnosed.

To detect novel endometrial cancer risk variants, we leveraged information from endometrian cancer risk factors in a multi-trait GWAS analysis. We identified three potentially novel loci that associate with endometria cancer risk, one of which (7q22.1) was genome-wide significant in a meta-analysis. This locus may affect endometrium cancer risk through altered testosterone levels.

Using UK Biobank cohort, the logistic regression model was first applied to evaluate the associations of adult anxiety and self-harm with birth by CS. genome-wide by environment interaction study (GWEIS) was then applied by PLINK2.0 to identify associated genes. GWEIS revealed multiple suggestive genes interacted with birth. by CS for anxiety, such as DKK2 (rs13137764, P = 1.24 Ã— 10- 9) and ATXN1 (rs62389045) For self- Harm, significant gene-environment interactions of birth byCS on self- harm were detected such as ALDH1A2.

There may be a bidirectional relationship between cognition and adiposity. Poor cognition leads to increased adiposity and vice versa. We aimed to determine whether these findings are causal. A total of 378 877 UK Biobank participants were studied.

Previous studies have reported cross-sectional associations between measures of epigenetic age acceleration (EAA) and kidney function phenotypes. We conducted a bidirectional two-sample Mendelian randomization study of EAA and kidneyfunction. We found that each 5 year increase in intrinsic EAA (IEAA) was associated with - 0.01 unit decreases in log-eGFR.

The heritability of alpha angle (AA) was 10%. AA had a moderate genetic correlation with hip OA. Eight independent genetic signals were associated with AA. Expected observational associations between AA and related clinical outcomes provided face validity.

Inverse-variance weighted two-sample Mendelian randomization (IVW-MR) is the most widely used approach that utilizes genome-wide association studies. Estimates from this approach can be subject to different biases due to the use of weak instruments and winner's curse. We developed a method (MRlap) that simultaneously considers weak instrument bias andWinner's curse while accounting for potential sample overlap.

Current guidelines raised the necessity of CVD risk scoring for prediabetes without clear recommendations. Study aimed to systematically assess the performance of 11 models. Neither risk stratification schemes for the general population nor those specific for Type 2 diabetes performed well.

The World Health Organization (WHO) introduced a framework for healthy aging in 2015 that emphasizes functional ability instead of absence of disease. Healthy ageing is defined as "the process of building and maintaining the functional ability that enables well-being"

Schizophrenia is a chronic debilitating psychiatric disorder with significant morbidity and mortality. We used information from 337,484 UK Biobank participants and performed PheWAS using schizophrenia genetic risk score on 1135 disease outcomes. Schizophrenia GRS was associated with 54 (39 distinct) disease outcomes including schizophrenia. Lower odds were found for several diseases including type 1 diabetes and coronary atherosclerosis.

The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has led to a fundamental number of morbidity and mortality worldwide. Glucosamine was indicated to help prevent and control RNA virus infection preclinically, while its potential therapeutic effects are largely unknown. We assessed the association of habitual glucosamine use with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronav virus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection, hospital admission, and mortality with COVID- 19 in a large population based cohort.

 genome-wide meta-analysis of 11.6 million variants in 10 cohorts involving 653 867 European ancestry participants (13 765 cases) Seventeen loci were associated with AS at P &#8804; 5 Ã— 10-8, of which 15 replicated in an independent cohort of 90 828 participants (7111 cases) Dyslipidemia, inflammation, calcification, and adiposity play important roles in the etiology of AS.

Growing evidence supports an association between fatty liver disease (FLD) and cardiac dysfunction and remodelling. Herein, we investigated the independent contribution of FLD to cardiac dysfunction in participants from the UK Biobank with cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) data available. FLD was independently associated with higher average heart rate, higher cardiac remodelling (higher eccentricity ratio and lower remodelling index) and lower left and right ventricular volumes.

High myopia (HM) is a leading cause of sight impairment, through myopic macular degeneration (MMD) We aimed to derive an improved polygenic score (PGS) for predicting children at risk of HM. We also wanted to test if a PGS is predictive of MMD after accounting for SER.

Study included 162,334 participants from the UK Biobank. 18,496 participants experienced at least one of hypertension, diabetes, and CKD, 2216 experienced multimorbidity, and 302 died afterwards. We observed differential associations of four air pollutants on different transitions from healthy status to incident disease. Air pollution exposure might be one important determinant for the incidence and dynamic progression.

Gallstones (cholelithiasis) constitute a major health burden with high costs related to surgical removal of the gallbladder. The association between gallstones and cholecystectomy and kidney cancer is controversial. We comprehensively investigated this association.

Since the outbreak of COVID-19, data on its psychosocial predictors are limited. We aimed to explore psychossocial predictors of the infection at the UK Biobank. Among females, absence of college/university degree and socioeconomic deprivation were associated with higher odds of infection.

Study included 407,615 participants from the UK Biobank study. Participants were classified into three lifestyle categories and three genetic risk categories. Cox models were fitted to assess the association of lifestyle and genetic risk.

Ischemic heart disease (IHD) has been linked with poor brain outcomes. Brain age was estimated in subjects with prevalent IHD (n = 1,341) using a Bayesian ridge regression model. Prevalent IHD was linked to significantly accelerated brain aging.

LDL cholesterol (LDL-C) is a well-established risk factor for coronary artery disease (CAD) However, the optimal LDL-C level with regard to efficacy and safety remains unclear. We analyzed 353 232 British from the UK Biobank and 41 271 Chinese from the China-PAR project. No significant non-linear associations were observed for CAD, all-cause mortality, and safety outcomes (Cochran Q P > 0.25 in British and Chinese)

Chronic liver disease is a major public health burden worldwide. We examined the association between clonal haematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) and chronic liver disease in 214,563 individuals. CHIP was associated with an increased risk of prevalent and incident liver disease.

Evidence relating omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids (n-6 PUFA) with dementia is scarce. Here, we included 440,750 dementia-free participants from UK Biobank. During a median follow-up of 9.25 years, 7768 incident dementia events occurred. Higher plasma levels of five PUFA measures showed consistent associations with lower dementia risk.

The immune response to infections could be largely driven by the individual's genes, especially in the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region. In addition to infection, the reactivations of VZV can be a potential causal factor for multiple traits. Identification of immune response-related health conditions can help elucidate the aetiology of certain diseases.

Existing evidence concerning the relationship between daytime napping and type 2 diabetes (T2D) is inconsistent, and whether the effects of napping differ by body fat percentage (BFP) and C-reactive protein (CRP) is unclear. We aimed to investigate the association between napping frequency and T2D risk and whether such an association was modified by BFP and CRP.

Study aimed to investigate the association of infertility, miscarriage, and stillbirth with age at natural menopause, and whether the association differed by race (Asian and non-Asian) A total of 303,594 postmenopausal women were included. Their median age atnaturalMenopause was 50.0 years (interquartile range, 47.0-52.0).

Study explored potential interaction effects of inflammation and coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) on the risks of anxiety and depression. Infection-induced perturbation of immune homeostasis could promote psychopathology.

Breast cancer (BC) is the most common cancer and the second leading cause of cancer death in women. One in eight women in the USA will develop BC during her lifetime. Current methods of BC screening are often underused due to limited access, expense and a lack of risk awareness.

Number of children, age of births, and span of births were all related to risk of dementia. Women who had three or more children and first birth at age before 25 years had elevated risk of all-cause dementia. These findings may help developing fertility policies or dementia prevention programs.

Despite increasing therapeutic options to treat rheumatoid arthritis (RA), many patients fail to reach treatment targets. The use of antidiabetic drugs like thiazolidinediones has been associated with lower RA risk. We aimed to explore the repurposing potential of these drugs in RA prevention.

Study aims to quantify risk factors of dementia, stroke, and mortality in Asian and black participants compared to whites. After adjusting for risk factors, black participants have an increased risk of dementia and stroke compared to white participants, while Asians has similar odds to the white.

Physical frailty is a state of increased vulnerability to stressors and is associated with serious health issues. How frailty affects mental health and brain structure remains underexplored. We aimed to investigate the mutual effects of frailty and health using large, multidimensional data.

Dementia and hearing loss are both highly prevalent conditions among older adults. We aimed to examine the association between hearing aid use and risk of all-cause and cause-specific dementia. We used data from the UK Biobank, a population-based cohort study.

Coronary artery disease (CAD) is a pandemic disease where up to half of the risk is explained by genetic factors. Vcam1+ smooth muscle cell state genes contributed most to SNP-based heritability of CAD. The results provide insights into the biological mechanisms associated with CAD risk.

Socio-economic status (SES) and biological aging are risk factors for dementia, including Alzheimer's disease. It is less clear if the associations with SES vary sufficiently across different biological age strata. We used data from 331,066 UK Biobank participants aged 38-73 with mean follow-up of 12 years.

Sleep disturbance is common following hospital admission both for COVID-19 and other causes. The clinical associations of this for recovery after hospital admission are poorly understood despite sleep disturbance contributing to morbidity in other scenarios. We aimed to investigate the prevalence and nature of sleep disturbance after discharge following hospital Admission for CO VID-19. And to assess whether this was associated with dyspnoea.

Previous research has linked specific modifiable lifestyle factors to age-related cognitive decline in adults. Little is known about the potential role of an overall healthy lifestyle in brain structure. We examined the association of adherence to a healthy lifestyle with a panel of brain structural markers among 2,413 participants in PolyvasculaR.

Using the UK Biobank population-based cohort, we developed and validated a simple model comprising age, family history, and a polygenic risk score to predict 5-year risk of prostate cancer. Of the 198 334 eligible participants, 8996 (4.5%) were diagnosed with incident prostate cancer during follow-up and had a mean age of 67.9 (SD = 5.8) years at diagnosis.

Retinal aging clocking, 'eyeAge', predicted chronological age more accurately than other aging clocks. It was independent of blood marker-based measures of biological age.

Causal mechanisms underlying systemic inflammation in spinal & widespread pain remain an intractable experimental challenge. Here we examined whether associations between blood C-reactive protein (CRP) and chronic back, neck/shoulder and widespread pain can be explained by shared underlying genetic variants. We also examined whether higher CRP levels causally contribute to these conditions.

Perivascular space (PVS) burden is an emerging, poorly understood, magnetic resonance imaging marker of cerebral small vessel disease. Genome-wide association studies in up to 40,095 participants revealed 24 genome-wide significant PVS risk loci. These were associated with white matter PVS already in young adults.

Brain-age can be inferred from structural neuroimaging and compared to chronological age. Brain-age delta was associated with abnormal amyloid-&#946;, more advanced stages (AT) of AD pathology and APOE -&#949;4 status.

Air pollution increases the risk of adult-onset asthma, but that the size of the effect is modified by lifestyle and genetic risk. Findings emphasize the need for integrated interventions for environmental pollution by the government.

Cancer and cardiovascular disease (CVD) diagnoses were ascertained using health record linkage. Participants with cancer history (breast, lung, prostate, colorectal, uterus, haematological) were propensity matched.

 Associations of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) of the MLXIPL  lipid gene with Alzheimer's (AD) and coronary heart disease (CHD) were examined in two samples of European ancestry from the US and UK. Two patterns of associations (represented by rs17145750 and rs6967028) were identified. The results suggest that these associations can be regulated by several biological mechanisms.

The study involved a total of 500,000 patients of European ancestry. The GSTM1 gene variant was found to be critical in the development of lung carcinogenesis. Oxidative stress caused by smoking is also a key mechanism in lung carcinogenic.

Early morning is characterized by an increased risk of cardiovascular events, a sudden rise in blood pressure, impaired endothelial function, and exacerbated hemodynamic changes. Study aims to examine whether the time of day of physical activity is associated with incident cardiovascular disease (CVD)

Opioid-related adverse events (OAEs) are serious public health concerns. OAEs are often associated with disrupted sleep, but the long-term relationship between poor sleep and subsequent OAE risk remains unknown. This study investigates whether sleep behavior traits are associated with incident O AEs in a large population cohort.

Evidence suggests a positive association between ultra-processed food (UPF) consumption and the incidence of cardiovascular disease (CVD) The study aims to investigate associations between UPF intake and respiratory disease, CVD, and their multimorbidity in a large prospective cohort.

Between 2007 and 2010, 229,026 women (mean age: 56.5 years) without prevalent HF from the UK Biobank cohort were included. Younger maternal age at first live birth and at last live birth were associated with higher risk of HF. Experiencing miscarriages or abortions was not significantly associated with incident HF.

Non-suicidal self-injury and suicide attempt represent significant public health concerns. Efforts to directly differentiate risk across outcomes are uncommon, particularly among older, population-based cohorts. Black individuals were more likely to report a suicide attempt.

Myocardial interstitial fibrosis is associated with cardiovascular disease and adverse prognosis. We developed a machine learning model to measure native myocardial T1 time, a marker of fibrosis. Genome-wide association analysis identified 11 independent loci associated with T1.

The causal relevance of polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) for risk of site-specific cancers remains uncertain. Study used summary genetic data on 10 PUFAs and 67 cancers. Genetically elevated PUFA desaturase activity was associated with urinary system cancers.

A healthy sleep pattern has been related to a lower risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) We aimed to identify the metabolomic signature for the healthy sleep patterns and assess its potential causality with T2DM. The study included 78 659 participants with complete phenotypic data from the UK Biobank study.

Mosaic loss of the Y-chromosome (LOY) is the most common somatic alteration in men. LOY is associated with age, smoking, and constitutional genetics. We aimed to assess the relationships between LOY, serum biomarkers, and clonal hematopoiesis (CH)

Genetic variation contributes greatly to LDL cholesterol (LDL-C) levels and coronary artery disease risk. By combining analysis of rare coding variants from the UK Biobank and genome-scale CRISPR-Cas9 knockout and activation screening, we substantially improve the identification of genes whose disruption alters serum LDL-C levels.

Recessive deficiency of proopiomelanocortin (POMC) causes childhood-onset severe obesity. We performed a large-scale genetic analysis to assess the effect of heterozygous, pathogenic POMC variants on obesity. In UK Biobank, we identified 60 heterozygotes for pathogenic variants, of whom 14 had obesity. Setmelanotide use in patients with obesity can now be questioned.

50% of children with obesity from consanguineous families from Pakistan carry pathogenic variants in known monogenic obesity genes. Here, we have discovered a novel monogenetic recessive form of severe childhood obesity using an in-house computational staged approach.

UK Biobank cohort study included 369,752 participants and 10,660 deaths. Overweight was not associated with the risk of death regardless of age. Attenuated associations with older age were observed only among the individuals with the highest obesity.

The association between sodium intake and long-term kidney disease endpoints is debated and yet to be proven. We aimed to investigate the associations of estimated 24-h urinary sodium excretion, reflecting daily sodium intake, with the incidence of end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) In this prospective cohort study including 444,375 UK Biobank participant, 865 (0.2%) ESKD events occurred after median follow-up of 12.7 years.

 Epidemiological evidence on the association between specific types of polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) intake and lung cancer risk is limited. We evaluated the associations between air pollutants and incident lung cancer, and whether dietary-specific PUFAs intake would modify the relationship. Higher dietary omega-3 and omega-6 PUFas intake was associated with a decreased risk of lung cancer in the study population.

PDCD1 gene variants have been reported to modulate liver inflammation and progression to hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) We examined whether the PDCD1 variation is associated with NAFLD severity in individuals with liver biopsy. The strongest genetic association with the rs13023138 G>C variation was subsequently tested for association with liver damage.

Physical activity, sedentary behaviour, and genetic variants have been associated with the nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) Whether and how the degree of healthy activity patterns may modify the impact of genetic susceptibility on NAFLD remains unknown.

Biological age is a risk factor for many chronic diseases independent of chronological age. A good lifestyle is known to improve overall health, but its association with biological age is unclear. This study included participants from the UK Biobank who had undergone 12-lead resting electrocardiography (ECG)

Cardio-cerebrovascular events are severe complications of diabetes. We aim to compare the incident risk of these events in maturity onset diabetes of the young, type 1 diabetes, and type 2 diabetes.

Fried food consumption strongly associated with 12% and 7% higher risk of anxiety and depression, respectively. Long-term exposure to acrylamide exacerbates scototaxis and thigmotaxis, and further impairs exploration ability and sociality of adult zebrafish.

Melanoma is one of the most commonly diagnosed cancers in the Western world. Third in Australia, fifth in the USA and sixth in the European Union. Predicting an individual's personal risk of developing melanoma may aid them in undertaking effective risk reduction measures.

Intimate partner violence (IPV) is a public health challenge negatively affecting victims' health. Telomere length (TL), a marker for biological ageing, might be reflective of the mechanisms through which IPV leads to adverse health outcomes.

Clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) and clonal cytopenia of undetermined significance (CCUS) are defined by somatic mutations in genes associated with myeloid neoplasms. CHIP/CCUS is highly prevalent in adults and defining predictors of MN risk would aid clinical management and research.

A total of 431,062 participants from the UK Biobank who were without cancer or cardiovascular disease at baseline between 2006 and 2010 were included in this study. 383,248 (88.9%) and 410,499 (95.2%) consumed oily fish and nonoily fish, respectively. Compared with the participants who did not consume oily fish, the adjusted HRs for the association of oily fish consumption (1 serving/week) with all-cause mortality and CVD mortality were 0.93 (0.87 to 0.98)

The UK Biobank (UKB) is a potentially valuable resource for the study of health disparities. We identified numerous diseases and health conditions with disparate prevalence values across population attributes. We deployed an interactive web browser to visualize the results of our analysis: https://ukbatlas.health-disparities.org/.

This article highlights the potential protective role of the SAMD15 gene against chronic pain following a mild traumatic brain injury. The expression of the gene is associated with a SNP, which is itself associated with neutrophils counts as well as chronic pain in large genetic studies.

Dysfunction of either the right or left ventricle can lead to heart failure (HF) and subsequent morbidity and mortality. We performed a genome-wide association study of 16 cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) imaging measurements of biventricular function and structure. 33 plasma proteins were prioritized, including repurposing candidates for DCM and/or HF.

The American Diabetes Association recommends a glycated haemoglobin target of less than 7% for treating type 2 diabetes mellitus. We used data from 5703 patients on metformin monotherapy participating in the UK Biobank baseline investigation.

Previous prediction algorithms for cardiovascular diseases (CVD) were established using risk factors retrieved largely based on empirical clinical knowledge. This study sought to identify predictors among a comprehensive variable space, and then employ machine learning (ML) algorithms to develop a novel CVD risk prediction model.

Volunteer-based studies such as the UK Biobank have become the cornerstone of genetic epidemiology. We found that increasing representativeness led to changes in SNP effect sizes and identified novel SNP associations for 12 traits. We urge the field to increase represent ativeness in biobank samples, especially when studying genetic correlates of behaviour, lifestyles and social outcomes.

Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) shares genetic variants with other autoimmune conditions. existing studies test the association between RA variants with a pre-defined set of phenotypes. objective of this study was to determine phenotypes that share genetic architecture with RA to inform our understanding of shared pathways.

Thousands of genomic regions have been associated with heritable human diseases. Attempts to elucidate biological mechanisms are impeded by an inability to discern which genomic positions are functionally important. We found 3.3% of the human genome is significantly constrained and likely functional.

There has been inconclusive evidence on how biological age (BA) may be associated with cancer incidence. We studied 308,156 UK Biobank participants with no history of cancer at enrolment. Using 18 age-associated clinical biomarkers, we computed three BA measures (Klemera-Doubal method, PhenoAge, homeostatic dysregulation)

Study included 87,258 UK Biobank participants (557 cases with incident RA) aged 37-73 y with complete lifestyle, genotyping, and nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) metabolomics data. A healthy lifestyle was assessed based on 5 factors: healthy diet, regular exercise, not smoking, moderate alcohol consumption, and normal body mass index.

This was a prospective cohort study of 198,265 UK Biobank participants who completed at least 1 dietary assessment. A web based 24 hours recall questionnaire was used to derive the energy-adjusted dietary inflammatory index (E-DII) All-cause mortality and incident CVD and cancer ascertained from linked records.

Poor sleep quality was associated with a higher risk of all-cause, cardiovascular disease (CVD) and cancer mortality. Lifestyle mediators (smoking, physical activity, sedentary, BMI and diet) could explain between 2.6% and 34.0% of the increased risk. Self-reported health, frailty, depression, and loneliness were significant psychosocial mediators.

Rest-activity rhythm is of major interest to public health, but its associations with health outcomes remain elusive. We examined associations between accelerometer-measured rest-activity. rhythm amplitude and health risks among the general UK population. Decreased rest- activity rhythm amplitude was significantly associated with increased incidence of cardiovascular diseases.

Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is associated with significant clinical, neuroanatomical, and genetic heterogeneity that limits precision diagnostics and treatment. This cross-sectional study discovered 3-dimensional endophenotypic representation that may elucidate the neurobiological underpinnings of ASD.

A healthy lifestyle is associated with a reduced risk of cardiovascular disease in adults with obesity. Little is known about the associations between a healthy lifestyle and the risk of other obesity-attributable diseases in this population. A healthy lifestyle score was constructed using information on not smoking, exercising regularly, no or moderate alcohol consumption, and eating a healthy diet.

The neural retina is considered a unique window to systemic health, but its biological link with systemic health remains unknown. This cohort study evaluated UK Biobank participants enrolled between 2006 and 2010. Of 249 metabolic metrics, 37 were independently associated with GCIPLT, including 8 positive and 29 negative associations. Most were associated with the rates of future mortality and common diseases.

Olfactory receptor 558 (Olfr558) is expressed in the kidney where its functional role is unknown. Using RNAScope, we find that OlfR558 localizes to vascular smooth muscle, including the renal afferent arteriole. We measured blood pressure (BP) in Olfr557 wild-type (WT) and knockout (KO) mice.

Study looked at 281,760 participants in the UK Biobank study. Data on pain in the hip, knee, back and neck/shoulder, or 'all over the body' were collected. MI and stroke events were determined from hospital admission records and death registries.

 Epilepsy has been associated with cognitive impairment and potentially dementia in older individuals. The extent to which epilepsy may increase dementia risk, how this compares with other neurological conditions, and how modifiable cardiovascular risk factors may affect this risk remain unclear.

Genome-wide genealogies compactly represent the evolutionary history of a set of genomes. inferring them from genetic data has the potential to facilitate a wide range of analyses. We introduce a method, ARG-Needle, for accurately inferring biobank-scale genealogie from sequencing or genotyping array data.

Clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) is a novel cardiovascular risk factor. Whether CHIP remains prognostic in individuals with established atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) is less clear.

Cross-sectional evidence implicates high prevalent frailty in patients with Parkinson disease (PD), whereas the longitudinal association remains unknown. The UK Biobank recruited over 500 000 middle-aged and older adults from 22 assessment centers across the United Kingdom. The final analysis included 314 998 participants.

Study examined interactions between ultraprocessed food (UPF) consumption and genetic predisposition with the risk of gout. 181 559 individuals from the UK Biobank study who were free of gouts at baseline were analysed.

Until recently, most genetic studies of headache have been conducted on participants with European ancestry. We conducted a large-scale genome-wide association study of self-reported headache in individuals of East Asian ancestry (specifically those who were identified as Han Chinese) 108 855 participants were enrolled, including 12 026 headache cases from the Taiwan Biobank. We identified a locus on Chromosome 17, with the lead single-nucleotide polymorphism rs8072917.

Higher body mass index in adulthood is widely acknowledged to be protective for most fracture sites. However, sources of bias induced by confounding factors may have distorted previous findings. This investigation aims to explore how prepubertal and adult body size independently influence fracture risk in later life. Using data from a large prospective cohort, univariable and multivariable MR were conducted.

Spinal curvature may impact the organs within the thoracic cage, including the heart. Cardiac abnormalities in patients with idiopathic scoliosis are often studied post-corrective surgery or secondary to diseases.

Chronic musculoskeletal pain has been linked to dementia. This study investigated whether greater number of chronic pain sites is associated with a higher risk of dementia and its subtypes.

The human leukocyte antigen (HLA) is a highly polymorphic region. HLA diversity may play a role in presenting tumour-associated peptides and inducing immune responses. We aimed to explore the role of HLA Diversity on cancer development. A lower risk of lung cancer was associated with HLA class II locus.

Both depression and breast cancer (BC) contribute to a substantial global burden of morbidity and mortality among women. Previous studies have observed a potential depression-BC link. We aimed to comprehensively characterize the phenotypic and genetic relationships between depression and BC.

Mobile phone use for making or receiving calls was significantly associated with a higher risk of new-onset hypertension, especially among high-frequency users. Compared with mobile phone non-users, a significantly higher risk was found in mobile phone users.

We used genetic and phenotypic data from 100,833 White British UK Biobank participants (57% female; mean age = 55.9 years) We regressed nine cardiovascular risk factors/diseases (alcohol consumption, body mass index, low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, lifetime smoking behaviour, systolic blood pressure, coronary heart disease, type 2 diabetes, and stroke) on their respective polygenic scores.

At present, the results on the associations between dietary patterns and risk of dementia are inconsistent. We aimed to investigate the associations of midlife dietary patterns with incident dementia and brain structures.

Using data from the UK Biobank, 498,621 participants who were free of AKI and had information on tea intake were included. After a median follow-up period of 12.0 years, 21,202 participants occurred AKI. There was a reversed J-shaped relation between tea consumption and incident AKI, with an inflection point at 3.5 cup/d. Light to moderate tea consumption, especially adding milk, can be part of a healthy diet.

Sleep and circadian disruption are associated with depression onset and severity. It is unclear which features (e.g., sleep duration, chronotype) are important and whether they can identify individuals showing poorer outcomes. Within a subset of the UK Biobank with actigraphy and mental health data (n = 64,353), penalised regression identified the most useful of 51 sleep/rest-activity predictors of depression-related outcomes. Key predictors across most models included: difficulty getting up, insomnia symptoms, snoring, actigraphY-measured daytime inactivity and lower morning activity (~8 am)

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is one of the most common functional digestive disorders. We analyzed data from the population-based cohort of the UK Biobank with 493,974 participants. 260 PheCodes were significantly overrepresented in self-reported physician-diagnosed IBS patients.

The corpus callosum (CC) is the main structure transferring information between the cerebral hemispheres. Previous large-scale genome-wide association study (GWAS) has illustrated the genetic architecture of white matter integrity of CC. This study found that CC volume is less stressed.

Telomerase reverse transcriptase (TERT) has been consistently associated with prostate cancer (PCa) risk. Few studies have explored the association between TERT variants and PCa aggressiveness.

Diabetes is associated with increased risk of common cancers. Evidence of cancer risk in individuals with different diabetes risk is still scarce. We aimed to evaluate the relationship between the Finnish Diabetes Risk Score (FINDRISC) and risks of cancer incidence and mortality.

Lifecourse Mendelian randomization is a causal inference technique which harnesses genetic variants with time-varying effects to develop insight into the influence of age-dependent lifestyle factors on disease risk. Here, we evaluate whether childhood body size has a direct consequence on 8 major disease endpoints by analysing parental history data from the UK Biobank.

Habitual coffee consumption has been linked to a growing list of health benefits. The mechanisms underlying the protective effects of caffeine remain speculative. Daily coffee intake should not be discouraged by physicians, even in the presence of a newly developed cardiovascular disease.

Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) are chronic multisystem diseases that cause tremendous health burdens worldwide. Previous epidemiological studies have found a bidirectional relationship between these two diseases; however, their causality remains largely unknown. We aim to examine the causal relationship between NAFLD and T2DM.

The association of age at stroke onset with dementia and the role of post-stroke lifestyle on dementia risk remains unclear. We leveraged data of 496,251 dementia-free participants from UK Biobank. Among participants with stroke history, a favorable lifestyle was associated with a lower risk of incident dementia.

A total of 20,320 COVID-19 patients in the UK Biobank cohort were included. Genome-wide association analysis (GWAS) was used to identify host genetic factors. Colocalization analysis found that two genes (SLC6A20 and LZTFL1) may affect the progression of the disease. Predictive model consisting of demographic characteristics, comorbidities and genetic factors could precisely predict the patient's progression.

The link between peripheral inflammation and neuroinflammation in depression is unclear. Here, we estimated associations among depression, C-reactive protein (CRP) as a measure of peripheral inflammation, and neuro inflammation. CRP was associated with higher depression symptoms.

Recent studies have linked exposure to road traffic noise or air pollution with incident type 2 diabetes (T2D) We hypothesized that long-term co-exposure increases the risk of incident T2D via the development of metabolic syndrome (MetS) This prospective study included 390,834 participants in UK Biobank.

Polygenic risk score (PRS) could be used to stratify individuals with high risk of diseases and predict complex trait of individual in a population. Previous studies developed a PRS-based prediction model using linear regression. One of the key assumptions of linear regression is that the variance of the residual should be constant at each level of the predictor variables.

Graph-theoretic metrics derived from neuroimaging data have been heralded as powerful tools for uncovering neural mechanisms of psychological traits, psychiatric disorders, and neurodegenerative diseases. In N = 8,185 human structural connectomes from UK Biobank, we examined the extent to which 11 commonly-used global graph-theory metrics index distinct versus overlapping information with respect to brain organization.

Mortality and incidence of CVDs are significantly higher in people with mood disorders. Study used data from the UK Biobank towards understanding the influence of genetic factors on the comorbidity. Results indicated a significant positive genetic correlation between CVBs and overall mood disorders and MDD specifically, showing substantial genetic overlap.

Study aims to understand the genetic predisposition to STEM occupations and investigate its associations with regional economic performance. We conducted a genome-wide association study on the occupational choice of STEM jobs based on a sample of 178,976 participants from the UK Biobank.

Obesity and type 2 diabetes (T2D) are associated with increased risk of pancreatic cancer. We assessed the relationship between pancreatic. cancer and two distinct measures of obesity, namely total. adiposity, using BMI, versus abdominal adiposity. using BMI adjusted waist-to-hip ratio (WHRadjBMI) using polygenic scores (PGS) and Mendelian randomisation (MR) analyses. PGSBMI was significantly (multiple testing-corrected) associated with pancreatic Cancer (OR[95%CI] = 1.0804[1.025-1.14], P = 0.0037)

Puritus is identified as an adverse drug reaction to arsenic trioxide. Arsenite-treated mice were used to confirm the biomarker. Naloxone relieves pruritus in patients with arseniasis.

The brain age gap (BAG) is widely considered a general indicator of brain health. BAG is sensitive to an array of genetic and nongenetic traits and diseases. Few studies have examined the genetic architecture and its corresponding causal relationships with common brain disorders.

Hearing problems (HP) in adults are common and are associated with several comorbid conditions. We conducted a comprehensive genome-wide investigation of HP in 748,668 adult participants. We identified 54 risk loci and demonstrated that HP polygenic risk is shared across ancestry groups.

Prediagnostic clinical characteristics of individuals with a final diagnosis of dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB), Parkinson's disease (PD) compared with controls without neurodegenerative disorders. The use of statins was lower in patients who developed PD and higher in patients with DLB compared to patients with AD.

Study aimed to generate coherent evidence on the post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 infection using electronic healthcare records across two regions. A total of 535,186 and 16,400 patients were diagnosed with CO VID-19 from HKHA and UKB, of whom 253,872 and 7613 (46.4%) were male.

The discovery in 2005 of the JAK2 V617F gain-of-function mutation in myeloproliferative neoplasms has deeply changed the diagnostic and therapeutic approaches to polycythemia. More recently, the use of NGS in routine practice has revealed a large number of variants, although it is not always possible to classify them as pathogenic. This is notably the case for the J AK2 E846D variant for which for which questions remain unanswered.

New method, random projection-based identity-by-descent (IBD) detection (RaPID) query. RaPID-Query identifies IBD segments between a query haplotype and a panel of haplotypes. A single query against all UK biobank autosomal chromosomes was completed within 2.76 seconds on average.

Patients suffering from mental disorders are at high risk of developing cardiovascular diseases, leading to a reduction in life expectancy. Genetic variants can display greater influence on cardiometabolic features in psychiatric cohorts compared to the general population.

 understanding how host genetics contributes to the tumor immune microenvironment (TIME) is essential to tailoring cancer screening and treatment strategies. We study 1084 eQTLs affecting the TIME found through analysis of The Cancer Genome Atlas and literature curation.

Genetically predicted Lp(a) was marginally related with higher odds of total stroke, ischemic stroke, and large-artery atherosclerotic stroke. The associations were also remarkable in the primary analysis using the UK Biobank data.

Frailty was associated with cardiometabolic diseases (CMDs, including coronary heart disease, stroke, and diabetes here) There were no systematic analyses estimating its role in incidence, progression, and prognosis of CMM. We included 351 205 participants without CMDs at baseline in UK Biobank.

Previous studies have hypothesized that autozygosity is decreasing over generational time. We determined that a model including an ancestry-by-country interaction term fit the data best. We speculate that this trend can be attributed to increases in urbanization and panmixia.

The burden of chronic conditions associated with sugary beverages is increasing. Little is known about the role of different types of sugary drinks in the co-occurrence of multiple chronic conditions ('multimorbidity') To inform future sugar-reduction guidelines, we aimed to examine the associations of sugar-sweetened beverages (SSB), artificially sweetened drinks (ASB) and natural juices (NJ)

For each 10 mm Hg increase in SBP the estimated effect was OR 0.96 (0.90-1.01) for overall prostate cancer. The MR-estimated effect of a 10mm Hg- SBP lowering through CCB genetic variants was OR 1.22 (1.06- 1.42) for all prostate cancers. We found that blocking calcium channel receptors may increase prostate cancer risk.

Hip fractures constitute a major health concern. Circulating amino acid levels have been proposed as markers of bone mineral density. Data on their ability to predict incident fractures are scarce. We propose that circulating valine may add information for hip fracture prediction.

There is increasing evidence that the complexity of the retinal vasculature measured as fractal dimension, Df, might offer earlier insights into the progression of coronary artery disease. We present a genome-wide association study (GWAS) of 38,000 individuals with white British ancestry from the UK Biobank. We replicated 5 Df loci and found 4 additional loci with suggestive significance.

Evidence on the gender-specific association between body composition and liver cancer incidence is limited. This prospective analysis included 4,75,659 participants free of cancer, based on the UK Biobank. Male patients in the highest body fat percentage group are more likely to develop liver cancer.

Identifying metabolic biomarkers of frailty is important for understanding its metabolic underpinnings and developing preventive strategies.
