Childhood asthma was associated with shorter attained adult height, irrespective of age at asthma diagnosis. The magnitude of height deviation in relation to asthma declined thereafter and became null after age 6.

Machine-learning algorithms can provide accurate predictions of age based on brain characteristics. There is significant variation in model accuracy reported across studies. Across subsets with different age ranges, performance metrics improve with increasing sample size. Age-bias corrected metrics indicate high accuracy, even for poorly performing models.

Alcohol misuse is a major global public health issue. The disorder is characterized by aberrant neural networks interacting with environment and genetics. Dissecting the neural substrates and functional networks that relate to longitudinal changes in alcohol use is important to elucidate therapeutic approaches. This study analyzed range of alcohol misuse in a population-based normative sample of 24,784 participants.

We examined interactions between educational attainment and genetic susceptibility on dementia risk among adults over 60 years old. A total of 174,161 participants were free of dementia at baseline. Low education attainment was significantly associated with higher dementia risk in the APOE &#949;4 carriers.

Wellbeing is an important aspect of mental health that is moderately heritable. Specific wellbeing-related variants have been identified via GWAS meta-analysis of individual questionnaire items. A multi-item within-subject index score has potential to capture greater heritability.

Studies examining cerebral asymmetries typically divide the l-R Measure (e.g., Left-Right Volume) by the L + R Measure to obtain an Asymmetry Index (AI) We used 306 global and regional brain measures provided by the UK Biobank. Removing any of these predictors changed the significance of sex differences in 33% of regions.

Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) is a disease of unknown etiology and pathogenesis. Hereditability is suggested by an increased disease risk in relatives. genome-wide association studies in ME/C FS have been limited by small sample sizes and broad diagnostic criteria.

Despite the widespread use of multivitamin/mineral supplements, the effects on cardiovascular disease (CVD) remain inconclusive. This population-based cohort study included 465,278 men and women who participated in the UK Biobank between 2006 and 2010.

The stock market is a bellwether of socio-economic changes that may directly affect individual well-being. We applied specification curve analysis to rigorously identify significant associations between the local stock market index (FTSE100) and 479,791 UK residents' mood.

Frailty is a multidimensional syndrome of decline that affects multiple systems. Although chronological age is the major risk factor, inter-individual variation in risk is not fully understood. Leucocyte telomere length (LTL), a proposed marker of biological age, has been associated with risk of many diseases. We sought to determine whether LTL is associated withrisk of frailty.

Child maltreatment is associated with asthma in adults. We examined whether lifetime major depressive disorder (MDD) or lifetime generalised anxiety disorder (GAD) mediate an association. 81 105 British adults in the UK Biobank completed a mental health survey.

Mental health research and care have yet to realize similar advances from MRI. A primary challenge has been replicating associations between inter-individual differences in brain structure or function and complex cognitive or mental health phenotypes. Such BWAS have typically relied on sample sizes appropriate for classical brain mapping.

Peripheral artery disease (PAD) is a major cause of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality. Larger genome-wide association studies have now provided the ability to evaluate whether genetic data can help improve our ability to identify patients at high risk of PAD.

To evaluate potential diagnostic and therapeutic biomarkers for age-related macular degeneration (AMD), we identified 8433 UK Biobank participants with rare complement Factor I gene (CFI) variants. We stratified these variants by predicted gene expression and measured their association with retinal pigment epithelium-Bruch's membrane (RPE-BM) complex and retinal thicknesses.

Genome-wide association study links infant mortality rate by place and year in the United Kingdom with common genetic variants among birth cohorts in the UK Biobank. Genetic correlations are found across multiple domains, including fertility, cognition, health behaviors, and health outcomes.

Study included 471,485 individuals of European ancestry from the UK Biobank, aged 38-73 years at baseline (2006-10) Dementia was identified using inpatient records and death registers. 33 out of 63 major diseases were associated with an increased risk of dementia. Individual diseases and multimorbidity are stronger predictors of dementia in non-APOE4 carriers.

 Complex-trait genetics has advanced dramatically through methods to estimate the heritability tagged by SNPs. The models underlying many of these analyses are inadequate, and consequently many SNP-heritability results have been inaccurate.

Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) epitomize this type of setting. Although the GWAS marginal estimator is popular, it has been criticized for ignoring the correlation structure of genetic variants. We show that the performance of GWASmarginal estimator depends on the LD pattern.

Of 470,853 UKB participants, 4.0% had pneumonia and 0.2% had influenza during follow up. Increased consumption of coffee, tea, oily fish, and fruit at baseline were significantly and independently associated with a lower risk of future pneumonia events. After multivariable adjustment, the odds of pneumonia (p &#8804; 0.001 for all) were lower by 6-9% when consuming 1-3 cups of coffee/day.

Study looked at prevalence of phenotypes as a function of the polygenic score (PGS) across environments in the UK Biobank cohort study. Cases where polygenic influences are greater or lesser than expected are seen to be particularly pervasive for educational attainment, obesity, and metabolic condition type-2 diabetes.

DataLad-based, domain-agnostic framework suitable for reproducible data processing in compliance with open science mandates. It affords the capture of machine-actionable computational provenance records that can be used to retrace and verify the origins of research outcomes.

Triglyceride (TG)-lowering LPL variants in combination with genetic LDL-C-lowering variants are associated with reduced risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) Genetic variation in the APOA5 gene encoding apolipoprotein A-V also strongly affects TG levels.

Recent works have shown that SNP heritability-which is dominated by low-effect common variants-may not be the most relevant quantity for localizing high-effect/critical disease genes. We introduce methods to estimate the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by a given assignment of SNPs to a single gene.

ProcR locus associated with lower coronary artery disease (CAD) risk but higher venous thromboembolism (VTE) risk. PROCR-219Gly increases plasma levels of (activated) protein C through endothelial protein C receptor (EPCR) ectodomain shedding in endothelial cells.

Metabolic syndrome is a group of heritable metabolic traits that are highly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2DM) Classical interventions to T2DM include improving diet quality, increasing physical activity, and reducing smoking and alcohol consumption. It is poorly understood how the phenotypes of diabetes-related metabolic traits change with respect to lifestyle modifications at the individual level.

Genetically regulated gene expression (GReX) can be estimated using prediction models derived from large multi-omic datasets. We applied PrediXcan to impute GReX in 51,520 ancestrally diverse Population Architecture. We identified 517 associations across 47 tissues in PAGE but not UKBB 50k. Our findings call for more diversity in reference datasets of tissue-specific gene expression.

Previous studies showed that diet and gut microbiota had a correlation with sleep. We used UK Biobank genotype data to assess the potential effects of diet-gut microbiota interactions on sleep phenotypes. Insomnia and sleep duration were used as dependent variables. Significant genetic correlations were discovered between insomnia/sleep duration and dietary habits.

Study looked at changes in body composition in 3088 free-living participants, part of the UK Biobank in-depth imaging study. All participants underwent neck-to-knee MRI scans at the first imaging visit and after approximately two years. No significant changes were observed in BMI, body weight, or waist circumference over the scanning interval.

Polygenic inheritance plays a pivotal role in driving multiple sclerosis susceptibility. We developed polygenic risk scores (PRS) of multiple sclerosis and assessed associations with both disease status and severity in cohorts of European descent. Individuals within the top 10% of PRS were at higher than 5-fold increased risk in UK Biobank and 15-fold higher risk in KPNC.

Risk scores from routine blood tests can be repurposed to estimate 10-year risk of cirrhosis morbidity in the community. Genetic risk factor information to these scores only modestly improved performance.

There is strong evidence of brain-related abnormalities in COVID-191-13. It remains unknown whether the impact of SARS-CoV-2 infection can be detected in milder cases. Here we investigated brain changes in 785 participants of UK Biobank.

South Asians in general, and Asian Indians in particular, have higher risk of type 2 diabetes compared with white Europeans. The reasons for the younger age of onset in relation to obesity, beta cell function and insulin sensitivity are under-explored.

Study included data from 39 294 participants with hypertension in the UK Biobank study. During a median follow-up of 6.25 years (241 418 person-years), 1518 deaths (549 attributable to CVD) and 4933 CVD (fatal and nonfatal) incident events were registered. Compared with the lowest category of moderate-to-vigorous physical activity, the relative risks (hazard ratios and 95% CIs) of all-cause mortality for increasing categories were 0.53 (0.46-0.61)

Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is the leading cause of mortality in people with Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) Statins reduce low-density lipoproteins and positively affect CVD outcomes. Statin type and dose have differential effects on glycaemia and risk of incident T2DM.

Heavy alcohol consumption has been associated with brain atrophy, neuronal loss, and poorer white matter fiber integrity. There is conflicting evidence on whether light-to-moderate alcohol consumption shows similar negative associations with brain structure. We examine the associations between alcohol intake and brain structure using multimodal imaging data from the UK Biobank.

Half a million adults were recruited into the UK Biobank prospective cohort study between March 2006 and October 2010. The main outcome measure was a composite primary outcome of 30-day major postoperative complications and 90-day all-cause mortality. Elevated pre-operative HbA 1c in people without diabetes may be associated with an increased risk of complications, but the association is likely confounded by end-organ comorbidity.

Genetic predisposition has been shown to contribute substantially to the age at which we die. Little is known about how lifespan is impacted by gene loss of function. Through whole-exome sequencing of 352,338 UK Biobank participants of European ancestry we assessed the relevance of protein-truncating variant (PTV) gene burden.

Seven hours of sleep per day was associated with the highest cognitive performance. Individuals who sleep between six-to-eight hours had significantly greater grey matter volume in 46 of 139 different brain regions.

On 462 063 participants of European ancestry, we characterized the relationship of 38 disease-relevant biomarkers, asthma diagnosis, ambient pollution, traffic factors, and genetic background. 30 biomarkers were in association with at least one environmental factor. Asthma diagnosis was associated with four pollutants (NO, NO 2 , PM 2.5 , and PM 10 ). The largest effect size was observed in PM 2, where a 5 &#956;g/m 3  increment of exposure was linked to a 1.52 increase in asthma diagnosis.

Mendelian randomization (MR) is a common tool for identifying causal risk factors underlying diseases. Here, we present a method, MR with automated instrument determination (MRAID), for effective MR analysis. MRAID borrows ideas from fine-mapping analysis to model an initial set of candidate single-nucleotide polymorphisms.

The impact of copy-number variations (CNVs) on complex human traits remains understudied. We called CNVs in 331,522 UK Biobank participants and performed genome-wide association studies. Total CNV burden negatively impacted 35 traits, leading to increased adiposity, liver/kidney damage.

Genetic variants in the human leukocyte antigen and killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptor regions have been associated with many brain-related diseases. How they shape brain structure and function remains unclear. To identify the genetic variants in HLA  and KIR genes associated with human brain phenotypes, we performed a genetic association study of &#8764;30 000 European unrelated individuals.

Leukocyte telomere length (LTL) serves as a mitotic clock. Reduced LTL has been associated with multiple human disorders. This cohort study found that shorter LTL was associated with a small risk increase of overall mortality.

This is a prospective analysis of 437,191 UK Biobank participants (age 56.3 years, 54% female) The main exposure was self-reported alcohol consumption. Outcomes included COVID-19, infectious diseases, and pneumonia mortality.

Vitamin D levels were significantly and nonlinearly associated with lower risk of cardiovascular outcomes and all-cause mortality. The findings highlight the importance of monitoring and correcting vitamin D deficiency in the prevention of CVD and mortality among adults with prediabetes and diabetes.

The combined health impact of physical activity (PA) and air pollution on chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) remains unclear. We investigated the joint effects of habitual PA and long-term fine particulate matter (PM2.5) exposure on COPD incidence in a prospective population-based cohort.

180,642 individuals free of CVD or cancer were enrolled from 2006 to 2010 and followed up to 2018 in the UK Biobank. Information on demographics, lifestyles, and medical history was collected through a baseline touchscreen questionnaire. A total of ten single-nucleotide polymorphisms were used to calculate the genetic risk score (GRS) of trimethylamine N-oxide (TMAO)

Age-related cognitive decline carries a huge personal, societal, and financial cost. A projected 152 million people worldwide will suffer from dementia by 2050. Early stages of cognitive decline are much more prevalent than dementia.

Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) is associated with increased risk of pregnancy complications and adverse perinatal outcomes. GDM often reoccurs and is linked to an increase in risk of subsequent diagnosis of type 2 diabetes (T2D) To improve our understanding of the aetiological factors and molecular processes driving the occurrence of GDM, the GENetics of Diabetes In Pregnancy Consortium assembled genome-wide association studies of diverse ancestry.

Sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG), testosterone and oestradiol have been associated with many diseases in observational studies. However, the causality of associations remains unestablished. Higher genetically predicted SHBG levels were associated with a reduced risk of hypertension, type 2 diabetes, diabetic complications, coronary atherosclerotic outcomes, gout and benign and malignant neoplasm of uterus.

Genome-wide proportional hazards ratio analyses were conducted in 340 318 European subjects. All-cause AFSW was genetically strongly correlated (rg = -0.68) with spherical equivalent (the measured strength of spectacle lens required to correct the refractive error) Time-to-event analyses found genome-wide significant associations at 44 independent genomic loci.

A total of 409,110 participants from the UK Biobank study, recruited between 2006 and 2010, were included. Compared with meat-eaters, vegetarians and pescatarians had a lower risk of overall, colorectal, and prostate cancer. No associations between the types of diets and prostate, breast, or lung cancers were found.

Some evidence suggests that being vegetarian may be associated with a lower risk of cancer overall. However, for specific cancer sites, the evidence is limited. We assessed associations of vegetarian and non-vegetarian diets with risks of all cancer, colorectal cancer, postmenopausal breast cancer, and prostate cancer.

Brugada syndrome (BrS) is a cardiac arrhythmia disorder associated with sudden death in young adults. With the exception of SCN5A, encoding the cardiac sodium channel NaV1.5, susceptibility genes remain largely unknown. Here we performed a genome-wide association meta-analysis comprising 2,820 unrelated cases with BrS and 10,001 controls, and identified 21 association signals at 12 loci.

Genomics-enhanced risk tools for coronary heart disease and type 2 diabetes. The risk tools integrate contemporary genome-wide polygenic risk scores with simple questionnaire-based risk factors. Without the need for blood tests or evaluation by a health professional, the risk tools provide a powerful yet simple method.

Concentrations of circulating sex hormones have been associated with a variety of diseases in women. We investigated the genetic architectures of circulating concentrations of estradiol, testosterone, and SHBG by menopausal status in women of European and African ancestry. Heterogeneity analysis identified 1 locus for testosterone (7q22.1) in the CYP3A7 gene and 1 loci that was strongly associated with concentrations of SHBG in premenopausal women only.

Polygenic scores (PGS) are important tools for carrying out genetic prediction of common diseases and disease related complex traits. Few comprehensive comparison studies have been performed to evaluate the effectiveness of PGS methods. We evaluate the prediction accuracy, computational scalability, as well as robustness and transferability.

Study included 345,794 European ancestry participants from the UK Biobank. 26.2% of the participants were former smokers, and 9.8% were current smokers. During follow-up, 1687 (0.49%) participants developed lung cancer. High genetic risk and smoking were independently associated with higher lung cancer risk.

Host genetic variants influence the susceptibility and severity of several infectious diseases. Discovery of genetic associations with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) phenotypes could help to develop new therapeutic strategies to decrease its burden. Between May 2020 and June 2021, we performed 65 genome-wide association studies.

We processed 123,662,421 primary care events from 230,096 UK Biobank (UKB) participants. We mapped 92% of Read2 and 91% of CTV3 to 1,449 and 1,490 Phecodes. UKB PheWAS using P hecodes from primary care EHR and hospitalizations replicated all (n=22) previously-reported genotype-phenotype associations.

10,033 participants ranging in age from 45 to 79 years were scanned by MRI in a single location. Photoperiod was positively associated with total amygdala volume (p) Amygdala volume has also been linked to depressed mood.

Low frequency and rare variants in RCN3 contributes blood pressure variation. Study demonstrates that focusing association analyses in linkage regions greatly reduces multiple-testing burden and improves power to identify novel rare variants.

The number of people living with obesity or who are overweight presents a global challenge. Development of effective interventions is hampered by a lack of research. We need to better understand the collective characteristics and behaviours of those who're overweight or have obesity.

A total of 386 937 participants were enrolled from 2006 to 2010 and followed up to 2018 in the UK Biobank study. The annual average air pollutant concentrations of particulate matter (PM) and nitrogen oxides (NO2 and NOx) were calculated. Healthy dietary patterns were evaluated by a healthy diet score (HDS) based on intakes of vegetables, fruit, fish, unprocessed red meat and processed meat.

Lean NAFLD may differ from NAFLd found in overweight or obese patients. We used the UK biobank to conduct a cross-sectional study.

UK Biobank (UKB) is a key contributor in mental health genome-wide association studies (GWAS) Only 31% of participants completed the Mental Health Questionnaire. We predicted generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and major depression symptoms using elastic net regression.

There is limited data on host-specific genetic determinants of susceptibility to bacterial and viral infections. Genome-wide association studies using large population cohorts can be a first step towards identifying patients prone to infectious diseases and targets for new therapies.

Nighttime Light Emission (NLE) is associated with diminished mental and physical health. We found that higher NLE associated with higher air pollution, less green space, higher economic and neighborhood deprivation, higher household poverty and higher depressed mood.

Aging is characterized by body composition alterations. Alcohol consumption may partially drive these alterations, but findings are mixed. Red wine may help protect against adipogenesis due to anti-inflammatory/eulipidemic effects. White wine may benefit bone health in older White adults.

Study included 339,902 adults without cardiovascular disease at baseline. The main exposures were four healthy lifestyle behaviours. Metabolic complications of excess adiposity were hypertension, diabetes and hyperlipidaemia. Risk was lower, but still increased for people with no metabolic complications.

Study comprised 69 185 European-ancestry UK Biobank cohort participants. 48.4% of 591 females homozygous for SLCO1B1*5 decreased function genotype had raised cholesterol. Less males had high cholesterol and the genotype effect was attenuated.

Polygenic risk scores (PRS) are an increasingly available tool to refine risk prediction for cardiometabolic diseases. Favorable lifestyle behaviors might offset increased polygenic risk, but whether frequency of depressed mood stratifies PRS-associated risk is unknown. We calculated individual-level 3-million variant PRS for coronary artery disease (CAD), type 2 diabetes (T2D) and atrial fibrillation in the UK Biobank.

Cardiac function quantification from MRI is still not a fully automatic process in the clinical practice. This is partly due to the shortage of training data covering all relevant cardiovascular disease phenotypes. We propose to synthetically generate short axis CINE MRI using a generative adversarial model.

Germline mutations in DNA repair genes and KLK3 have been associated with adverse prostate cancer (PCa) outcomes in separate studies but never jointly. The objective of this study is to simultaneously assess these two types of germline mutations.

Activation of microglia in the spinal cord following peripheral nerve injury is critical for the development of long-lasting pain hypersensitivity. Apolipoprotein E (Apoe) is the top upregulated gene in spinal cordMicroglia at chronic time points after nerve injury in mice. polymorphisms in the APOE gene in humans are associated with chronic pain.

Obesity is a risk factor for both cardiovascular disease and dementia. We examined associations between obesity, including estimates of central obesity with brain gray matter (GM) volume in the UK Biobank. We found that central obesity, was associated with decreased GM volume.

National Academy of Science's 2017 Report found limited evidence that acute marijuana smoking is positively associated with an increased risk of acute myocardial infarction. No evidence to support or refute associations between any chronic effects of marijuana use and increased risk.

Air pollution may cause inflammatory and oxidative stress damage to the brain, leading to neurodegenerative disease. The association between air pollution and dementia, and modification by apolipoprotein E genotype 4 (APOE-&#949;4) has yet to be fully investigated. UK Biobank enrolled >500,000 participants with ongoing follow-up.

Case-control status does not account for the fact that not all controls may have lived through their period of risk for the disorder of interest. The age-of-onset distribution may also depend on information such as sex and birth year. Here, we present LT-FH++, an extension of the liability threshold model conditioned on family history.

Pancreatic body PDFF was different between T2DM and nondiabetics matched by body mass index. The developed segmentation's performance was no different from manual annotations. Application on type 2 diabetes subjects showed potential for assessing pancreatic disease heterogeneity.

Study included 393,690 participants without CVD at baseline measurements between March 13, 2006, and October 1, 2010, from UK Biobank. During a median follow-up of 8.93 years, we observed 10,218 incident CVD events, including 6595 myocardial infarctions (MIs) and 3906 strokes. Among participants with a poor sleep pattern, unfavorable lifestyle (per score increase) was associated with 25% (95% CI, 13% to 39%) increased risks for CVD and MI.

Genetic variants within the APOE locus may modulate Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk independently or in conjunction with APOE*2/3/4 genotypes. Identifying variants and mechanisms would importantly advance our understanding of APOE pathophysiology and provide critical guidance for AD therapies aimed at APOE.

Previous observational studies suggested that a reduction in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) or a supranormal eGFR value was associated with adverse cardiovascular risks. A previous Mendelian randomization (MR) study under the linearity assumption reported null causal effects from eG FR on myocardial infarction (MI) risks.

Previous studies have shown that marine omega-3 PUFAs (fish oil) supplements was associated with improved cognitive function. We aimed to assess the relations between use of fish oil supplements and risks of all-cause and disease-specific dementia according to the apolipoprotein E (APOE) &#949;4 dosage.

Higher educational attainment reduced genetic susceptibility to higher body mass index, smoking, atrial fibrillation and type 2 diabetes, but increased susceptibility to LDL-C and systolic blood pressure. Little evidence of effect modification was found for all other traits considered.

Study examines how alcohol intake from wine and non-wine alcoholic beverages (non-wine) in g/d are associated with all-cause, cancer, non-cancer and CVD mortality. Consumption was assessed in 354 386 participants of the UK Biobank cohort who drank alcohol at least occasionally and survived at least 2 years after baseline.

Host genetics are known to influence the gut microbiome, yet their role remains poorly understood. We performed a genome-wide association study of 207 taxa and 205 pathways representing microbial composition and function in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project.

The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has witnessed more than 4.5 million deaths as of the time of writing. Whether nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) increases the risk for severe COVID- 19 remains unclear. We performed large-scale TSMR analyses to examine whether there is a causal relationship between NAFLD, serum alanine aminotransferase, grade of steatosis, or fibrosis stage.

Decompensation is a hallmark of disease progression in cirrhotic patients. New Early Prediction of Decompensation score uses platelet count, albumin, and bilirubin concentration. It predicts decompensation during a 3-year follow-up in three validation cohorts.

Migraine affects over a billion individuals worldwide but its genetic underpinning remains largely unknown. Here, we performed a genome-wide association study of 102,084 migraine cases and 771,257 controls and identified 123 loci, of which 86 are previously unknown.

Assortative mating induces long range dependence across causal variants. All marker-based heritability estimators implicitly assume mating is random. We provide mathematical and simulation-based evidence.

Severe mental illnesses (SMI) including major depressive disorder (MDD), bipolar disorder (BD), and schizophrenia spectrum disorder (SSD) elevate accelerated brain aging risks. Cardio-metabolic disorders (CMD) are common comorbidities in SMI and negatively impact brain health.

Gender captures social components beyond biological sex. Assessment of gender typically relies on questionnaires which may not be available. The aim of this study is to construct a gender metric using available variables in the UK Biobank and to apply it to the study of angina diagnosis.

Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) is an autosomal dominant form of monogenic diabetes, reported to be caused by variants in 16 genes. Concern has been raised about whether variants in BLK, KLF11, and PAX4 cause MODY. We examined variant-level genetic evidence (cosegregation with diabetes and frequency in population) for published putative pathogenic variants in these genes.

Back pain is a common and debilitating disorder with largely unknown underlying biology. We identify 41 variants at 33 loci. The most significant association (ORIDD = 0.92, P = 1.6 Ã— 10-39) is with a 3'UTR variant in CHST3.

Few studies have explored the emerging adiposity marker A Body Shape Index (ABSI) with cancer risk. This study investigated the associations between ABSI and the incidence of cancer at 23 sites and all cancer combined.

Greater maternal adiposity before or during pregnancy is associated with greater offspring adiposity throughout childhood. We used Mendelian randomisation with polygenic risk scores (PRS) to investigate whether associations between maternal pre-/early pregnancy body mass index (BMI) and offspringÂ adiposityÂ from birth to adolescence are causal. We found a positive association between maternal BMI and BW, supporting a moderate causal effect.

Clinical presentation of congenital heart disease is heterogeneous, making identification of the disease-causing genes and their genetic pathways and mechanisms of action challenging. Here we identify 705 lines with cardiac arrhythmia, myocardial hypertrophy and/or ventricular dilation. Among these 705 genes, 486 have not been previously associated with cardiac dysfunction in humans.

Recently developed deep learning-based methods have the potential to provide a faster and more scalable alternative to more conventional neuroimaging analysis pipelines. These methods were also shown to have higher test-retest reliability, raising the possibility that they could also exhibit superior head motion tolerance.

BMI is a complex disease risk factor known to be influenced by genes acting via both metabolic pathways and appetite regulation. In this study, we aimed to gain insight into the phenotypic consequences of BMI-associated genetic variants. We harnessed gene expression datasets derived from subcutaneous adipose and brain tissue.

Alcohol consumption is thought to be one of the modifiable risk factors for colorectal cancer (CRC) However, the causality and mechanisms by which alcohol exerts its carcinogenic effect are unclear. We evaluated the association between alcohol consumption and CRC risk by analyzing data from 32 cohort studies and conducted two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis.

UK Biobank is a large prospective cohort, based in the UK, that has deep phenotypic and genomic data on roughly a half a million individuals. Included in this resource are data on approximately 78,000 individuals with "non-white British ancestry"

Traumatic experiences are described as the strongest predictors of major depressive disorder (MDD) Several studies indicate that body mass index (BMI) exerts a large confounding effect on both inflammation and MDD. We sought to replicate previously reported associations between these traits in a large subset of the UK Biobank. Our findings highlight the importance of controlling for both BMI and trauma when studying MDD in the context of inflammation. They also suggest that the experience of traumatic events can increase the risk forMDD.

Prospective cohort study included 477,293 UK residents aged 37-73 years. We identified 12,870 cases of cholelithiasis over a median follow-up of 8.1 years. Regular use of PPIs or H2RAs was associated with an increased risk.

Tobacco smokers have reduced Parkinson's disease (PD) risk. Some patients with PD experience constipation long before they develop mobility problems. Recently, the gut microbiome has been implicated in PD.

The complexity of people's social lives may constitute the dominating factor in the vibrancy of many individuals' environment. The neural substrates linked to social cognition appear especially susceptible when people endure periods of social isolation. Previous human social neuroscience studies have focused on the DN, while HC subfields have been studied in most detail in rodents.

Occupational exposures are important, preventable causes of COPD. We previously found an increased risk of COPd among six occupations. We aimed to build on these findings and elucidate the underlying potential causal agents to focus preventive strategies.

'Sexually antagonistic' (SA) variants contribute to variation in life-history traits and overall fitness. Theory predicts that SA variants could be enriched on the X chromosome or autosomes. But current empirical tests face two formidable challenges. We argue that the polygenic nature of SA variation and sex asymmetries in SA effects might render X-linked enrichment of SA polymorphisms unlikely.

Gut microbiome and dietary patterns have been suggested to be associated with depression/anxiety. limited effort has been made to explore the effects of possible interactions between diet and microbiome on the risks of depression and anxiety. We observed 51 common diet-gut microbiome interactions shared by both PHQ score and depression status.

Study included 72 434 individuals with 37 780 clinical variants. Of 5360 pathogenic/loss-of-function variants, 4795 (89%) were associated with an RD less than or equal to 0.05. Mean penetrance was 6.9% (95% CI, 6.0%-7.8%) for pathogenic variants and 0.85% for benign variants.

Research into the genetic architecture and shared influences with liability for mental disorders is lacking. We conducted a genome-wide association study (GWAS) of total cerebellar volume. We identified 33 GWAS signals associated with total cereBellar volume, of which 6 are known to alter protein-coding gene structure.

Few studies focused on peripheral immunity and dementia. We examined the longitudinal association between incident dementia and peripheral immunity markers. The results revealed that increased innate immunity markers were associated with higher dementia risk.

The extent to which the adverse metabolic component of obesity contributes to disease is often uncertain. We aimed to use Mendelian randomisation and specific genetic variants to separately test the causal roles of higher adiposity with and without its adverse metabolic effects on diseases.

Biological age (BA) is a measure of functional capacity and prognostic of health outcomes that discriminates between individuals of the same chronological age (chronAge) 95% of the variance in chronAge is shared among clocks. One year's OCAA typically has the same effect on risk factors/10-year disease incidence as 0.09/0.25 years of chronAge.

Myasthenia gravis is a chronic autoimmune disease characterized by autoantibody-mediated interference of signal transmission across the neuromuscular junction. We performed a genome-wide association study (GWAS) involving 1,873 patients and 36,370 healthy individuals to identify disease-associated genetic risk loci. Two other loci were discovered on 10p14 and 11q21, and the previous association signals at PTPN22, HLA-DQA1/HLA-B, and TNFRSF11A were confirmed.

Lower muscle mass and strength are risk factors for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) This study examined both the strength and pattern of the associations between these 2 physical capability markers and severe NAFLD using data from the UK Biobank study.

In high-pollution areas, physical activity may have a paradoxical effect on brain health by increasing particulate deposition in the lungs. We examined whether physical activity modifies associations of air pollution (AP) with brain volumes in an epidemiologic framework. VigPA may exacerbate associations of AP with white matter hyperintensity lesions.

The herpesviridae virus cytomegalovirus has been associated with lower cognitive function in some but not all studies. In this community-based adult sample, cytomeGalovirus was not associated with cognitive function. In adjusted interaction models, age, sex, educational attainment, and income did not moderate associations.

Polygenic scores (PGS) are commonly evaluated in terms of their predictive accuracy at the population level by the proportion of phenotypic variance they explain. We investigated the stability of PGS in European American (EUR) and African American (AFR)-ancestry individuals from the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort and the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development study.

Diabetes mellitus (DM) is known to be associated with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) Others have developed polygenic risk scores (PRS) associated with PDAC risk. We aimed to compare the performance of these PRS in an independent cohort.

Size at birth is known to be influenced by various fetal and maternal factors, including genetic effects. South Asians have a high burden of low birth weight and cardiometabolic diseases. Studies of common genetic variations underpinning these phenotypes are lacking.

Cerebral microbleeds (CMBs) appear as small, circular, well defined hypointense lesions of a few mm in size. Due to their small size, contrast variations and other mimics, CMBs are highly challenging to detect automatically. In this work, we aim to detect CMB candidate subjects from a larger dataset, UK Biobank, using a machine learning-based, computationally light pipeline.

Data were collected from 107,442 UK Biobank study participants aged 40 to 69 years. Myopia was defined as mean spherical equivalent (MSE) &#8804;-1 dioptre (D) Temporal changes in myopia frequency by birth cohort and associations with environmental factors were analysed.

Breast (BCa) and prostate (PrCa) cancer are the first and second most common types of cancer in women and men, respectively. We used Mendelian randomisation to assess the causal effect of body mass index (BMI), body fat percentage (BFP), waist circumference (WC), hip circumference (HC), and waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) on BCa and PrCa risk. We found that increased BMI, WC and HC decreased the risk of breast cancer.

Fat content and volume of liver and pancreas are associated with risk of diabetes in observational studies. We conducted a Mendelian randomization study to examine causality of such associations. Pancreatic fat was associated with type 2 diabetes but not type 1 diabetes.

Sleep and circadian phenotypes are associated with several diseases. Study aimed to investigate whether sleep and circadian Phenotypes were causally linked with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19)-related outcomes.

Previous studies have shown reduced cardiovascular risk with increasing high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) levels. However, recent data in the general population have shown increased risk of adverse outcomes at very high concentrations of HDL-C. We aimed to study the gender-specific relation between very high HDL- C levels and adverse cardiovascular outcomes and the genetic basis.

We propose an effective two-stage pipeline for detecting and synthesising absent slices in both the apical and basal region. The imputation network is based on a dedicated conditional generative adversarial network (GAN) that helps retain key visual cues and fine structural details. The proposed approach can improve the reliability of high-throughput image analysis in large-scale population studies.

Polygenic scores (PGS) for blood cell traits have potential clinical utility in disease risk prediction and prevention. We find that PGSs designed using common machine learning methods EN and BR show improved prediction.

Refractive errors are associated with a range of pathological conditions, such as myopic maculopathy and glaucoma, and are highly heritable. Studies of missense and putative loss of function (pLOF) variants identified via whole exome sequencing (WES) offer the prospect of directly implicating potentially causative disease genes.

Of 378,051 unrelated individuals of European ancestry, 2,402 were classified as having experienced severe COVID-19. Exposures included sex, cardiometabolic risk factors [obesity and type 2 diabetes (T2D), tested jointly], and multiple deprivation index. Five independent variants reached genome-wide significance.

Malignant gliomas are the most common primary adult brain tumors. Mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) sequence variation has been linked with certain cancers. Research on glioma is lacking.

Serum liver enzymes (alanine aminotransferase [ALT], aspartate aminOTransferases [AST], &#955;-glutamyl transferase [GGT] and alkaline phosphatase [ALP) are the leading biomarkers to measure liver injury. We conducted a phenome-wide association study to identify disease phenotypes associated with genetically predicted liver enzymes based on the UK Biobank cohort.

It is well-accepted that both environment and genetic factors contribute to the development of mental disorders (MD) Few genetic studies have used time-to-event data analysis to identify susceptibility genetic variants associated with MD. SPACOX approach was used to identify the susceptibility loci for MD. We also observed that multiple environment factors could influence the association between susceptible loci and MD.

Cognitive resilience is the ability to withstand the negative effects of stress on cognitive functioning. The UK Biobank does not have measurements of the same cognitive phenotype at distal time points. We used education years (EY) as a proxy for past cognitive performance.

The human protein transmembrane protease serine type 2 (TMPRSS2) plays a key role in SARS-CoV-2 infection. It is required to activate the virus' spike protein, facilitating entry into target cells. We hypothesized that naturally-occurring TMPR SS2 human genetic variants may modulate the severity of SARS. We focused on the only common TMPRss2 non-synonymous variant predicted to be damaging.

The UK Biobank study recruited > 500,000 participants between 2006 and 2010. Analyses included > 370,000 middle-aged and older adults with a median follow-up of 11.75 (IQR = 1.4) years. Compared to individuals with excellent self-rated health and favourable health status, individuals with other combinations of self- rated and objective health status had a greater mortality risk.

Inflammatory bowel disease is associated with an increased risk of skin cancer. The aims of this study were to determine whether IBD susceptibility variants are also associated with skin cancer susceptibility and if such risk is augmented by immune-suppressive therapy.

Risk-taking differs between humans, and is associated with personality measures of impulsivity and sensation-seeking. To analyse the brain systems involved, self-report risk-taking, resting state functional connectivity, and related behavioral measures were analyzed in 18,740 participants of both sexes from the UK Biobank.

The minor G risk allele in the common melatonin receptor gene (MTNR1B, rs10830963) has been associated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction among patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D) activating the melatonin receptors 1B through melatonin has been shown to promote cell proliferation, which could be hypothesized to increase cancer risk.

Major depression (MD) is a heterogeneous disorder; however, the extent to which genetic factors distinguish MD patient subgroups remains uncertain. This study sought evidence for genetic heterogeneity in MD. Using UK Biobank cohort, the authors defined 16 MD subtypes within eight comparison groups.

Dental caries, periodontal disease, stomatitis, and the related inflammatory burden increase AD risk. Oral pathology and the oral microbiome correlate with POAG vulnerability. Prostaglandin is a possibility.

Cardiometabolic disorders (CMD) arise from a constellation of features such as increased adiposity, hyperlipidemia, hypertension and compromised glucose control. Many genetic loci have shown associations with individual CMD-related traits, but no investigations have focused on simultaneously identifying loci showing associations across all domains. We identified four loci associated with risk across all seven CMD traits in the UK Biobank.

Systolic and diastolic blood pressure are highly correlated modifiable risk factors for cardiovascular disease (CVD) We report here a bidirectional Mendelian Randomization (MR) and horizontal pleiotropy analysis of S/DBP summary statistics. We construct a composite genetic risk score (GRS) by including pleiotropic variants. The composite GRS captures greater (1.11-3.26 fold) heritability for BP traits.

The effects of gene-by-environment (GÃ—E) interactions on complex diseases are significant, especially the superimposed effects of multiple environmental factors. Research on the multi-environments-gene interactions of anxiety, depression, and self-harm is still limited. This study included white individuals (N = 66,041-74,482) from the UK Biobank.

Socioeconomic status and air pollution have independent effects on the risk of testing positive for SARS-CoV-2. Green space and natural environment space in the proximity of people's homes may mediate the effect of air pollution.

Over 76 genetic loci (comprising 90 SNPs) have been associated with PD by the most recent GWAS meta-analysis. Most of these PD-associated variants are located in non-coding regions of the genome. We hypothesised that PD- associated genetic variants modulate disease risk through tissue-specific expression quantitative trait loci effects.

Populations at increased risk of dementia need to be identified for well-powered trials of preventive interventions. Weight loss, which often occurs in pre-clinical dementia, could identify a population at sufficiently high dementia risk.

Extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost) outperformed traditional logistic regression in predicting myocardial infarction (MI) in a large cohort. The UK Biobank is a population-based prospective cohort including 502 506 volunteers with active consent.

Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) in late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) do not capture the synergistic effects among multiple genetic variants and lack good specificity. We applied tree-based machine learning algorithms (MLs) to discriminate LOAD and age-matched unaffected subjects in UK Biobank with single nucleotide variants (SNVs) from AD studies. MLs prioritized a set of SNVs located in genes  PVRL2 ,  TOMM40 ,  APOE , and  APOC1.

Hearing loss was recently identified as a modifiable risk factor for dementia. Potential mechanisms explaining this relationship are unknown. Study examined longitudinal change in resting-state fMRI functional connectivity and gray matter volume in individuals who developed a hearing impairment.

Low portability of polygenic scores (PGSs) across global populations is a major concern that must be addressed before PGSs can be used for everyone in the clinic. PGS accuracy has been shown to decay as a function of the genetic distance between the training and test cohorts.

We studied the UK Biobank prospective cohort (n = 324,486) for observational analysis with poor handgrip strength or self-reported slow walking pace as the exposures. The functional sarcopenia status are targetable causative factors for interventions aiming to reduce risks of cardiovascular disease or mortality.

Both genetic variants and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) contribute to the risk of incident severe coronavirus disease (COVID-19) Whether genetic risk is the same regardless of preexisting COPD is unknown. polygenic risk score can be effectively used in screening for high-risk populations.

Previous studies have reported inconsistent associations between chronic kidney disease (CKD) and dementia. This study compared the performance of different measures of calculating estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)

Social isolation is prevalent in individuals with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) Its potential health impact on IBD prognosis has not been quantitatively well examined. We leveraged data of 486,014 participants (including 5791 with IBD) from UK Biobank. We measured social isolation by the frequency of meeting family/friends, leisure and social activity.

Age-standardised prevalence and deaths for dementia have been reported to be higher in women compared with men. The role of female-specific endocrine and reproductive events in modulating dementia risk needs to be further clarified.

Auditory deficits are increasingly recognised following aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage. Central hearing impairment, also known as auditory processing disorder (APD), often coexists with cognitive deficits. The aim of this study was to assess auditory outcome following aSAH and its relationship with cognition.

Inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) response among patients with asthma is influenced by genetics. biologically actionable insights based on associations have not been found. Various glucocorticoid response omics data sets are available to interrogate their biological effects.

High body mass index (BMI) has implications for clinical practice. We tested the hypotheses that high BMI causally influences heart failure incidence and mortality. We studied 106 121 individuals from the Copenhagen General Population Study.

Grip strength has been associated with increased risk of some site-specific cancers. The ability of grip strength to predict other diseases may be affected by whether it is expressed in absolute or relative terms, but the evidence for cancer is scarce.

Transthyretin (TTR) is the precursor of the fibrils that compromise organ function in hereditary and sporadic systemic amyloidoses (ATTR) RNA-interference and anti-sense therapeutics targeting TTR  hepatic transcription have been shown to reduce TTR amyloids formation. We leveraged genetic and phenotypic information from the UK Biobank and transcriptomic profiles from the Genotype-Tissue Expression project to test the association of genetically regulated TTR gene expression with 7149 traits.

Many young women with endometriosis go undetected for an extended period, which may lead to pain sensitization. Clinical tools to better identify candidates for laparoscopy-guided diagnosis are urgently needed. There is growing interest in using genetics as part of the clinical risk assessment.

Delirium is a neurocognitive disorder characterized by an abrupt decline in attention, awareness, and cognition after surgical/illness-induced stressors on the brain. Electrocardiogram data were examined in 38,740 middle- to older-aged UK Biobank participants. Low HRR was equivalent to being 6 years older, a current smoker, or &#8805;3 additional cardiovascular disease risks.

High bone mineral density (BMD) is a risk factor for osteoarthritis (OA) It is unclear whether this represents a causal effect or shared aetiology and whether these relationships are body mass index (BMI)-independent. We performed bidirectional Mendelian randomization (MR) to uncover the causal pathways.

There is conflicting data on the effect of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) on bone mineral density (BMD) and fracture risk. Recent genetic data suggest that men may also carry genetic risk factors for PCOS; the associations of these factors with parameters of bone health remains unknown. We aimed to investigate if the genetic risk of PCOS is associated with BMD and fracturerisk in women and men in the UK Biobank dataset.

Heart disease remains the leading cause of death worldwide. Increased blood lipid levels are heritable risk factors of cardiovascular disease. Most previous GWAS4-23 have been conducted in European ancestry populations. We find that increasing diversity rather than studying additional individuals of European ancestry results in substantial improvements.

Excess liver fat, called hepatic steatosis, is a leading risk factor for end-stage liver disease and cardiometabolic diseases. It often remains undiagnosed in clinical practice because of the need for direct imaging assessments. We developed an abdominal MRI-based machine-learning algorithm to accurately estimate liver fat from 4,511 middle-aged UK Biobank participants.

Past-oriented rumination and future-oriented worry are two aspects of perseverative negative thinking related to the neuroticism endophenotype and associated with depression and anxiety. Genetic associations for worry did not implicate specific biological processes, while past- oriented rumination had a more specific genetic background. Biological pathways leading to rumination appeared to differ according to folate intake.

Study aimed to identify genes/proteins involved in determining fat distribution. PLIN1, PDE3B, ACVR1C and PLIN4 genes were found to have beneficial effects. INSR LoF is associated with lower TG and HDL levels but may increase the risk of type 2 diabetes.

Identifying genes underlying memory function will help characterize cognitively resilient and high-risk declining subpopulations. We identified DCDC2 gene significantly associated with episodic memory among non-carriers of APOE &#949;4 (N = 24,941)

Many predictive models exist that predict risk of common cardiometabolic conditions. Most models do not include genetic risk scores and do not distinguish between clinical risk requiring medical or pharmacological interventions and pre-clinical risk. In this study, we developed, validated, and compared the performance of three decision rule algorithms.

An observational association between nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and kidney function impairment has been reported. We aimed to investigate the causal effects from NAFLD on estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) The eGFR outcome was assessed in individuals of white British ancestry from the UK Biobank (N = 321 405)

Women experience major depression and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) approximately twice as often as men. Estrogen is thought to contribute to sex differences in these disorders. Reduced estrogen is also known to be a key driver of menopause symptoms.

Proton pump inhibitor (PPI) users had a 16% higher risk of stroke than non-users. The absolute effect of PPI use on stroke increased with the baseline Framingham Stroke Risk Score. Physicians should exercise caution when prescribing PPIs.

Genotype-by-environment interaction (GxE) studies probe heterogeneity in response to risk factors or interventions. We expand the traditional GxE model to directly model genetic and environmental moderation of the dispersion of the outcome. We find that changes in the penetrance of a genome-wide polygenic score for BMI across birth year are partly representative of a more general pattern of expanding BMI variation across generations.

We performed genome-wide association studies (GWAS) for hearing loss-related traits in the UK Biobank (N = 362,396) We selected a high confidence set of ten hearing-associated gene products for staining in human cochlear samples. Results suggest common genetic variation to influence structural resilience to damage.

The association between inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and dementia remains uncertain. We aim to investigate whether IBD is associated with higher dementia risk. Using multivariable Cox regression models, we analyzed the onset of all-cause dementia among 497,775 participants.

Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is characterized by ovulatory dysfunction and hyperandrogenism. For every 1 SD increase in the PCOS PRS, men had increased odds of obesity, type 2 diabetes mellitus, coronary artery disease, and marked androgenic alopecia.

Study looked at 200,643 individuals from the UK Biobank. Cumulative incidence by age 70 years among the nonheterozygotes across PRS strata ranged from 9% to 32% for breast cancer and prostate cancer, respectively. Among the PV heterozygotes it ranged from 20% to 48% in moderate-risk genes.

Psychotic-like experiences (PLEs) are risk factors for the development of psychiatric conditions like schizophrenia. As PLEs have been related to alterations in both white matter and cognition, we investigated whether cognition (g-factor and processing speed) mediates the relationship.

Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) have identified germline variants influencing the risk of developing colorectal cancer. There has been limited examination of the possible role of inherited variation as a determinant of patient outcome. We performed a GWAS for overall survival (OS) in 1926 patients with advanced CRC from the COIN and COIN-B clinical trials.

We identified 10,674 genetic associations for 3892 plasma proteins to create a cis-anchored gene-protein-disease map of 1859 connections. This proteo-genomic map provides a framework to connect etiologically related diseases.

Accelerometer data collected from 103 712 UK Biobank participants over a period of 7 days. A total of 3172 cases of CVD were reported during a mean follow-up period of 5.7 (+/-0.49) years. An age- and sex-controlled base analysis found that sleep onset time of 10:00 p.m.-10:59 p.M. was associated with the lowest CVD incidence.

Researchers have long investigated a hypothesized interaction between genetic risk and stressful life events in the etiology of depression. We conducted a genome-wide by environment interaction study (GWEIS) in 18,532 patients with depression from hospital-based settings and 20,184 population controls. Results: The GWEIS in the iPSYCH2012 sample yielded three novel, genome- wide-significant loci located in the ABCC1 gene.

The state of somatic energy stores in metazoans is communicated to the brain, which regulates key aspects of behaviour, growth, nutrient partitioning and development. We found that humans who carry loss-of-function mutations in MC3R have a later onset of puberty. Mice lacking Mc3r had delayed sexual maturation and an insensitivity of reproductive cycle length to nutritional perturbation.

Stroke is the leading cause of death and long-term disability worldwide. Previous genome-wide association studies identified 51 loci associated with stroke (mostly ischemic) and its subtypes among predominantly European populations. We used whole-genome sequencing in ancestrally diverse populations from the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program.

Every 1,000 units/km2 increment in residential density within a 1-Km network catchment was independently associated with a 2.8% (odds ratio: 1.028, p = 0.0058) and 11.4% (or 1.114, p.114) increase in loneliness.

 Observational studies have suggested that sleep and circadian disturbances are potentially modifiable risk factors for low bone mineral density (BMD) This study aimed to replicate the findings by examining observational association of sleep traits with low estimated BMD. It also examined whether these associations were causal by using Mendelian randomization (MR) analyses.

Both genetic and cardiovascular factors contribute to the risk of developing heart failure (HF) Whether cardiovascular health metrics (ICVHMs) offset the genetic association with incident HF remains unclear.

Male androgenetic alopecia (AGA) has been implicated as a putative risk factor in severe COVID-19. Research suggests that androgen signalling, which plays a central role in AGA aetiology, promotes SARS-CoV-2 infection.

Brain age can be estimated using different Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) modalities including diffusion MRI. Limbic tracts based model reached the highest accuracy with a Mean Absolute Error (MAE) of 5.08.

Mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) is present in multiple copies in human cells. We evaluated cross-sectional associations of whole blood mtDNA copy number (CN) with several cardiometabolic disease traits in 408,361 participants of multiple ancestries. Age showed a threshold association with mtDNA CN: among younger participants (P  = 0.0014) versus a 0.14 s.d. lower level of mt DNA CN ( P  = 1.82 Ã— 10 -13 ) among older participants.

Phenotypic and genetic relationships between migraine and lipoprotein subfractions. There was a significant phenotypic association (odds ratio 1.27 [95% confidence interval 1.12-1.44]) and a significant genetic correlation at 0.18 ( p  = 0.001) Between migraine and triglyceride-rich lipoproteins (TRLPs) concentration.

A total of 8,159 participants from the UK Biobank with MRI scans suitable for CMB analysis were included. One or more definite CMBs were detected in 572 (7.0%) participants. Hypertension, smoking, and alcohol consumption were associated with deep C MBs, but not with lobar CMB's.

Type 2 diabetes is associated with increased risks of cognitive dysfunction and brain abnormalities. The extent to which risk factor modification can mitigate these risks is unclear. We investigated the associations between incident dementia and cognitive performance among individuals with type 2 diabetes.

The relationship between asthma and coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) risk is not clear and may be influenced by level of airway obstruction. We aimed to investigate COVID- 19 risk in people with asthma. We used UK Biobank data from all participants tested for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronav virus 2 (SARS-CoV-2)

Platelet count (PLT) and mean platelet volume (MPV) are highly heritable quantitative traits. Hundreds of genetic signals previously identified, mostly in European ancestry populations. We utilize whole genome sequencing (WGS) from NHLBI's Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine initiative.

Study looked at 403,187 participants from UK Biobank. Healthy sleep pattern was defined by chronotype, sleep duration, insomnia, snoring, and daytime sleepiness. Weighted genetic risk score for atrial fibrillation was calculated.

The neurotropic protozoan Toxoplasma gondii has been associated with cognition and several neuropsychiatric diseases including schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. Findings have been mixed, however, with some studies reporting positive associations and others finding no associations. We used data from the UK Biobank and the National Health and Examination Survey (NHANES) to investigate the association.

Accurate risk assessment is critical in clinical decision-making. Building a new model for the target cohort would be ideal but costly. Existing methods have been proposed to recalibrate the model. We develop a weighted estimating-equation approach.

Previous evidence suggests that coffee might be related to dementia. Little is known about coffee and dementia in individuals with elevated genetic susceptibility for dementia. Coffee intake was assessed at baseline and included total, instant, ground, and decaffeinated coffee. Heavy coffee consumption was associated with a higher risk of AD.

Study looked at relationship between visual impairment (VI) and dementia in the UK Biobank Study. Found VI was associated with increased risk of dementia, with progressively greater risk among those with worse visual acuity.

The association between circulating cholesterol and triglyceride levels and ovarian cancer risk remains unclear. Data from two large cohorts in the United States and United Kingdom suggest that total cholesterol levels may be inversely associated with ovarian cancer.

We identify 74 statistically significant gene-disease associations across 27 genes. Seven of these conditions have a positive predictive value (PPV) of at least 30% in both cohorts. The addition of GCK, HBB, PKD1, and MIP rare variants into genetic screening programs would reach an additional 0.21% of participants.

Genotype imputation is widely used in genetic studies to boost the power of GWAS. However, the uncertain nature of imputed genotypes can cause bias in the downstream analysis. We showed that the imputation accuracy is diminished if the real genotypes contain minor alleles.

The link between cardiometabolic and psychiatric illness has long been attributed to human behaviour. Recent research highlights shared biological mechanisms. The ASTN2 locus has been previously implicated in psychiatric and cardiometric traits.

Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a complex disease with a late onset and is characterized by the progressive loss of muscular and respiratory functions. We found 84 SNPs associated with 46 genes that are involved in different pathways including: "Ca 2+  activated K +  channels"

SGLT2 inhibitors block renal glucose reabsorption. This study aimed to identify genetic variants mimicking S GLT2i to further our understanding of the potential underlying biological mechanisms. Using the UK Biobank resource, we identified 264 SNPs located in the SLC5A2 gene. None of the variants met these criteria.

Glucosamine shows anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer benefits with minimal adverse effects. We aimed to explore the relationship between use of glucosamine and risk of lung cancer and lung cancer mortality based on data from the large-scale nationwide prospective UK Biobank cohort study.

Copy number variants (CNVs) include deletions or multiplications spanning genomic regions. duplications and triplications of SNCA have been shown to cause forms of Parkinson's disease. We performed a systematic analysis of CNVs in a Turkish dementia cohort.

Despite advances, understanding the protective role of the apolipoprotein E (APOE) &#949;2 allele in Alzheimer's disease remains elusive. We examined associations of TOMM40 and APOE variants with AD in a sample of 2862 AD-affected and 169,516 AD-unaffected non-carriers of the & #949;4 allele. Association of men with AD is 38% more beneficial when it is accompanied by a combination of these variants.

Study aimed to investigate the association between individual and combinations of macronutrients with premature death, CVD and dementia. Data were utilised from a prospective cohort of 120 963 individuals (57 % women) within the UK Biobank. Sex differences were investigated.

US practice guidelines now recognize South Asian ancestry as an important risk-enhancing factor. The magnitude of enhanced risk within the context of contemporary clinical care, the extent to which it is captured by existing risk estimators, and its potential mechanisms warrant additional study.

Large-scale human exome sequencing can identify rare protein-coding variants with a large impact on complex traits such as body adiposity. We sequenced the exomes of 645,626 individuals from the United Kingdom, the United States, and Mexico. We identified 16 genes with an exome-wide significant association with BMI. Inhibition of GPR75 may provide a therapeutic strategy for obesity.

Age at first sexual intercourse and age at first birth have implications for health and evolutionary fitness. We identify 371 single-nucleotide polymorphisms, 11 sex-specific, with a 5-6% polygenic score prediction. Signals are driven by the genetics of reproductive biology and externalising behaviour, with key genes related to follicle stimulating hormone (FSHB), implantation and infertility.

We use UK Biobank data to train predictors for 65 blood and urine markers such as HDL, LDL, lipoprotein A, glycated haemoglobin, etc. from SNP genotype. For example, our Polygenic Score (PGS) predictor correlates &#8764;0.76 with lipop Protein A level, which is highly heritable and an independent risk factor for heart disease.

Evidence on the effect of ambient air pollution on vitamin D is limited. This study aimed to examine the association of air pollution exposure with serum levels of 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25OHD) A total of 448,337 subjects were included in this analysis. All analyzed air pollutants were negatively associated with serum vitamin 25OHD levels.

One of the major challenges in the post-genomic era is elucidating the genetic basis of human diseases. In recent years, studies have shown that polygenic risk scores can estimate individual risk for common diseases. We present here a sex-specific integrated approach that combines PRS with additional measurements and age to define a new risk score.

Study looked at 10-year fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk in individuals without previous CVD or diabetes aged 40-69 years in Europe. Predicted CVD risk varied several-fold across European regions.

 partial volume effect (PVE) confounds the estimation of perfusion into a specific tissue of interest such as gray or white matter. This confound occurs because the image voxels contain a mixture of tissues with disparate perfusion properties. We conclude that there is sound theoretical motivation for the use of PVEc alongside conventional, 'uncorrected', images.

Excess adiposity has been linked with various cancers, but association between body composition and some cancers remains unclear. We investigated associations of body composition with risk of overall cancer and major site-specific cancers in a prospective cohort of 454 079 cancer-free participants from UK-Biobank.

Pneumonia is a respiratory condition with complex etiology. Host genetic variation is thought to contribute to individual differences in susceptibility and symptom manifestation. Here, we analyze pneumonia data from the UK Biobank and FinnGen. We identify two independent loci on chromosome 15 to be associated with pneumonia.

AlphaMissense was shown to have good performance using benchmarks based on variants causing severe disease and on functional assays. Although AlphaMissense produced the highest SLP on average across genes, it produced the maximum SLP for only 4 genes. The marked inconsistency across genes means that it is difficult to decide on an optimal method of analysis.

The extent to which this diet supports metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) has not yet been assessed. This study aimed to investigate the association between the EAT-Lancet diet and risk of MASLD and its severity.

Liver oncogenesis is accompanied by discernible protein changes in the bloodstream. By employing plasma proteomic profiling, we can delve into the molecular mechanisms of liver cancer and pinpoint potential biomarkers. We identified 193 proteins with notable differential levels between the groups. MR analysis offered a compelling negative association between apolipoprotein B (APOB) and liver cancer.

Retinal artery occlusion (RAO) is positively correlated with acute ischemic stroke (IS) and results in severe visual impairment. This study aims to perform integrated analysis using UK Biobank plasma proteome data of RAO and IS to identify potential targets and preventive drugs.

Triglyceride-glucose (TyG) index is an emerging surrogate indicator of insulin resistance. It has been demonstrated as a risk factor for various cardiovascular diseases including coronary syndrome, in-stent restenosis, and heart failure. Study included 420,292 participants without baseline AD/AA from the large-scale prospective UK Biobank cohort.

Few studies have accounted for dynamic transitions between AF and dementia. Frequent napping was associated with a 1.17-fold AF risk. Genetic predisposition significantly modified associations between napping and AF.

Population-based cohort study using data from the UK Biobank. Study included 181,058 women of white ethnicity born in England between 1937 and 1970. 1131 had an MS diagnosis.

Pulmonary embolism causes a substantial burden of morbidity and mortality. Evidence has suggested an association of clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) with the risk of arterial thromboembolism. We performed a community-based cohort study including 464,417 individuals with available whole exome sequencing (WES) data.

Cross-sectional study included UK Biobank participants with complete data (2006-2010) for analysis. Glaucoma patients were older and had a higher percentage of males and a higher mean IOP compared to controls.

8,024 individuals with pre-existing CVD from the UK Biobank had their PA measured using wrist-worn accelerometers over a 7-day period in 2013-2015. During an average of 6.8 years of follow-up, 691 deaths (273 from cancer and 219 from CVD) were recorded. An inverse non-linear association was found between PA duration and all-cause mortality risk.

Phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) analysis was conducted to map the association of genetically predicted smoking status with 1,549 phenotypes. Sickle cell anemia and type 2 diabetes exhibited the most significant SNPs. Study affirms causal relationships between smoking and obstructive chronic bronchitis, cancer of the bronchus, peripheral vascular disease, emphysema, pneumococcal pneumonia, chronic airway obstruction.

Study aimed to investigate the association between cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection and five neurodegenerative diseases. Study included white British individuals who underwent CMV testing in the UK Biobank from January 1, 2006 to December 31, 2021. Results showed that CMV infection did not affect the risk of developing AD.

Physical activity (PA) can attenuate the impact of genetic susceptibility to these traits. We aimed to investigate whether higher PA modify genetic impact on liver-related traits in the UK Biobank cohort. PA was self-reported, while magnetic resonance images were used to estimate liver fat and liver volume. Association between GRSLF and liver fat was not different among lower. PA did not modify the effect of GRSlF and GRSLV on MASLD or CLD.

Individualized phenotypic prediction based on structural magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is an important goal in neuroscience. Prediction performance increases with larger samples, but small-scale datasets with fewer than 200 participants are often unavoidable. We have previously proposed a " meta-matching" framework to translate models trained from large datasets to improve the prediction of new unseen phenotypes.

Metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease is a significant risk factor for cardiovascular disease (CVD) This study assesses the association between leisure-time physical activity, sedentary behavior, and CVD risk among patients with the disease. High physical activity levels were linked to a significantly lower risk of CVD.

The relationship between serum uric acid (SUA) levels and brain-related health remains uncertain. This study aimed to investigate the relationship between SUA levels and some neurodegenerative disorders and brain structure.

Lifestyle factors or air pollution factors (LAFs below) are well-established. It is unclear the influences of LAFs on the trajectory of IHD and COPD multimorbidity (referred as ICM below) Study investigated influences of high-risk factors including current smoking or quitting due to illness or physician's advice.

Colorectal cancer (CRC) is a leading cause of cancer mortality worldwide. A polygenic risk score (PRS) quantifies an individual's genetic risk of a condition. Existing PRS for CRC have so far been used to stratify asymptomatic populations. An integrated risk model combining PRS, age, sex, and patient-reported symptoms was predictive of CRC development.

 UV exposure inversely associated with all-cause, cardiovascular disease (CVD) and cancer mortality. Solarium users were also at a lower risk of non-CVD/non-cancer mortality. The benefits of UV exposure may outweigh the risks in low-sunlight countries.

Modeling the way brain activity dynamically unfolds can add important information to our understanding and characterisation of individual cognitive traits. One approach is to extract features from models of brain network dynamics to predict individual traits. These predictions are susceptible to variability due to factors such as variation in model estimation induced by the choice of hyperparameters.

Study included 413,630 participants without bone fractures at baseline in the UK Biobank study between 2006 and 2010. Results indicate that physical pre-frailty and frailty are related to higher risks of bone fractures. Such association was more pronounced among those with longer sedentary behavior time.

The associations between cardiovascular disease (CVD) and multiple psychiatric disorders and suicide attempt have not been investigated clearly. We conducted a matched cohort study involving 63 923 patients who were first hospitalized with a CVD diagnosis between 1997 and 2020. Analyses stratified by polygenic risk score revealed little impact of genetic predisposition to studied psychiatric conditions on observed links.

High-proportion spliced-in (hiPSI) titin truncating variant (TTNtv) carriers have a higher risk of atrial fibrillation and heart failure. The role of cardiovascular risk factors in modifying the risk of these outcomes attributed to hiPSI TTNtv carriers is unknown.

The study included 453 602 participants from the UK Biobank. Childhood body size at the age of 10 years was collected through a questionnaire. Adulthood body size was assessed using body mass index (BMI), waist circumference (WC), waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) and fat-free mass index.

Open-source model can simulate interventions for primary prevention of cardiovascular disease (CVD) It incorporated the cumulative effects of risk factors (e.g., cholesterol-years or blood pressure-years) to enhance health economic modelling in settings where clinical trials are not possible.

Parkinson's disease is highly heterogeneous across disease symptoms, clinical manifestations and progression trajectories. Despite knowledge gleaned from genetics analysis, dysregulated proteome mechanisms stemming from genetic aberrations remain underexplored. Proteogenomic analysis identified 577 proteins that enrich for Parkinson's disease-related pathways.

Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) affects approximately 20%-30% of the general population and is linked to high-caloric western style diet. There are little data that specific nutrients might help to prevent steatosis. Increased dietary Mn intake was associated with a lower likelihood of MRI-diagnosed steats.

The role of circulating polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) in preventing liver cirrhosis complications remains unclear. Between 2006 and 2010, 273,834 UK Biobank participants with plasma PUFA quantification data were enrolled and followed up until October 31, 2022. Total plasma PUFAs, omega-3 PUF as, docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), omega-6 PUFas, and linoleic Acid (LA) were inversely associated with the risk.
