Networks estimated from pairwise similarities of 40 sulci on 5 morphological metrics comprised two clusters.

The causal relationship between daytime napping and the risk of Parkinson's disease (PD) remains unclear. This study investigated the association between napping frequency and duration and PD incidence. The role of the systemic immune-inflammation index (SII) in the association was assessed through mediation analyses.

 Obesity is a key predictor of type 2 diabetes (T2D) But metabolic complications are not solely due to increased BMI. We hypothesized that differences between genetically predicted BMI and observed BMI could reflect deviation from individual set point and may predict incident T2D.

The mechanisms underlying relationships between ambient air pollution and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) risk remained largely uncertain. A total of 227,962 participants with complete data were included from the UK biobank study. Concentrations of nitrogen dioxide (NO 2 ), nitrogen oxides (NO x ), and particulate matter (PM 2.5 and PM 10 ) were evaluated by land-use regression models.

Peptidylglycine-&#945;-amidating monooxygenase (PAM) is a critical enzyme in the endocrine system. Two LoF variants in the PAM gene, Ser539Trp (minor allele frequency: 0.7%) and Asp563Gly (5%), independently contributed to a decrease of 2.33 [95% confidence interval (CI): 2.52/2.15; P = 2.5E-140] and 0.98 (1.04/0.92) SD units of PAM-AMA, respectively. The cumulative effect of the LoF was associated with diabetes, reduced insulin secretion, and higher levels of GH

Body image dissatisfaction (BID) has been recognised as a psychological correlate of body size. Being overweight increased the risk of disordered eating and self-harm. Being underweight was protective against disordered Eating.

We postulated that T2D predisposes to exocrine pancreatic diseases through (epi)genetic mechanisms. We explored the methylome (methylationEPIC arrays) of the exocrine pancreas of 141 donors. PNLIPRP1 null variants (in 191K participants of the UKbiobank) associated with elevated glycemia and LDL-cholesterol.

Influenza, viral, respiratory, and skin and subcutaneous infections were associated with increased long-term dementia risk. These infections were also associated with region-specific brain volume loss, most commonly in the temporal lobe. Genetic variants influenced expression of immunologically relevant infection-related proteins, including ITGB6 and TLR5.

DAPGAN is a deep adaptive perceptual generative adversarial network. It reconstructs high-quality MR images from undersampled k-space data. The method improves the average SSIM from 0.81 to 0.93.

Genome-wide association study meta-analyses were conducted of in situ melanoma vs controls, and in situ vs invasive melanoma (case-case) using 4 population-based genetic cohorts. A strong genetic correlation (genetic r = 0.96; 95% CI, 0.76-1.15) was observed between the 2 classifications. Despite indistinguishable heritability estimates between the melanoma classifications, PRS suggest germline genetics may influence whether a person gets in situ or invasive melanomas.

There is considerable uncertainty regarding the associations between various risk factors and Parkinson's Disease. This study systematically screened and validated a wide range of potential PD risk factors from 502,364 participants in the UK Biobank.

Many disease processes are influenced by circadian clocks and display 24-hour rhythms. Whether disruptions to these rhythms increase stroke risk is unclear. We examined 100 000 participants from the UK Biobank. Suppressed relative amplitude was associated with stroke risk.

The American Heart Association introduced a novel cardiovascular health (CVH) metric, Life's Essential 8 (LE8), for health promotion. The relationship between LE8 and cancer mortality risk remains uncertain. High CVH was associated with reduced overall cancer mortality compared to low CVH. Adherence to ideal CVH correlates linearly with decreased mortality risk across multiple cancer subtypes.

Study aimed to investigate associations of time from waking to first cigarette (TWFC) with all-cause mortality, cardiovascular disease (CVD) mortality and incident CVD. Data were from the UK Biobank, including 32 519 people smoking aged 40-70 years.

Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) have emerged as popular tools for identifying genetic variants that are associated with complex diseases. Most of the multiple phenotype association tests are designed for a single variant, resulting in much lower power. We propose a new method, named Meta-TOW-S, which conducts joint association tests between multiple phenotypes and a set of variants.

The UK Biobank documented 5132 incident VHD cases with a mean follow-up of 12.3 years and 1418 deaths following VHD. Compared to those with a poor lifestyle, women and men with VHD who followed an ideal lifestyle had lower hazard ratios.

Study includes 175 214 cancer-free participants in the UK Biobank. Participants with the highest EAT-Lancet diet scores have a lower risk of lung cancer incidence.

Proteomic biomarkers have shown promise in predicting various cardiovascular conditions. But their utility in assessing the risk of atrial fibrillation (AF) remains unclear. Study aimed to develop a protein-based risk score for predicting incident AF.

Using data from 332,359 UK Biobank participants, we calculated biological aging acceleration, indexed by the presence of leukocyte telomere length (LTL) deviation. The acceleration of facial aging (i.e., looking older than the chronological age) was assessed using a self-report question. Compared to the "Absence of trauma and psychopathology" cluster, the "adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) with psychopathologist" cluster showed strong associations with those aging measurements.

 Accelerated biological aging may be associated with increased risk of esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC) However, its relationship with genetic variation, and its effect on improving risk population stratification remains unknown. We performed an exposome association study to determine potential associated factors associated with EAC.

Higher accelerometer-assessed volume and intensity of physical activity (PA) have been associated with a longer life expectancy. We aimed to produce UK Biobank age-referenced centiles for PA volume andintensity. We modeled the effect of adding moderate (walking) or vigorous (running) activity.

Inflammatory spondyloarthropathies (ISpAs) are associated with pain, fatigue, stiffness, and anxiety. We investigated the combined associations of obesity and physical activity with symptom severity in ISpAs.

Asthma pathophysiology is associated with mitochondrial dysfunction. Mitochondrial DNA copy number (mtDNA-CN) has been used as a proxy of mitochondrial function. Lower levels of mt DNA-CN are associated with asthma diagnosis, severity, and exacerbations.

Study compared race- and ethnicity-specific BMI cutoffs for the three classes of obesity based on equivalent risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) During a median follow-up of 13.8 years among 507,763 individuals, 5.2% developed T2D.

There has been extensive evidence that aging affects human brain function. However, there is no complete picture of what brain functional changes are mostly related to normal aging and how aging affects brain function similarly and differently between males and females. We employ deep learning with explainable AI to discover primary FCs related to progressive aging.

Fatty acids (FAs) have emerged as significant contributors to tumorigenesis, yet prospective evidence regarding their specific effects on lung cancer risk remains scarce. A cohort study was conducted involving 112,547 cancer-free participants from the UK Biobank. After multivariable adjustment, MUFAs were positively associated with lung cancer. In contrast, PUFAs, particularly n-3 PUF as, were associated with a lower risk.

Cross-sectional study included 31,738 UK Biobank participants with high quality optical coherence tomography (OCT) images. High HDL-C levels were associated with thinner RNFL thickness.

Study aimed to investigate the interplay between genetic susceptibility and socioeconomic disparities on psychiatric disorders. Disadvantaged socioeconomic status was associated with the risk of anxiety and depression across all strata of genetic risk. Strong associations were shown for individuals with greater genetic susceptibility.

The retinal age gap (RAG) is emerging as a potential biomarker for various diseases of the human body. However, training generalizable models is hindered by potential shortages of diverse training data. The proposed framework employs a memory-efficient 8-bit quantized version of RETFound.

Sex disparity between metabolic-obesity (defined by body mass index, BMI) phenotypes and obesity-related cancer (ORC) remains unknown. We aimed to systematically assess the association of our newly proposed metabolic-anthropometric phenotypes with risk of overall and site-specific ORC by sex.

Polygenic risk scores (PRS) derived from European individuals have reduced portability across global populations. We investigated the performance of a wide range of PRS models across four ancestry groups (Africans, Europeans, East Asians, and South Asians) for 14 conditions of high-medical interest.

Both body mass index (BMI) and genetic factors independently contribute to cardiovascular disease (CVD) It is unclear whether genetic risk modifies the association between BMI and the risk of incident CVD. This study aimed to investigate whether BMI categories and genetic risk jointly and interactively contribute to CVD events.

The traditional classification of left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) fails to correlate with outcomes among patients with increased LV mass (LVM) Increased LVM was found in 4,255 individuals, with an average age of 64 +/- 7 years. Over a median follow-up period of 5 years (IQR: 4-6), 100 patients (2%) died.

Previous studies have shown that major surgical and medical hospital admissions are associated with cognitive decline in older people. We aimed to validate these findings in a large cohort and investigate associations with neurodegeneration using MRI. We analysed data from the UK Biobank collected from March 13, 2006, to July 16, 2023, linked to the National Health Service Hospital Episode Statistics database.

Lipid-lowering drugs were associated with decreased risk of 21 types of cancers. These included melanoma, skin cancer, and reproductive, hematological, urinary, digestive, nervous, and endocrine system cancers.

We used UK Biobank plasma proteomic data to associate 2,923 plasma proteins with infection mortality before 31st December 2019 (240 events in 52,520 participants) Since many plasma proteins also predict non-infection mortality, we focussed on those associated with >1.5-fold risk of infection mortality in an analysis excluding survivors. Of these, we identified genetically predicted increasing MERTK concentration was associated with increased risk.

Study involved 430,886 participants aged 40 - 69y from UK biobank. Grip strength and walking pace were used as indicators for muscle function. Higher grip strength exhibited a dose-dependent inverse association with incident PAD. Slow walking pace significantly correlated with increased PAD risk.

Traditional association studies of cardiovascular disease (CVD) categorizations and polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) yielded conflicting findings. We propose a novel classification system based on fundamental characteristics of cardiovascular patients. The protective effects of total PUFAs, omega-3 and DHA were mainly reflected in all-cause mortality, and were more significant in Cluster 2 and Cluster 3.

The precise associations between common clinical biomarkers and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) risk remain unclear but hold valuable insights for HCC risk stratification and prediction. We examined the linear and nonlinear associations between the baseline levels of 32 circulating biomarkers. We then developed a point-based risk score to predict HCC.

A child's relative age within their school year ('relative age') is associated with educational attainment and mental health. Hypothesis driven studies often re-examine the same outcomes and exposure, potentially leading to confirmation and reporting biases. We conducted a hypothesis-free investigation of the effects of relative age.

This study investigates the relationship between modifiable risk factors and dementia subtypes using data from 460,799 participants in the UK Biobank. An unfavorable medical history significantly increased the risk of ACD, AD, and VD.

Osteoporosis is a major global health issue, weakening bones and increasing fracture risk. Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) is the standard for measuring bone mineral density. Predictive modeling using genetic and clinical data offers a cost-effective alternative.

 Frailty was associated with an increased risk of chronic liver diseases. Public health strategies should target reducing chronic liver disease risk in frail individuals. Implementing strategies that target frailty could have major public health benefits for liver-related disease prevention.

The association of overweight/obesity and metabolically unhealthy (MU) with the risk of developing Barrett's esophagus (BE) remains uncertain. We analyzed the body mass index (BMI) and metabolic indicators at baseline of 402,510 individuals from the UK Biobank with no history of BE. In Cox regression analyses, both MU and overweight/Obesity were independently associated with BE incidence.

Somatic mutations in the TET2 gene that lead to clonal haematopoiesis (CH) are associated with accelerated atherosclerosis development in mice and a higher risk of atherosclerotic disease in humans. Mechanistically, these observations have been linked to exacerbated vascular inflammation. Study aimed to evaluate whether colchicine, a widely available and inexpensive anti-inflammatory drug, prevents the accelerated Atherosclerosis associated with CH.

 flavonoids are hypothesised to play a role in preventing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and asthma. The objective of this cohort study was to examine associations between flavonoid intake and COPD, asthma and lung function. Compared to low intakes, moderate-high intakes of flavanol monomers were associated with up to an 18% lower risk of incident COPD.

The role of copy number variations (CNVs) in influencing EA/SES/cognition remains unclear. Using a large-scale (n = 305,401) genome-wide CNV-level association analysis, we discovered 33 CNV loci significantly associated with cognition. The genes identified in gene-level tests were enriched in biological pathways such as neurodegeneration, telomere maintenance and axon guidance.

UK Biobank followed 102,424 chronic disease-free participants. 15,672 and 35,801 participants developed 1 and 2+ chronic conditions, respectively. Adherence to a low-inflammatory diet was associated with decreased multimorbidity risk.

Study followed 364,240 participants from UK Biobank aged 40-73 years from 2006 - 2010 to 2021. 29,796 new cases of cardiovascular disease, including 24,797 coronary heart disease and 6229 stroke.

Study included 99,126 participants without depression in the UK Biobank at baseline. The incidence rate of depression was 1.94 per 1000 person-years after an average follow-up of 12.10 years. We found that MVPA and UPF consumption had additive interactions on depression risk.

Malnutrition in people 65 years or over is often cited. This study includes both middle-aged and older adults. Public health policy is highlighting the need to increase disease-free life years.

The role of psychosocial factors in CVD remains underexplored. High levels of social isolation and loneliness were linked to a higher risk of CVD. Mediation analyses pinpointed inflammation as a crucial mediator, especially for loneliness.

The Planetary Health Diet index (PHDI) prioritizes the well-being of both individuals and the planet. But it has yielded mixed results on cardiovascular disease (CVD) Our aim was to assess the association between the PHDI and risk of CVD.

Study sought to elucidate the association of the American Heart Association's Life's Essential 8 (LE8) metrics with the incidence of cardiovascular disease (CVD) among depression participants. 20,832 participants with depression from UK-Biobank were included.

Both ambient air pollution and lifestyle factors contribute to the incidence of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) We aimed to assess the joint associations of ambient airpollution and lifestyle with the NAFLD risk. We also investigated whether lifestyle modifies the association of air pollution with the risk.

Our knowledge of the contribution of genetic interactions (epistasis) to variation in human complex traits remains limited. We propose QuadKAST, a scalable algorithm focused on testing pairwise interaction effects (quadratic effects) within small to medium sized sets of genetic variants.

Physical activity (PA) is considered beneficial for lowering cardiovascular risks following type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and prediabetes. We aimed to describe the intensity-specific dose-response associations of PA and sedentary behavior (SB) with macrovascular and microvascular events among individuals with T2DM.

Cancer associations for coding variants in ATM and CHEK2 were evaluated using whole-exome sequence data from UK Biobank linked to cancer registration data (348 488 participants) PTVs in ATM were associated with increased risks of nine cancers at p, while those in CHEk2 were linked to three. The findings can inform genetic counselling of carriers.

Study included 31,229 dementia-free adults from the UK Biobank between the ages of 40 and 70. Prediabetes and diabetes were both associated with significantly higher BAG. Diabetes was further associated with significant increase in BAG over time. Having a healthy lifestyle significantly attenuated the diabetes-BAG association.

Smoking was reinforced as a potent modifiable risk factor for multiple CH types. Males in socially deprived areas of England had lower risk of mosaic loss of chromosome Y. Females with moderate/high alcohol consumption (2-3 drinks/day) had increased mLOX risk.

Gene-environment interaction (G Ã— E) is likely an important influence shaping individual differences in alcohol misuse (AM), yet it has not been extensively studied in molecular genetic research. We carried out GWEIS for four AM phenotypes in the large UK Biobank sample (N = 360,314) with trauma exposure and socioeconomic status (SES) as moderators of the genetic effects.

The associations between one-carbon metabolism (OCM) nutrients (methionine, folate, vitamin B6, and vitamin B12) and Alzheimer's disease (AD) remains inconclusive. We analyzed data from 192,214 participants who completed at least one 24-hour dietary questionnaire and had no previous history of AD based on the UK Biobank.

As medical imaging technologies advance, these tools are playing a more and more important role in assisting clinical disease diagnosis. Integrating multi-organ imaging with genomic information can significantly enhance the accuracy of disease prediction because many diseases involve both environmental and genetic determinants.

Subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) is caused by rupture of intracranial aneurysm. We aimed to evaluate the association between female hormonal and reproductive factors and SAH.

Fat-to-muscle mass ratio (FMR) has been considered a potentially useful indicator for assessing disease risk. However, the association between FMR and risk of death remains inconclusive. We investigated the associations of FMR with all-cause and cause-specific mortality by sex.

The highly polygenic nature of human longevity renders pleiotropy an indispensable feature of its genetic architecture. We aimed to model the additive variance in lifespan as a function of the cumulative liability from pleiotropic segregating variants. The median lifespan in the highest decile of our composite prognostic index is up to 4.8 years longer.

Study aims to assess the association between intake of different types of fruit (citrus, pomes, tropical fruits, berries, gourds, drupes, dried fruits, and other fruits) and risk of new-onset kidney stones in general population. A total of 205 896 participants with at least one completed 24-h dietary recall from the UK Biobank are included.

Early-onset cancer (diagnosed under age 50) generally manifests as an aggressive disease phenotype. We analyzed a prospective cohort of 66,308 participants who were free of cancer at baseline in the UK Biobank. Higher genetic risk (highest vs lowest tertile of PRS) was associated with significantly increased risks. An unfavorable lifestyle was also associated with higher risk of total cancer and breast cancer in females.

Age at menopause (AOM) has a substantial impact on fertility and disease risk. Many loci with variants that associate with AOM have been identified through genome-wide association studies (GWAS) under an additive model. We found that women homozygous for the stop-gain variant rs117316434(A) in CCDC201 (p.(Arg162Ter) reachedMenopause 9 years earlier than other women (P = 1.3 Ã— 10-15)

Metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MASLD) is the most prevalent chronic liver pathology in western countries. Efforts to identify causal genes for MASLD have been hampered by the relative paucity of human data from gold-standard magnetic resonance quantification of hepatic fat. We created a functional genomic framework to study MASLD genes in vitro using CRISPRi.

Hematuria is an established sign of glomerular disease and can be associated with kidney failure. There has been limited scientific study of this trait. Here, we combined genetic data from the UK Biobank with predicted gene expression and splicing from GTEx kidney cortex samples.

Physical activity has been associated with preventing the development of type 2 diabetes and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease. We analyzed 3072 serum proteins in 26 men, normal weight or overweight, undergoing 12 weeks of a combined strength and endurance exercise intervention. Serum CD300LG exhibited positive associations with insulin sensitivity and angiogenesis-related gene expression in both muscle and fat.

Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is responsible for over 30% of mortality worldwide. Mitochondria are crucial in the pathophysiology, development and progression of CVDs. We investigated the role of genetic variants in both mtDNA and nuclear-encoded mitochondrial genes (NEMG) in CVD, including coronary artery disease, hypertension, and serum lipids in the UK Biobank.

Genetically influenced CAD was associated with a higher risk of self-reported chest pain in both men (OR: 1.27, CI:1.2-1.33) and women. In women only, genetically influenced CAD is associated with an increased risk of back pain and neck and shoulder pain. Sensitivity analysis did not indicate the results were biased by directional pleiotropy.

Telomeres protect chromosome ends from damage and their length is linked with human disease and aging. We developed a joint telomere length metric, combining quantitative PCR and whole-genome sequencing measurements from 462,666 UK Biobank participants. This metric increased SNP heritability, suggesting that it better captures genetic regulation of telitere length.

Physical activity has been associated with preventing the development of type 2 diabetes and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease. We analyzed 3072 serum proteins in 26 men, normal weight or overweight, undergoing 12 weeks of a combined strength and endurance exercise intervention. Serum CD300LG exhibited positive associations with insulin sensitivity and angiogenesis-related gene expression in both muscle and fat.

Heart failure has two major clinical subtypes: HF with reduced (HFrEF) and preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF) Blood pressure and lipid profile are established risk factors of HF. We assessed potential causal effects of blood pressures and lipids on HF subtypes.

High cognitive reserve (CR) has been related to lower dementia risk, but its association with heart disease (HD) is unknown. We aimed to explore the relation of CR to HD and cardiac structure and function. High CR was associated with delayed HD onset by 1.59 (95% CI, 1.37-1.82) years compared with low CR.

VQTL association studies are performed on plasma levels of 1463 proteins. A set of 677 independent vQTLs are identified across 568 proteins. Over 1100 GEIs are identified between 101 proteins and 153 environmental exposures.

"Weekend warrior" pattern, characterized by achieving the most moderate to vigorous physical activity (MVPA) over 1-2 days, as opposed to more evenly distributed patterns, was compared. Study looked at 77,977 participants without prior kidney diseases and with usable accelerometer data.

Diabetes mellitus (DM) increases heart failure incidence and worsens prognosis. We aimed to define the diabetic myocardial transcriptome and validate hits in their circulating protein form to define disease mechanisms and biomarkers.

Physical frailty has been found to increase the risk of multiple adverse outcomes including cardiovascular disease (CVD) in diabetic patients. But whether this could be modified by traditional risk factor control remains unknown. We aimed to explore the joint and interaction effects of frailty and traditional riskFactor control on therisk of CVD.

In diabetes mellitus patients, hyperuricemia may lead to the development of diabetic complications, including macrovascular and microvascular dysfunction. The level of blood uric acid in diabetic patients is obtained by sampling peripheral blood from the patient, which is an invasive procedure and not conducive to routine monitoring. We developed deep learning algorithm to detect noninvasively hyperurics from retina photographs and metadata.

This is a cross-sectional study using data from 422,693 UK Biobank participants aged from 40 to 69 years old, during 2006-2010. LTL was measured as the ratio of telomere repeat number to a single-copy gene.

There is a lack of research examining the interplay between objectively measured physical activity volume and intensity with life expectancy. Individuals from UK Biobank with wrist-worn accelerometer data were included. Over a median follow-up of 6.9 years, there were 1719 deaths.

Smoking is a well-known risk factor for atrial fibrillation (AF) But the association of smoking timing with AF risk remains unclear. This study aimed to investigate the association between smoking timing and AF risk.

Dietary advanced glycation end products (AGEs) may promote oxidative stress and inflammation in the gastrointestinal tract. The aim of this study is to investigate the association between dietary AGE intake and the risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)

The associations of age at diagnosis of breast cancer with incident myocardial infarction (MI) and heart failure (HF) remain unexamined. Addressing this problem could promote understanding of the cardiovascular impact of Breast cancer. Data were obtained from the UK Biobank.

Circulating insulin and insulin-like growth factor-1 (IGF-1) concentrations are positively correlated with adiposity. However, the causal effects of insulin and IGF-1 on adiposity are unclear. We performed two-sample Mendelian randomization analyses to estimate the likely causal effects.

The influence of air pollution on dynamic changes in clinical state from healthy to atrial fibrillation (AF), further AF-related complications and ultimately, death are unclear. We retrieved 442,150 participants free of heart failure, myocardial infarction (MI), stroke and dementia at baseline from UK Biobank. Over a 12.6-year median follow-up, a total of 21,670 incident AF patients were identified, of whom, 4103 developed complications and 1331 died.

The Prostate, Lung, Colorectal and Ovarian (PLCO) Cancer Screening Trial was conducted from 1993 to 2001 in the United States. FSG screening was significantly associated with a reduction in mortality in both the medium-risk and high-risk groups.

The cerebellum is linked to motor coordination, cognitive and affective processing, in addition to a wide range of clinical illnesses. To enable robust quantification of individual cerebellar anatomy relative to population norms, we mapped the normative development and aging of the Cerebellum across the lifespan.

The associations of age at diagnosis of breast cancer with incident myocardial infarction (MI) and heart failure (HF) remain unexamined. Data were obtained from the UK Biobank. Among breast cancer participants, younger age was significantly associated with elevated risks of MI (hazard ratio [HR] = 1.36)

Osteoarthritis is a prevalent musculoskeletal condition. The role of specific serum biomarkers, such as calcium, vitamin D, and C-reactive protein (CRP), in predicting mortality remains unclear. This observational study analyzed longitudinal data from over 500,000 participants in the UK Biobank.

Apolipoprotein E &#949;4 (APOE4) is a strong genetic risk factor of Alzheimer's disease and metabolic dysfunction. Whether APOE4 and markers of metabolic dysfunction synergistically impact the deterioration of white matter (WM) integrity in older adults remains unknown.

A novel algorithm, AlphaMissense, has been shown to have an improved ability to predict the pathogenicity of rare missense genetic variants. However, it is not known whether Alpha Missense improves the ability of gene-based testing to identify disease-influencing genes.

Short, but not long, sleep duration was linked to a 33% increased risk of HF. Engaging in sufficient PA, especially recommended MVPA or VPA, can partially mitigate this risk.

Current approaches used to identify biological subtypes of major depressive disorder (MDD) mainly focus on clinical characteristics that cannot be linked to specific biological models. Here, we examined multimorbidities to identify MDD subtypes with distinct genetic and non-genetic factors.

Elevated allostatic load (AL) has been associated with the risk and poor prognosis of many chronic diseases. The association between AL and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is unknown. High AL biomarker panel was associated with a greater risk of IBD.

Evidence shows the beneficial effect of adhering to a regular physical activity (PA) pattern on brain health. Whether the 'weekend warrior' pattern, characterized by concentrated moderate-to-vigorous PA (MVPA), is associated with brain health is unclear.

Study involved 9029 men who drank only beer/cider, and 6989 women drinking only red wine. Alcohol consumption was captured by self-reported questionnaire and reported as units per week. Arterial stiffness index (ASI) was estimated using photoplethysmography.

Aims to examine bidirectional association between type 2 diabetes (T2D) and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) Participants free of IBS at baseline in the UK Biobank were included in the analysis of T2D and incident IBS.

Imbalances in gut microbiota have been proposed as a potential contributing factor to diabetic complications. However, the causal relationship remains incompletely understood. We found negative associations between Bifidobacterial order and Actinomycete phylum with DKD in type 1 diabetes. Conversely, these taxa showed positive associations with ketoacidosis in type 2 diabetes.

Study looked at relationship between cardiorespiratory fitness (CRF) and liver fat content (LFC) CRF was estimated with bicycle ergometer fitness testing. LFC was quantified through liver proton density fat fraction (PDFF)

We conducted this cross-sectional study to investigate the independent associations between lipid metabolites and osteoporotic fractures. Serum lipid, lipoprotein levels and nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) based metabolic biomarkers were measured at the baseline. Statistically significant disparities were identified in NMR-based biomarkers among men and women with incident fractures.

Natural polyamines, including spermidine (SPD), spermine (SPM) and putrescine (PUT), are evolutionarily conserved endogenous molecules crucially involved in central cellular processes. Their physiological importance may extend to the maintenance of cognitive function during aging. Few studies have explored the link between dietary polyamines and dementia risk.

Genome-wide association studies have revealed many brain disorder-associated SNPs residing in the noncoding genome. We present an unsupervised Bayesian framework to identify disease-associated genes by integrating risk SNPs with long-range chromatin interactions.

A total of 31 433 participants with prediabetes and diabetes from the UK Biobank were included. Information on the intake of SSBs, ASBs and NJs was accessed by 24-hour dietary recalls from 2009 to 2012. The study outcome was new-onset AF.

Study included 204,847 participants (44.7% males) from the UK Biobank. Over a median follow-up of 9 years, the study documented 1,696 cases of ADRD, 1,093 cases of PD, and 419 neurodegenerative-related deaths. Those with the highest intake of unsweetened and caffeinated coffee (&#8805; 3 cups/day) showed hazard ratios (95% confidence intervals) of 0.75 (0.62, 0.91) for ADRD.

Study looked at association of glycated haemoglobin (HbA1c) and serum glucose with intraocular pressure (IOP) Participants were selected from the UK Biobank, excluding those with eye conditions that may affect IOP. Those with diabetes had higher IOP and a higher prevalence of ocular hypertension.

Study examined the association between ultra-processed food (UPF) consumption and rheumatoid arthritis (RA) Study included 207,012 participants without RA at recruitment and completed 24 h dietary recalls. There was a 6% elevated risk of RA incidence per SD increase in UPF intake.

Some observational studies suggest a lower mortality associated with higher BMI. Using BMI-associated genetic variants can avoid these biases and generate more valid estimates. Future studies should be designed carefully to produce unbiased estimates that account for reverse causation.

Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common heart arrhythmia worldwide. It is linked to a higher risk of mortality and morbidity. To predict AF and AF-related complications, clinical risk scores are commonly employed. But their predictive accuracy is generally limited, given the complexity of patients with AF.

We used CatBoost machine learning to model and discover biomarkers of depression in UK Biobank data sets. Of the nine diagnostic models for depression, the performance of the traditional risk factor model was improved after the addition of proteomic data. KEGG pathway analysis of 45 screened proteins showed that the most significant pathway involved was the cytokine-cytokine receptor interaction.

The role of main work during the life course in predicting frailty, a typical geriatric syndrome, is still largely unknown. We aimed to investigate the potential association between the main work done during. the life with frailty and pre-frailty among participants 60 years and older of the UK Biobank study.

VAT is recognized as an important target for cancer prevention. Despite the recognized role of visceral adipose tissue (VAT) in carcinogenesis, its independent association with cancer risk beyond traditional obesity measures remains unknown.

Fruit consumption has been associated with a lower cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk but the underlying mechanisms are unclear. We investigated the cross-sectional and prospective associations of fruit consumption with markers of adiposity, blood pressure, lipids, low-grade inflammation, glycaemia, and oxidative stress.

Allometric body shape index (ABSI) and hip index (HI), as well as multi-trait body shape phenotypes, have not yet been compared in their associations with inflammatory markers. The aim of this study was to examine the relationship between novel and traditional anthropometric indexes with inflammation using data from the EPIC and UK Biobank cohorts.

Finemap-MiXeR is a novel method for finemapping causal variants from GWAS summary statistics. It controls for correlation among variants due to linkage disequilibrium. The method is computationally efficient in several aspects.

Perimenopause (that is, the years around the final menstrual period (FMP) is associated with increased risk of developing psychiatric disorders compared with the late reproductive stage. Information on menopausal timing and psychiatric history was obtained from nurse-administered interviews and online questionnaires from 128,294 female participants within UK Biobank. Incidence rates of psychiatric disorders were compared to the reference premenopausal period.

Parkinson's disease (PD) is a neurodegenerative influenced by various clinical factors. The potential relationship between renal function and the risk of PD remains poorly understood. This study aims to explore the association between kidney function and risk of developing PD.

Parkinson's disease (PD) is a debilitating neurodegenerative disorder. The rising global incidence highlights the need for the identification of modifiable risk factors. In a gene-based burden test of rare variants, we discovered a novel association between loss-of-function variants in ITSN1 and PD.

A number of studies have explored the link between neurodegenerative disorders (NDDs) and albumin, the main protein in human plasma. The results have been inconsistent, highlighting the necessity for a detailed systemic analysis. We investigated the relationship between baseline levels of serum and urine albumin and the occurrence of common NDDs.

Despite numerous studies investigating the association between androgenetic alopecia (AGA) and serum uric acid (SUA), the causal relationship between AGA and SUA remains unknown. We utilized bidirectional Mendelian randomization (MR) to explore the causality between SUA and AGA. We chose single nucleotide polymorphisms associated with genome-wide significance.

High levels of device-measured physical activity were associated with cardiac remodelling within normal ranges. Associations with MVPA were also observed for the right ventricle and the left/right atria, with an inverse association observed for LV ejection fraction.

The triglyceride-glucose (TyG) index performs better at reflecting insulin resistance when combined with waist circumference (WC), body mass index (BMI), and waist-to-height ratio (WHtR) than when used alone. This study aimed to prospectively examine the relationships between TyG, TyG-BMI, Tyg-WC, and TyG -WHtr with the incidence of myocardial infarction (MI) and its subtypes.

The study included 202,063 UK Biobank participants conducted between 2006 and 2022. It found the highest quintile for hPDI and uPDI were associated with an increased risk of osteoporosis. BMI was identified as an important mediator in the association.

Genome-wide association study (GWAS) data on sarcopenia-associated traits including appendicular lean mass, low handgrip strength, and usual walking speeds were obtained from the UK Biobank. MR analysis showed that high appendicularLean mass was positive associated with the risk of developing benign neoplasm of bone and articular cartilage. At the same time there is no statistically significant association was found of traits related sarcopenian to malignant neoplasms.

Despite a proposed causal role for low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) in aortic stenosis (AS), randomized controlled trials of lipid-lowering therapy failed to prevent severe AS. We aimed to assess the impact on AS and peak velocity across the aorta conferred by lifelong alterations in LDL-C levels mediated by protein-disrupting variants in three genes for LDL metabolism.

Long-term breast cancer survivors are known to develop second malignancies. Second primary lung cancer (SPLC) is one common type. Smoking was identified as a main risk factor for SPLC among BC survivors.

The rate of AdSD in the cervical or lumbar spine will be less than 3% annually after primary fusion. Unemployed/Retired status achieved significance as a risk factor for AdSD. BMI, age, gender, race, tobacco use, area deprivation, and osteoporosis were not significant.

The study looked at the impact of COVID-19 on the long-term risk of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary outcomes and other digestive abnormalities in various follow-up periods. The risk profile was most pronounced during the initial 3 months, but persisted for >6 months in validation cohorts, but not in the discovery cohort.

This study aimed to investigate the associations between carbohydrate intake and gout risk. We included 187,387 participants who were free of gout at baseline and completed at least one dietary assessment in the UK Biobank. Over a median follow-up of 11.69 years, 2548 incident cases of gouts were recorded. Total carbohydrate intake was associated with a reduced gout. risk.

Fish oil use was inversely associated with the incidence of CKD (HR 0.90; 95% CI: 0.83, 0.97) Risk was mediated by serum levels of HbA1c, CRP and HDL-C.

Alcohol-associated liver disease (ALD) is a public health concern. ALD patients often have psychiatric comorbidities, but the effects of psychiatric interventions on ALD are not well-established. This study explores the prognostic impact of psychiatric intervention on ALd within UK Biobank cohort.

Study aimed to elucidate the causal relationship between Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) and Chronic Respiratory Diseases (CRDs) Data were sourced from the FinnGen Consortium and UK Biobank. No significant causal links were found between OSA and other CRDs.

Eating whole grains, fruits and vegetables lowered the risk of dementia by 31%, study finds. That benefit held true even for people with existing diagnoses of cardiometabolic conditions. Brain scans of those who followed an anti-inflammatory diet showed significantly lower levels of neurodegeneration and vascular injury.

HFE p.C282Y+/+ (homozygous) genotype and central adiposity both increase liver disease and diabetes risks, but combined effects are unclear. We estimated waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) associations with incident clinical outcomes in routine care in the UK Biobank community cohort. We found positive linear WHR relationships for hospital inpatient diagnosed liver fibrosis/cirrhosis, liver cancer, and type 2 diabetes.

We conducted pre-diagnostic metabolome-wide analyses among 249,677 UK Biobank participants. 107 metabolites were associated with incidence of hospitalized gout (N=2735) before urate adjustment. Findings persisted when including non-hospitalised incident gout cases.

Study looked at extent to which joint risk factor control might attenuate the excess risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) in participants with obesity. The optimal controlling of all six risk factors was associated with a 49% decrease in risk of CKD. The protective correlations were more pronounced in men compared with women.

Diet-disease association studies increasingly use dietary patterns (DPs) to account for the complexity of the exposure. We assessed if a DP associated with type 2 diabetes mellitus, CVD, and all-cause mortality is also associated with colorectal cancer. DP1 was characterised by increased intake of chocolate and confectionery.

The association between physical activity and venous thromboembolism (VTE) remains unclear. In the UK Biobank, 1,182 incident VTE cases were documented during a median follow-up of 6.18 years. The participants in the highest quartiles of total volume of physical activity had lower adjusted HRs (95% CIs) for VTE than those of the lowest quartiles.

Liver expression quantitative-trait locus (eQTL) meta-analysis data on 1,183 participants. We found 9,013 eQTL signals for 6,564 genes; 23% of eGenes had two signals, and 6% had three or more signals. Isolating signals by conditional analysis prior to coloc resulted in 37% more colocalizations.

Previous research on the association between physical activity (PA) and kidney function is inconsistent. Increasing PA is modestly associated with improving annual eGFR CysC and reduced risk of RDKF.

Proteomics and metabolomics offer substantial potential for advancing kidney transplant research. To achieve this, adequate quality and numbers of biological samples are required. Rich, yet unverified resources of recipient material are the serum repositories present in the immunological laboratories of kidney transplant centers.

Sex-based differences in cardiovascular health (CVH) and the incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) among women at different menopausal stages and men. The Accelerated Failure Time model assessed the impact of CVH on the time to T2DM onset.

Constipation shares common risk factors with hypertension and is associated with an increased risk of several cardiovascular diseases. Traditional cardiovascular risk factors, including hypertension, only explain part of major adverse cardiac events (MACE) Understanding what other risk factors contribute to MACE is essential for prevention.

Recent observational and Mendelian randomization analyses have reported significant effects of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (VLDL-C) on risk that is independent of ApoB. In the UK Biobank, Apo B was highly correlated with VLDL -C. The independent effect of HDL-C remained robust (HR, 0.86;  P  P =0.029)

 psoriasis is characterized by erythema and scaly skin lesions. There is a causal relationship between anti-Epstein Barr virus antibody and Psoriasis. The underlying immunological mechanism also provides a new perspective for experimental research.

Constipation is common in patients with Parkinson's disease (PD) But its impact on incident PD remains uncertain. We aimed to prospectively investigate constipation symptoms and the risk of PD.

Lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC) is a major subtype of non-small cell lung cancer with a high mortality rate. Identifying plasma proteins associated with LUSC could provide new insights into the pathophysiology of the disease and potential therapeutic targets. HSPA1L, PCSK7, POLI, SPINK2, TCL1A, and VARS were identified as potentially causal for LUSc risk.

This study evaluated the association between physical activity and the risk of sepsis. It was based on whole-genome association study data from the UK Biobank and the FinnGen database. It found that the risk was significantly inversely associated with genetically predicted MVPA and VPA.

 magnesium deficiency is linked to higher cardiovascular disease risk, but its association with chronic kidney disease (CKD) remains unclear. This study aimed to evaluate the relationship between dietary magnesium intake and CKD development in adults with clinically normal kidney function.

Ischemic heart disease (IHD) is the single leading cause of mortality globally. Statins are the mainstay for IHD treatment. However, the specific mechanisms underlying statins' benefits on IHD have not been clarified. To examine the mechanisms through proteins, we used two-step Mendelian randomization approach.

Air pollution has been linked to gastrointestinal (GI) diseases, but their relationship remains unclear. We extracted significantly modulated genes and CpG sites related to air pollution (PM2.5, PM10, and NOx) and transportation noise pollution (aircraft, railway, and traffic road noise) Genome-wide methylation analysis and colocalization analysis were performed to disentangle the relationship between pollution-related blood DNA methylation (DNAm) alterations and GI diseases risk.

Study examined relationship between major plasma n6 PUFA, linoleic acid (LA), and total and cause-specific mortality. Comparing LA Q5 to Q1, the hazard ratio (HR, 95% CI) for total mortality was 0.80 (0.76, 0.84)

Population-based cohort study analyzed UK Biobank participants with whole-exome sequencing, electrocardiogram, and cardiovascular magnetic resonance data. A likely pathogenic/pathogenic (LP/P) TTR variant was detected in 473 (0.1%) participants, with Val142Ile being the most prevalent. LP/P variants were associated with higher left ventricular mass indexed to body surface area.

The relationship between serum lipids and sarcopenia remains unclear due to conflicting results in previous studies. Data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) were analysed using multivariable regression and restricted cubic splines. Elevated TG, but not HDL-C, LDL-C or TC levels, was significantly associated with an increased risk of sarc Openia.

Air pollution, particularly fine particulate matter and gaseous pollutants including NO 2 and NO x, presents significant public health challenges. While the harmful effects of these pollutants are well-documented, the molecular mechanisms underlying their impact on health remain incompletely understood.

Congenital long QT syndrome (LQTS) diagnosis is complicated by limited genetic testing at scale, low prevalence, and normal QT corrected interval. We developed a deep learning approach combining electrocardiogram (ECG) waveform and electronic health record data.

Individuals with psychiatric disorders have been reported to have elevated levels of inflammatory biomarkers. This study assessed associations between inflammation biomarkers and subsequent psychiatric disorders risk. Leukocytes, haptoglobin, CRP, and IgG were associated with a subsequent risk of psychiatric disorders.

Prostate cancer remains the second leading cause of cancer death in men in the United States. We set out to identify germline variants associated with cases of lethal prostate cancer (LPCa) We compared whole-exome sequencing data of 550 LPCa patients to 488 healthy male controls.

Artificial intelligence (AI)-enabled electrocardiography (ECG) can be used to predict risk of future disease and mortality but has not yet been adopted into clinical practice. Existing model predictions do not have actionability at an individual patient level, explainability, or biological plausibi. We sought to address these limitations by developing the AI-ECG risk estimator (AIRE) platform.

 Classical gene-by-environment interaction (GxE) analysis can be used to characterize genetic effect heterogeneity but has a high multiple testing burden in the context of genome-wide association studies (GWAS) We adapt a colocalization method, SharePro, to account for effect heterogeneity in fine-mapping and identify candidates for GxE analysis with reduced multiple testing burdens. SharePro demonstrates improved power for both fine- mapping and G xE analysis compared to existing methods.

Study assesses the validity of a self-reported clinical diagnosis of schizophrenia. Polygenic risk scores (PRS) and phenotypes relating to demographics, education and employment were compared across diagnostic groups.

TM6SF2 -rs58542926-T is associated with increased cirrhosis and modestly decreased coronary artery disease prevalence. The relative effects of TM6 SF2 genotype on major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) vs. liver-related events (LRE) is not known. We utilized the UK Biobank, a prospective cohort with genetic and inpatient diagnosis data.

Study aims to explore whether conventional and emerging biomarkers could improve risk discrimination and calibration in secondary prevention of recurrent atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) We analysed any improvement in C indices and net reclassification index (NRI) for future ASCVD events.

Cardiometabolic multimorbidity (CMM) and aging are increasing public health concerns. This prospective study used UK Biobank cohort to investigate relationship between biological aging and the trajectory of CMM to dementia and mortality.

Previous genome-wide association studies of depression have primarily focused on common variants, limiting our comprehensive understanding of the genetic architecture. We identified 22 genes associated with depressive symptoms, including 6 newly discovered genes (TRIM27, UBD, SVOP, ADGRB2, IRF2BPL, and ANKRD12)

Previous studies have shown inconsistent associations between serum lipids and the risks of fractures and osteoporosis in the general population. This prospective cohort study analysed data from 414 302 UK Biobank participants.

Kidney insufficiency is defined as the early stage of heart failure. Mendelian randomization analyses based on several large heart failure cohorts suggest no linear causal effect between kidney function and heart failure (HF) However, whether there is a non-linear causal relationship between kidneyfunction and HF has not been reported.

Cognitive reserve (CR) has been linked to dementia, yet its influence on the risk of depression and related outcomes remains unknown. We aimed to examine the association of CR with depression and subsequent dementia or death, and to assess the extent to which CR is related to depression-free survival. A comprehensive CR indicator (low, moderate, and high) was created using latent class analysis.

Automated algorithms are regularly used to analyse cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) images. We outline a visual quality control (VQC) process for image analysis using automated batch processing. We assess the performance of automated analysis and the reliability of replacing visual checks with statistical outlier (SO) removal approach.

CKD is highly prevalent among people with diabetes. There is limited evidence on dietary risk factors for CKD. We examined the associations between healthy and less healthy plant-based diets (PBDs) and the risk of CKD among those with diabetes and to identify potential underlying mechanisms.

30% of adults globally suffer from sleep disorders. There are few longitudinal studies on the association between vitamin C and these disorders. We enrolled 68,221 participants from the UK Biobank. Vitamin C intake at the Q4 level (132.88-191.51 mg/d) was significantly associated with a reduced risk of sleep disorders, with an HR (95% CI) of 0.78.

Synthetic data promise privacy-preserving data sharing for healthcare research and development. Compared with other privacy-enhancing approaches, analyses performed on synthetic data can be applied downstream without modification.

The triglyceride (TG) content of low-density lipoprotein (LDL-TG) has been shown to be more predictive of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) events than the cholesterol content of LDL. The study was to develop an equation for estimating LDL-TG based on the standard lipid panel and to compare it to estimated LDL-C as a risk biomarker.

Gestational diabetes mellitus is associated with a higher risk of cardiovascular diseases, but the causality remains unclear. This study investigated the relationship between genetic predisposition to gestational diabetes and the risk of coronary artery disease. Type 2 diabetes and hypertension were identified as mediators of the relationship.

Body composition at early and middle age may be indicative of the risk of MND development. We performed a cohort study in the UK Biobank to assess the association of developmental body metrics and premorbid body composition measures.

Previous studies have established that rare biallelic SYNJ1 mutations cause autosomal recessive parkinsonism and Parkinson's disease (PD) We analyzed 8165 PD cases, 818 early-onset-PD (EOPD,   20) in the Sac1 SY NJ1 domain and PD (Pfdr = 0.040)

Shapley values have been used extensively in machine learning. Recently, feature selection methods using predictive Shapley values and p-values have been introduced, including powershap. We present a novel feature selection method, LLpowershap, that takes forward these recent advances.

Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) is the most ubiquitous parameter in cardiac imaging examinations. This is a prospective cohort study based on UK Biobank. Incident cardiovascular disease was the outcome, including heart failure, atrial fibrillation, ischemic heart disease, and myocardial infarction. A U-shaped relationship was observed between quantified LVEF and cardiovascular events risk.

Rosuvastatin and atorvastatin are the most widely prescribed moderate- to high-intensity statins. Evidence on their efficacy and safety during actual use is limited. This study found differences in risks for some important outcomes.

Arterial stiffness is a powerful independent risk factor for adverse cardiovascular events. Age and raised blood pressure (BP) are major contributors to increased arterial stiffness. Arterial Stiffness Index (ASI) simplifies the assessment of stiffness using a pulse waveform.

Heart failure is a common cardiovascular complication to diabetes. Increased fibrosis of the myocardium has been suggested to be a mechanism. No convincing clinical evidence has so far been presented. A better understanding of how myocardial tissue characteristics influence functional aberration in diabetes could aid diagnosis and treatment.

UK Biobank data was used for observational analysis. Cox proportional hazard models were used to quantify the observational associations between liver enzymes and risks of 1109 diseases. Two-sample MR was performed to replicate the identified observational associations. In MR, 52 associations were replicated (10 for ALP, 14 for ALT, 10 for AST and 18 for GGT)

Obesity has been associated with risk of atrial fibrillation (AF), but once AF is established, it seems to be favorable. Body mass index (BMI) does not distinguish between fat and lean body mass, and could lead to the potential misclassification of risk categories. A total of 8,325 patients with AF at baseline were included in the prospective cohort study using UK biobank data.

Cardiac contractility index (CCI) is a simple non-invasive measure of myocardial contractility defined by systolic blood pressure divided by indexed left ventricular end-systolic volume. Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) is essential for phenotyping patients with suspected heart failure (HF) It is load dependent and insensitive to subtle subclinical ventricular dysfunction. We explored the relationship between CCI and laboratory and imaging biomarkers, including LVEF and LV strain.

Having a larger body size at age 10 was strongly associated with being overweight or obese in adulthood. Similar patterns were observed for colorectal, endometrial, kidney, pancreatic and esophageal cancer. Maintaining a healthy weight in adulthood may help mitigate the risk of obesity-related cancers.

People who recalled maltreatment in childhood are at higher risk of T2D in adulthood, partly due to obesity. Excess T2d risk among those reporting maltreatment could be reduced by 39% if their BMI was comparable to participants who had not been maltreated, assuming causality.

Identifying genetic drivers of chronic diseases is necessary for drug discovery. We develop a machine learning-assisted genetic priority score, which we call ML-GPS. It incorporates genetic associations with predicted disease phenotypes to enhance target discovery.

PWAS (proteome-wide association study) is an innovative genetic association approach that complements widely used methods like GWAS. Results from PWAS cover 99 common diseases and conditions, each with over 10,000 diagnosed individuals per phenotype.

Study included 147,188 participants with hypertension and complete data on modifiable risk factors from the UK Biobank. Health score was constructed from eight modifiablerisk factors, including four lifestyle behaviors and four cardiometabolic factors. biomarkers including inflammation and renal function collectively explained 46.60% of the associations between the combined lifestyle factors and infectious disease risk.

UK Biobank dementia-free participants were followed from one year after recruitment (median date: 24 January, 2010) until 31 October, 2022. Psychosocial states were measured by 22 items related to five dimensions. We identified clusters of individuals with distinct psychosocial patterns using latent class analysis.

This study aims to identify colorectal cancer (CRC)-related proteomic profiles and develop a prediction model for CRC onset. We integrate proteomic. profiles with genetic and non-genetic factors (QCancer-15) to improve the risk stratification and estimate. of personalized initial screening age.

Patients heterozygous for germline CBL loss-of-function (LOF) variants can develop myeloid malignancy, autoinflammation, or both. We observed an upregulation of the inflammatory gene expression signature in whole blood from these patients. These patients had constitutively activated monocytes that secreted 10 to 100 times more inflammatory cytokines.

Study examined the relationship between the number of live births and bipolar disorder and major depression. Cross-sectional study utilized data from >55,000 women in the UK Biobank. Results indicated that live births serve as an independent protective factor against BDMD.

Gout is a chronic disease that is caused by an innate immune response to deposited monosodium urate crystals in the setting of hyperuricemia. Here, we provide insights into the molecular mechanism of the poorly understood inflammatory component of gout. We detected 377 loci and 410 genetically independent signals (149 previously unreported loci in urate and gout)

Adiposity is an established risk factor for multiple diseases. causal relationships of different adiposity types with circulating protein biomarkers have not been systematically investigated. Genetically-predicted body mass index (BMI), body fat percentage (BF%), waist circumference (WC), and waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) are significantly lower in Chinese adults.

A potential protective role of cognitive reserve proxies against frailty has been suggested in older adults. We explored the cross-sectional association between cognitive reserve indicators and frailty phenotype. Data were obtained from the UK Biobank.

The role of environmental factors in stroke has received public attention in the last few centuries. Air quality and ambient temperature are the most common types. This study aimed to investigate the effects of long-term air pollution and ambient temperatures on the occurrence of ischemic stroke.

Tonsillectomy was associated with a lower risk of mild (odds ratio [95% confidence interval]: 0.80 [0.75-0.86]) and severe COVID-19 in the UK Biobank. The associations did not differ substantially by sex, age or Townsend deprivation index. Levels of blood inflammatory, lipid and metabolic biomarkers did, however, not differ greatly by history of surgical removal of tonsils.

Time spent sitting above 10 h/day was associated with both higher orthostatic circulatory disease and major CVD risk. Time spent standing was not associated with major CVB risk. The deleterious associations of overall stationary time were primarily driven by sitting.

Study included 7248 adults with diabetes from the UK Biobank who had complete dietary data. 565 (7.8%) participants developed new-onset CKD during a median follow-up of 11.96 years. Inverse relationship of dietary Mn intake with CKD found in people with diabetes at glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) and#8805;6.5%.

Severe coronary artery disease (CAD) represents an advanced arterial narrowing, often associated with critical complications like myocardial infarction and angina. Study aimed to comprehensively investigate determinants of severe and multi-vessel CAD manifestations.

Aortic aneurysms are an important clinical problem. High-resolution 3D CMR sequences allow detailed aortic assessment. But they are time-consuming which limits their use in screening routine cardiac scans and in population studies. A new method of producing isotropic 3D aorti segmentations from routine CMR 2D anisotropic localizers shows good agreement with segmentation made directly from 3D isotropics.

Systemic changes in multiple diseases may influence the onset of dementia. The specific temporality between exposure diseases and dementia remains uncertain. This study aims to yield a global picture of precursor diseases to dementia and to provide detailed instructions for risk management.

We explored the association between history of traumatic brain injury with cognitive performance and imaging measures of white matter integrity. Traumatic brain injury was associated with poorer cognitive and imaging phenotypes. The strongest deleterious associations were for narrow-band injury.

Metabolic abnormality has a stronger association with dementia than obesity. Metabolically abnormal non-obesity and obesity are associated with higher risks of incident dementia. Recovering from an abnormal metabolic status to normal reduces the risk of dementia in populations without obesity.

The hippocampus, with its complex subfields, is linked to numerous neuropsychiatric traits. Given the hippocampus's high heritability, considering hippocampal and subfield volumes (HASV) as endophenotypes is essential. Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) on 24 HASV traits were conducted. Gene set analysis revealed enrichment of neural differentiation and signaling pathways.

White matter (WM) brain age, a neuroimaging-derived biomarker indicating WM microstructural changes, helps predict dementia and neurodegenerative disorder risks. The cumulative effect of chronic stress on WM brain aging remains unknown. We assessed cumulative stress using a multi-system composite allostatic load (AL) index.

 Depression is a modifiable risk factor for dementia. It remains unclear whether there are sex differences in how depression affects dementia risk. Women reported greater depression severity than men. Hippocampal volumes found to mediate the relationship between depression severity and fluid intelligence only in women.

Noninvasive tools (NITs) are currently used to stratify the risk of having or developing hepatic steatosis or fibrosis. Their performance and a proteomic-enabled improvement in forecasting long-term cardio-renal-metabolic morbidity, malignancies and all-cause mortality are lacking.

There is uncertainty about the associations between moderate alcohol consumption and liver-related outcomes. We aimed to explore the associations of moderate drinking with cirrhosis, steatotic liver disease (SLD), and liver cancer in a large cohort study. Compared with non-drinkers, moderate drinkers had a lower risk of SLD.

We aimed to identify ethnicity-specific BMI and waist circumference cutoffs for cardiovascular disease (CVD) and to define optimal thresholds for CVD risk and subjective wellbeing (SWB) We used data from 296,767 UK Biobank participants and adjusted logistic and linear regression models.

Cancer survivors have an increased risk of incident heart failure (HF) attributable to shared risk factors and cancer treatment-induced cardiac dysfunction. Selection for HF screening depends on risk assessment, but the optimal means of assessing risk is undefined.

Myocardial Infarction (MI) and severe mental disorders (SMDs) are two types of highly prevalent and complex disorders. The contributions of common and rare genetic variants to their comorbidity arestill unclear.

Study looked at 73,630 adults aged 40-79 years in the UK Biobank accelerometer substudy. Participants wore wrist-attached accelerometers for a duration of 7 days, which was used to compute the Sleep Regularity Index (SRI) Compared with regular sleepers, irregular sleepers were at higher risk of T2D incidence.

Allostatic load (AL) is an objective measure of the biological components of chronic stress within clinical practice. This study investigates the association between AL and these mental disorders. High AL is positively associated with increased risks of depression, anxiety, and suicide.

Aspirin was not associated with increased risk of overall (hazard ratio (HR): 1.11, 95% confidence interval (CI): 0.95-1.27,  P  = 0.188) or fatal ICH. Subgroup analysis indicated that aspirin use in individuals older than 65 years or with concurrent anticoagulant use was correlated with increased ICH risk.

Acute pancreatitis (AP) is a complex disease most commonly caused by gallstones, alcohol intake, or hypertriglyceridemia. Identifying individuals with a high genetic susceptibility to AP could contribute to a better risk stratification in the clinic.

Chronic inflammation is associated with the etiology of various cancers. There is a lack of systematic research in urologic cancers. This study aims to use a two-sample Mendelian randomization (MR) approach to evaluate the role of circulating cytokines.

Race and SES were important determinants of brain volumetric outcomes, with partial mediation of racial/ethnic disparities through SES, lifestyle, health-related, and cognition factors. Over 20% of the total effect (TE) of race/ethnicity on WMH was explained by the indirect effect.

Study aimed to identify low- and high-risk diabetes groups within prediabetes populations using data from the Taiwan Biobank. High-risk groups strongly associated male gender, higher BMI, smoking, and metabolic markers. Tailored preventive strategies, particularly for young males in Taiwan, are crucial to reducing T2D risk.

Study used UK Biobank data to find the genetic determinants of COVID-19 vaccine-induced seropositivity and breakthrough infections. Findings confirmed link between HLA region and seroconversion after first and second doses.

MVPA is a measure of moderate-to-vigorous physical activity in the UK Biobank study. Risk reductions in all-cause mortality and CVD incidence can be achieved with as little as 10 and 15 min of MVPA per week, respectively. The highest additional benefit of adding more minutes per week was observed between 100 and 250 weekly minutes.

Stroke risk factors may contribute to cognitive decline and dementia by altering brain tissue integrity. If their effects on brain are nonnegligible, the target regions for stroke rehabilitation with brain stimulation may be biased due to the pre-existing brain differences caused by these risk factors. Here, we investigated the effects of stroke risk factors on cortical thickness and surface area in individuals without a history of stroke.

Polygenic risk score (PRS) and rare monogenic variant screening are valuable tools for predicting cancer risk. Integrating both common and rare genetic variants is crucial for accurate risk assessment. Individuals in high-PRS groups with rare high-impact gene variants show up to 15- and 22-fold higher risk for breast and prostate cancers.

COVID-19 is associated with acute risk of major adverse cardiac events (MACE), including myocardial infarction, stroke, and mortality (all-cause) However, the duration and underlying determinants of heightened risk of cardiovascular disease and MACE post-CO VID-19 are not known. Data from the UK Biobank was used to identify COVID- 19 cases and population controls.

Study aimed to assess the effect of physical activity, APOE genotype, and sex on AD risk, brain volume, and cognition. UK Biobank data from 2006 to 2023 was accessed. Higher self-reported and accelerometer-assessed physical activity was associated with lower disease incidence.

Up to 17% of cancer survivors have been reported to develop second primary cancers (SPC) Human leukocyte antigen (HLA) is characterized by its polymorphism and has been associated with various diseases. This study aims to explore the role of HLA diversity in SPC incidence.

Polygenic risk score (PRS) is a major research topic in human genetics. A significant gap exists between PRS methodology and applications in practice due to often unavailable individual-level data. We introduce an innovative statistical framework to optimize and benchmark PRS models.

It remains unclear how retinal images contribute to CVD risk profiling and how the results can inform lifestyle modifications. We aimed to determine the performance of cardiovascular risk prediction model from retina images. We developed a deep learning model to predict 5-year MACE using a two-stage DL neural network.

Study aims to evaluate the association between adverse events at varying life stages and the risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) Study included 140,997 participants from the UK Biobank. Compared with the "low-level exposure" pattern, "child-to-adulthood exposure" was associated with increased risk of CKD.

As men age, circulating testosterone (T) decreases, circulating sex-hormone binding globulin (SHBG) increases. It is unclear if circulating T, independently of comorbidities, is associated with fracture risk in men.

The vitamin K-dependent coagulation factor protein Z (PZ), encoded by the PROZ gene, is canonically considered to have anticoagulant effects through negative regulation of factor Xa. Paradoxically, higher circulating PZ concentrations have repeatedly been associated with an elevated risk of acute ischemic stroke.

We consider the problem of combining multiple biomarkers to improve the diagnostic accuracy of detecting a disease. We propose a pairwise model fitting approach to estimate the distribution of the optimal linear combination of biomarkers. The approach is evaluated in simulation studies and applied to data on chlamydia detection and COVID-19 diagnosis.

The role of environmental factors, particularly air pollutants, in the prevalence of sarcopenia remains unclear. This study explored the relationship between the prevalence and exposure to air pollutants. It also investigated potential interactions with genetic susceptibility and inflammation.

Age-related decline in circulating serum testosterone concentrations is a well-established phenomenon in men. While the decline is partially linked to comorbidities such as obesity, type 2 diabetes (T2D), and cardiovascular disease (CVD), healthy ageing men present with rather stable levels. Recent genetic mapping studies demonstrated a large influence of common genetic variation on testosterone levels.

Von Hippel-Lindau (VHL) is an autosomal dominant disease associated with increased risk for developing hemangioblastomas of the central nervous system and retina. Little is known about the systemic effects of VHL alterations on the cardiometabolic system. Aim Study whether VHL gene variants are associated with an increased cardiometric risk.

The plasma proteome holds promise as a future diagnostic and prognostic tool. We assessed the ability of plasma proteins to associate with two primary risk factors of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and to predict incident T2DM.

Alzheimer's disease (AD) is associated with heterogeneous atrophy patterns. We identified two latent dimensional representations of brain atrophy in symptomatic mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and AD patients. In early asymptomatic stages, the two dimensions are associated with diverse pathological mechanisms.

This prospective cohort study analyzed 268,184 individuals from the UK Biobank. Biological age was estimated using phenotypic age (PhenoAge), Klemera-Doubal methods (KDM-BA), and telomere length. The metabolic heterogeneity of obesity can be evaluated by four BMI metabolic phenotypes.

Age-related decline in circulating serum testosterone concentrations is a well-established phenomenon in men. While the decline is partially linked to comorbidities such as obesity, type 2 diabetes (T2D), and cardiovascular disease (CVD), healthy ageing men present with rather stable levels. Recent genetic mapping studies demonstrated a large influence of common genetic variation on testosterone levels.

Age-related decline in circulating serum testosterone concentrations is a well-established phenomenon in men. While the decline is partially linked to comorbidities such as obesity, type 2 diabetes (T2D), and cardiovascular disease (CVD), healthy ageing men present with rather stable levels. Recent genetic mapping studies demonstrated a large influence of common genetic variation on testosterone levels.

Study analyzed the associations of the Dietary Inflammatory Index, physical activity, and sleep on biological aging and all-cause mortality. Maintaining an anti-inflammatory diet and engaging in at least moderate physical activity are associated with delayed physiological aging. However, the level of physical activity recommended by the World Health Organization does not achieve the optimal effect in delaying biological aging.

Study comprised 452 131 individuals from the UK Biobank with glycated hemoglobin A1C (HbA 1c ) and eBMD levels. Fracture risk was highest in individuals with T1D and ICD (HR 2.84, 95%CI [2.53, 3.19]), followed by those with ACD. Evidence for a non-linear association between Hb a 1c and fracture risk was observed.

There is a lack of prospective evidence to clarify the direction of their associations. We included 430,414 participants from UK Biobank and followed them from recruitment (2006-2010) to 2021. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and asthma cases were obtained from inpatient data and death register.

The association of serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D [25(OH)D] and genetic polymorphisms of the vitamin D receptor (VDR) with incident abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) remains uncertain. In this study, 2,042 participants developed incident AAA during a median follow-up of 12.5 years. There was a significant inverse association between serum 25( OH)D and AAA incidence, particularly among individuals with higher genetic risk for AAA, older age, and without diabetes.

Associations of saturated and unsaturated fatty acids (FAs) with cardiovascular disease (CVD) remain controversial. We aimed to investigate the prospective associations of objectively measured FAs with CVD, including incident coronary heart disease (CHD) and stroke.

The role of rare non-coding variation in complex human phenotypes is still largely unknown. We performed a whole-genome sequencing association analysis for height using 333,100 individuals from three datasets.

Visceral adiposity index (VAI) is a marker of visceral fat accumulation and metabolic dysfunction. There is limited evidence of its association with cancer. The VAI was associated with six cancer sites and with all-cause cancer.

Study aims to investigate associations of metabolic syndrome (MetS) with cognitive function, dementia and its subtypes. MetS was associated with poorer cognitive performance and might increase the risk of all-cause dementia as well as vascular dementia.

Aging plays an important role in type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) But the association between accelerated biological age and T2DM remains unclear. This study aimed to examine the associations of biological aging with T2 DM, and explore the potential mediation effect of amino acids.

Child maltreatment (CM) is a critical aspect of early-life adversity with long-lasting impacts. All types of CMs, except physical neglect, significantly increase the risk of chronic pain. Biopsychosocial factors are found to explain over 60% of the association between CM and CP.

Gene-based burden tests are a popular and powerful approach for analysis of exome-wide association studies. Correlation between these tests can complicate the multiple testing correction. We introduce a method called the sparse burden association test (SBAT) that tests the joint set of burden scores.

Bipolar disorder (BD) is linked to an increased risk of neurodegenerative diseases such as dementia and Parkinson disease. The extent to which the associations could be explained by BD-related medications (antipsychotics, lithium, and antiepileptics) was unknown.
